# 上清灵宝大法（宋）

**Shangqing Lingbao Great Ritual**

*Scripture Title:* *Shangqing Lingbao Great Ritual*
Originally transmitted by Ning Quanzhen and recorded by Wang Qizhenmu, emerging during the Southern Song dynasty. One of the comprehensive compilations of Daoist ritual methods of the Song-Yuan talismanic Daoist lineages. Comprising twenty-seven sections and sixty-six scrolls.

*Source Edition:* *Zhengtong Daoist Canon*, Section Zheng Yi.

**#1 (This catalog entry was supplemented by the editor.)**

**The Supreme Purity Numinous Treasure Great Ritual, Scroll 1**
*Transmitted by the Perfected of Mystic Subtlety, the Radiant and Salvific Master Xiao Quan-Zhen to Wang Qi-Zhen, Disciple of the Supreme Purity Three Caverns and Successor in the Numinous Treasure Lineage*

**Chapter on Establishing the Foundations and Clarifying the Principles**

**General Preface**

The Master said: The *Numinous Treasure Great Ritual* (Lingbao Da Fa) encompasses the Three Caverns, unifying the myriad methods. It is the teaching expounded by the Most High Great Luo Heaven’s Yuanshi Tianzun, transmitted by the Jade Dawn Dao Lord, the Five Venerable Sovereigns, the Lofty Perfected, the Marvelously Practiced Immortals, the Ten Directions’ Divine Kings, and the Supreme Perfected Deities. Later, the Mysterious Primordial Golden Portal’s Li, the True Celestial Emperor, descended into the world to propagate the teaching and deliver beings, whereupon it was heard among mortals.

This comprises the thirty-six divisions of the revered scriptures, totaling eighteen thousand chapters—the root and wellspring of all Daoist traditions, profound and recondite, unified with the myriad methods.

Moreover, the Heavenly Perfected Sovereign possessed the *Eight Clarities*, *Five Translations*, *Seven Scriptures*, *Eight Latitudes*, *Ten Mysteries*, and *Forty-Seven Chapters*, which together form a single corpus. In their subtlety, they exhaustively elucidate all principles.

The *Eight Clarities* emulate Heaven’s opening of the eight faculties to illuminate the obscure. The *Five Translations* model the five kalpas of transformation, generating the Five Phases, whereby qi first configures the scriptures of the world. The *Seven Scriptures* draw forth the pathways of the Great Dao. The *Eight Latitudes* demarcate the boundaries of the teaching. The *Ten Mysteries* refer to the Ten Profound Principles. The *Forty-Seven Chapters* expound the origins, developments, and essential frameworks. Together, they form a single corpus, fully unfolding the profound and abstruse purport. In their meticulous detail, they establish categories and gates, pivoting as one.

**The Eight Clarities**

1. **Clarifying the Primordial Ancestral Qi and Its Initial Transformation into Jade Script**
   According to the *Numinous Treasure Jade Script Inner Sound Scripture*: Prior to the Three Qi, after the primordial chaos, within it the true essence congealed, subsequently generating the Primordial Qi. Within the Primordial Darkness, there was a spirit called Yuanshi Tianwang. Its qi coalesced, co-emerging with the Primordial Beginning, flowing and transforming to form efflorescence—neither form nor appearance, now expanding, now contracting. By the *Yan Kang* kalpa, one qi divided into two qi: the Void and the Natural, whence arose the Beginning Qi. The two qi intertwined, condensing into the Great Void, pervading the boundless. The script measured one *zhang* square, with eight corners, trailing radiance—its principle unfathomable. One qi congealed, enfolding the Jade Script. By the *Long Han* kalpa, Yuanshi Tianwang apportioned the two qi, and as chaos parted, light emerged: the qi ascended, clarified, and settled to form Heaven; the qi descended, accumulated, and stagnated to form Earth. From the division and union of the two qi, a harmonizing qi arose at the center, called the Mysterious Unity Qi, also known as the Great Brahma Qi. By the *Chi Ming* kalpa, Yuanshi unfolded the diagram, wherein a true yang qi transformed into the Fire of the Cavernous Yang. Yuanshi wielded the Cavernous Yang Fire to smelt and blend the Three Qi, harmonizing the Jade Script into Red Script. Thus, the kalpa was named *Chi Ming* (Red Clarity), and the script was called the *Red Book Jade Script*—such is the principle.

2. **Clarifying the Generation and Nurturance of Chaos, the Forging of Myriad Forms**
   Since chaos split open, the Three Qi formed script, refined by fire into Red Script. The luminous qi’s essence became the sun; the numinous qi’s essence became the moon. The residual light dispersed, dividing into the Three Clarities’ sages and the Three Images. The spirits of the Three Qi, from this point onward, gave rise to all forms—none but the Three Qi of the Mysterious Primordial Beginning.

3. **Clarifying the Numinous Treasure Great Ritual as the Naturally Arising Diagram and Book, Encompassing All Phenomena and Serving as the Pivot of the Three Powers**
   By the *Kai Huang* kalpa, the five kalpas had fully unfolded, the Five Phases fully manifested, and the various Perfected and Immortals were generated. Within the five kalpas, the true essence of the Mysterious Center was produced, and within the essence, the spirit—all named the *Shang Huang* (Supreme Sovereigns). Thus, the kalpa was named *Shang Huang*. During the five kalpas, the upright qi of the Five Phases flowed and spread, taking form: now gathering, now dispersing; now rolling, now unfurling; now embodying clouds, mist, fire, and haze; now resembling stars, constellations, gold, and jade. They formed creatures—worms, fish, dragons, birds—all emerging from the Red Book Jade Script, naturally dividing and generating the scriptures of the Three Caverns and Four Thorns, the Dragon Embryo Stone Scenery, the myriad talismans, and the three divisions’ thousand-fold diagrams. The Heavenly Perfected Sovereign and the Supreme Perfected Jade Consort transcribed these texts, compiling them into registers to rectify the root of generation and transformation, to encompass the origin of all phenomena, to mold the mechanism of all beings, and to serve as the pivot for the production of immortals and Perfected—such is the principle.

4. **Clarifying the Great Ritual as the Ancestral Teaching of the Three Caverns, Giving Birth to All Sages**
   After the five kalpas unfolded, the upper realms became profoundly mysterious: the Jade Purity Cavern-Real, the Supreme Purity Cavern-Perfected, and the Great Purity Cavern-Spiritual. The scriptures of the Three Caverns and the four auxiliary talismans all arose from the Red Book Jade Script, receiving the qi of the Numinous Treasure to take form. Formerly, Yuanshi Tianzun commanded the thirty-nine emperors of the Supreme Sovereigns and the nine heavens’ celestial emperors to each record incantations, forming the *Great Cavern’s* thirty-nine chapters, elucidating the body of the five kalpas’ chaotic transformation and expounding the method of harmonizing the Three Qi into one. These were entrusted to the Jade Dawn Dao Lord. Subsequently, across the various heavens, the thirty-six divisions of the revered scriptures were expounded. Later, during the era of the Three Sovereigns, the Golden Portal’s Later Sage, the Mysterious Primordial Lord Lao, descended to transform the world. During the time of Shennong, he descended as Yu Mozi, tasting the hundred herbs, distinguishing the five grains, and expounding the *Scripture of Longevity*. During the time of Fuxi, he descended as Tian Yezi, rectifying the eight directions, unfolding yin and yang, and expounding the *Numinous Treasure Primordial Yang Scripture*. During the time of Zhu Rong, he descended as Yu Huazi, resolving the Three Bonds and aligning the Seven Governances, and expounding the *Numinous Treasure Five Stars’ Chaotic Constant Scripture*. During the time of the Yellow Emperor, he descended as Guang Chengzi and expounded the *Numinous Treasure Daoist Sincerity Scripture*. During the time of Shaohao, he descended as Sui Yingzi and expounded the *Numinous Treasure Primordial Treasury Scripture*.

During the time of Gaoxin, he was known as Yuanyangzi and expounded the *Numinous Treasure Subtle Words Scripture*. During the time of Emperor Yao, he was known as Wuchengzi and expounded the *Numinous Treasure Governance Scripture*. During the time of Emperor Shun, he was known as Yinshouzi and expounded the *Great Clarity Scripture* and the *Numinous Treasure Red Writ Scripture*. During the time of Yu of Xia, he was known as Zhenyuzi and expounded the *Five Chapters of True Writ Scripture* and the *Dragon’s Pride Scripture*. During the Zhou dynasty, he was known as Guoshuzi and expounded the *Numinous Treasure Red Essence Scripture*, the *Two Chapters of the Dao and Virtue*, and the *Numinous Treasure Eight Mights’ Subjugation of Demons Scripture*. During the reign of King Hao, he was known as the Left Elder Immortal of the Great Ultimate and expounded the *Numinous Treasure Sacrificial Scripture for Ghosts* and the *Karmic Retribution Scripture*. In the Han era, he was named Master Red Pine and once expounded the *Three Ones Scripture*. By the first year of Yongshou during the reign of Emperor Huan, the teachings of the Orthodox Unity, Great Clarity, and Cavern Spirit descended to the human realm. During the reign of Emperor Wu, he was named Ah Shanggong and expounded the *Chapters of the Dao and Virtue*. The Queen Mother of the West, bearing the mandate of the Primordial Beginning, expounded the *Numinous Treasure Thirty-Six Revered Scriptures*, completing the sacred texts of the world.

By the eleventh year of Yonghe in the Jin dynasty, the teachings of the Jade Clarity Cavern True descended to the human realm, and thus the Three Caverns were fully revealed. Through the great Dharma of the Numinous Treasure, all the sages were born and transformed.

**First Principle:** It clarifies the human body, modeling the Primordial Beginning’s creation of the chaotic state to generate the sacred embryo of the Dharma-body. When father and mother unite in essence, a single point of harmonious qi is contained; the two blacks divide and split, first giving rise to the kidneys. The three blacks separate and initiate, giving rise to the spirit-palace—the heart. The four qi merge, and the flower-canopy takes form. The five qi open their radiance, like a flower with five petals, and thus the five viscera are complete. This is like the image of three movements reaching the five kalpas. The two qi divide and judge: above, they give rise to the Mud Pill, and below, they give rise to the Mysterious Valley—the Water Palace. The three qi refine with fire: above, they give rise to the sun and moon, like the two eyes, illuminating the entire body, as if manifesting the ten thousand images. The principle of the human body is identical to this.

**Second Principle:** The external division of the body must recognize the ancestral qi of the Numinous Treasure. Entering sand, it becomes gold; entering stone, it becomes jade. Birds give rise to simurghs and phoenixes; beasts give rise to dark dragons. Plants and trees give rise to numinous mushrooms; the five grains contain auspicious omens. When qi scatters, it becomes harmonious winds; when qi ascends, it becomes auspicious clouds; when qi descends, it becomes sweet dew. Entering water, it gives rise to night-glowing pearls; dwelling in humans, it gives rise to sages and worthies. This is the ancestral qi, the essence of the Great Harmony and the Supreme One, the chief of all spirits. Since the Great Treasure possesses this substance, like the division of the human form, it enters the central cinnabar valley of the Great Floating Li Land. Completing the nine transformations and dividing into five changes, it forms the Dharma-body—this is the ten traversals of the Primordial Beginning, where withered bones are revived.

**Sixth Principle:** It clarifies the ancestral qi of the Primordial Beginning, which existed before formlessness. By comparison, it descends in substance to become qi, transforming and giving birth to the ten thousand treasures. What form does it take in the present world? Gathering this qi and consuming it leads to transcendence and ascent as a perfected one—this is precisely the qi of the Numinous Treasure. Even the ten thousand kinds possess it, such as dragon pearls, tiger treasures, ox bezoars, and crow cinnabar. The flowing essence, jade radiance, and elixir are also of this kind. The qi of the Numinous Treasure: in heaven and earth, it is like the sun at high noon; in the body, it is the initial union of spirit and qi. Thus, the Perfected One of the Supreme One said:
*"Always at the Great Ultimate, grasp the pivot of the mechanism,
In movement and stillness, the spirit-pearl descends behind the curtain.
From this, the Numinous Treasure is born in the Mysterious Valley,
When the millet-pearl is empty, one sings and chants in joy."*
This is it. Those who obtain and consume it will surely ascend to the rank of perfected ones, for even lesser immortals cannot attain this wisp of floss.

**Seventh Principle:** It clarifies the great Dao within the great Dharma of nurturing beings and turning back the numinous, which is the way of ascending at dawn. Next, reciting and chanting the methods of longevity, deliverance from the world, corpse-liberation, and attainment of the Dao, as well as the myriad methods contained in the scriptures. The *Numinous Treasure Scripture* expounds the purport of the Celestial Worthy of the Primordial Beginning speaking the scriptures in the heavens—this is the constant principle. Above, there is the way of refining the true within, causing flesh and bones to fly together; in the middle, there is the method of longevity, deliverance from the world, and corpse-liberation; below, there is the teaching of ascending to the ancestors and delivering the mysterious. In its greatness, it protects and stabilizes heaven and earth, rectifies the degrees of celestial lodgings, and has the power to heal disasters and repel demons. In its smallness, it has the efficacy to cure deep illnesses and revive the dead. In its brightness, it possesses the numinous power to whistle and summon wind and thunder, transforming naturally. In its subtlety, it has the texts to summon and employ ghosts and spirits, penetrating and perceiving the ten heavens. Thus, it is said to contain the myriad methods.

**Eighth Principle:** It clarifies that the great Dharma has three ranks, which must perfect the sagely and true immortal Dao. If one thoroughly fathoms the mysterious and investigates the subtle, practicing the ten superior ways of the upper rank, with merits and virtues complete, one will ascend in broad daylight. For those who engage in supplementary cultivation, obtaining one method saves one, achieving longevity and deliverance from the world, becoming the chief of immortals in the earthly grotto-heavens. If one reverently pays homage morning and evening, offering devotion and service, one will surely attain the immortal state of corpse-liberation, becoming a scattered immortal of the Ten Continents and Three Islands.

The Master said: *"The eight clarifications can open wisdom, and the five translations begin to complete the sacred texts."*

**First Translation:**
The translator says:

The jade script emerged before the void of non-being, concealed within the hollow emptiness, known as the Great Brahma Jade Script. When the Crimson Clarity unfolded its chart, fire refined it into writing, becoming the Crimson-Written Jade Script. The Primordial Beginning, through the divine might of Great Permeation, expanded the Five Scripts to give rise to the numinous, unfolding the esoteric to establish the great Daoist teachings.

**Second Translation**
The translator says:
After the fire refined it into writing, following the Crimson Script, each character spanned a zhang in size, with human and horned radiance trailing downward, covering the myriad heavens and casting its shade upon the Western Primordium. As the root of the Nine Heavens and the flowing force of clouds, its jade brilliance and golden essence shone resplendently across the great firmament. The Primordial Beginning commanded the Perfected Sovereigns of Heaven to transcribe its script in full, naming it the Eight Might Dragon Script, also called the Eight Assemblies of the Myriad Heavens. It is concealed within the Seven Jeweled Jade Terrace of the Supreme Clarity Mystic Capital’s Golden Gate, as well as the Purple Tenuity Upper Palace, the Orchid Chamber’s Golden Abode, the Eastern and Western Flowery Halls, and the Nine Heavens’ Grand Auroral Repository.

**Third Translation**
The translator says:
The Primordial Heavenly Honored One serves as the patriarch of Daoist methods, while the Jade Dawn Dao Lord acts as the master of the Numinous Treasure teachings.

The compilation of these five sacred scriptures of Numinous Treasure, the Jade Characters of the Thirty-Two Heavens forming the canon, is titled *The Luminous Chapters of Cloud Seal Script*. The Queen Mother of the West transmitted them to the Yellow Emperor, while the Dragon Might Master imparted the *Five Talismans of Numinous Treasure* to Great Yu. The Most High and Later Sages bestowed the *Venerable Scripture of Numinous Treasure* upon the hundred generations of emperors—all contained within the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures, without further translation. When the Yellow Emperor sought the Dao at Mount Emei, he beheld the Perfected Sovereigns in person and received their teachings anew. Later, Master Left of the Azure Heavens, through the True Master Xu of the Supreme Ultimate, disseminated and propagated them, likewise without retranslating or reinterpreting.

**Fourth Translation**
The translator says:
In the first year of the *Yuanfeng* reign of the Han, on the seventh day of the seventh month, the Queen Mother of the West descended and conferred these scriptures and methods upon Emperor Wu of Han. The Emperor did not comprehend the language of the Great Brahmā. The Queen Mother replied: "The Primordial Beginning is a being of the Great Canopy Heaven, while the Dao Lord is a being of the Western Jade Realm of Śinā—even their speech differs from that of the Divine Continent, let alone the language of the Great Brahmā." Thereupon, she transcribed them in writing, transforming the celestial jade characters into contemporary script. Within the rituals of the Great Brahmā’s language—its vestments and regalia, palace names, diagrams, seals, cyclical signs, hexagrams, qi phases, altar designs, and great methods—along with the practices of the various ranks and the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures, all were adapted to the written language of the Han era, becoming the authoritative speech of past and present.

**Fifth Translation**
The translator says:
After the Perfected Sovereigns of Heaven transcribed the script in full, it was established as the correct pronunciation. The Perfected One of Wondrous Conduct compiled the great methods of talismanic script for cultivation and application. The Perfected Ones of True Radiance, Yu Luoqiao, and Resplendent Luminous Sound gathered the talismans and diagrams of the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures to form the *Precious Register of the Central Alliance*. The texts of the Thirty-Six Divisions of True Scriptures became the *Great Method of Numinous Treasure*, thus spreading through the ages. Master Left of the Azure Heavens transmitted the scriptures, registers, and esoteric methods to the True Master Xu of the Supreme Ultimate. The Master bequeathed them to the Perfected One Yang of Supreme Clarity, who synthesized the methods of the two ranks—*Supreme Clarity Cavern Mystery* and *Jade Clarity Cavern Truth*—whereupon divine scriptures gradually emerged in later generations.

Here ends the first scroll of the *Great Method of Supreme Clarity and Numinous Treasure*.
Preface to the *Great Method of Supreme Clarity and Numinous Treasure*.

**Ancient Preface**

In ancient times, our Primordial Master, the Celestial Worthy of Original Beginning, moved by great compassion, broadly delivered all beings, saving them across kalpas. He established the teaching prior to Heaven, responding to circumstances without constraint, his transformative influence flowing through form beyond the Three Realms and Nine Springs, unbound by the human world or what lies beyond appearances.

In the pristine age of Dragon Han, he taught the Great Vehicle. By the time of Yan Kang, when the primordial unity had dispersed, he bestowed the Middle Method. The Great Vehicle is non-action, non-affair, letting things follow their natural course. The Middle Method involves rest and effort, guiding beings according to their capacities.

After the Kaihuang era, when the Red Clarity returned, customs grew shallow and turbid. People deceived their true simplicity, abandoned their roots, drowned in deluded nature, and lost their original emotions. They turned away from the mysterious workings of wondrous being and forsook the profound principles of spontaneity. Thus, beneath the Fangzhu Terrace, empty names filled the green bamboo slips. Within the Dengdu Terrace, the titles of black texts multiplied. Those who sank into perdition crowded the roads at dawn, while those who ascended to transcendence stood shoulder to shoulder across millennia. The great brush of sagely compassion swiftly opened the path to deliverance.

Thus, the Three Primes establish the standards of sincerity, and the Four Poles illuminate the statutes. The scriptures of the Three Caverns and Four Supplements, the registers hidden in earth and stored in heaven, the precepts of the *Nüqing* and *Xuandu*, the texts of the Eight Jades and Nine Tripods, the writings of the Golden Perfected and Eight Poles, the talismans of phoenix qi and dragon scripts, the methods of yielding gold, flowing water, and jade, the talismans of *Kaiming* and *Zhenling*, the texts of the Five Elders’ strategems, the registers of ascending to perfection through the Eight Seas, the writs of the Great Kalpa and Vast Perfection, the chapters of the *Lingbao* for summoning dragons, the sections of the *Zhengyi* for saving the world, the seals of the *Dongshen* for opening mountains, the formulas of the *Shangqing* Eight Effulgences, the verses of the *Xuanzhen* and *Qusu*, the diagrams of the *Taiping* Left and Right, the ranks of the *Dongxuan* wisdom, the arts of riding the void and treading emptiness, the manifestations of grasping the Dipper and seizing the *Kui*—

Some restrain the body and mind, some dissolve transgressions and impurities, some swallow awns and ingest effulgences, some refine qi and nurture the primordial embryo, some seal mountains and summon clouds, some sit in forgetfulness and cast off illumination. They open myriad paths to draw in and guide, extending manifold methods to uplift and support, desiring that all beings clinging to consciousness and harboring life may ascend to the shore of the Dao. How could this be limited to those who wear stars as hairpins and gird themselves with the moon, alone ascending to the courts of immortality?

Hence, the three-chapter and five-section rituals emerged, along with the *Hetu* altar methods, the formulas for bowing in submission and presenting memorials, and the offices of the wind-borne courier steeds. For all who dwell in the world and have matters to memorialize, the lords of the sun and moon, the true officials of the local domains, ride those courier dragons and make their petitions heard at the heavenly gates. Though the heavenly palaces are distant and the earthly realms humble, response follows upon perception, swift as a flicker of light. Thus, the great Dao saves all beings, leaving nothing—great or small—unattended. For seeking blessings and praying for perfection, the fasting methods are paramount.

There are twenty-seven grades of fasting, all detailed in the Three Caverns scriptures, each cavern comprising nine ranks of fasts. Among them, the Inner Yellow Register Fast is renowned for its far-reaching blessings, broadly rescuing those in the Three Paths. The time of karmic retribution arrives as swiftly as an echo follows a sound, and its efficacy has been verified throughout the ages by countless individuals. Yet, utmost sincerity is foremost, the radiance of dragons supreme, and the purity of incense smoke secondary. Should any aspect be lacking, it becomes a blemish upon the fast. Those who cultivate and uphold these practices—how could they not be cautious?

Moreover, the methods of the Yellow Register deliver and save in abundance. When ruler and subject practice together, the blessings extend to all—humans and heavens alike. According to their undertakings, the principles and approaches are manifold. The scriptures further state: The teachings of the Three Caverns spread and fill the human realm. Practicing the Dao and observing fasts, teachings are established in accordance with what is fitting. Between the human world and the heavens above, these have long been in circulation. Should emperors, kings, lords, common folk, or any beings upon the land encounter disasters and calamities that must be dispelled, they may summon Daoist masters and female officials, whether many or few, to erect jade altars, hang silken canopies, scatter flowers, burn incense, light lamps to illumine the night, perform the ritual circumambulations, and offer repentance. Through the six periods of day and night, they labor without ceasing, and spiritual responses are swiftly obtained, with blessings and virtues universally bestowed.

The scriptures say: The Yellow Register is foremost in delivering the countless generations of ancestors, the departed of past and present, those trapped in the Three Paths, sunk in the hells for ten thousand kalpas, enabling them to transcend suffering, ascend to heaven, and rescue the hidden souls. This scripture may be practiced in accordance with the world’s needs, whether for three days, seven days, one period, or nine periods. Memorials are presented, and sincerity is swiftly conveyed to heaven—none fail to reach their destination.

Furthermore, the *Lingbao* is the root and origin of the great Dao, the wondrous transformation of the Primordial Beginning. It emerges from the void, naturally evolving through kalpas, subtly aligning with yin and yang, dividing and shaping creation. It safeguards the imperial mandate, protects the people of heaven, holds the reins of the celestial pivot, and expands the profound mystery. It encompasses the great demonic methods of the Five Emperors, summons the offices of the myriad heavens and primal unities, delivers the living and the dead, and governs the Three Realms. Its talismans are inscribed according to the celestial qi, its hidden chapters unfold profound meanings. It is concealed within the Palace of the Elixir Pearl, forbidden in the divine precincts of the Flowery Hall. Revered by all heavens, it is transmitted but once in ten thousand kalpas. Those who follow its luminous statutes conduct themselves with proper measure. Without the great fortune of past lives, how could one casually encounter it? To meet and cultivate it is a rare convergence. Through it, one may summon numinous darkness at the Three Passes, gather precious blossoms at the Nine Gates. When merit is complete and virtue perfected, one is ranked among the immortal elders, reviving the dead and restoring the body, returning to truth and regaining the root. Revered by humans and heavens, its transformations are boundless. It summons the perfected and calls forth the numinous, pervading the Three Ways—truly the most exalted of the myriad methods for delivering beings, the majestic and vast Brahman.

Thus, this preface is respectfully composed. Mysterious Preface.

At the Primordial Beginning of kalpas, it is the root and origin of Heaven and Earth. The Numinous Treasure unfolds its chart, mastering the pivot of yin and yang. It expounds the principle of the sun and moon’s transformations, governs the mechanism of stars’ measured courses, subtly gathers the wandering net, and uplifts the zi and wu. It restores the creative workings of the Five Phases, pursues the three qi’s primordial radiance, advances and retreats with Qian and Kun, soars and revolves with Li and Kan. It seizes the dragon and tames the tiger, reins the phoenix and rides the simurgh, feasting at dawn on the blossoms of the Purple Court, supping at dusk on the nectar of Azure Flower. Refining the form with flowing fire, irrigating the substance with the Jade Pond’s waters, six dragons dance in the layered skies, nine qi seethe and boil in the jade crucible. The Dao gives me life—things have no fixed nature.

Abandoning things and releasing form, qi and spirit merge and truth becomes luminous. Releasing passions and nurturing vastness, essence and blood flow and qi naturally congeals. The true fire soars high, flying to support the bright sun of Mount Fuqiu. Water and metal are restrained, flourishing the toad of the Jade Palace. Eight simurghs cry in unison, praising the elegant melody of the empty song. Nine phoenixes sing together, raising the profound sound of the Ten Absolutes. Looking up and down at the numinous mound, the perfected of the ten directions gather of themselves. Attending audience before the Most High, the feathered and winged hosts of the myriad spirits soar in their chariots. A grain of millet hangs high, its transformations unfathomable. Embracing the obscure and dim, the countless multitudes all return. When the turbid and contentious rush forward, the thousand spirits and myriad qi scatter entirely.

Gathering qi makes treasure; assembling spirit makes numen. Qian is firm and purely yang; Kun is yielding and of yin substance. The qi of spontaneity is formless and nameless. Above, it reaches the Nine Pures, where it borrows the name of “mysterious darkness.” Below, it penetrates the Nine Earths, where it takes names distinguished by form. Thus we know: dim and distant, indistinct and vague, still and unmoving, yet responsive when stimulated and thus communicating. The two qi revolve, moving with Heaven and Earth in timely response. The Three Fields connect with the wondrous, moved by yin and yang’s revolutions. No need for other applications—why seek ease for oneself?

Abiding in spirit and knocking the teeth awaken the initial truth of entering the Dao’s gate. Refining qi and inscribing talismans clarify the scholar’s rule of observance. To swallow the Nine Revolutions’ elixir, one must create in accord with the four seasons. Circulating the Zhou Tian, uniting water and fire, smelting metal and casting the crucible, refining stone to mend the mysterious—stealing the sun and moon’s essence, binding the spirit-perfected’s lead and mercury. First clarify the zi and wu, then distinguish water and metal. Advancing and retreating, drawing and adding, know the time and adapt to the season. Warmth, nurturing, and refinement must be without error. Do not kill the good for desire and greed, do not envy and steal with lust. Distance hatred and leave resentment; transform bone to kinship. Deliver gods and humans, expound teachings to the mortal world. Penetrate the mysterious and investigate the subtle, all chapters reveal profound wisdom. Bind demons and repel afflictions, severing the source of the six roots’ obstructions. Abandon the false and follow the true, extinguishing the gateway of the five sufferings’ transmigration.

Binding the hun-soul and restraining the po-soul,
nurturing the dark to conceal the spirit,
the body radiates light,
the form leaves no trace.

Unsealing the Three Luminaries,
separation and union arise naturally.
Lofty and serene, the Yu Luo soars,
through ten thousand kalpas the Xiao Tai crowns the peaks.
Ascending the Golden Portals,
roaming the jade mountains’ transcendent realms.
Riding the jasper wheels,
the Ten Qi manifest in spontaneous flight.
Guiding the green ranks,
the Five Elders of the heavens bow in reverence.

Swiftly erasing the causes of karmic ledgers,
severing the roots of evil paths.
Wondrous indeed this Dharma—
thus it ranks among the scriptures,
awakening the lost and benighted,
rescuing those yet unenlightened.

Long ago, I encountered the Pure Subtlety Venerable,
who taught me the art of exhaling and inhaling the Two Qi.
Next, I met the Jade Emperor of the Mysterious August,
who bestowed upon me the oral instructions of the Golden Elixir.
I grasped the celestial numbers of Heaven and Earth’s inception,
comprehended the mechanisms of yin and yang’s generation and destruction.
The hundred flowers and myriad herbs
all guard their roots and secure their stems.
Rare birds and strange beasts
all embrace the One and contain the Primordial.

Thus I know that inverting the Five Phases
and overturning the Four Images,
stealing the qi of the Primordial One’s flight into mystery,
preserving the essence of the true and wondrous body,
erecting the precious tripod on Kongtong,
flying golden essence within the numinous cavern,
conjoining the inner and outer water and fire,
uniting the upper and lower measures,
the primordial qi circulates in full,
stirring the Primordial Yellow to make the Mysterious Pearl radiant.
Encompassing the cosmos,
containing the Golden Elixir to provide inexhaustible resources.

Know then that Heaven and Earth alone are supreme,
their transformations formless and without substance.
The wondrous Dao of Qian and Kun,
the beginningless and endless cycle of life and death.
The Dao is not to be sought afar—
it lies not beyond door and window.
Few draw near to it,
many keep their distance.
Abandoning the root to chase illusory truth,
they willingly forget the springs and soil in delight.
Mistaking the perverse for the upright,
they vainly endure summer and winter in passage.

Stillness generates strength,
tranquility prompts profound reflection.
The Seven Emotions fan the flames,
severing the intestines and transforming yin—life and destiny hang in peril.
The Six Desires entice and ensnare,
scattering essence and dissolving form—spirit and qi vanish.
The Five Viscera tremble,
the Nine Orifices open and close—
none discern the origin of life and destiny.
Odd and even pair,
yet how can one fathom creation’s workings?
How could one discern the mysterious mechanism?

I invoke great compassion,
wishing to uplift the immortal disciples.
Gathering this spirit and qi,
I compile it under the title *Mysterious Chapters*.
Thus it is named the *Lingbao’s Guide and Snare*,
corresponding to the inner Dharma of the true scriptures.
Entrusted to the wondrous practice,
it emerges to deliver beings across the world,
manifesting in the ten directions under myriad names.
Compiled into scriptures,
filling the Ganges’ sands—
each phrase is profound,
every passage is the Dao.

Grasping this wondrous principle,
one is born and dies yet abides with the Dao.
Comprehending this true mechanism,
separation and union occur naturally—
coming and going leave no attainment.
Those who encounter it possess immortal bones from past lives,
those who practice it accumulate blessings through generations.
Those who err and fall among humans and heavens,
fearing they may stray from the path of awakening,
are guided to clarity and perfection,
attaining realization of the Dharma gate,
practicing the secret treasury of the Dao.

Thus the preface concludes in earnest.

*Shangqing Lingbao Great Dharma, Scroll the Second*
*Dongwei Gaoshi Kaiguang Jiu Ku Zhenren Xiao Quanzhen*
*Transmitted to the Shangqing Three Caverns Disciple, Lingbao Preceptor Wang Qizhen*
*Compiled and Applied: The Seven Scriptures*

The Master said: The methods of practice and application comprise the Seven Scriptures.

First: Penetrating vision of the hundred spirits. One ingests the *Hunyuan Jade Tablet* and recites the *High Mystery Inner Taboo Names*, practicing the *Yuanshi Inner Contemplation* of the Dao. If unable to perform this, one should practice the *Inner Vision of the Hidden Treasury* instead.

Second: Consulting the Dipper, severing the registers of death, and inscribing life in the Southern Bureau—what is called "the Northern Dipper casts down death, the Southern Dipper raises up life."

Third: Audience at the Origin.

Fourth: Dividing the spirit to govern affairs.

Fifth: Establishing a celestial abode in the Immortal Bureaus.

Sixth: Liberating the mysterious ancestors and entrusting governance to the Southern Palace.

Seventh: Selecting and responding to the mysterious summons.

**Ingesting the Jade Tablet and Penetrating Vision of Hidden Scripts**
The Master said: The nine grades of scriptures of the *Three Caverns of Shangqing* are divided into the *Four Auxiliaries*, comprising ten thousand scrolls. Only the *Three Stages of Lingbao* possess residual divine chapters, which prioritize the salvation of the dead and deliverance of the living. Those who serve the Perfected below often begin with diligence, yet ultimately fail to persist. This is due to the obscurity of worldly roots and the darkness of consciousness—where the six wisdoms remain unopened, one is deluded by the six heavens’ demons, and the four perverse influences arise wantonly, manifesting myriad transformations, unable to attain penetrating clarity.

Thus, among the scriptures of the Three Caverns, the highest is called *Dongzhen* ("Cavern of Perfection"). For ordinary practitioners of perfection, it unifies form and spirit, allowing the eyes to behold the Perfected and merge with the Dao in harmony. As for the middle and lower *Dongxuan* ("Cavern of Mystery") and *Dongshen* ("Cavern of Spirit"), they are the origin of the ten thousand methods and the root of the six penetrations. Therefore, the Heavenly Worthy verifies the *Eye of Dao-Wisdom* and the *Eye of Truth*, while the Perfected establishes the *Dharma Eye* and the *Eye of Compassion*. Thus, observing the Three Realms is like holding them in the palm of one’s hand.

The Heavenly Worthy established methods to illuminate inner contemplation, externally manifesting *penetrating vision* to reflect the *Eye of Dao-Wisdom*. *Compassionate vision*, *penetrating vision*, and *distant observation* embody the *Eye of Dharma-Compassion*. Therefore, in the Three Caverns, all who study *Dongzhen* must first *penetrate and see the Perfected* before attaining perfection. As for *Dongshen*, one must *witness the spirit-Perfected with the eyes* before achieving spirit-communion and becoming a spirit-immortal.

Among the ten thousand methods of the Three Caverns, none do not first require the self-clarity of the Three Caverns before one can communicate with spirits, and the numinous descends into the body—extending to *Dongshen*, *Dongyuan* ("Cavern of Abyss"), and *Dongling* ("Cavern of Numinosity"). The *Eight Histories of the Great Cavern*, the *Six Ding*, the *Spirit-Flight Six Jia*, and the *Luminous Cavern Vision* all establish methods for *communicating with the eyes*.

For male practitioners, lewdness; for female practitioners, perversity—when the six roots do not contend, one dissipates true *qi* and vainly hopes for *Dongshen*. Those of pure yang do not conceal their spirit-immortality, while those of pure yin manifest only as ghosts—this is the true secret.

The *Jade Tablet*, the ancestral scroll of the first method, when cultivated for a hundred days, causes true immortals to manifest their traces. Seeing them, one may command their service, summon celestial Perfected, and when merits and virtues are complete, ascend in broad daylight across the Three Caverns. Without this *Jade Tablet*, all efforts are in vain, and one will never attain penetrating clarity.

Formerly, this was not transmitted to the lower world. Because the *Lingbao* teachings spread and demonic perversities emerged from the yin, it was used to *penetrate and prevent* their *crooked mouths and hidden forms*, shielding Daoist practitioners from delusion. The *Jade Tablet* contains the *Inner Taboo Names* of the highest Perfected. Practicing it according to the method ensures swift attainment of perfection.

For transmission, choose the days of the *Three Origins*, the *Ten Upright Days*, or the *Eight Nodal Days*. Provide two jade tablets, nine taels of gold, a thousand feet of white silk, and a hundred thousand in alms-wealth to pledge alliance with the Three Officials. The master must not transmit without such a pledge. Should one recklessly divulge the celestial treasure, the master will punish them with the *Wind Blade’s Trial*. If the disciple practices yet fails to achieve anything, their lifespan will be reduced by a twelve-year cycle.

Assess the disciple’s capacity—whether abundant or modest—without misjudging their worth. Do not transmit to the unworthy, lest it be leaked to the undaoistic. The penalty for this is the same.

**Heaven-Earth Jade Characters, Inner Sounds**
The two talismans below are to be swallowed on the *zhongwen* day of the middle finger, two pieces each, to summon the *qi* of the Father-Mother.

**Sun-Moon Jade Characters, Inner Sounds**
**Sun-Moon Imperial Sovereign, Inner Taboo Names: Yao Dao Zhi. Zheng Hui Tiao. General Liang.**

**Gao Qian Shuang.**
**Heavenly Sovereign Lord, Inner Sounds**
**Earthly Sovereign Lord, Inner Sounds**
**Human Sovereign Lord, Inner Sounds**

**Talisman-Swallowing Incantation**
Heavenly, Earthly, and Human Sovereigns—Three Primordial Lords of the Pure.
Untie knots, disperse stagnation, bar the gates of death.
Repel misfortune, expel the corpse, the heart’s spirit at peace.
The Five Stars’ taboo names—
The Three Heavens’ hidden taboo names.

**Talisman-Swallowing Incantation**
Primal Father unites with the feminine, Mysterious Mother returns to the masculine.
Heaven and Earth merge as one, the human Dao’s jade talisman preserves life,
the five viscera radiant and luminous.
Ears and eyes open with clarity, my Dao flourishes and ascends.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance!*

**Three Perfected Ones’ Inner Taboo Names**
**Supreme Emperor’s Inner Taboo Names**

**Talisman-Swallowing Incantation**
The Great One bears the talisman, the Grand Beginning commands the numinous.
True immortals guard life, the Three Emperors oversee the welcoming.
*Qi* flows through the Mysterious Pass, the *po* refined, the *hun* heroic.
Swallow the *qi*, unite with the talisman, penetrating the myriad spirits.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance!*

**Seven Luminaries’ Inner Taboo Names**

**Talisman-Swallowing Incantation**
East linked to Fusang, west piercing Chengyang.
The Five Phases align, merging at the center.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance!*

**Southern Dipper’s Six Offices’ Taboo Names**
**Northern Dipper’s Seven Primes’ Inner Taboo Names**

**Talisman-Swallowing Incantation**
Southern Offices govern the Seven Governances, molding the *po*, forging the *hun*.
Following the Dao, they create; opposing Heaven, they turn the Wheel of Law.
Revolving through the celestial patterns, they reverse death into life.

**Seven Stellar Consorts, Madam Hidden Taboo Names**
**Divine Tiger, Divine Officials’ Inner Taboo Names**

**Talisman-Swallowing Incantation**

**The Mighty Constellations’ Transformations**

The Chief Star expands its celestial bounds, responding to infinite transformations.
Holding the Azure Regulator, it guides the *po* and *hun* in their migrations.
Soaring through the Five Portals, swiftly borne on the winds of transmission.
The Primordial Sovereign’s Nine Uglies, the Joyous Radiance of the Three Fields.
Following the path of enlightenment, they examine fate; altering destinies, they seize propitious words.
Those who cling to illness and grasp gold fail to penetrate the mysteries of the Dao.
The Three Realms’ governance is wholly entrusted to my authority.

**Three Terraces’ Secret Taboo Names**

**Talisman-Swallowing Incantation**
The Upper Eight Effulgences nourish the embryo within the Muddy Pellet.
The Middle Eight Effulgences nurture the placenta within the Crimson Palace.
The Lower Eight Effulgences dissolve the fetal root within the Womb Base.
The Three Origins shine in mutual reflection, the Terrace Spirits gleaming brightly.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance!*

**Central Dipper’s Rightful Envoy’s Secret Taboo Names**
**Two Beginnings’ Secret Taboo Names**

**Talisman-Swallowing Incantation**
The Great Chief of the Central Dipper revolves through the Dipper and traverses the Winnowing Basket.
Reversing the Five Constants, escaping form at Heaven’s Pass.
The Great One and Heavenly Unity diverge, the Two Beginnings spread apart.
The Eight Effulgences merge in darkness, the Deities of Fate bestow peach-blossom health.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance!*

**Mysterious Maiden’s Secret Taboo Names**
**Three Masters’ Correct Sounds’ Secret Taboo Names**
**Four Saints’ Secret Taboo Names**
**Six Jia’s Secret Taboo Names**
**Six Ding’s Secret Taboo Names**
**Four Upright Merit Officers’ Yang Spirits’ Inner Taboo Names**
**Four Upright Merit Officers’ Yin Spirits’ Inner Taboo Names**
**Five Commanders’ Secret Taboo Names**
**Three Generals’ Secret Taboo Names**
**Three Paths’ Jade Taboo Names**
**Five Marchmounts’ Jade Taboo Names**
**Thunder Deities’ Secret Taboo Names**

**General Talisman-Swallowing Incantation**
The Mysterious Maiden’s Inner Consorts unite yin and yang in harmony.
The Three Masters uphold discipline; the Four Saints divide their keen authority.
The Six Jia are yang spirits; the Six Ding are yin officials.
The Four Upright Primordial Lords, the Five Directors’ Commanders.
The Three Paths and Five Sufferings govern the earthly chariot of Kun.
Xun and Zhen command thunder; yin and yang restrain and regulate.
Dui and Qian radiate light; Kan and Li exchange positions.
Below, they open the Ghost Gate, purging filth and sweeping away defilement.
Swiftly delivered to the Immortal Clan, they stride forth without fear.
*Primordial, flourishing, advantageous, steadfast*—the divine *qi* of reversal and compliance.

The Master says: Whenever receiving and upholding this method, on New Year’s Day, enter the oratory, face north, and set up an incense table. Arrange cinnabar and realgar, then use light yellow paper to inscribe the High Mystery’s Inner Taboo Names according to the prescribed form. Upon completion, bow twice, then store them in a clean casket, marking each with a secret seal to prevent confusion.

On the *jiazi* day, swallow the Three Heavens’ Hidden Taboo Names, the Heaven and Earth Jade Characters, the Three Rivers’ Taboo Names, and the Supreme Deity’s Inner Taboo Names.
On the *jiayin* day, swallow the Seven Luminaries’, Southern and Northern Dippers’, Three Terraces’, and Central Dipper’s Inner Taboo Names.
On the *jiachen* day, swallow the Three Sovereigns’ Inner Taboo Names, the Five Commanders’ and Three Generals’ Taboo Names, the Two Beginnings’ Taboo Names, and the Three Masters’ Taboo Names.
On the *jiawu* day, swallow the Six Jia’s, Six Ding’s, and Four Upright Officers’ Taboo Names.
On the *jiashen* day, swallow the Divine Tiger’s, Divine Officials’, and Mysterious Maiden’s Inner Consorts’ Taboo Names.
On the *jiaxu* day, swallow the Thunder Deities’ Inner Taboo Names.

Whenever preparing to swallow a talisman, one must arrange incense, fire, a water vessel, a small sword, an emperor’s bell, and washing implements the night before, ensuring everything is complete to avoid last-minute deficiencies. Retire at the proper hour, then rise between the *zi* and *chou* hours to perform the ritual. Don proper attire, wash and rinse, then enter the oratory. Light incense and candles, draw a cup of well-flower water, and place it before the sacred images. Next, take the jade tablet containing the Inner Taboo Talismans and arrange them on the altar. Step back, enter the chamber, and pay homage to the Perfected. Clasp the Jade Purity Mudra with both hands and pace the Dipper to the sacred space. In spring and summer, begin pacing from *Kui*; in autumn and winter, from *Pou*. Offer incense at *Kui*, gaze toward the Heavenly Gate, and bow nine times. Kneel lengthily, secretly memorialize the Upper Grotto, and silently recite a petition, burning it in the censer. Bow twice again, clasp the Jade Purity Mudra with both hands, face north, and consecrate the water before swallowing the talisman according to the following method.

**Secret Memorial to the Perfected**
On this day, month, and year of the current Great Year, your subordinate [Name], humbly burns incense and reverently memorializes the Three Clarities’ Supreme Deities, the Jade Emperor, the Purple Tenuity Great Emperor, the Sun and Moon, the Five Stars, the Southern Asterisms and Northern Dipper, the Three Terraces’ Star Lords, the Three Heavens’ Perfected, the Four Saintly Marshals, the Five Marchmounts’ Five Emperors, the Seven Stellar Consorts, the Southern Prosperity Elder, the Six Ding Jade Maidens, the Six Jia Divine Lords, the Thunder Deities and Rain Department, the Divine Tiger Great Saint Envoys, the Four Upright Merit Officers, the Four Upright Divine Generals, the Grotto-Observing Divine Generals, and the Penetrating Vision Lads.

Your subordinate, in accordance with the *Lingbao* Great Law’s *Hunyuan* Jade Tablet and *Shangqing* Hidden Writings, on each *liu jia* day, combines and swallows the Perfected Ones’ Inner Taboo Names, Jade Characters, and Hidden Names in purification and ingestion, beseeching the Grotto-Observing Divine Perfected to command and employ immortal spirits, pursue souls, and seize *po*. Humbly hoping the Perfected’s compassion will not deem this petition presumptuous or offensive, permit your subordinate to ingest and uphold these talismans.

Now, on this *jiazi* day, I reverently follow the prescribed form to swallow the Perfected One’s Jade Character and Hidden Taboo Name. I pray for the descent of the true and proper Dao *qi* to irrigate my Dharma Eye, enabling me to penetrate and observe the hundred spirits, command the thousand Perfected, summon the Six Jia on my left, call the Six Ding on my right, establish traveling offices, foreknow the yet-unmanifest, embody water and fire, and transform without limit.

Your subordinate, unable to bear the weight of this prayer, prostrates in hope of your grace.

Upon concluding the prayer, burn the silent petition in the censer and bow nine times. Next, with the left hand, form the Five Marchmounts Mudra, securing it at the Central Marchmount. Offer incense, then with the right hand, pass the water over the incense. Grasp the emperor’s bell with the left hand and shake it seven times. With the right hand, pour the water seven times into the cup while reciting the incantation seven times.

**Pouring Water at the Northern *Kui* Incantation**
*Kui* manifests numinosity, *Kui* manifests sageliness.
Encountering baleful *qi*, it must respond with swift seizure.

Recite the incantation seven times, then draw seven breaths of northern *qi* and blow them into the water.

Next, form the Five Marchmounts Mudra, hold the water, wield the sword, and recite the following incantation.

**Great One Divine Incantation**
Reverently invoke the Great One Heavenly Perfected, the Primordial Heavenly Perfected, the True Immortals and True Persons, who correspond above to the Qian position.
The Six Ding spirits on the left, the Six Jia armies on the right,
Receive the Heavenly Heart on my behalf and universally save the myriad spirits.
Great One Divine Incantation, Southern Fire Wheel.
Expel evil, dispel illness, seize the water, and command.

Upon concluding the incantation, visualize the sun within the water, then recite the incantation seven times. Draw one breath each of southern and northern *qi*, blow them into the water, and with both hands, pass the water over the incense while reciting the incantation.

**Qianyuan Incantation**
Qianyuan, origination, prosperity, perseverance—
Sun and moon illuminate me.
Divine spring enters the five viscera,
The six bowels attain peace.
Immortals together ascend in transformation,
Soaring to pay homage in the Supreme Clarity.

Recite this incantation seven times, draw seven breaths of *qi* from the Heavenly Gate, blow them into the water, then release the water. Next, with both hands, begin at *zi* and trace the circuit: first form the mudra and flick the water, then circle through the twelve branches while reciting the following incantation.

**Five Peaks Upholding the Body Incantation**
The Five Peaks uphold the body,
Heaven and Earth share the same life.
Sun and moon revolve in motion,
Corresponding to the Five Phases.
Perfected Ones of the Celestial Circuit,
Jade names distinctly inscribed.
Each descends with true *qi*,
Irrigating the root of the womb.
Spirit clear, *qi* radiant,
Penetrating the profound darkness.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the law!

Bow twice, stand in *ding* position, hold the talisman, and examine each character line by line. Draw *qi* and swallow it.

**Method for Drawing Qi**
The disciple reverently follows the Great Law: on any day of the Six Jia, ingest the true *qi* of the various Perfected Ones.

Draw Heavenly *qi*—face *qian* and inhale.
Draw Earthly *qi*—face *kun* and inhale.
Draw Solar *qi*—face east and inhale.
Draw Lunar *qi*—face west and inhale.
Draw Five Planets’ *qi*—inhale once from each of the five directions.
Draw Three Sovereigns’ Brahman *qi*—inhale thrice from *zi*, *shen*, and *yin*.
Draw Southern Dipper *qi*—inhale six times from the south.
Draw Northern Dipper *qi*—inhale seven times from the north.
Draw Three Terraces *qi*—inhale thrice above the head of the Northern Dipper.
Draw Hidden *qi* of the Three Heavens’ Perfected Ones—inhale thrice from the Heavenly Gate.
Draw *qi* of the Three Masters who deliver my spirit—inhale thrice from the northwest.
Draw Wondrous *qi* of the Five Peaks upholding the body—inhale once from each of the five directions.
Draw *qi* of the Three Paths’ General Controller—inhale thrice from the south, the Northern Yin Heavenly Gate.
Draw Gentle true *qi* of the Six Ding—inhale once from each *ding* cyclical direction.
Draw Martial *qi* of the Six Jia—inhale once from each *jia* cyclical direction.
Draw Transformative *qi* of the Great One—inhale twice from the *yin* direction of the Great One.
Draw True *qi* of the Seven Yin Divine Tigers—inhale from the northwest.
Draw Upright *qi* governed by the Four Direct Officers—inhale once from the direction of the year, month, day, and hour’s establishment.
Draw Upright true *qi* of the Supreme Lord—inhale thrice from the Heavenly Gate.
Draw *qi* of the Three Primes’ internal refinement—inhale thrice from the Heavenly Gate.
Draw True *qi* of the Nine Heavens’ Mysterious Woman—inhale thrice from the southwest.
Draw *qi* of the Thunder and Rain Division—inhale eleven times from the *xun* direction.

Upon completing the inhalation of *qi*, recite the following incantation:
Heaven is my canopy, Earth my support.
Southern Asterism and Northern Dipper are my garments.
I conceal myself within the Three Realms,
At the center of the Great Void.
*Qian* cannot encroach, the branches cannot harm.
Now let Heaven and Earth be unable to perceive my substance,
Sun and moon unable to perceive my form,
Ghosts and spirits unable to perceive my body.
I traverse the Great Emptiness,
Emerging from darkness, entering obscurity.
A thousand evils, ten thousand perversities,
Demonic calamities contrary to the Dao—
Those who encounter me die,
Those who meet me perish.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the law!

Upon concluding the incantation, draw *qi* from the ten directions, form the Ten Thousand Seals mudra, and flick it into the water. Then face the Heavenly Gate, visualize yourself as the Primordial Heavenly Worthy, silently recite the hidden jade talisman’s name, take the jade talisman with your left hand, and swallow it with water. Inhale three mouthfuls of water, then spray the remaining water toward the Heavenly Gate.

After swallowing the talisman, next take the Seven-Character Divine Tiger Jade Talisman into your left hand. With your right hand, form the Five Peaks and Three Paths mudra, stopping at the Central Peak to stabilize it. Recite the incantation:
Command the transformation of the primordial *hun* and *po* stars,
Let the flying testes descend with true *qi* into my body.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the law!

Upon concluding the incantation, draw one breath of *qi* from each of the five directions, intending to infuse it into the water. Visualize the Seven Yin Ladies descending with dark radiance *qi* into the water. With your left hand, cast the jade talisman into your mouth, and with your right hand, take water to send it down. Then inhale the remaining water, spray it toward the Ghost Gate, shout the command to seize, bow twice, and withdraw. Set aside the water and sword, then draw one breath of *qi* from the Ghost Gate, hold your breath, and in a quiet chamber, face south and sit upright to practice the Primordial Internal Contemplation.

**Three Paths and Five Peaks Mudra**
For the Five Peaks mudra: cross the left and right hands with palms facing upward, interlocking the little fingers and ring fingers. Hook the left and right middle fingers with the opposite little fingers. Hook the left and right third fingers with the opposite ring fingers, extending them straight alongside the middle fingers. Raise the thumbs to support the middle fingers.

**Primordial Internal Contemplation**
The master says: When practicing this method, sit upright facing south in a quiet chamber, burn incense, and place a mirror before you. Draw one breath of *qi* from the Ghost Gate and blow it into the mirror. Then close the chamber and practice Primordial Internal Contemplation, which must be performed while sitting upright.

First gather the *qi* of the hexagrams, then visualize the five viscera:
The heart is like a lotus bud, like red *gaoying*, within the lungs below.
The lungs are like a flowery canopy, like white *gaoying*.
The liver is like a golden bell, eight-petaled, on the left, like purple *gaoying*. The gallbladder is like a strung pearl, its color like blue-green *gaoying*.
The spleen is like an overturned plate, like yellow-purple *gaoying*, covering the Great Granary below, which is yellow.
The kidneys are one and six, before the stomach, directly opposite the cinnabar field behind the navel, five-colored with central yellow, one *cun* and two *fen* in size, arranged like the hexagrams in the color of true cinnabar.

**Internal Contemplation Diagram**
On yang days: first take six sets of six breaths (thirty-six breaths) to form one yang line. Repeat this to complete six lines, forming *Qian* and *Kun*. Then take four sets of six breaths (twenty-four breaths) to transform the odd yang into an even yin line. Repeat this to complete six lines, forming the *Kun* hexagram.

On yin days: first take four sets of six breaths (twenty-four breaths) to form one yin line. Repeat this to complete six lines, forming the *Kun* hexagram. Then take six sets of six breaths (thirty-six breaths) to transform the even yin into an odd yang line. Repeat this to complete six lines, transforming into *Qian* and *Kun*.

**Alternative Method**
Yang Day Cavern-Viewing Hexagram *Qi* Method

**Yin Day Hexagram Qi Method**
Again visualize as before to form the *Kun* hexagram. Without drawing breath, from below ascend upward, swish and swallow twenty-four breaths, dividing them into six mouthfuls to swallow. Let the fluid descend naturally to form one yang line.

Upon completing this, once more settle the mind and calm the thoughts, closing the *qi* for a long while. Allow the spirit to congeal and *qi* to emerge, then perform mutual exchange and guiding exercises two or three times to ensure the *qi* flows freely between above and below. Next, regulate the breath and practice the method of thorough visualization.

**Perceiving the Hundred Spirits**
The Master says: When first practicing this method, silently invoke the hundred spirits. After the morning audience with the Perfected, observe your true form appearing in the mirror. Only then face the mirror to summon the celestial deities, earthly spirits, Jade Maidens, Jade Lads, Merit Officers, talisman clerks, and attending servants.

**Method of Stealth, Stealth, Stealth, and *Gou***
First recite the water incantation, wash the ears and eyes before and behind, then practice penetrating vision.

**Azure Mystery Water Incantation**
Reverently invite the Azure Maiden, the Spirit-Responsive Perfected Youth, to ascend and descend with the primordial life mandate.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as the Azure Mystery Heavenly Worthy commands.*

This is the Jade Purity mudra. Hold it over the water’s surface, face east, and recite the incantation nine times. Draw the eastern *qi* nine times, combine it with the mudra, and flick it into the water. Then raise the Jade Purity mudra and wash the ears and eyes with the middle finger.

**Ear and Eye Washing Incantation**
Azure Youths, carry out the decree for your servant.
*Swiftly, swiftly, open my spirit’s passage, divine objects, observe people, and respond to the numinous.*

Upon completion, gaze sharply into the mirror.

**Great Incantation of the Numinous Treasure Jade Mirror**
Reddish haze, ink-black, grinding the true, *walà*, Numinous Treasure.
*Xingsheng turns, Duli shifts, Kehan the Sage, Gongdu’s wish.*
*Xingsheng turns, Duli shifts, Kehan the Bright, Gongdu fulfills. Cut the corners true, gather souls and seize.*
*Gongdu gathers souls and seizes.*

Summon the swift messengers of the eight directions, celestial deities, earthly spirits, and the myriad spirits to assemble as one.

*By the decree of the Conjoined Brightness Heavenly Emperor, by the decree of Heaven and Earth, seize.*

This method: first form the Three Coatings and Five Peaks mudra with both hands, recite the incantation, draw the *qi* of the five directions, and blow it into the mirror. Next, blow toward the Ghost Gate, inhale the *qi* of the Ghost Gate, and blow toward the southeast. Recite the incantation again, inhale the southeastern *qi*, and blow it into the mirror. Then blow toward the Heaven Gate once more, recite the incantation again, inhale the *qi* of the Heaven Gate, and blow it into the mirror.

**Incantation:**
Reverently invite the great deities of the eight trigrams—*Qian*, *Kan*, *Gen*, *Zhen*, *Xun*, *Li*, *Kun*, and *Dui*—to gather and seize the wayward and demonic spirits from the eight directions, causing them to manifest their forms within my mirror.
*Swiftly, swiftly, seize.*

This method: with a brush, mark one point from *Qian* to *Dui*, eight points in total. Draw the directional *qi* and blow it to illuminate the ghostly beings of the Three Realms and the hundred spirits of the ten directions, revealing their forms. For matters unknown, close the eyes briefly, blow *qi* into the mirror, and upon closing the eyes, the vision will appear. Practicing this daily, all ghosts and demons will naturally reveal their true forms without concealment.

Recite again:
*Xingsheng turns, Duli shifts, Kehan the Bright, Gongdu fulfills. Cut the corners true.*
*Gather souls and seize.*
*Gongdu gathers souls and seizes.*

Upon completing the incantation, draw the *qi* of the eight directions and blow it into the mirror. With daily devotion, the spirit-*qi* will naturally manifest beings without further effort.

**Incantation of the Numinous Treasure Jade Purity Penetrating Mystery Mirror**
Thirty-two Heavens, thirty-two Emperors.
The hidden names of all heavens, the hidden sounds of all heavens.
The empty cavern of heaven, the natural numinous scripture.
The hidden rhymes of all heavens, the sounds within heaven.
The honored within heaven, the spirits within heaven.
The great demons within heaven, the numina within heaven.
Nine harmonies and ten unions transform into the Upper Clarity.
The boundless mystery, profound and unfathomable.
The divine Perfected descend, universally delivering heaven and humanity.
Today, joyfully receiving deliverance, passing through the barriers of all heavens.
Request the eradication of the Three Evils, severing the roots of earthly existence.
Soaring through the Five Passes, names recorded in the Great Mystery.
Demon Kings supervise and report, unrestrained at the gates of heaven.
The Eastern Dipper records lifespan, the Western Dipper inscribes names,
The Northern Dipper decrees death, the Southern Dipper bestows life,
The Central Dipper, the Great Chief, oversees all spirits.
The Azure Emperor guards the hun-soul, the White Emperor attends the po-soul,
The Red Emperor nurtures *qi*, the Black Emperor circulates blood,
The Yellow Emperor presides at the center, myriad spirits cannot transgress.
Azure Heaven Demon King, Bayuan Choubo.
Red Heaven Demon King, Futiandan Shi.
White Heaven Demon King, Fanshan Liumu.
Black Heaven Demon King, Jianchou Langfu.
Yellow Heaven Demon King, Hengtian Danli.
The Five Great Demon Emperors, lords of all spirits.
Soaring and marching with drums, commanding ghostly soldiers.
Brandishing banners and beating drums, roaming the vast emptiness.
Self-styled resplendent, all heavens unite in merit.
Ascend to heaven to deliver humanity? Sternly seize the Northern Zheng.
Divine Lords receive the mandate, universally sweeping away inauspiciousness.
Eight Mighties spew a single venom, fierce horses spread fourfold.
Heavenly Soldiers lead the vanguard, marshaling banners and flags.
Hurl fire for ten thousand miles, streaming bells in eight directions.
Dare to test or resist the Upper Perfected?
Gold and iron strike first, the Great Queen inflicts punishment.
Slaughter and dismember ghostly souls, wind and fire unceasing.
Thousands upon thousands beheaded, ten thousands upon ten thousands dismembered.
Demons dare not offend, ghosts dare not haunt.
The Three Officials of the Northern Zheng inspect the ghostly camps.
No concealment permitted, the Golden Horse post-haste.
Universally proclaim without end, all spirits heed.
The Five Emperors of the Three Realms, declare to the Upper Clarity.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as the Yuanshi Heavenly Worthy and the Most High Dao Lord decree.*

This method: face the Heaven Gate, recite the incantation, inhale *qi* and blow it toward the ten directions. Recite the incantation again, inhale the *qi* of the ten directions, and blow it into the mirror.

**Incantation to Summon Spirits into the Mirror**
Heaven and earth ascend and descend, the two *qi* intermingle.
The two *qi* of yin and yang, sun and moon conjoin in brightness.
I now decree and summon the penetrating vision spirits, the divine beings of heaven above and below, yin and yang, to appear in their true forms within my precious mirror.

This method: raise the *Qian*-*Kun* talisman, face east, and draw one mouthful each of southeastern and northwestern *qi*, blowing it toward the mirror’s surface—this is called the Upper Mystery *qi* blow.

**Incantation for Sharply Gazing at Celestial Deities in the Mirror**
From whence do I derive this power, to sharply gaze at celestial deities in the mirror?
Yin and yang harmonize and align, the imperial mandate manifests the body.

**Holding the Numinous Treasure Mirror**
Black crow of the eastern sun, vermilion Thearch spirit.
No coercive force can compel—
the Three Origins naturally return to the mirror.

Sun and moon stir the wheel of intent;
within the realm, all numinous officials—
or as some say, celestial and terrestrial deities—
swiftly manifest their forms at will.

This method: blow southeastern *qi* onto the mirror’s surface.

**Method for Penetrating Vision**
First inscribe the central section of jade characters and swallow them. If unclear, further inscribe the names of the thirty-two heavens and swallow them. Morning and evening, recite one scroll of the *Huangting Neijing Jing*. Once at dawn and once at dusk, in a quiet, dim chamber, use the second finger of both hands to press the four directions above the eyes, then trace the circular light nine times.

**Incantation:**
The circular light scatters and divides,
crimson, clear, and purple clouds.
The Three *Qi* linger and protect,
preserving your bodily root.
Piercing vision of a hundred spirits,
penetrating sight of ten thousand deities.
The pupil-child within the eye
clearly beholds the worthy perfected.
If there be communion with the numinous,
together we ascend to the Upper Clarity.
Swiftly, swiftly, as in the statutes and ordinances.

After reciting the incantation, press the hands to the eyes and brows, nine times each.

**Method for Shifting Scenery and Communicating Light**
Divine light, divine light,
illuminating the eight directions.
Above, it connects with sun and moon;
below, it pierces the frigid regions.
East, south, west, north—
universally shining upon the ten thousand states.
Celestial deities and perfected immortals,
scenery, mountains, and rivers,
seas, rivers, and springs,
ghosts and beings of the hidden depths—
wherever the Three Lights shine,
nothing remains concealed.
The divine light mirror seizes all,
no obstruction, not even a hair’s breadth.
Swiftly, swiftly, as in the statutes of the Three Realms of Upper Clarity.

This method: visualize the eastern sun, western moon, and Northern Dipper. Recite the incantation once, draw *qi*, and blow onto the mirror or the center of the palm. First anoint with sesame oil, then raise the intention to illuminate.

**Incantation for Intent**
□□ facing the Most High,
dispatching the radiant true body.
If the intent of the ordinary mind does not arrive,
the pupil-child will not descend.
First recite the incantation, then with the left hand trace from *mao* to *wu*, pressing firmly, and call: "Divine generals, swiftly come to attend the origin."
Draw three mouthfuls of southern *qi* and direct them to the place, commanding the pupil-child to look. If a divine person arrives, all will manifest their forms.

Recite the incantation again:
□□ bestows the true method,
the ten thousand spirits all return in full.
If the descending pupil-child is not believed,
silently blow upon the household—
even small children will see and manifest as such.

**Numinous Treasure Jade Mirror for Penetrating Subtle Mysteries**
Red apricot, *mao* ink-black,
*li* grind true,
*dui* stocking wax,
*chou* numinous treasure.
Central revival engenders transformation,
*chen* solitary servant shifts,
*mao* may be Han brightness,
*yin* merit all accomplished.
Two fingers press beneath the thumb’s nail.

Cut the corner straight,
two fingers press the center of the thumb.
Gather the hun and seize.

Thumb presses the center.
Merit all gathers the hun and seizes.
Swift messengers of the eight directions,
celestial deities and earthly spirits,
the ten thousand spirits return as one—
unite with the luminous Heavenly Thearch of the sun,
unite with the mandate of heaven and earth to seize.

This method: face the ghost gate and recite the incantation once. Draw *qi* from the eight directions and blow onto the banner—it will naturally grow heavy. Do this three times. First form the Three Crossings and Five Sufferings mudra, recite the incantation, draw southeastern *qi*, and blow onto the mirror. With a brush, begin at the *qian* direction and mark eight points.

**Incantation:**
Reverently summon the great deities of the eight trigrams—*qian*, *kan*, *gen*, *zhen*, *xun*, *li*, *kun*, *dui*—to swiftly descend.

This method: draw *qi* from the eight directions and blow. A thousand eyes behold as one; sun and moon receive and uphold. Those who do not expend spirit-*qi* will naturally manifest their forms within.

**Incantation for Manifesting Forms**
Reverently summon the Great Heaven of Primordial Origin above,
the Perfected of the Left Mystery,
the Perfected of the Right Mystery.
Hear your disciple’s summons:
illuminate the golden essence,
open the jade portal.
Seize and manifest the soul of the departed *so-and-so*,
the spirit of *so-and-so*—
swiftly manifest the form.

This method: press the center of the middle finger, recite the incantation once, draw northern *qi*, blow onto water, sip a mouthful, and spray toward the ghost gate. Visualize drawing *qi* and blowing onto the banner. Recite "no concealment permitted" thirty-six times.

**Shifting Scenery and Communicating Light**
The ordinances of the Primordial Origin,
the edict of the Lord of the Dao.

**Summoning the Radiant Lads**
Summon the Lad of Sunlight, the Lad of Moonlight, the Lad of Starlight, the Lad of Cavernous Yang, the Lad of Luminous Dawn. Mobilize the mysterious Dipper of the Three Lights, the mysterious essence of sun and moon, transforming them into the sixfold divine radiance of universal penetration. Shine through and illumine the ten directions of the world, where myriad scenes and a thousand Perfected Ones shift to manifest before one’s eyes—divining persons, foretelling objects, revealing the unmanifest and the yet-to-come, communicating with spirits and invoking numinous response.

**Method:** Draw *qi* from the midst of the Three Lights and blow onto a brush, or use a finger to inscribe a talisman in the palm. The brush should be dipped in cinnabar; the finger, in hempseed oil. After inscribing, blow *qi* and recite the incantation again. Recite the incantation, draw *qi*, and blow—repeat this three times. A streak of fire will appear, penetrating and illuminating the netherworld and events yet to unfold.

**The Celestial Bureau’s Cavernous Mystery Mirror**
Red haze, black ink, grind the true, wrap in wax, *Lingbao*.

**Incantation:** In midair, trace with the left hand the Heart Seal of one’s original master. With the right hand, gather it from the void into the palm, then blow the *qi* of the five directions seven times. Press down—repeat this three times until the three colors of blue, yellow, and white appear.

Recite again:
Reverently summon the talismanic envoys of descending Perfection and summoning numina—hasten to descend, true *qi* alight upon the eyes, by edict.

Draw the *qi* of the Heavenly Gate and blow—behold the talismans of Descending Perfection and Summoning Numinous Spirits, their cinnabar hues manifesting in the palm.

Recite again:
Divine winds stir and blow, jade scripts resound like chimes.

Blow the *qi* of the southeast—behold the two talismans swaying.

Recite again:
Reverently summon the Lad of the Dao Who Opens the East, the Lad of the Dao Who Opens the South, the Lad of the Dao Who Opens the West, the Lad of the Dao Who Opens the North, the Lad of the Dao Who Opens the Center—hasten to descend with me.

Draw the *qi* of the five directions and blow—behold the Lads of the Five Directions. Only then may each be summoned, pursued, and made to descend, to be employed according to the method.

**The Cavernous Mystery Mirror of Numinous Treasure** further states: Summon spirits into the mirror. Heaven and Earth descend their *qi*, sun and moon conjoin their light. Above in the heavens, below on the earth, *so-and-so* from *such-and-such* place manifests in form.

Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the ordinances and edicts.

Draw the *qi* of Heaven and Earth and blow as in the usual method.

**Method for Expediting the Passage of Departed Souls**
The master says: When approaching the altar to subdue demonic and wayward spirits, one must ensure that both the living and the dead receive benefit and deliverance. First, break open the prison.

**Incantation for Breaking Open the Prison**
Primordial Origin of the Primordial Above, Lord of the Dao on High. Instruct your servant to wield the talisman, illuminating and breaking open the dark prison, that the sin-laden souls may depart and be freed.

Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the ordinances and edicts.

This incantation is from the *Scripture of Ninefold Pure Brahmanic Chanting*. Face the Heavenly Gate, recite silently nine times, blow *qi* onto the departed soul—thus the soul-spirit shall be released from suffering.

Next, employ the refinement of Water and Fire.

**Incantation for Water Refinement**
Withered, revive; extinguished, live again. Attain rebirth in the heavens, receive anew the Great Numen. Through the kalpas of the Nine Heavens, return and repeat the womb’s infancy. Filth and karmic burdens dissolve and vanish—ascend in broad daylight, reborn.

**Method:** Take a vessel of water, face north, and knock the teeth nine times. Visualize three Jade Lads and seven Jade Maidens. Spit seven mouthfuls of saliva, recite the incantation seven times, and sprinkle the departed soul.

**Incantation for Fire Refinement**
Sunlight and moonlight, lingering in Cavernous Yang. Flowing fire enters the vessel, refining and transforming yin’s baleful radiance. Corporeal filth vanishes, the myriad *qi* harmonize in well-being. Transcend the five sufferings, ascend and soar to the celestial halls.

**Method:** Take a vessel of fire, face south, and knock the teeth three times. Visualize as before, exhale *qi* three times, and blow nine times. Take the true form of Deng Mountain and reduce it to ash. Burn the Primordial Talismanic Mandate of the True Form of Deng Metropolis to subdue demons and carry out the rites. Protect and recommend the departed soul, that it may be ranked in the Southern Palace. The embers of Deng Metropolis extinguish, the Three Officials relax their punishments. Bonds, fetters, and karmic obstructions are absolved—receive transformation and be reborn. Refined according to rank, ascend to the courts of blessedness.

When the incantation is complete, press the tongue against the upper palate. Visualize the body as the primordial Celestial Worthy of Numinous Treasure upon the crown of the head, silently recite the hidden words once, and envision golden radiance filling the mouth. With both hands form the Mudra of Jade Purity, then scatter the ash toward the northeast. Release the mudra, and the soul shall immediately ascend to the Vermilion Palace, where, refined according to rank, it returns to life in the courts of blessedness.

---

*The Supreme Purity Numinous Treasure Great Rites, Scroll Two concludes.*

**Text Title:** *The Supreme Purity Numinous Treasure Great Rites*
Originally transmitted by Xiao Quanzhen, reverently compiled by Wang Qizhen; emerged from the simplicity of the Southern Song.
One of the comprehensive compendia of Daoist rites from the Song-Yuan *Yuanshu* tradition.
Comprising twenty-seven sections in sixty-six scrolls.
**Source Edition:** *Daoist Canon of the Orthodox Tradition*, First Section.

---

*The Supreme Purity Numinous Treasure Great Rites, Scroll Three*
Transmitted by the Perfected of Mystic Subtlety, the Illuminating and Salvific Master Baoguanzhen
To the disciples of the Three Caverns of Supreme Purity, the lineage-holding masters of the Numinous Treasure teachings, Wang Qizhen, compiler.

**Section on the Weaving of Scriptural and Ritual Practice**

**Method of Penetrating Vision**
To enter the chamber: regulate the breath and sit within the layered halls. This means one has already taken a seat before the peachwood altar table. Suspend a mirror above the altar, with a basin of water before the mirror’s surface. The yang spirit resides in the mirror, the yin spirit in the water.

The Perfected of Numinous Treasure, divine so-and-so, swiftly manifest your form here.

**Urgent as the statutes command!**

**Method for the Placard of the Chamber**
