The Chamber of Divine Tiger Penetrating Vision—may the attending officials, soldiers, *gongcao* messengers, and jade maidens of this chamber, who await the dawn’s audience and the cessation of routine duties, swiftly assemble here in clear manifestation to guard and attend, heeding the summons of this chamber.

To the right, prepare a placard, inscribed on both sides:
*Today, enter the chamber. Today, do not enter the chamber.*

**Method for the Silent Memorial of Penetrating Vision**
[Your] subordinate, the Dharma-ranked [disciple] of [such-and-such] surname, prostrates and bows twice, respectfully memorializing:

I humbly reflect that, though born in the lower realms, I early planted good affinities, received the numinous scriptures, and gained access to the Dao’s domain. Presumptuously holding office in the Three Caverns’ Dharma duties, I strive to deliver the dead and ferry the living, to cleanse the dust-rooted defilements, to concentrate my thoughts on the supreme Dao, and to cultivate refinement from beginning to end, upholding the precepts without lapse.

Yet, with my defiled, ordinary frame, I have not fathomed the profound principle of the Primordial Origin. My ears and eyes are blocked, my body and mind benighted—how could I clearly perceive spirits and gods, or penetrate the hidden and manifest?

Yesterday, by the grace of my initiation master [so-and-so], I received the transmission of the *Numinous Treasure Great Rites* and the *Hundred Million Characters of Penetrating Vision* from the *Jade Tablet of the Primordial Origin*. Today, on this [such-and-such] day, I reverently swallow the inner secret name in accordance with the method, to achieve penetrating vision of the true numina.

I humbly beseech the ancestral masters, the Three Treasures, and the divine numina of the Emperors on High to pardon my transgressions of irreverence and offense, and to grant the marvel of their transformative refinement. May they specially bestow the true, living *qi* of rectitude, the luminous wisdom of the Great Dao, the salvific grace of the Three Treasures, and the sixfold penetrating *qi* of the perfected, flowing into the fields of my body.

Within, may they scour the dust from the mirror of my heart; without, may they dispel the filth from my ears and eyes. May they open the radiance of my viscera, dissolve the yin stagnation of the hundred passages, subdue and vanquish demonic calamities and karmic obstructions, and sever the knotted roots of the womb’s origin.

Thus may I, having swallowed the inner secret divine script, instantly illuminate the ten directions, sit in contemplation of the Three Realms, penetrate the hidden and manifest, clearly perceive spirits and gods, deliver the dead and aid the living, cultivate the true and study the Dao. Whatever I desire or turn toward, may no wish go unfulfilled.

May this assist the flourishing of the true wind and exalt the mysterious transformation on high. I dare not lightly divulge or neglect [these teachings], nor betray the Dao or my master. Should I violate this covenant, I willingly submit to the mysterious statutes.

Your subordinate prostrates and secretly presents this memorial of the heart, one document, respectfully addressed to the throne of the Most August Three Treasures before the gates of the Three Heavens.

Your subordinate, unable to contain his fervent entreaty, is overwhelmed with awe and trepidation.

[Seal] the inner [memorial] with the Six *Ding*.

The Master said: On the sixth day of each month at the hour of *wu* (noon), take six characters of the true secret names of the Six *Ding* in cinnabar script on yellow silk, facing the direction of the current ten-day period as the head, and arrange the rest in order. Draw in *qi* and distribute them. Form every two characters into one talisman, making three talismans in total. On the seventh day at the first watch of *chou* (1–3 a.m.), upon waking, put on your clothes, face the *Ding* direction, and take one talisman to form into a pellet. Recite its name and swallow it with pure water. At the appointed time, when you first hear a sound like someone stirring, swiftly face the original direction, draw in *qi* six times, and swallow it. The same applies to the middle seventh day and the last three ten-day periods. After practicing this method for a full month, whenever you have any matter, face the direction of the current ten-day period, recite the names, draw in *qi*, and swallow it. Close your eyes for a long while, and the Six *Ding* will report to your heart-spirit. Whatever arises in your mind or is spoken will all be future events, with no failure to manifest. If malevolent ghosts or spirits trouble you, use the same method, and the Six Spirits will reveal the cause of the ghostly affliction. Even the colors of clothing, the number of people, and all details will be verified.

**Externally Aligning the Six Jia**
The Master said: On each *Jia* day of the month at the hour of *mao* (5–7 a.m.), write the names of the Six *Jia* in cinnabar on white silk, face the direction of the current ten-day period, and swallow it with westward-flowing water. If the Three Luminaries (sun, moon, stars) are not visible, use well water. Afterward, clench your fists firmly, sit upright, and strike the Heavenly Drum thirty-six times. Knock your teeth twenty-four times, interlock your hands in the *xiangyi* mudra, perform the Crane’s Peck six times, and rotate the Three Passes nine times. Separate your hands to part the water at the nape. Visualize the *qi* field below the navel as a radiant sun, blazing like fire throughout your body, both inside and out, glowing red. Recite the names thirty-six times, draw in *qi*, and blow it over your body. Constantly visualize the Six Spirits attending you. The Six *Jia* will reveal future events in dreams before they occur. The Six *Jia* will always guard your form, and over time, you will see them and command them at will. For minor malevolent spirits causing harm, write their talismans in cinnabar, burn them with gold coins in fire, and the Six Generals will immediately dispatch them into the sea.

**Harmonizing Memorials and Petitions**
The Master said: On the day before the last day of the year, bathe and change clothes in advance. At dawn the next day, sit upright in a secluded chamber, face the Gate of Heaven, and recite the hidden secret names of the Three Heavens—*yong*, *liu*, *jing*—continuously for twelve hours, completing a total of three hundred thousand recitations. On New Year’s Day, maintain silence for the entire day. Thereafter, whenever reciting memorials, petitions, or invocations, perform the method once: draw in eastern *qi* and blow it onto the text, and it will immediately reach its destination, receiving a mysterious response. It is also said: On the last day of each month, recite one hundred thousand times, and memorials will swiftly reach the Three Heavens.

**Urgent Relief from Distress**
The Master said: On the eight solar terms, observe a pure fast. At the end of *xu* (7–9 p.m.) and the beginning of *hai* (9–11 p.m.), enter a quiet chamber, sit upright, and recite the inner secret names of the Three Heavens, guarding the center and reciting the *Biao De Pan Lei* one hundred thousand times. When encountering tigers, wolves, or poisonous creatures, hold your breath for seven cycles, recite the names thirty-two times, and all toxins will subside and cause no harm. It is also said: On the first day of each month, recite ten thousand times. After three months, this will respond to all disasters and urgent distress. Silently recite thirty-two times, and disasters will naturally dissolve.

**Guarding the Body with the Five Peaks**
The Master said: On the ninth day after the Beginning of Spring, the third day after the Beginning of Summer, the seventh day after the Beginning of Autumn, and the fifth day after the Beginning of Winter, on the day when earth *qi* flourishes, face each direction at the hours of *zi*, *wu*, *mao*, *you*, *yin*, *shen*, *si*, and *hai*, and knock your teeth according to the number of the direction. Visualize the lords, officials, and officers of the Eastern Peak leading the Four Peaks before you. Recite the Five Peaks incantation, chant the names of the Five Peaks, draw in the *qi* of the five directions, and swallow it. After a year of practice, when seeking matters or fearing urgent distress—such as traveling through mountains or crossing waters—first knock your teeth five times, recite the names, draw in the *qi* of the five directions, and swallow it. Then blow over your body and distribute the *qi* to the directions. You will escape distress, and all your endeavors will be supremely auspicious and as you wish.

**Penetrating Wisdom and Myriad Insights**
The Master said: On the fifth day of the fifth month, write the secret names of the Northern Dipper in cinnabar without counting the number, wrap them nine times in red silk, place them in a green bamboo tube, seal it tightly with paper, and secure it in the handle of a hawk’s perch. Retrieve it when fully prepared. Consume one dose per day, and you will recite ten thousand words, gaining penetrating wisdom and insight. Alternatively, on the seventh day of the first ten-day period, write on yellow silk with cinnabar, wrap it seven times in *tengpao*, and take one pill per day, swallowing it with pure water. After forty-nine days, you will foreknow all matters, your wisdom will commune with the divine, and you will recite ten thousand words daily without forgetting. It is also said: On the night of the seventh day of the first ten-day period, take one grain of frankincense and one grain of cinnabar the size of a bean, soak them in a bowl of westward-flowing water or well water, and add the cinnabar-written Dipper name to the water. Face east, recite the *Qingtong Fengming* incantation, chew the frankincense and cinnabar finely, and swallow them with the water. Then face north, recite the Dipper name and the incantation: *"Northern Dipper, Supreme Unity Divine Youth, one inhalation brings a hundred responses."* Recite seven times, form the Dipper talisman into a pellet, and swallow it with water. Next, recite the incantation: *"Divine Youth of Azure Radiance, spirit light mysteriously bright."* Recite nine times, draw in eastern *qi*, and blow it into the remaining water to wash your eyes. On the eighth day, omit the frankincense and cinnabar, using only the Dipper name and reciting the three previous incantations to consecrate the water for washing your eyes. When someone submits a petition, use only the first three incantations, draw in eastern *qi* and swallow it, close the door briefly, and whatever arises in your mind or is spoken will all align with the petitioner’s intent. Keep this secret.

**Daily Talisman Ingestion Practice**
The Master said: Write one *bao* (precious) character in cinnabar on yellow paper, totaling twenty-one strokes. Recite the incantation *"Qin Jing Quan Shou Mo Qi Kui Zhi Pi Ze Zhi Po"* (twenty-one characters), one incantation per stroke as you write. Swallow one talisman daily, visualizing the *ling* (spirit) character in your heart and the *bao* (precious) character on your head.

The Master said: For all injuries from poisonous substances, as well as paralysis, swelling, cinnabar tumors, and ailments of the five viscera and six bowels, write the Four Upright Yin-Yang taboo names on the afflicted area, either ingesting them internally or applying them externally. No more than three characters are needed before recovery is achieved.

The Master said: For all illnesses, write the Southern Dipper taboo names and ingest them. Write in cinnabar on yellow paper.

**Five Peaks Pacifying and Stabilizing Talismans**
The Master said: When writing talismans, first recite the *Kuicheng* incantation, form the *chen* mudra, draw in *Kuicheng qi*, and blow it onto the inkstone. Next, recite the *Qianyuan* incantation to infuse the brush, then recite the *Taiyi* incantation and blow onto the ink. After a while, grind the ink forty-nine times in alternating directions, draw in southeastern *qi*, and blow it onto the inkstone. Then recite the *Five Peaks Upholding the Body* incantation, form the mudra with the middle finger, blow onto the paper, and write the talisman in cinnabar. Silently recite the incantation once more, draw in northwestern *qi*, release the mudra into the talisman, seal and imprint it according to the method, and have the patient carry the talisman while burning it with prayers. When it is consumed in the flames, a response will manifest. The *Fuzheng* talisman is practiced in the same manner.

**Shangqing Wondrous Conduct Perfected One’s Year-Breaking Talismans**
Heaven and Earth taboo names, Sun and Moon taboo names, Five Stars taboo names, Four Upright taboo names, Six Ding taboo names on yang days, Six Jia taboo names on yin days.

Dao Treasures, Dharma Treasures, and the sacred decrees of Zhenwu, the Celestial Marshal, and the Great Generals of the Luo Heaven are invoked: *"We respectfully summon [Name] Spirit to act in accordance with the decree."*

On the day of the year, month, day, and hour, the proclamation is issued.
The Dharma position: [Surname] [Given Name], acting in accordance.

**Five Peaks Pacifying and Stabilizing Talisman**
The Master said: For all malevolent spirits, demonic entities, haunted altars, inauspicious temples, cursed lands, water demons, flood dragons, and jade serpents, write in cinnabar on a large stone and sink it, or bury it in place.

The Five Peaks stabilize the five directions: Heaven corresponds to the northwest, Earth to the southwest, and Humanity to the southeast. The *Gongdu* is in the northeast. When writing, form the mudra of the Five Peaks and Three Passes, draw in their *qi*, and blow it onto the talisman.

**Nine Palaces Revealing Ghosts**
The Divine Master said: If a disciple lacks steadfast power and encounters all manner of unruly ghosts and spirits, they may rely on the Nine Palaces method. Men begin at the *Li* Palace, moving counterclockwise each year, initially skipping the second palace and starting at the *Kan* Palace. Each year, they move counterclockwise, skipping *Gen*, and always passing through one yang palace per year. Determine the palace based on the year, then proceed to the month within the year, the day within the month, and the hour within the day. Further subdivide by the hour to identify the time of illness, transgression, or ghostly manifestation. The year’s branch, month’s branch, day’s branch, and direction will reveal the nature of the ghost or spirit.

*Qian* governs heavy-headedness, difficulty lifting the body, cold and pain in both feet—afflictions caused by a yang person. If a lingering illness leads to death, the spirit sinks in the northwest. If there are vows or pledges involving banners and incense, the *Kan* Palace brings mental confusion and lethargy, with dark-clad spirits or wayward souls. Abdominal rumbling, water swelling, or limb distension may occur, with drowned spirits struggling to speak. Wandering in the due north may cause strange dreams and sorrowful sighs. A single ghost, whether yin or yang, requires careful questioning to uncover the cause.

*Gen* affects the heart and flanks with fullness, throat obstruction, raving speech, and erratic behavior, with uncontrollable grief and laughter. Groups of eight ghosts often haunt temples or improperly tended graves. Stone and metal spirits may also appear in the northeast—examine their forms closely.

*Zhen* brings jaundice and pestilence, alternating chills and fever spreading to the limbs, loss of appetite, cursing, and offenses against heavenly decrees. Ghosts of those executed, killed by epidemics, or clad in blue-green may follow, with red and yellow female ghosts appearing. Danger looms within three days.

*Xun* causes delirious speech, blindness, and riddles that cannot be deciphered. Ancestral spirits may speak in hushed tones, while external curses often come from women. Ghosts seize the hun and po souls, causing day and night groaning. Only through purification and seeking the Great Dao can health and peace be restored.

*Li* brings misfortune in the due south, with paralysis, pain, burns, and sores. Overheating and jaundice may occur, with blood ghosts and those who died in childbirth. Those who perished from slander or violent deaths, or who haunt their relatives, are yang spirits. Face the fire position to confront these malevolent ghosts and reveal their actions.

*Kun* affects the spleen and stomach, causing dysentery and bodily weakness. Chronic conditions are difficult to cure, as lingering corpses reside in the southwest. Disturbing the earth may offend the yearly *sha*, manifesting strange lights. Ancestral mothers and drowned spirits may follow, drawn by improper burials.

*Dui* brings consumption, convulsions, wheezing, coughing, and foot ailments. Burials that bring misfortune or injuries from punishments may cause recurring afflictions. Seeking merit through misguided rituals or ancient artifacts near the home may invite three accompanying ghosts, leading to grievances and retribution.

The Master said: This method, practiced with purification and ingestion, refines the self into truth. When the cycle is complete, the technique of penetrating vision becomes fixed. The gaze is like seeing through a dark window or piercing a mouse’s hole, discerning objects a hundred paces away in the mist. With eyes closed for a long time, focus the vision. If the mind wanders even slightly, the eye’s spirit will stray, and the luminous perception will fade. Initially, it appears as a thin mist, then as scattered colored lights. After twenty-eight days, it resembles shadows; after thirty-five days, it gradually clarifies; after forty-nine days, forms and attire become visible; after ninety days, voices and sounds can be heard; and after a hundred days, one may command immortals and spirits. Above all, maintain purity and stillness. If unable to practice this, proceed with the *Inner Vision of the Central Repository* method.

The Dao of the Numinous Treasure has three levels: the highest is the *Emperor One and Returning Wind* Dao; the middle is the *Central Principle of Five Qi Harmonization*, bestowed upon the Five Emperors; the lowest is the *Ten Transformations of Returning Spirit* scripture, entrusted to the various Perfected Ones. Beyond these three, the remaining methods serve to aid the living and deliver the dead, summoning the true and invoking the numinous. Those who study the highest Dao and aspire to immortality will find all essentials within these texts.

**Inner Vision of the Central Repository**
The Master said: If one cannot enter seclusion for a hundred days, on a *liu jia* day at dawn, face south and sit upright. Write the inner taboo names in black ink on white silk, place them in a clean vase, and add soil from the six directions of the current ten-day period, each in its corresponding position, covering the taboo names in the vase. Place the vase in the *jia* direction and seal it according to the method.

Then sit upright, circling the Five Peaks and Three Paths mudra once with both hands, recite the incantation once, and inhale the qi of the six directions to swallow it. Next, recite the prayer again and inhale the qi of the *jia* direction to swallow it. By noon, impurities will be cleansed, and verification achieved. After ten days of stabilization, on the following *jia* day, take the previous jade tablet and burn it, mixing the ashes with dark mystery water to ingest. Discard the soil from the prior ten-day period into flowing water. Rewrite the jade tablet and again place soil in the vase as before. Then perform the mudra circuit and recite the incantation. After completing sixty *jia* days, inner vision will reveal the five viscera, and with eyes closed, one may commune with spirits and penetrate the numinous. If one violates the precepts through sexual indulgence, all prior efforts will be lost, and lifespan will be shortened by one hundred twenty years.

**Aligning with the Dipper**
The Master said: The method of aligning with the Dipper requires selecting a site unpolluted by birth or death defilements. Construct a frame resembling a bamboo trellis, upon which place a carpenter’s square to model the Dipper’s form. At the crucial juncture of the square, suspend eight bright mirrors so their light shines downward, following the Dipper’s configuration to point toward the earth’s directions. Below, use white chalk to draw the Dipper’s shape upon the stars, placing a lamp on the ground so its light aligns with the mirrors’ reflection. With seven feet of red silk, inscribe the inner names of the Seven Stars and bind it beneath the forehead. Don pure garments, wield a sword, and arrange all according to the diagram. The Perfected Master should choose a time after clear skies and rain for optimal effect.

When aligning with the Dipper, begin at the Dipper’s handle intersecting *qian*, stepping to each star while reciting the incantation forty-nine times. Then observe the convergence of the Three Luminaries, inhale their qi, and swallow it with water. Cast the cup, inhale water to spray at the Ghost Gate, shout the command, and strike the cup with the sword—forty-nine times in total. After the incantation, proceed to the second star, repeating this for all seven stars. Upon returning to the Dipper’s mouth, meditate in stillness for a long while, settle the spirit, and bow seven times. Gazing into the Dipper’s mouth, if two stars appear and one is discerned, the register of death will be severed and altered. That night, celestial Perfected Ones, the Three Realms, and ten thousand spirits will all descend to the seat, awaiting the Dipper’s report while lying in repose.

**Dipper-Aligning Talisman**
This talisman is inscribed in cinnabar on seven feet of crimson silk. When aligning with the Dipper, bind it to the back of the head with the talisman facing outward.

**Dipper-Aligning Incantation**
Dwelling in the mundane, petty persons seek the Dao and yearn for the numinous.
Ever beholding your august presence, we pray for long life.
Supreme Jade Emperor, Purple Tenuity Emperor Lord:
The Three Terraces gave me birth, the Three Terraces nurtured me, the Three Terraces protected me.
□□□□□□□.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance.

Moreover, within the incantation, the Great Dipper’s mighty *Kui* governs and oversees all spirits. At its center dwell the exalted sages, the two august stellar lords. Now I align with the Dipper, praying to behold its true form. May the register of death be severed, the roots of evil extirpated. May I ascend through the Five Portals, my name inscribed in Jade Clarity. May decline and illness be cut off, the tomb’s baleful influence severed, sparing both body and soul. In the Northern Capital, sins are erased; in the Southern Bureau, long life is recorded. A hundred demons come to receive their charge; once the task is complete, they report to the Most Exalted. The Great Emperor confers the merit; the Jade Emperor commands its execution. Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the statutes and ordinances of the Three Heavens’ Mysterious Capital.

**Visualizing the Spirit and Aligning with the Dipper**
The master says: If a woman or one whose *qi* and blood are weak and feeble cannot stand for long, they should project the spirits of the Two Perfected Ones and visualize their soul aligning with the Dipper. If unable to physically pace the Dipper’s stars, on the twenty-first day of the month at the *hai* hour’s end, enter the oratory, face north, and prepare a mat. Place incense atop the head, and visualize the spirit’s intent following the incense smoke directly toward the Dipper. Envision the Seven Stars gleaming brightly in the Northern Dipper all at once. After a long while, knock the teeth seven times and recite the incantation according to the Dipper’s sequence. Once complete, lie down upon the mat in the oratory. Again visualize the Dipper’s two august stellar lords, their radiance shining brilliantly—this very night, there shall be a wondrous response. If no sign is perceived, wait for the next auspicious day, follow the method to align with the Dipper, and await the response before proceeding. If after seven attempts no sign appears, further alignment is forbidden, for one’s karmic transgressions are too grave to sever or alter the register of death. The adept must cultivate purity and precision, awaiting the numinous response as proof of efficacy. This method is the warp and weft of summoning the numinous, the oral transmission for recitation and practice. It should be performed in seclusion, with the mouth closed.

After aligning with the Dipper for seven days, do not return to the mundane chamber, lest others’ fear disrupt the transformative *qi*. Only after completing the Dipper alignment may one select a day for the **Audience with the Origin**.

**Audience with the Origin**
At the time of the Audience, face east, adjust robes and cap, and sit upright in the oratory. Use a mirror to reflect your form, visualizing your own image. Do this for seven days until the visualized form is as clear and vivid as your reflection. At midnight, envision your form within the Mud Pill; at noon, visualize it residing in the heart; at the *bu* hour, visualize it in the lower *dantian*. After seven days and nights, the distinctions between above and below will be clear. That night, report to the Gate of Heaven and memorialize the Three Heavens’ Jade Emperor, the Eastern and Western *qi*, the Queen Mother of the West, and the Azure Lord. Only then may the Audience with the Origin begin.

The method is as follows: At midnight, the *zi* hour, enter the oratory. Invoke and summon the divine messengers of the Dao, the Ten Heavenly Receivers, the Jade Maidens, the Flying Celestial Heralds, the two officials of the Upper Bureaus, the Direct Envoys of the Orthodox Unity, the Left and Right Attendant Messengers, the Yin-Yang Divine Scribes, the Chariot Officers of the Scarlet Talismans, the Wind-Riding Couriers, the Post-Horse Memorial Officers, the Flying Dragon Riders, the Spirit-Gathering and Spirit-Feeding Officers, the *Qi*-Gathering and *Qi*-Feeding Officers, the Demon-Gathering and Demon-Feeding Officers, the Thirty-Two Heavenly Memorial Scribes, the Lords of the *Jiazi* Cycle, the Jade Script Divine Messengers, the Demon-Discerning Jade Maidens, the Incense-Bearing Jade Maidens, the Heavenly Cavalry, the Celestial *Ding* Warriors, the Central Administrative Immortals, the Duty-Holding Jade Maidens, the Golden Lads, the Dragon-Riding Couriers, the Phoenix Chariots, the Purple Feathered Canopies of Lingzhi, the *Ding* Warriors’ Aides—all arrayed before you, each distinct and clear.

Then, clasp the **Ascension and Wind-Presenting Talisman** in hand, wear the **Jade Clarity Audience with the Origin Talisman** at the waist, and place the **Heaven-Ascending Unification Great Contract** upon the crown of the head. Next, sit upright, press the tongue to the upper palate, and visualize the Three Primordial Officials within the Three *Qi*. Within the Three *Qi* dwell the Perfected Ones, identical to your own form. First, hold the breath for twelve cycles, visualizing the Perfected One within the lower primordial white *qi* ascending into the heart to merge with the Perfected One within the yellow *qi*, becoming one. Then, hold the breath for nine cycles, visualizing the Perfected One within the central yellow-white *qi*, along with the *qi*, ascending into the Mud Pill to merge with the Perfected One within the blue-green *qi*, becoming one. The Perfected One wears a black cap and blue-green robes, adorned with the Five Peaks and Four Waterways.

Next, the left eye emits red *qi*, the right eye emits white *qi*; the two *qi* intertwine, forming a sphere of true *qi* that transforms into a chariot. Before you appears a cinnabar-jade feathered brush, shaped like a great chariot. Hold the breath for twenty-seven cycles, visualizing the Perfected One emerging from the crown of the head to board the chariot. The heart’s form vanishes, as if in a dream. Mounting the purple *qi* and golden light, gradually ascend, accompanied by divine spirits, until reaching the Wind-Presenting Realm. There, behold the Wind-Presenting Officers riding celestial beasts, wielding instruments. The adept draws the Wind-Presenting Talisman before the chariot. After a long while, the Wind-Presenting Chariot’s spirit guides the chariot through the Wind-Presenting Realm, swirling like dense clouds, circling nine times before emerging.

Upon reaching the Stellar Realm, the sun and moon’s yellow path shines like a long rainbow, flanked by jeweled flowers and treasure trees resembling pine and cedar with blue-green leaves, yellow-red blossoms, and crimson fruits. When the wind stirs, they naturally produce the sound of gold and jade. In the distance, jade towers and golden palaces float amidst clouds of treasure—all are the abodes of stellar officials and immortals. At times, immortals’ disciples ride carriages, phoenixes, cranes, or dragons, or mount clouds. The adept must cover their face and yield the path.

After half an hour, the chariot ascends the ten-thousand-mile rainbow road. Amidst faint purple clouds appears the Gate of Heaven, where celestial attendants stand guard—only the divine guardians within the gate are formidable. Opposite the Gate of Heaven lies the realm of the Desire Realm’s Demon King, the Heaven of Desire within the Grand Clarity. Beyond this point, present the Great Contract to the guarding deities, enter the Gate of Heaven, and proceed at will to the Audience.

**Ascension and Wind-Presenting Talisman**
**Three Heavens’ Audience with the Origin Talisman**

A nine-inch green silk talisman inscribed in cinnabar and encased in a yellow pouch is to be worn. **Great Contract for Ascending to Heaven and Uniting with the Dao**

**Dividing the Spirit to Govern Affairs**
The Master says: Once the Audience with the Origin is complete, one learns the celestial bureau and office to which they are assigned. Three days prior, notify the deities under one’s governance, and select a day to divide the spirit and attend to affairs. The etiquette for paying respects is somewhat akin to worldly protocol—submit name tablets and titles in advance. On the appointed day, follow the same rites as the Audience with the Origin, inspecting the divine attendants and their regalia. Place the seal before oneself, along with the contract and bamboo slips. After a long while, the spirits of one’s assigned realm will arrive to escort them. Proceed as before, merging the spirit and departing, naturally riding a chariot to the office to assume duties. Each day after the Audience with the Origin, one must attend to governance. If circumstances prevent attendance, petition the Three Heavens and the governing bureau for leave. Should there be reprimands, the Three Heavens may obstruct, and the bureau spirits will return. If one is yet unable to govern the mysterious bureau, establish a Daoist abode, cultivate in seclusion, and divide the spirit to attend to affairs.

**Establishing a Daoist Abode**
The Master says: Those who receive and practice the Great Daoist Law should revere the secluded chamber where the abode is founded. Establish the celestial bureau at the front and honor the Most High Sage at the rear. This is called a *jing* bureau. Each day after the Audience with the Origin, dismiss the celestial assembly and enter the *jing* to attend to affairs. All governance is conducted within the *jing*. All officials of the Numinous Treasure and Cavernous Mystery belong to the Inner Forbidden Bureau of the Queen Mother of the West’s Primordial Void. Once you hold a celestial rank, petition the Heavenly Mechanism Central Ministry to establish an abode here. Also institute the Offices of Ceremony, Command, and Guard, left and right bureaus. Bestow celestial robes, including a thirty-two-strip azure cloak with black trim, vermilion shoes, and a crown. The *Three Powers Harmonious Crown* uses two layers of five-colored silk, embroidered with the true forms of the Five Peaks. All in the Queen Mother’s palace wear this attire. It may not be used except during the Audience with the Origin or governance. When merits are fulfilled and the spirit is welcomed, ascend to the celestial abode, descend to pay respects to the Youthful Origin, receive the scriptures, and become an immortal official of the Three Realms.

**Deliverance of Ancestral Spirits**
The Master says: Only after mastering the preceding Five Scriptures may one deliver ancestral spirits, entrusting their governance to Nanchang. The methods are contained in the *Numinous Treasure Yellow Register Retreat Rites* and need not be repeated here. If one observes the five abstinences during the Upper Prime and single-mindedly performs deliverance, reciting scriptures and presenting talismans, the merit is profound—no need to await grand retreat merits. If one commits grave transgressions, ancestors may fall into ghostly realms. With merit, they ascend to the Azure Yang Immortal Realm. Reflect carefully on this.

**Selection for Mysterious Promotion**
The Master says: The Way of Mysterious Promotion comprises twenty-four ranks of the Great Dao’s orthodox laws, governed by the Jade Bureau of the Supreme Emperor. These are overseen by the Southern Bureau of the Fire Mansion and the Heavenly Mechanism Inner Ministry. The presiding deities are the Heavenly Emperor of Primordial Illumination, the Left Minister of Pacified Elevation, the Great Lord Jade Infant of the Primordial Void, and the Central Yellow Elder, Master of Teachings. The Supreme Emperor’s Bureau of Promotion issues this edict:

*"The Crimson Radiance of the Primordial Heaven governs the teachings of the Three Realms. I oversee this—who among you has lofty aspirations? Among the myriad beings, only the Central Harmony Bureau, the Sole Office of a Hundred Million, and the Great Lord of the Primordial Void of Mysterious Promotion propagate the teachings, conferring the twenty-four ranks of celestial offices. Without established merit and virtue, one cannot respond to the true."*

The Master says: Though one may possess the qualities for a divine rank, without merit or conduct, their name cannot be recorded on the Cinnabar Terrace. Promotions and demotions are uncertain, rewards and punishments untimely. Yet with a single selection, one may attain the title of Perfected. The Twenty-Four Ranks of the Jade Bureau are as follows:

**Supreme Clarity Jade Bureau, Upper Court Orthodox Law**
Governed by the Central Yellow Elder, the *Scripture of the Heavenly Youth* serves as the governing text.

**Highest Jade Clarity Supreme Ultimate Court Orthodox Law**
Governed by the Most High Elder, the *Scripture of Disaster Dispelling* serves as the governing text.

**Jade Bureau of the Primordial Life-Sustaining Mansion Orthodox Law**
Governed by the Heavenly Worthy of Life-Sustaining Longevity, the *Scripture of Life Protection* serves as the governing text.

**Jade Bureau of the Five Emperors Nurturing Creatures, Heavenly August Orthodox Law**
Governed by the Heavenly August Supreme Emperor, the *Scripture of Secret Transmission* serves as the governing text.

**Azure Net Disaster-Dispelling Jade Bureau Orthodox Law**
Governed by the Perfected of the Azure Net, the *Scripture of the Eleven Luminaries for Disaster Dispelling* serves as the governing text.

**Highest Clarity Life-Protecting Jade Bureau Orthodox Law**
Governed by the Later Sage, Master of the Primordial Mystery Teachings, the *Scripture of Spirit Communication and Body Protection* serves as the governing text.

**Numinous Treasure Longevity-Extending Jade Bureau Orthodox Law**
Governed by the Heavenly Worthy of Longevity Extension, the *Scripture of Longevity Extension* serves as the governing text.

**Azure Clarity Left Bureau Jade Bureau Orthodox Law**
Governed by the Heavenly Worthy of Great Unity and Salvation, the *Scripture of Salvation* serves as the governing text.

**Three Primes Precious Slips Jade Bureau Orthodox Law**
Governed by the Heavenly Worthy of Great Unity and Salvation, the *Scripture of Salvation from the Nine Hells* serves as the governing text.

**Great Unity Divine Bureau Jade Bureau Orthodox Law**
Governed by the Central Yellow Emperor Lord, the *True Scripture of the Supreme Prime* serves as the governing text.

**Supreme Clarity Demon-Subduing Heavenly Treasure Altar Jade Bureau Orthodox Law**
Governed by the Five Spirits Primordial Elder, the *Scripture of Demon Subduing* serves as the governing text.

**Great Peace Nation-Protecting Altar Jade Bureau Orthodox Law**
Governed by the Heavenly Worthy of Great Peace and Nation Protection, the *True Writ of the Five Elders* serves as the governing text.

**Highest Clarity Cavernous Abyss Inner Court Jade Bureau Orthodox Law**
Governed by the Heavenly Worthy of the Cavernous Abyss, the *Scripture of the Cavernous Abyss Dragon Emperor* serves as the governing text.

**Highest Clarity Heavenly Pivot Court Jade Bureau Orthodox Law**
Governed by the Six Perfected Lords of the Southern Dipper, the *Scripture of the Southern Dipper* serves as the governing text.

**Highest Clarity Heavenly Mechanism Inner Court Jade Bureau Orthodox Law**
Governed by the Great Emperor of the Purple Tenuity of the North Pole, the *Scripture of the Northern Pivot and Mysterious Axis* serves as the governing text. The *Golden Mysterious Feather Chapters of the Purple Tenuity* is also used.

**Supreme Clarity Eight Might Demon-Subduing Jade Bureau Orthodox Law**
Governed by the Central Yellow Elder, the *Elder Lord’s Scripture of Demon Subduing* serves as the governing text.

**The Secret Teachings of the *Scripture of the Conversion of the Barbarians***
Compiled by Master Wen Shi of the Primordial Beginning.

**Numinous Treasure Protective Destiny Jade Bureau Orthodox Law**
Governed by the Sagely and Protective True Martial Great Divinity, the *Scripture of the Dark Warrior* serves as the governing text.

**Highest Clarity Nine Heavens Life-Generating Great Primal Jade Bureau Orthodox Law**
Governed by the Flying Heavenly Divine Kings, the *Nine Heavens Life-Generating Chapter Scripture* serves as the governing text.

**Numinous Treasure Tribulation-Delivering Heavenly Immortals Inner Court Jade Bureau Orthodox Law**
Governed by the Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, the *Tribulation-Delivering Scripture* serves as the governing text.

**Nine Elders Immortal Capital Prefecture Jade Bureau Orthodox Law**
Governed by the Lords of the Nine Elders Immortal Capital, the *Scripture of the Nine Perfected* serves as the governing text.

**Primordial Beginning Demon-Subduing Jade Bureau Orthodox Law**
Governed by the Primordial Beginning Heavenly Worthy, the *Primordial Beginning Demon-Subduing Scripture* serves as the governing text.

**Numinous Treasure Ascending Mystery Jade Bureau Orthodox Law**
Governed by the Primordial Beginning Heavenly Worthy, the *Ascending Mystery Disaster-Dispelling Scripture* serves as the governing text.

**Numinous Treasure Heavenly Immortals Jade Bureau Orthodox Law**
Governed by the Highest Clarity Dao Lord, the *Three Sovereigns Golden Purple Primordial Spirit Scripture* serves as the governing text.

**Supreme Clarity Pillow-Center Longevity Jade Bureau Orthodox Law**
Governed by the Central Yellow Elder, the *Pillow Scripture* serves as the governing text.

The Master said: Of the twenty-four ranks of Jade Bureaus above, some have both scriptures and methods descended into the world; some have neither scriptures nor methods descended; some have methods descended but not the scriptures; and some have scriptures descended but not the methods. Yet when observing the Cavern-Heavens and aligning with the Dipper, harmonizing the primordial and dividing the spirits, administering affairs in the immortal offices, or establishing domains to deliver the ancestors of the mysterious lineage, one must select and respond to the mysterious summons, memorialize the Three Heavens, and entreat the descent of the true transmitted scriptures and methods. Only then, having taken charge of a Jade Bureau and received the Heavenly commission to govern its office—achieving great merit surpassing all others—may one ascend to the rank of Perfected.

**The Eight Latitudes of Cultivation and Recitation**
The Master said: The regulations for cultivation and recitation contain eight secret principles of the Latitudes. Should even one be divulged, the rest lose their numinosity. If treated with carelessness, one’s immortal aspirations shall forever be lost.

Should one’s body alone swiftly incur leprosy and sores, the Mysterious Ancestors shall swiftly dispatch the Fire Officials. The adept must seal these principles within the heart, enduring the approach of axe, drill, boiling water, or flame—preferring to tread willingly into them rather than utter a word in careless speech. Though such calamity befalls the body, the Great One, the Five Elders, and the hundred spirits shall instantly transform into luminous clouds to welcome the adept’s spirit into the Upper Clarity.

Should the adept doubt these words and dare to leak them, observe the response of the Upper Mystery: disasters near and far shall strike the one who divulges the Latitudes, annihilating their clan and subjecting them to a hundred generations of wind and blade—all to be witnessed in an instant.

**First: The Latitude of the Jeweled Pearl’s Mysterious Transformation**
The Master said: What is the Latitude of the Jeweled Pearl’s Mysterious Transformation? It is the Great One containing blossoms, the Jade Dew congealing into pearls. When the adept visualizes and recites this, ascension to Perfection is achieved before ten thousand repetitions. Within the heart dwells the Primordial Heavenly Worthy; within the dewdrop appears one’s own form, like a blossom cradling dew.

**Second: The Latitude of the Lion’s Majestic Spirit**
The Master said: The Latitude of the Lion’s Majestic Spirit is the Solar Controller of Destiny transforming and giving life, descending and then ascending. When the adept visualizes and recites this ten thousand times, they shall ride clouds and mount dragons, ascending to the Great Void in broad daylight. Atop the head dwells the Primordial Heavenly Worthy; within the heart stands the lion, and the adept, riding the lion, takes its place within the heart, descending into the Five-Colored Cinnabar Field.

**Third: The Latitude of the Wondrous Chariot of the Upper Palace**
The Master said: The Latitude of the Wondrous Chariot of the Upper Palace is the division of the Emperor’s Palace into the Three Origins, where merit is perfected. When the adept visualizes and recites this ten thousand times, the entire body ascends as an immortal. Within the Nine Palaces of the head, the Upper Four Palaces and Lower Five Palaces contain one’s own form in the second palace of the Upper Four. After four thousand repetitions, merit is fulfilled.

**Fourth: The Latitude of Central Prohibition and Realization of Perfection**
The Master said: The Latitude of Central Prohibition and Realization of Perfection is sitting within the Cinnabar Terrace, where the Central Prohibition perfects the Realized One—sixty accumulated merits equaling those of the Nine Perfected. Within the heart’s Cinnabar Chamber dwells one’s own form. Recite this three thousand times.

**Fifth: The Latitude of the Lower Origin’s Initial Study**
The Master said: The Latitude of the Lower Origin’s Initial Study is the secret resolve within the Cinnabar Valley, where the spirit is preserved, and the three thousand deeds are recorded in the Jade Perfected’s register. Within the Lower Cinnabar Valley dwells one’s own form. Recite this three thousand times.

**Sixth: The Latitude of Instantaneous Response and Divine Penetration**
The Master said: The Latitude of Instantaneous Response and Divine Penetration is the Three Qi generating the Three, uniting above with the Three Heavens, crafting the adept’s body to divide into forms across the Ten Heavens—equal in stature to the Great Marshal, with natural dignity and bearing, seated upon a lion amidst the empty mystery of the Solar Radiance Jeweled Pearl. The Five-Zhang Ancestral Origin encircles tenfold, responding with wondrous transformations. Within the Three Qi dwell the Heavenly Worthies of the Ten Directions; the Primordial One sits upon the lion within the sun, five zhang above the earth.

**Seventh: The Latitude of the Jade Tone and Myriad Spirits**
Internally ingest and externally recite the twenty-two tones. Visualize the Jade Worthy and the Nine Sovereign Lords of Mud, recite the Jade Chapters, and bow in reverence to the Primordial Lord. After ten thousand repetitions, no merit shall remain unfulfilled. Across the Four Directions and Thirty-Two Heavens, within the Mud-Pill Palace dwells the Primordial Heavenly Worthy; within the heart appears one’s own form, offering homage.

**Eighth: The Latitude of the Three Realms’ Summoning of Spirits**
The Master said: The Latitude of the Three Realms’ Summoning of Spirits is the Three Realms and Three Origins—after a hundred thousand repetitions, the Three Realms may be delivered, and the immortal unites with the cloud chariot.
- **Upper Realm**: Upon the Azure Cloud Qi, within the Upper Cinnabar Field, one’s own form appears. Five thousand repetitions for the Upper Origin.
- **Middle Realm**: Within the Yellow Cloud of the Celestial Valley Qi, in the Middle Cinnabar Field, one’s own form appears. One thousand repetitions for the Middle Origin.
- **Lower Realm**: Within the White Cloud of the Spirit Valley Qi, in the Lower Cinnabar Field, one’s own form appears. One hundred repetitions for the Lower Origin.

The Master said: The true statutes of the Eight Latitudes grant ascension to immortality upon mastering even one Latitude—provided it is wielded as effortlessly as a palm directing fingers. Yet to leak even one Latitude is to dash all hopes of flight, sinking instead into the abyss of the non-Dao. The adept must thoroughly comprehend and investigate these principles, refraining from reckless discussion or disclosure. Practice diligently, and the Perfected of the Three Heavens shall await your ascension.

*Here ends Scroll Three of the Great Rites of the Numinous Treasure of the Upper Clarity.
Scroll Four of the Great Rites of the Numinous Treasure of the Upper Clarity.*

The Venerable Master of Subtle Illumination, the Perfected of Salvation from Suffering, Ning Quanzhen, transmitted this to the Disciples of the Three Caverns of the Upper Clarity who receive the teachings of the Numinous Treasure, the Lineage Master Wang Qizhen, compiler.

**The Ten Mysteries of Cultivation and Application**

The Master said: The Ten Mysteries are what are called the Ten Profound Essentials.

1. **Supreme Samādhi of Spirit Radiance**
2. **The Millet Pearl Entering the Wondrous**
3. **The Central Regulation of the Five Qi**
4. **The Ten Revolutions Returning the Spirit**

These four mysteries each possess the hymns and taboo names of the host of Perfected Ones.

5. **Exhaling and Inhaling the True Qi**
6. **The Hidden Taboo of the Mysterious Perfected**, wherein the primordial qi binds the embryo palace of refinement. The measured breaths of inches and spans have already been expounded in the *Illustrated Principles*.

7. **The Embryo’s Transformation of Corporeal Form**, clarifying the firing times of the Cavernous Yang and the great reckoning of the Celestial Cycle, refining the jade script within to generate and transform the embryonic immortal.

8. **The Primal Spirit’s Supernatural Penetration**, responding to and manifesting merit and power.

9. **Yin Elixir and Yang Elixir**, the flowing essence and jade radiance. These already possess established methods.

10. **The Great Practice of Brahmā Qi**, which is one’s own primordial qi.

To fathom these profound mysteries is to attain limitless ascension; to comprehend their principles is to find the origin of spirit immortality.

**The Supreme Samādhi of Spirit Radiance**

The Scripture states: For seven days and seven nights, the sun, moon, and stars of all heavens, the jade armillary and jade balance, simultaneously halt their revolutions. The spirit winds fall silent, mountains and seas conceal their clouds, the sky is free of drifting veils, the four qi shine brightly and clearly. The lands, mountains, rivers, forests, and trees of the realm are leveled as one, no longer possessing high or low, and the earth transforms entirely into azure jade, without any other color. The host of Perfected Ones attend in assembly, while the Celestial Venerable of Primordial Beginning floats suspended in the void above a five-colored lion.

The Master said: This describes the wondrous application and supernatural penetration of the Celestial Venerable of Primordial Beginning, the workings of his transformative mechanism and responsive resonance. Though it speaks of seven days and seven nights during which the sun, moon, and stars halt their revolutions, how then is day distinguished from night? The reckoning of seven days and seven nights is not limited to this alone. In the Jade Clarity, there is the Floating Black Soil, and there are transformations of such awe-inspiring divine efficacy as those spoken of by the Dao Lord of the myriad heavens. In that instant of response, the ten thousand heavens of the Three Realms and all directions are likewise affected. This subtle and wondrous sagely response is the external transformation of the Celestial Venerable. The sun and moon do not move, the stars do not revolve, the jade armillary and jade balance halt their revolutions, and day and night are no longer manifest. Yet in truth, the inner workings of his sovereign function have never ceased for even a moment. Thus, the seven days and seven nights of the Luminous Dawn are not the same as the seven days and seven nights spoken of in the Jade Capital’s scriptural teachings, nor are they comparable to the seven days and seven nights of the human world. To speak of one realm is to encompass all heavens and all lands; thus, it is said to be the land of one realm. When leveled as one, it universally unites the ten thousand transformations, and the divine transformation extends everywhere without exception. Thus, it is said there is no longer high or low.

From the inner perspective: the sun and moon of the heavens do not blink, the stars do not circulate their qi, the jade armillary and jade balance do not cease their revolutions, the spirit winds are silent without exhalation or inhalation, the mountains and seas conceal their clouds without the morning exchange of yin and yang, the sky is free of drifting veils without inner or outer obstruction, the four qi shine clearly and brightly, and inner and outer, above and below are as one. The land of one realm is like one’s own body; the mountains, rivers, forests, and trees are like the four limbs, the hundred vessels, the hair and pores, the nine orifices, the skin and flesh, the constructive and defensive qi, the spirit chamber, and the bones and joints. The earth transforming entirely into azure jade is entry into the realm of Daoist samādhi.

The Master said: From the inner perspective, this is the Supreme Samādhi of Spirit Radiance, wherein one lucidly perceives the Jade Clarity realm. With the merit of seven days and seven nights—seven days and seven nights—the sun and moon halt their revolutions, the two eyes do not blink, neither closed in darkness nor inwardly directed, nor gazing outward. For seven days and seven nights, one sustains prolonged vision, halting the blinking of the eyes, illuminating the three regions, and penetrating inner and outer with clarity. The qi of one’s body circulates at dawn through the hundred joints and meridians, the yin and yang, the constructive and defensive qi, all connected to the breath and vessels of the three regions. These breath vessels are the jade armillary and jade balance of one’s own body. The four extremities correspond to the jade armillary, and the three regions respond to the jade balance. When the jade armillary does not revolve, the sun and moon pause in their course, and the stars halt their revolutions. When the four extremities do not reach, the three regions do not breathe, and the qi and blood of the entire body cease their circulation.

First, one must achieve the silence of the spirit winds, without the sound of exhalation or inhalation, and the concealment of mountains in clouds, without the obscuring realm of deluded thoughts. In clarity and stillness, the sky is free of drifting veils, and naturally, the four qi—warmth, coolness, cold, and heat—shine brightly and clearly, all things sharing a single hue. Moreover, the inner and outer of one’s body are like azure jade, without a speck of dust. Gradually, the hundred Perfected guard the Gate of Death, and the ten thousand Perfected attend one’s corporeal form, enabling the body to ascend into the void. After a hundred days, the spirit merges with the wondrous Dao; after a thousand days, one ascends in broad daylight.

The Celestial Venerable floating in the void is one’s own spirit residing in the Jade Clarity Palace, also called the Palace of the Jade Emperor. The Scripture states: "One’s own body possesses the Celestial Venerable; why gaze upward to the heavens?" The *Hymn of the Primordial Perfected* also says: "Though the Celestial Venerable is distant and wondrous, he descends near to the Mud Pill Palace." The palaces and chambers are all adorned with the seven treasures, naturally distinguishing their forms.

The five qi ascend to the Crimson Palace, and through the wondrous transformation of numinous power, they coalesce to form a lion. The Celestial Venerable sits upon it, descending into the Cinnabar Field. To the left is blue-green, to the right is white, in front is red, behind is black, and in the center is yellow—hence the designation of five colors. The mysterious seat floats in the void, responding to transformations of being and non-being, truth and resonance.

For seven days and seven nights, one lucidly perceives the Celestial Venerable of the Jade Clarity. At this time, the Supreme Samādhi of Spirit Radiance ascends to the utmost wondrous, and with merit complete and encounter perfected, one may immediately rise lightly into the air through the power of effort. Within samādhi, one undergoes demonic trials—water, fire, blades, weapons, royal laws, and ten thousand kinds—all reporting even the slightest infraction, yet none can grasp the principle of the Dao. Beyond the seven days and seven nights, what one sees pertains to future events. Should one speak of it, all prior merit is lost, and the hope of immortality vanishes. How could one not guard one’s words?

The Perfected of the Great Unity hymned:
*In the murky depths, without intent,*
*The Great Abyss conceals its form.*

Amidst the azure vastness, all merges as one—existence congeals into spirit. Light as a swan’s feather, unmoved, within and without hold fast to purity. The tortoise devours the crimson serpent, knitting the essence of true radiance. Sun and moon grow dim, the jade pivot does not rise. White rainbows and azure mists intertwine, weaving back and forth.

After seven days, through spiritual potency, one beholds the Jade Clarity of one’s own accord.

*The Jade Pivot and Jade Balance Diagram*
One inhalation, one exhalation—three inches, four arrivals, together making six inches and one arrival, totaling fifteen parts. They weave heaven and earth, spanning fifteen in length and breadth. Thus the Supreme Lord entrusted this to the Yellow Emperor as the River Chart’s numbers.

With each inhalation, the pulse stirs twice; with each exhalation, the pulse stirs twice. When breath settles into stillness, the pulse stirs five times, and with a great sigh, six inches move once. One inch per breath, the pulse traverses six inches.

The method of the Great Samādhi of Spirit Radiance begins with settling the heart. The heart is the dwelling of the hundred spirits, the palace of the five senses. When the heart’s sovereign is profoundly still, then sounds, sights, wealth, and profit cannot disturb it. By this, the Dao is not far off.

Though many in this age admire the Dao, few truly attain it. Though their initial resolve may be earnest, those who grow lax do so because their hearts are not settled. The method of settling the heart lies in severing the Three Corpses, expelling the Six Bandits, commanding demons to eradicate the roots of harm to the Dao, and stilling qi to achieve the wondrous entry into spirit.

Stillness brings samādhi; samādhi brings response. Spirit radiance wells forth within, sun and moon shine with clarity. One qi abides constantly, the ten thousand spirits do not scatter. Lucidly, one beholds the realm of the Jade Clarity.

The method states: The adept severs thought, clarifies the heart, and concentrates the spirit upon the Dao. Circulating the crimson qi of the Crimson Palace, it descends to the Mysterious Spring, ascends to the heart’s blood, and the two qi of kidney essence intermingle. Released into the Cinnabar Field, they gestate and give birth to an infant, which gradually grows into the form of a true person.

Next, circulating the azure qi from the liver like clouds, it descends to shroud the true person, who is clad in azure robes, an azure jade crown, and an azure jade tablet, their countenance joyful and harmonious.

Then, from the Fire Pool of the heart, a fire dragon leaps forth, bearing the true person aloft on five-colored clouds of qi. Ascending the Great Bridge of the Spine, it rises straight to the Mud Pill, merging with the Celestial Venerable of Primordial Beginning as one body. The golden towers and jade halls, the dharma throne and jeweled canopies—all are perfectly arrayed.

In an instant, the Celestial Venerable of Primordial Beginning enacts the Dao of generation: from the One comes the Two, from the Two comes the Three. From this, a hundred treasures radiate forth, giving birth to the myriad heavens, the jade maidens, and the lords of the palaces, all standing in solemn array.

The Celestial Venerable enters stillness, then emits a single beam of precious light, illuminating the Northern Yin. All is transformed into a hue of azure jade, from above to below, the light shining with perfect clarity.

The Celestial Venerable commands the flying celestial officials, the celestial lictors, and the mighty celestial warriors. Bearing golden jade tablets and golden script with decrees, they proceed directly to the Twelve River Sources of the Northern Feng. There, they purge filth and impurity, beseech the extinction of the Three Evils, and sever the earth’s roots.

From Kun to Gen, from Gen to Kun, from Chen to Xu—marking Xu, Hai, Zi, and Dui, then Zhong and Zhen, Mao. Visualize the liver emitting a single strand of azure qi, sweeping away all roots and enabling the flight past the Five Corpses. Then mark Shen, You, Yin, Si, and Hai.

Following the mudra, summon the spirit officials to open the Five Gates, purifying desire, lust, love, and greed.

The Celestial Venerable visualizes the entire body suffused with radiant brilliance, as in the realm of Crimson Clarity. Again, the Celestial Venerable commands the demon kings, celestial lictors, mighty celestial warriors, and flying celestial kings to descend directly to the Northern Feng and call forth the names of the Three Corpses. Three figures emerge, and the Great God of Cast Fire hurls flames into the blazing cavern, incinerating them until all is pure and clear.

Next, call forth the names of the Seven Po. Seven figures in white emerge from the lungs. Then call forth the names of the Three Hun. Three figures in azure emerge from the liver. Together, they enter the Fire Pool for refinement, transforming into infants with luminous jade bodies, their forms adorned with crimson patterns and net-like tracery, each stationed in their respective palace.

The Celestial Venerable then descends to dwell in the realm of Crimson Clarity, sitting in perfect stillness. The lords of the palaces disperse with the light, leaving nothing behind. The body shines with utter clarity; inner thoughts do not stray outward, nor do outer thoughts intrude. This is the true realm of the Dao.

Guard and practice this, and the Dao of the Great Samādhi of Spirit Radiance may be attained.

Each day at dawn, the adept sits in stillness and silence, settling the heart with utmost reverence, free from inner or outer distractions. First, purify body and speech, then visualize as described above.

Next, knock the teeth thirty-six times, stirring the Flower Pool to irrigate the Five Sprouts. Generate a mouthful of numinous fluid and swallow it into the Abyss of Primordial Origin.

With the left hand, form the mudra of the Twelve Branches, flying the Zi-Wu Dipper to ascend to the Mud Pill. With the right hand, form the mudra of the Twelve Branches’ eyes, flying the Zi-Wu Dipper through the Cavern of the Cinnabar Qi Pillow. Raise the head, eyes fixed upward toward the sun and moon, directly drawing in the qi of the Great Yang and swallowing it into the Crimson Palace.

Maintain even qi without ascent or descent, gaze fixed without blinking. The suns and moons of the myriad heavens halt their movement. Within the primordial qi of the chaotic center, named the Constellations, qi ceases its circulation.

Cross the ten fingers over the heart, circulating the pulse without cease. Press the tongue to the upper palate, close the teeth, and generate saliva. Spirit and wind grow silent.

Swallow the qi, descending it to the Cinnabar Field, where mountains and seas store clouds. Close the eyes, disregarding outer thoughts. Within and without, nothing exists; the heavens are free of floating haze.

Circulate the qi once more, pervading the four limbs, within and without, above and below as one. Four qi grow bright and clear.

Sit upright, the body unmoving, like the land of a kingdom. With the entire body, stir and circulate the joints, within and without, above and below. Banish all stray thoughts—mountains, rivers, forests, and trees—all level as one, without height or depth.

Sit evenly, the heart directed in devotion. Visualize the form of one’s body and its earth transformed entirely into azure jade. This is the realm of samādhi in the Dao.

When the circulation is complete, lie down to rest and descend from the seat.

*The Diagram of the Great Samādhi of Spirit Radiance*
A person sits upright within a circular radiance, the body enveloped in five-colored light.

The Oral Instructions state:
Align the ears with the shoulders, the nose with the navel. Gather the six senses, concentrate the spirit in the eyes. Neither external nor internal—observe the radiance of the spirit.
After three days, within the secluded chamber, a single point of spirit-light appears. Diligently stabilize the spirit.
After four days, it gradually brightens and expands, filling the chamber with spirit-light. Within this samādhi, all things become as if non-existent.
After seven days, all true spirits and ghostly beings are seen, entering the Dao of penetrating vision.
With forty-five days of guest and host in full vigor, each governs its portion.

To practice the Dao of penetrating vision, one must uphold the two grades of precepts and conduct.
After three years of great samādhi, facing the Three Pure Ones, the Heavenly Worthy bestows a celestial writ. Ascending in broad daylight, one is appointed a Heavenly Perfected.
Without upholding virtue and precepts, wisdom does not arise, and the path of the Great Vehicle remains inaccessible.
Those of wondrous ability, in perfect union with the utmost subtlety, ascend into Jade Clarity.

This Dao does not distinguish between delivering beings, aiding the living, or subduing evil. For morning and evening practice, preserving the body and guarding life, dispelling calamities and chronic afflictions—this Dao must be cultivated.
Only at the hours of dawn and midnight, when the spirit is clear and the qi fresh, when the myriad spirits gather as one, and the obscure and manifest become thoroughly illuminated—only then may this practice be undertaken. This is the wondrous workings of the body’s diurnal and nocturnal transformations, transmitted from the lineage master to the Mystic Master, the August Personage, passed down orally to deliver beings.

Should one fail to sit in accord, one’s celestial rank is forfeited in vain. The celestial and terrestrial bureaus will bear no record of one’s immortal register.

The Scripture states:
When the ten recitations are complete, the Great Perfected of the Ten Directions and the boundless Heavenly Realized Ones assemble as one. The men and women of a kingdom turn their hearts in reverence, coming forth like fine rain or dense mist—so numerous they cannot be counted. Half the land of the kingdom sinks beneath their weight, beyond all restraint.

Thereupon, the Primordial Beginning suspends a precious pearl, large as a millet grain, in the void five measures above the earth. The Primordial Beginning leads the Great Perfected, the Heavenly Realized Ones, the exalted sages, the Perfected of wondrous conduct, and the innumerable hosts—all enter into the precious pearl. Gazing upward, the heavenly beings see only a shimmering radiance entering through the pearl’s opening. Once within, they know not where they are.

The people of the kingdom disperse, and the land returns to levelness, no longer slanted or sunken.

The Master explains:
When the recitation of the scripture is complete after ten cycles, the boundless Great Perfected of the Ten Directions and the Heavenly Realized Ones arrive as one, summoning the protective power of the Ten Grades of Wisdom. The scripture’s blessings manifest as auspicious responses, and the entire kingdom is shielded and delivered, all attaining longevity. Thus, they turn their hearts in reverence, the whole kingdom coming forth.

The recitation of the scripture is said to be like fine rain or dense mist—its number beyond reckoning. The "innumerable hosts" refers to the myriad heavens, where a single kingdom gathers in the Great Floating Black Soil. The land cannot bear the weight. The scripture’s power and virtue, along with the vast multitude, cause the earth to narrow and sink. Though half the kingdom is already pressed down, the influx cannot be halted.

Thus, the Heavenly Venerable enacts the wondrous and great transformation, suspending a single treasure-pearl, vast as a millet grain, within the boundless void—its tethering strand beyond all reckoning. Five *zhang* above the earth, it floats beyond the realm of turbid hues. It draws forth the Heavenly Perfected of the Great Upper Origin, the Nine Grades of Perfected Beings; the lofty and revered Sagely Worthies of the Middle Origin, the Nine Grades of Sages; and the Wondrous-Practiced Realized Ones of the Lower Origin, the Nine Grades of Immortals. A thousand chariots and ten thousand riders follow the Heavenly Venerable’s ascent, all entering together into the treasure-pearl.

All celestial beings who are not Heavenly Perfected, Sagely Worthies, or Realized Ones cannot follow the mechanism of effortless transformation and thus cannot enter the marvel of the suspended millet-pearl, able only to gaze upward in reverence. They see them surge forth and enter through the pearl’s mouth, yet know not where they go.

Consider how even lesser immortals of lower rank possess the marvel of mustard-seed containing Mount Sumeru, or the realm of heaven and earth suspended within a gourd. How much more, then, does the Great Sagely Heavenly Venerable, in unfolding and proclaiming the great teaching, manifest divine transformations!

The treasure-pearl, vast as a millet grain, is already subtle and wondrous. Yet, suspended five *zhang* above the earth within the boundless void, even heavenly spirits lack the luminous wisdom to perceive it. How much more so for those who witness its mouth—truly, it is the Heavenly Venerable drawing forth the Sagely Perfected into the wondrous realm of being and non-being.

At the moment they follow the Heavenly Venerable into the treasure-pearl, the celestial beings gazing upward see its mouth. Once all have entered, the celestial beings can no longer perceive the interior of the pearl or its wondrous transformations. Thus, the people of the kingdom disperse, and the earth returns to levelness, no longer slanted or sunken.

This is the realm of scripture-recitation at that time—the marvel of the Heavenly Venerable’s treasure-pearl. Speaking in terms of the Great Dao, the divine power of the Dao is vast beyond all containment, subtle beyond all entry. When gathered, it transforms into the boundless multitudes, all attaining the marvel of a mustard seed or a hair’s tip. Such is its gathering. When dispersed, it arises from non-being, pervading the myriad heavens and kingdoms, multiplying into countless forms, omnipresent and all-pervading. Such is its dispersal.

Suspended five *zhang* above the earth, it transcends the five desires, five dusts, five aggregates, five hues, five fragrances, five sounds, and five turbidities, existing beyond the reckoning of the five phases. Thus, it enters the marvel of the void-suspended.

The millet grain is the chief of the five grains. The kingdom is likened to a single body. The slanting and sinking signify the Dao’s partiality and constraint, its oneness not yet complete, thus unable to embody the wondrous transformation of the profound and mysterious.

The celestial beings are the myriad spirits; the Sagely Worthies, Heavenly Perfected, and Wondrous-Practiced Realized Ones are the spirits of the Three Origins. The Heavenly Venerable is the master of the body.

Speaking of the wondrous inner realm of the Dao, this is the secret of the Jade Clarity treasure-pearl’s divine transformation and the embryo-immortal. Speaking in terms of the great method, it is the practice of grain-refusal to cure illness. Speaking in terms of recitation and cultivation, it is the ritual of numinous and wondrous transformation, the means of dispelling calamity and summoning fortune.

The Master says: After nine revolutions and ten recitations, the workings of merit are complete, and one attains the marvel of entering non-being from being, the wondrousness of the void-suspended millet-pearl. First, the yang essence is summoned; then, the yin radiance is called forth. Like fine rain or dense mist, they enter the body. The primordial *qi* of the ancestral origin is fully replete, and the tenfold divine transformations revolve. The primordial *qi* of the original valley returns as one, and all *qi* follow in unison, transforming into the mysterious cinnabar of the millet-pearl, which settles within the numinous palace of the Yellow Court. The elixir completed, it pierces the sun; partaking of it, one instantly mounts the cloud-chariot, ascending to Jade Clarity to take the rank of Realized One.

The *Taixuan* Realized One intones:
*Divine gaze like heaven, in resonance with the Great Mystery.*
*Three days of yang unite; seven dawns complete the yin.*
*Thirteen in the Kun position; eighteen revolve Qian.*
*New moon and crescent bear the talisman; eight eights form the arc.*
*On the twenty-third night, yin and yang merge at their origin.*
*This is called the Constant Dao, the meeting of the Three Fields.*
*If a single speck is stained, the unbroken continuity is lost.*

*The Diagram of the Millet-Pearl Entering the Marvelous*
*The Diagram of the Heavenly Venerable’s Wondrous Transformation*

Within the center, the Five Qi are ordered.

The Scripture states:
*Primal Cavern, Jade Calendar—*
*Dragon Han extends its prosperity.*
*Boundless kalpas drift in primordial chaos,*
*Above, no returning hues; below, no returning abyss.*
*Wind and marsh pervade the void;*
*Vajra rides the heavens.*
*From heaven above to heaven below,*
*No darkness, no obscurity,*
*No form, no shadow,*
*No limit, no end.*
*The vast Brahmanic expanse, vast and lightless,*
*Scarlet radiance unfurls the chart—*
*Celestial revolutions move of themselves.*
*The Primal Beginning settles and stabilizes,*
*Unfolding the Five Scriptures.*
*Scarlet script on jade, eight mighty dragon glyphs*
*Preserve and regulate the kalpic cycles,*
*Ensuring heaven’s eternal endurance.*

The Brahmanic qi spreads and fills the cosmos;
Myriad patterns unfold.
The Primal Net flows and evolves,
Thirty-two heavens in ceaseless revolution,
Colorless wheels turning through the ten directions.
The Dipper revolves, the Winnowing Basket traces,
Circling back through the Five Constants.
Thirty-five divisions gather the qi of the Upper Origin.
Eight luminous scenes merge in darkness;
Qi enters the Mystery of Mysteries.
Within the Mystery, the Great August One,
The Highest Perfected of the Celestial Emperor.
Floating upon the radiance of the Great Rosy Clouds,
They chant and intone the Cavernous Chapters.
Golden perfection shines resplendent,
Its echoes flowing through the cloudy encampments.
Jade tones gather qi;
Spiritual winds amass mist.
The Purple Void flourishes in elegance,
Assisting and sheltering the myriad immortals.
A thousand harmonies, ten thousand unions—
Naturally, they attain perfection.
Within the perfected dwells the spirit,
The Great Lord of Longevity.
The Lordless Lad,
The White Prime Honored Spirit,
The Great One Who Oversees Destiny,
Peach and Health united in extension.
Grasping talismans, holding registers,
They safeguard life and root its essence.
Ascending to the Upper Clarity,
They enter and exit the Flowery Chamber.
Within the Eight Obscurities,
In the subtlest of subtleties,
They descend to guard the human body,
The Mud-Pill Palace and the Crimson Palace.
Within the center, the Five Qi are ordered,
Merging and uniting the hundred spirits.

The Master says:
*This is the Heavenly Worthy’s discourse on the origins of the Dao’s creation and the cosmos’s unfolding—the beginning of the Five Kalpas’ generation.*

The Scripture states:
*From heaven above to heaven below,*
*No darkness, no obscurity,*
*No form, no shadow,*
*No limit, no end.*
*The vast Brahmanic expanse, vast and lightless.*

The Master says:
*This clarifies the fundamental nature of the Great Dao’s origin and end.*

The Scripture states:
*Scarlet radiance unfurls the chart—*
*Celestial revolutions move of themselves.*
*The Primal Beginning settles and stabilizes,*
*Unfolding the Five Scriptures.*
*Scarlet script on jade, eight mighty dragon glyphs*
*Preserve and regulate the kalpic cycles,*
*Ensuring heaven’s eternal endurance.*

The Master says:
*After the Heavenly Worthy’s Five Kalpas of secluded transformation, the fire of the Cavernous Yang is smelted to forge the scriptures. The kalpa is named Scarlet Radiance. Settling and stabilizing the Five Directions, it ensures heaven’s eternal endurance. This is the Dao by which the Five Thearchs nurture beings, entrusted to the Five Elders and the various perfected—it is the Middle-Grade Dao.*

The Scripture states:
*Myriad patterns unfold;*
*The Primal Net flows and evolves.*
*Thirty-two heavens in ceaseless revolution,*
*Colorless wheels turning through the ten directions.*
*The Dipper revolves, the Winnowing Basket traces,*
*Circling back through the Five Constants.*
*Thirty-five divisions gather the qi of the Upper Origin.*

The Master says:
*After the kalpa unfolds, only the patterns of the myriad dharmas are established. Their transformative functions converge in the Upper Origin.*

The Scripture states:
*Eight luminous scenes merge in darkness;*
*Qi enters the Mystery of Mysteries.*
*Within the Mystery, the Great August One,*
*The Highest Perfected of the Celestial Emperor.*
*Floating upon the radiance of the Great Rosy Clouds,*
*They chant and intone the Cavernous Chapters.*
*Golden perfection shines resplendent,*
*Its echoes flowing through the cloudy encampments.*
*Jade tones gather qi;*
*Spiritual winds amass mist.*
*The Purple Void flourishes in elegance,*
*Assisting and sheltering the myriad immortals.*

The Master says:
*The preceding clarifies the fundamental nature of the cosmos’s Great Dao; next is expounded the Dao of the inner landscape of the human body. The Eight Luminous Scenes and the Three Sections’ Twenty-Four Spirits are the chiefs of the myriad immortals, the lords of the host of spirits. The Great August One within the Mystery is the Queen Mother of the West of the Primordial Origin. This is the Great Cavern’s Mystery within Mystery, the subtlety within subtlety—the supreme of the supreme Dao. Those who understand become divine immortals; cultivating it, they attain the rank of Highest Perfected.*

The Scripture states:
*A thousand harmonies, ten thousand unions—*
*Naturally, they attain perfection.*
*Within the perfected dwells the spirit,*
*The Great Lord of Longevity.*
*The Lordless Lad,*
*The White Prime Honored Spirit,*
*The Great One Who Oversees Destiny,*
*Peach and Health united in extension.*
*Grasping talismans, holding registers,*
*They safeguard life and root its essence,*
*Ascending to the Upper Clarity.*

The Master says:
*This is precisely the Dao of the Five Spirits merging within the Great Cavern’s myriad transformations—entrusted to the Jade Dawn’s Upper-Grade practitioners.*

The Scripture states:
*They enter and exit the Flowery Chamber,*
*Within the Eight Obscurities,*
*In the subtlest of subtleties.*
*Descending to guard the human body,*
*The Mud-Pill Palace and the Crimson Palace.*
*Within the center, the Five Qi are ordered,*
*Merging and uniting the hundred spirits.*

The Master says:
*The Great One embraces the flower like a lotus. The Eight Obscurities and the subtlest of subtleties compare to the warp and weft of the Five Qi. All arise from the Three Offices merging the hundred spirits, presiding over the Five Spirits’ transformations.*

The Oral Transmission states:
*This is the first of these two chapters—the treasure within the numinous, the Upper-Grade Dao. As the Jade Dawn Dao Lord has said: "Receiving the Primal Beginning’s boundless deliverance of beings, this is the Upper-Grade Dao."*
*Creation and transformation are not external to the body; their root is likened to the Three Heavens. The Thirty-Nine August Emperors of the Highest Sovereign, the Supreme Perfected of the Nine Empyreans, the myriad emperors of the cosmos, the limitless Highest Perfected—all revere and pay homage, attending within the Purple Tenuity’s Upper Palace, the Golden Portal’s Seven-Treasure Jeweled Terrace. Spirit consorts attend with incense; perfected ones keep watch. Once every forty thousand kalpas, it is transmitted. To recklessly divulge this Dao is to be stricken from the Jade Clarity’s register; nine generations of ancestors will sink into the prison of fiery torment, the body enduring forever the trials of the wind-blade. For endless kalpas, there will be no redemption; for seven dark lineages, there will be the retribution of leprosy and insect afflictions. Unless one has already attained the rank of Perfected, there is no precept by which it may be transmitted. To mistakenly reveal a single word is to incur eternal suffering. Unless taught by a sage of the Supreme Mystery, how could a minor immortal of the Celestial Perfected ever come to understand it?*

The Perfected of Wondrous Conduct intones:
