*One qi pays homage, entering the Eight Obscurities.*
*Heaven’s gate and earth’s portal—*
*Opening and closing, blocking and flowing.*
*Life’s root lies in the Great Tenuity,*
*The luminous beam of the ancestral qi.*
*Heaven enters to act as yang;*
*Heaven opens in yin.*
*Earth leaks to become the perfected;*
*Receiving and expelling, right and wrong.*
*Water and fire arrive together;*
*The hundred spirits turn eastward.*
*Returning to the Valley Chamber,*
*Reckless divulgence brings collapse.*

*The Diagram of the Great One Embracing the Flower*
*The Eight Meridians of the Heart Envelope, ascending to connect with the Nine Hues, internally containing the Five Colors. The Great One embraces the flower like a white lotus, branching to connect with the Nine Cauldrons’ tranquility.*

*The Diagram of the Five Spirits Merging*
*Ten Revolutions Returning the Numinous*

The Scripture states:
*Ten Revolutions Returning the Numinous—*
*The myriad qi ascend as immortals.*

The Master said: The Way of Ten Revolutions is the Way of the Five Phases’ generation and completion. The method of Ten Revolutions is that of the Heavenly Worthy’s tenfold recitation of the scripture—its divine transformations embody this principle.

The Scripture states: *All perfected beings attend the assembly.*
The Master said: When the true ones of the body gather, this saying may be discussed.

The Scripture states: *When the Primordial Heavenly Worthy recited the scripture once, all the great sages of the heavens simultaneously praised its goodness. At that time, all the deaf and ailing in the land had their ears opened and regained hearing.*
The Master said: When the true ones gather in constant goodness, the Water number generates the One, and all under heaven receive its grace. Water ascends to the imperial court, flowing through mountains and valleys, bathing the kidneys to augment wisdom, opening deaf ears, and restoring hearing to the ailing. Yet when the Supreme Way speaks of it, the deluded do not understand. Those with true illness beyond sound do not hear; even the fire of silent clarity is called deafness. Only by obtaining the true One of Water, letting wisdom flow and ascend to wisdom, do the ears open and hear together.

The Scripture states: *When the scripture was recited twice, the blind regained their sight.*
The Master said: The eyes are the masters of the body’s luminosity, the root of the sun and moon’s essence. They are the windows for seeking the true and the numinous source for perceiving the Way. In the *Supreme Way’s Forbidden Scripture*, the sun and moon are foremost—light is fire. The central pupil is the origin of Mars, the sun and moon dividing their radiance. Fire’s generating number is two; the true Water of Heaven One bathes and generates the root of the primordial beginning. The Supreme Mystery’s true fire soars and flies within the heart, thus restoring light and returning brightness, connecting with the three luminaries’ splendor—this is how the blind regain their sight. Moreover, the root of generation and transformation is the *jia*; when the two kidneys’ *xu* and *hai* elements split open, Water ascends to the origin, the three pupils congeal above, the heart generates fire-vision, the three lights merge, and the two pupils govern the eyes’ light—this is called *xuyuan*. Even color-blindness in the Supreme Way follows this pattern.

The Scripture states: *When the scripture was recited three times, the mute could speak.*
The Master said: This is the generating number of Wood. Speaking in terms of the Supreme Way, things generate the Five Phases, and one color contains five hues; yin and yang mutually reverse and conceal their functions. As for the mute, in ordinary terms, the lungs govern sound. According to the Five Constants, speech is born of Metal, and Metal governs voice. Thus, when the Heavenly Worthy recites three times, the divine transformation of Wood’s generating number resides in the West. The true body of Metal, summoned by Wood, reverses and transforms divinely—this is how the mute can speak.

The Scripture states: *When the scripture was recited four times, the lame, the paralyzed, and those with chronic accumulations all rose and walked.*
The Master said: This is the generating number of Metal. The lame and paralyzed suffer from hemiplegia, withered muscles and blood, and contracted limbs—these are the afflictions of paralysis, lameness, and stiffness. Chronic accumulations refer to long-standing, incurable illnesses passed down through generations. These are precisely conditions where sinews and vessels are stiff, blood networks obstructed, and flow impeded—all belonging to the Wood vessel’s liver qi and the utmost of the network vessels, corresponding to the number four. Is this not what the divine immortals call the method of reversing the Five Phases’ generation and completion? Speaking in terms of the Supreme Way, the illnesses of the Dharma-body thrive when Metal and Wood interact, but perish when Metal and Wood are properly employed. Just as Water and Fire mutually depend, Metal and Wood mutually cherish—thus, the four recitations, Metal’s generating number, complete Wood’s divine transformation. This is the meaning.

The Scripture states: *When the scripture was recited five times, long-standing chronic illnesses all restored their forms.*
The Master said: This is the generating number of Earth. The body’s muscles, blood, and form all belong to Earth. The five recitations restore form through the Five Phases’ body. Thus, the blind, deaf, mute, lame, paralyzed, chronically ill, and those with long-standing ailments all recover at once, restoring their forms and wholeness—this is the generating number of the Five Phases.

The Scripture states: *When the scripture was recited six times, white hair turned black, and fallen teeth regrew.*
The Master said: This is the completing number of Water.

The Scripture states: *When the scripture was recited seven times, the old regained their youth, and the young grew stronger.*
The Master said: This is the completing number of Fire. The body’s inner light generates, and the five viscera’s splendor manifests externally. The old regain their youth, and the young gain enhanced appearance and strength—all through the power of Water and Fire.

The Scripture states: *When the scripture was recited eight times, pregnant women and creatures with wombs, whether born or unborn, all achieved generation and completion.*
The Master said: This is the completing number of Wood. The qi of generation nurtures all things, enabling their birth and completion. The sacred embryo congeals the numinous, free from all depletion. The eight qi flourish and coalesce, dividing forms and transforming embryos, free from all depletion—this is governed by Wood’s generative qi.

The Scripture states: *When the scripture was recited nine times, the earth’s treasuries opened, and gold and jade revealed their forms.*
The Master said: The sacred embryo’s nine revolutions are the completing number of Metal. Forms cannot conceal the radiance of Metal’s light; jade’s splendor illuminates the entire body. This is what is called a golden countenance and jade visage, skin like jasper and nectar like jade, bathing and irrigating the whole body. Exhaling and inhaling animate all things, instantly generating gold and jade; blowing qi forms gold, and spitting on the ground creates treasures. A hundred lights and a thousand hues interlace within and without, connected by the Five Phases’ completed functions of gold and jade, giving rise to the sacred embryo’s divided forms.

The Scripture states: *When the scripture was recited ten times, withered bones revived and all rose as complete humans.*
The Master said: This is the completing number of Earth. This is what is called *Ten Revolutions Returning the Numinous, the myriad qi ascending as immortals*—restoring the skeleton, reviving the dead, transforming withered bones into immortals, and reviving them as complete humans. These ten recitations trace their origin to the Five Phases’ generating numbers and conclude with the Five Phases’ completing numbers. Understanding this Way leads to longevity; cultivating it leads to immortality, shedding the husk and ascending in flight—this is its ultimate achievement. If merit is perfected and conduct fulfilled, one ascends to the rank of high perfected. Eighty-one days make one revolution; eight hundred days, the Lesser Vehicle; three thousand days, the Greater Vehicle. Departing not from these words, they produce all divine immortals. Though the paths of the myriad methods differ, their affairs converge in one principle.

The True Master said: The oral instructions are exhausted in this text—this is the lesser Way, transmitted to the perfected.

The Dharma-Empty Perfected One intoned:
*From one to ten, the Five Phases are the root.*
*Yin and yang revolve in cycles,*
*Entering and exiting the sacred gate.*

The sun ascends Mount Fusang, the moon sinks into the Dark Abyss.
The myriad spirits pay homage to the True; they attain union with the Great Primal.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as in statute and decree!*

**Exhaling and inhaling the true qi:**
The Scripture states: Draw qi thirty-two times.
The Master said: The true qi of the Numinous Treasure is the true Dao-qi of the thirty-two heavens. Without absorbing this qi, inner cultivation lacks the foundation for achievement, and external practice yields no responsive verification. Then one merely walks the upper path as an empty corpse, or recites sacred chapters as a lower ghost—all efforts are in vain.

**Qi of the heavens:**
Great Yellow Heaven’s yellow qi,
Great Bright Heaven’s green qi,
Clear Bright Heaven’s blue-green qi,
Mysterious Womb Heaven’s red qi,
Primal Bright Heaven’s azure qi,
Upper Bright Heaven’s black qi,
Void-Nothing Heaven’s jade-green qi,
Great Ultimate Heaven’s purple qi.

The Master said: Step the *gang* of Dipper, Ox, Girl, Void, Danger, House, and Wall, and draw qi—then the Heavenly Lords of the eight heavens dispatch perfected immortals as attendants and guards. They penetrate and observe the affairs of the eight heavens, and wherever one goes, there is no obstruction.

Bright Crimson Heaven’s white qi,
Mysterious Bright Heaven’s green qi,
Radiant Bright Heaven’s yellow qi,
Bamboo Fall Heaven’s blue-green qi,
Void-Origin Heaven’s red qi,
Contemplative Bright Heaven’s azure qi,
Mysterious Bright Heaven’s black qi,
Great Resplendent Heaven’s jade-green qi.

The Master said: Step the *gang* of Horn, Neck, Root, Chamber, Heart, Tail, and Winnowing Basket, and draw qi according to its color—then the Heavenly Lords of the eight heavens dispatch perfected immortals as attendants and guards. They penetrate and observe the affairs of the eight heavens, and wherever one goes, there is no obstruction.

Primal Load Heaven’s purple qi,
Great Peace Heaven’s white qi,
Manifest Stability Heaven’s yellow qi,
Beginning Yellow Heaven’s green qi,
Great August Heaven’s blue-green qi,
Thought-Free Heaven’s red qi,
Upper Divination Heaven’s azure qi,
Ultimate Void Heaven’s black qi.

The Master said: Step the *gang* of Well, Ghost, Willow, Star, Spread, Wing, and Axletree, and draw qi according to its color—then the Heavenly Lords of the eight heavens dispatch perfected immortals as attendants and guards. They penetrate and observe the affairs of the eight heavens, and wherever one goes, there is no obstruction.

Luminous Court Heaven’s jade-green qi,
Abyssal Passage Heaven’s purple qi,
Great Script Heaven’s white qi,
Great Simplicity Heaven’s yellow qi,
Great Void Heaven’s green qi,
Great Liberation Heaven’s blue-green qi,
Dragon Transformation Heaven’s red qi,
Great Ultimate Heaven’s azure qi.

The Master said: Step the *gang* of Straddler, Harvester, Stomach, Pleiades, Net, Turtle Beak, and Orion, and draw qi according to its color—then the Heavenly Lords of the eight heavens dispatch perfected immortals as attendants and guards. They penetrate and observe the affairs of the eight heavens, and wherever one goes, there is no obstruction.

**Method of absorbing qi:**
The oral instructions state: For absorbing the qi of the thirty-two heavens, first knock the teeth nine times. From the Heavenly Gate, enter the Upper Primal Net-Streaming Diagram, proceeding to the twenty-eight lunar lodges and stepping through them. For each heaven, visualize the golden towers and jade halls, where the Heavenly Thearch sits enthroned, crowned and robed in the color of that heaven. From his mouth descends qi of the corresponding color, like fine threads or luxuriant mist, spreading over your body. Inhale it according to the prescribed number, drawing it into your body. For any prayers or petitions, silently present them in the *gang*-wind of the Thearch’s Mysterious Governance. Immediately await the responsive communion from the four directions and the Brahma Heavens of the Dipper’s *gang*. Always align with the lodges of the day for absorption, and practice concurrently across the four heavens.

The Master said: This Dao is the chart first revealed by the Primordial Beginning, the hidden and arcane Way of the Jade Maiden of Mysterious Perfection.

From the *jia-zi* day, the *Tun* hexagram stands at the head, with Water ☵ above and Thunder ☳ below. The yang lines number thirty-six breaths, the yin lines twenty-four breaths. One exhalation measures three inches, one inhalation three inches—this constitutes one breath. When the pulse arrives four times, each arrival spans one inch and five *fen*, so four arrivals make six inches.

The true *qi* of old yang, with doubled exhalation and inhalation, counts thirty-two. At twenty-eight counts, the accelerated practice of sixty hours binds the primordial *qi* into the true script within the Cinnabar Valley, naturally forming jade-like radiant patterns, dragon scripts with eightfold brilliance. Refined with the true fire of pure yang, it becomes the Red Writ.

To know this Dao, consult the Chart of the Primordial August One of Mount Tortoise—this is the method for ascending in broad daylight. Without comprehending its profound principles, follow the recitation practices and ingest it for a year; naturally, you will attain spiritual communion. Await the descent of the Mysterious Perfection to bestow guidance.

**Embryonic Transformation and Corporeal Refinement**
The August Person’s Teachings state: The sagely embryo of the Primordial Beginning has a ten-month process of bodily formation and a Way of seven heads and five roots.

The Scripture says:
- **Supreme Wondrous Head**: Fifteen years.
- **Peerless Conduct Head**: Twenty-five years.
- **Ānāpāna Head**: Thirty-five years.
- **Prolonged Clarity Head**: Forty-five years.
- **Bent Head**: Fifty-five years.
- **Three Realms Bowing Head**: Sixty-five years.
- **Host of Demons Bound Head**: Seventy-five years.

The Master said: The *Supreme Wondrous Head* does not require nine years of practice. The *Peerless Conduct Head* may attain perfection in seven years. The *Ānāpāna Head* ascends in nine years. The *Prolonged Clarity Head* completes its cycle in twelve years, with spirit fully realized. The *Bent Head* achieves liberation through *shi-jie* in eighteen years. At sixty-five, one becomes an immortal of Earth and Water, their name recorded in the Celestial Register—hence the *Three Realms Bowing Head*. At seventy-five, one attains longevity and transcends the world, free from demonic trials—hence the *Host of Demons Bound Head*. Those who extend their years beyond this also bind the host of demons.

The Scripture says: The *upper colorless root* is the Celestial Root. Sever the Earthly Root to preserve the Life Root and eradicate the Evil Root.

The Master said: The *upper colorless root* signifies the purification of all sensory defilements, entering the state of formlessness and non-action—this is the Celestial Root. Without attaining this root, first sever the Earthly Root to eliminate karmic burdens and suffering debts, thereby preserving the Life Root. Both paths prioritize the eradication of the Evil Root.

It is also said: The *upper follows the Celestial Root*, the *middle follows the Earthly Root*, while the *color root* is eliminated, and the *secondary mind-root* is extinguished.

The Master said: Only after mastering the Way of the sagely embryo’s seven heads and five roots may one enter the embryonic transformation of the Primordial Beginning.

The sagely embryo of the Primordial Beginning arises after the Red Writ and before the Azure Vault, born in the Great Floating Li Soil. The eight vessels of the heart’s pericardium correspond externally to the nine colors. Refined in the Nine Cauldrons, preceding the seven heads and five roots, the Red Writ and Azure Vault, when Heaven and Earth emerge from numeration, lie in the breath before inhalation and exhalation.

Once the mechanism of breath is established, it governs the ebb and flow of *qi*. Day and night comprise 3,500 breaths, each breath marked by four pulse arrivals within inhalation and exhalation. One exhalation spans three inches, one inhalation three inches—thus, each breath cycle encompasses six inches of egress and ingress. Each pulse arrival measures one inch and five *fen*, totaling fifteen *fen*—the great number of yin and yang.

The body of Heaven and Earth follows the ratio of three to two. When the true *qi* enters the Nine Cauldrons, it circulates mercury and absorbs lead, forging the sagely embryo of the Primordial Beginning.

Each hour, the *qi* extends 6,750 inches. Over twelve hours, it spans 81,000 inches, totaling 8,100 feet—810 *zhang* of true *qi*—constituting the twelve hours. Each hour is divided into eight *ke* and twenty *fen*, totaling ninety-six *ke* in twelve hours. The trigrams *Qian*, *Kun*, *Gen*, and *Xun* occupy four *ke*, making one hundred *ke* in all. Each hour is fixed at 1,150 breaths, totaling 13,800 breaths in twelve hours. Each breath regulates one *zhu* of fire; twenty-four *zhu* make one *liang*, and 384 *zhu* constitute one *jin* of fire. With 13,500 breaths, the true fire amounts to 315 *jin*, two *liang*, and a half—eight yin and eight yang.

Thus, when the revolutions of Heaven and Earth are fixed, human *qi* and blood circulate through the body in a day and night, with one hundred *ke*. Each *ke* contains sixty *fen*, and one hour—eight *ke* and twenty *fen*—yields 360 breaths. With each inhalation and exhalation, Heaven and Earth traverse sixty *li*. In one day and night, they travel 961,500 *li*. The celestial sphere spans 365 degrees, twenty-five *fen*, and a half, totaling 182 degrees, seventy-five *fen*, seventy-five *miao*. Each degree measures 1,464 *li*, six *cun*, and twenty-eight constellations revolve in harmony with Heaven and Earth, advancing with the Dipper and retreating with the Winnowing Basket.

Each *ke*, Heaven and Earth traverse 10,800 *li*. Each *ke* has sixty *fen*, and each *fen* six breaths. In one hour, Heaven and Earth travel 84,004 *li*, while the *qi* extends 6,750 inches. Over twelve hours, the *qi* traverses 700,890 inches in total.

As Heaven and Earth move, *qi* and blood flow; as yin and yang revolve, *ying* and *wei* circulate. When the sun and moon conjoin, the inner *qi* converges, and from this convergence, the supreme treasure is born. When the supreme treasure gathers, the Great Elixir forms, and the sagely embryo congeals.

The pathways of leakage are assailed by the Eight Evils. The foundation of elixir transformation lies in the union of the Ten Celestial Stems, aligned with the Nine Cauldrons and harmonized with the Nine Colors, perfected through the Nine Revolutions.

**Chart of the Eight Vessels of the Heart’s Pericardium in the Primordial Inner Contemplation**
**Primordial Spiritual Penetration**
The Scripture says: Those who penetrate the mysterious and fathom the subtle can master its chapters. Let scholars of the highest learning recite it; let students recite it.

Here is the translation:

---

**General Precepts (Two Items):**
For offerings and reverent rites, recite this scripture ten times.

**General Precepts (Two Items):**
Let scholars of the highest learning cultivate and recite it; let the people of the world receive and recite it.

**General Precepts (Two Items):**
Recite and chant during the long fast of the first month, the long fast of the seventh month, and the long fast of the tenth month. *(Three Items)*

Recite and chant on the days of the Eight Nodal Festivals and on one’s own life-destiny day. *(Two Items)*

Recite it a hundred times, recite it a thousand times, recite it ten thousand times. *(Three Items)*

During the six daily periods, burn incense and circumambulate the scripture ten times.

When heaven and earth reach their end, when the sun and moon wane and wax, when the utmost sagely are at rest and the lesser learned fall ill or perish. *(Four Items)*

Cultivate and recite the scripture ten times while burning incense. *(One Item)*

One should also perform purification rites, burn incense, and recite the scripture.

When the revolutions of heaven and earth conclude, when the stellar lodges deviate from their courses, when the four seasons lose their proper measures—
when the sovereign suffers calamity, when pestilence spreads, when masters and friends pass away. *(Six Items)*

Fast and recite the scripture to dispel celestial disasters above, to protect and stabilize the emperor, to ward off poison and harm below, and to deliver the multitudes, ensuring that in life and death, all may rely upon it. *(Six Items)*

Resolve in the heart to perform purification rites, burn incense, and recite the scripture ten times. *(One Item)*

Those who know its sound and can fast and recite it shall recite it. *(Two Items)*

The Master says: The above thirty-eight items are all the original, inherent, and wondrous merits of the Primordial Dao, beyond all conception. Should even one item be lacking, the response will fail to manifest, and one cannot be deemed a Perfected Person.

**Mysterious Responses in Cultivation and Recitation**
The Master says: To know the merits of reciting this scripture, align with the Supreme Mystery—there are one hundred and fifty kinds of mysterious responses. Once these responses arise, the day of ascending as an immortal and soaring into the void is near. If no mysterious response occurs, one should repent and purify the will, awaiting the auspicious signs of the mysterious response.

The myriad heavens chant from afar; the ten thousand emperors offer rites.
Rivers and seas fall silent; mountains and peaks conceal their clouds.
The sun and moon pause in their radiance; the celestial pivots cease their turning.
All demons bind their forms; ghostly spirits lose their clarity.
The dead return to life; white bones become human.

**Ten Auspicious Signs of the Supreme Sages:**
The Five Emperors stand in attendance; the Three Realms bow in reverence.
Demon spirits lose their sight; ghostly apparitions vanish.
Those on the verge of death are delivered; those who have perished are restored to life.

**Six Auspicious Signs of the Aspiring Learner:**
Earth deities are subdued and commanded; demonic spirits are bound and restrained.
Death is averted, and life alone remains.

**Three Auspicious Signs of the Student:**
---

Gates and households flourish, generation after generation thriving and prosperous,
bound to good karmic conditions—ten thousand calamities cannot assail them,
and divine spirits guard their doors.

**Five Auspicious Signs of the Devout:**
All heavens arrive in unison; the suffering souls of countless ancestors,
trapped in darkness, are immediately delivered and ascend to the Crimson Palace.
After nine years of refinement, they are transformed and reborn,
becoming noble persons. Those who diligently study and master the scriptures,
fulfilling their merit and perfecting their virtue, all attain immortality,
soaring to the Golden Gates and roaming the Jade Capital.

**For the Advanced Learner** who cultivates and recites this scripture:
all are immediately delivered and ascend to the Southern Palace.

**For the Common Reciter:**
life is prolonged, and years extended. Thereafter, all attain the Way of *shijie*,
where the soul briefly dissolves, escaping the underworld’s torments,
and swiftly regains form, roaming the vast heavens.

**Ten Auspicious Signs of the Ordinary Reciter:**
freed from earthly servitude, they ascend to the Southern Palace.

**Two Auspicious Signs of Recitation in the First Month:**
the body attains immortality; the heavens inscribe their names,
recorded on yellow registers and white tablets, erasing death and granting life.

**Three Auspicious Signs of Recitation in the Seventh Month.**

To stabilize and secure the nation’s destiny, safeguard the heavens’ eternal endurance, ensure dynastic succession without end, and perpetually reign as sovereign—thus pacifying the realm and bringing the people to proclaim great peace.

**Recitation in the Tenth Month:** Six Auspicious Signs.
The Perfected of the Nine Palaces.

**Recitation on the Eight Festivals:** One Auspicious Sign.
The soul and spirit become pure and upright; the myriad *qi* endure forever. Unafflicted by suffering, the body radiates light. The Three Realms attend as guards; the Five Emperors oversee reception. Myriad spirits pay homage; names are inscribed in the heavens. When merit is fulfilled and virtue perfected, one ascends to the Supreme Clarity.

**Recitation on One’s Natal Day:** Ten Auspicious Signs.
With eyes closed in serene contemplation, the body sits amid clouds of blue, yellow, and white *qi*. Within and without, all is shrouded in mist. Azure Dragon, White Tiger, Vermilion Bird, Dark Warrior, Lion, and White Crane array themselves to left and right. Sun and moon illuminate the chamber, its interior suffused with radiance. A circular halo emerges from the crown, its light pervading the ten directions.

**Recitation Within the Chamber:** Nine Auspicious Signs.
The Three and Five Merit Officers, Attendant Envoys of the Left and Right, Incense-Bearing Golden Lads, Message-Transmitting Jade Maidens, the Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans, and the Fragrance Officials of the Appointed Day—all are summoned by the Mystic Register.

**Recitation of the Mystic Chapters Ten Thousand Times:** Fourteen Auspicious Signs.
The revolutions of heaven and earth also know decline and end. The sun, moon, and five planets likewise wax and wane. Even the most sagely and divine may experience repose or adversity. Those of lesser learning may also suffer illness or harm.

**Prayer and Exorcism:** Four Auspicious Signs.
If the learner’s Dao is shallow or their immortal rank incomplete, their destined time of dissolution may arrive. Passing through the Great Yin, at the moment of transition, fellow learners and perfected beings may burn incense and recite the scripture ten times on their behalf. By thus delivering the corporeal form according to the method, the soul and spirit ascend directly to the Southern Palace. According to the measure of their cultivated merit, they are reborn after a calculated span, their transmigration unceasing, and so attain immortality.

**Refinement of the Corpse in the Great Yin:** Three Auspicious Signs.
When the revolutions of heaven and earth draw to a close, one should perform purification rites, burn incense, and recite the scripture. When the stellar lodges fall into disorder and the sun and moon lose their proper course, one should perform purification rites, burn incense, and recite the scripture. When the four seasons lose their order and yin and yang fall out of harmony, one should perform purification rites, burn incense, and recite the scripture. When the sovereign faces calamity and warfare erupts on all sides, one should perform purification rites, burn incense, and recite the scripture. When pestilence spreads and the multitudes perish, one should perform purification rites, burn incense, and recite the scripture. When teachers or companions pass away, one should perform purification rites, burn incense, and recite the scripture.

**Purification Rites and Daoist Practices:** Ten Auspicious Signs.
The heavens record names; myriad spirits stand guard. For the distinguished perfected, this ensures attainment as a minister of the Golden Gates and a sage sovereign. The heavens meticulously record the merits and transgressions of all, without the slightest error. Even the Demon Kings of the Celestial Center will advocate for one’s attainment of the Dao.

**Cultivation of Merit:** Five Auspicious Signs.
The Flying Heavenly Divine Kings descend to observe the practitioner, recording their diligent merit and submitting it to the heavens. Myriad spirits pay homage; earthly deities stand at the gates. The Great Merit Demon Kings advocate for one’s ascent as an immortal.

**Recitation with True Understanding:** Six Auspicious Signs.
Nothing is not averted, nothing is not exorcised, nothing is not delivered, nothing is not accomplished—for this is the natural sound of the Celestial Perfected. Thus, recitation summons the Flying Heavenly Ones to descend and observe; the Supreme Emperor sings from afar. Myriad spirits pay homage; the Three Realms attend in reverence. All demonic hordes bow their heads; ghostly spirits perish of their own accord. The resonant chime of jade rings forth; the ten directions grow solemn and clear. Rivers and seas fall silent; mountains and peaks swallow their mists. Myriad spirits tremble and submit; immortals are gathered in assembly. The heavens are free of impurity; the earth is cleansed of demonic dust. Profound wisdom illumines the depths; the vastness of the Mysterious is utterly profound.

**Twenty-Four Auspicious Signs.**
Expounding the scripture once: all Celestial Great Sages simultaneously proclaim its virtue; in one nation, the deaf and ailing regain their hearing.
Expounding the scripture twice: the blind recover their sight.
Expounding the scripture thrice: the mute regain speech.
Expounding the scripture four times: the lame, the chronically ill, and the bedridden all rise and walk.
Expounding the scripture five times: those afflicted by long-standing and intractable illnesses instantly regain their form.
Expounding the scripture six times: white hair returns to black; fallen teeth regrow.
Expounding the scripture seven times: the aged regain their youth; the young grow strong.
Expounding the scripture eight times: pregnant women, birds, and beasts—whether their offspring are born or unborn—all attain proper development.
Expounding the scripture nine times: the earth’s treasuries open, revealing gold and jade.
Expounding the scripture ten times: withered bones revive, rising as fully formed humans.

**Ten Auspicious Signs of Inward Recitation:** The birth of the sagely embryo of the Primordial Beginning.

**Yin Elixir and Yang Elixir**
The scripture states: *Flowing essence and jade radiance, five colors flourishing in abundance.*
The scripture states: *The body radiates light.*
The scripture states: *The wondrous head of the highest rank, ten recitations deliver humanity. A hundred demons conceal their traces; separation and union arise naturally. The Crimson Text of the Primordial Chaos, the peerless Supreme Perfected.*

In the primordial kalpas of the Primordial Beginning, the myriad heavens were brought forth. The Three Luminaries were revealed—this is the root of heaven. Above, there is no further ancestor; only the Dao is the body. The Five Scripts unfold and expand, universally nurturing the divine spirits. Without scripture, there is no illumination; without scripture, there is no clarity; without scripture, there is no establishment; without scripture, there is no accomplishment; without scripture, there is no deliverance; without scripture, there is no birth.

The scripture states: *Jade essence and evergreen mulberry, transcending the void to attain immortality.*
The master says: *Flowing essence and jade radiance are the Numinous Treasures of Heaven. They may be refined and ingested to commune with the Perfected.* Thus, the Celestial Perfected Sovereign declares: *Before the Great Void, there was not a single thing.* The Primordial Heavenly Worthy emerged within the Three *Qi*, smelting the Crimson Text of the Primordial Chaos to forge the jade characters. The Three Luminaries were revealed, universally nurturing the divine spirits. Though we know of these today, comparing them to the era before the Primordial Beginning, the *qi* that gave birth to the Numinous Treasures may be gathered again, refined into an elixir, and ingested to attain perfection.

The method states: *Upon a high mountain’s sheer cliff, where no human treads, in a place where the sun and moon’s light converges, establish a secluded chamber. Its shape should be round above and square below, with a diameter of eight feet and sides of ten feet, raised five feet above the ground. Bore thirty-two apertures, arranging them in the pattern of the Twenty-Eight Constellations, like windows to admit the sunlight.*

Begin on the day when the sun aligns with the Horn Star. Use a vessel of the Seven Treasures, five inches in diameter, filled with westward-flowing water, to receive the descending sunlight. After forty-five days, five-colored flowing essence-sand will congeal within the water. Collect and ingest it, and your face will radiate a flowing purple light, enabling communion with the divine and attainment of perfection.

To refine the Great Elixir of the Numinous Treasure, place thirty-two vessels beneath the thirty-two apertures. On the day when the sun aligns with each constellation, gather the corresponding directional water and infuse it with the Four Springs—comprising rain, dew, frost, and snow. Let the sun illuminate and the moon bathe the water; after forty-five days, floating sand will form upon its surface, shimmering with luminous brilliance. Guard its purity diligently, allowing no dust to obscure it. Then, arrange the altar furnace with eight gates and commence the firing. Forge a crucible from twelve taels of gold and a cauldron from twenty-four taels of iron. Use a yang-burning mirror to kindle the flame and tend it day and night. Open the furnace once every forty-five days, and at that time, anoint it with moonlight to condense the white blossom within. When one catty has accumulated, add twenty-four *zhū* each of the Riverbank Maiden’s cinnabar-mountain white soul and the Crimson Mound’s vermilion child, placing them within the crucible and sealing it with the numinous elixir. Refine with yin and yang fire for seven periods, causing the essence to ascend to the lid. When it increases to one catty, proceed to the Nine Revolutions. After nine years, it will naturally congeal within the womb-chamber, forming a crimson fruit with a vermilion stem—a single grain of which, when swallowed, instantly transforms one into a flying immortal.

Every forty-five days constitutes one bathing cycle. As for the Way of the Golden Elixir, the firing of the jade characters resides within the cinnabar valley. On one’s life-destiny day, follow the method to circulate through the apertures and ingest the essence of the sun and moon. This belongs to the rank of the True *Qi* Canon. When merit fills both inner and outer realms, one may ascend to the Jade Clarity on the appointed day. The Jade Birth is the essence of jade light, descending to nurture the Fusang Tree, enabling transcendence across the empty realms. This is also the wondrous purport of the Three Luminaries within the Great Cavern. Only after the elixir is completed and the world is saved may it be consumed.

The Master says: The crimson text descends in flight, the Great One contains its bloom—like the lotus as the origin, with a hundred flowers following. It is also called the Numinous Treasure Pearl-Light Elixir, capable of curing all illnesses, reviving the dead, and, with prolonged ingestion, ensuring longevity. It is most potent when gathered on *bǐng-dīng*, *xū-hài*, *chén-sì* days and hours: with the left hand, pluck thirty-two unopened white lotuses; with the right, thirty-two red lotuses. Dry them over fire until brittle, then incinerate them to ash. Next, on the third day of the third month, the seventh day of the seventh month, and the ninth day of the ninth month, gather one catty each of a hundred flowers as companions. Then add five *liǎng* each of nine-jointed sweetflag, ginseng, rehmannia, asparagus, atractylodes, dried ginger, and sesame. Grind them together, blending with the hundred-flower nectar into a paste, and form into pills the size of soybeans. Take five to seven pills with ash-free wine. The gathering and blending are accompanied by invocations, as detailed in the recitation canon. Consuming one pill daily grants foresight after a hundred days, freedom from illness after a year, and immortality. After a thousand days, the Five Spirits will be fulfilled, and eternal life instantly attained.

The *Dà Xíng Fàn Qì* Scripture states: The Eight Luminaries merge in darkness, *qi* enters the profound mystery, within which abides the Supreme Emperor, the Lofty Perfected. The Master says: This is the primordial *qi* of the Queen Mother of the West’s Eight Luminaries, also called the Cinnabar Sovereign Lord. It is the supreme Dao of the Highest Rank, by which all true immortals of the Three Realms refine the great Brahman within the human body, aligning above with celestial transcendence. Thus, the breath of inhalation and exhalation—when the *qi* circulates within the body and unites with the Great Yang—refines the great medicine. This is the true path of cultivation and the stairway to the Dao.

The Scripture says: The Great Brahman *Qi* pervades the cosmos, the boundless Brahman of the primordial chaos, the formless realm of Brahman conduct. The Master says: Humans are born from the boundless Brahman of the primordial chaos yet die through the boundless Brahman of the turbid ford. If one seeks to master the Great Brahman *Qi*, first cultivate the twelve kinds of Brahman conduct, then distinguish the Brahman *qi*. The origin of Brahman *qi* is the Queen Mother. This is also the supreme Dao of the Great Cavern.

Humans are endowed with *qi* at birth, which also marks the beginning of their allotted span. The breath of inhalation and exhalation manifests in the three regions and four extremities of the pulse. Each exhalation measures three inches, each inhalation three inches—measured by the celestial balance, aligning with the Great Yang. One day and night comprise one hundred *kè*, totaling six thousand divisions. Each *kè* contains sixty *fēn*, each *shí* (two-hour period) eight *kè*, and twenty *fēn*, totaling one hundred forty *fēn*. In a day and night, there are thirteen thousand five hundred breaths. Each *kè* contains three hundred sixty breaths. With each inhalation and exhalation, the pulse travels six inches, and the Great Yang traverses sixty *lǐ*. In a day and night, the Great Yang travels a total of nine million six hundred fifteen thousand *lǐ*, circling the heavens and illuminating three hundred sixty-five degrees and twenty-five and a half *fēn*. Each day it advances one and a half degrees, completing a celestial cycle of one hundred eighty-two degrees, sixty-two *fēn*, seventy-five *miǎo*. Each degree measures one thousand four hundred sixty-four *lǐ*, six *cùn*, and four *fēn*. The twenty-eight constellations progress through their encircling degrees, while the great Dao’s Brahman *qi* flows endlessly, revolving the Dipper and traversing the Winnowing Basket, cycling through the Five Constants.

As the Great Yang’s true *qi* flows one hundred eight thousand *lǐ* each *kè*, and each *kè* contains sixty *fēn* and three hundred sixty-two breaths, the Great Yang’s flowing light advances three hundred sixty *lǐ* per *fēn*. Each *shí*, the Great Yang’s flowing true light travels eighty-six thousand four hundred *lǐ*, while its *qi* permeates six thousand seven hundred fifty *cùn*. Over twelve *shí*, the total *qi* and blood circulate seven hundred eight thousand ninety *cùn*. As the sun and moon conjoin, yin and yang intermingle; as the sun and moon move, the defensive and constructive *qi* circulate—thus the great medicine is completed herein.

Within the ancient crucible of the Nine *Qi*, a small child gathers. Each day and night, the Brahman *qi* ascends in audience. If even a trace of dust-like thought arises, the Great Brahman *Qi* is lost, failing to pervade the body—then death ensues, for this is the foremost gateway to mortality.

Here the root of the Nine *Qi* resides—the profound abode of true earth—located in the northwest quadrant, between *xū* and *hài*, bordering the Jade Purity realm and connecting to the Mud Pill Palace. To the south, it joins the Crimson Palace of Yang Permeation; above, it links to the lung *qi*; below, it reaches the inner gate, the portal of sun and moon, the cinnabar chamber where gold and mercury conjoin. To the north lies the inner kidney, spanning three *cùn*, flanked by twelve divine chambers, wherein dwells the sovereign of Brahman *qi*—the solitary true mother.

**Chart of the Western Tortoise Mountain**
The Western Tortoise Mountain, also called Dragon Mountain, signifies the Dao of wood. The Metal Mother resides there, embodying the essence of metal. It is the root of the Nine Heavens and the foundation of the nine palaces within humans. The nexus of yellow *qi*’s profound abode, the palace of Brahman *qi*, the true seat of earth. In the celestial northwest, between *hài* and *zǐ*, lies the birthroot of the infant. Spanning myriad leagues in circumference, its bounds are immeasurable, transcending all conventional measures. Its height borders the Jade Purity realm, ascending to the brain. Its meridians connect to the Jade Emperor’s Palace; to the southeast, it adjoins the Divine Tiger Gate, linking to the lung *qi*, and further communicates with the great stomach. To the northwest, it intersects the Cold Cavern, exchanging *qi* with the kidney palace’s hidden chamber. At its southern extreme, Cavern Yang harmonizes with the heart; to the north, it points to the Curved Array, treading the Central August Palace. Above, it fills the twenty-four nodes of Jade Capital, the twelve-storied tower. Extending thirty thousand *lǐ* in breadth, it is the convergence of the Three *Qi*. Gold surges forth as walls, jade coalesces as gates—this is the palace of true earth and jade liquid. Golden terraces and jade halls mirror the prior discourse. The twelve divine chambers encompass the Seven Governors, Nine Palaces, and Three Fields. As stated before, above flows the essence of the Purple Palace’s Golden Flower Hall, flanked by five apertures—the gateway where the essences of the five viscera gather. Naturally arising purple *qi* clouds intertwine with nine-colored phoenix patterns, cascading like silk through the four limbs and eight vessels, the five viscera and six bowels, where crimson blossoms and purple essences internally generate the Five Non-Beings. Its cliffs birth purple cassia groves and jade forests, coral branches and jade roots; the hanging groves bear fruit—crimson children and white rings—where flawless *qi* engenders these treasures. Three flowers radiate upon the vermilion landscape; reversed fragrance flows through the Great Mystery. Inward vision connects the Three Illuminations; five aromas arise from the Five *Qi*. Eight *qi* stir as jade flutes sing in the void—sound without instrument within.

**The Flow of the Primordial Net**
The Master said: The Primordial Net is the path of primordial *qi*, the root of the Nine Heavens. From a celestial perspective, it lies in the northwest quadrant, bordering the Jade Purity realm. To the southeast, it joins the rosy clouds of Yang Permeation, ascending to the Divine Tiger Gate of the Pure Palace. To the northwest, it spans the wilds of the Cold Valley, ascending to the Golden Portal of the Immortals’ Court. At its southern extreme, it reaches the land of Great Cinnabar and Floating Blackness, where *qi* harmonizes with the radiance of Cavern Yang. To the north, it aligns with the Curved Array, intersecting the *qi* of the Flower Canopy, treading the central expanse of Broad Mound, directly filling Jade Capital. Eight winds converge—this is the Western Tortoise Mountain, the numinous root of heaven.

The Master said: To examine the Primordial Net is to scrutinize the celestial root and pivot, the warp of *qi*, the origin of the Dao’s source. Before the Dao’s division, the Primordial Net was already established—this is the great form of heaven and earth, the subtle axis of wondrous *qi*. It weaves through the thirty-two heavens, threading the twenty-eight constellations’ divisions. That which ascends is called the Dao; that which flows forth is called the teaching. Practiced internally, it aligns with the body; applied externally, it revolves with method. This is the natural pattern of heaven and earth, the embodiment and function of the human form.

Moreover, the illusory human body, formed from impure and turbid matter—once the embryo stirs, the three hairs serve no purpose. A thing of dust and decay, only our singular spirit shares a beginning and end with heaven and earth, equally endowed with ancestral *qi*. Thus, the head is round like heaven, the feet square like earth; the eyes resemble sun and moon, the body mirrors *qián* and *kūn*. The *qi* and breath circulate in accord with heaven’s measures. If one cultivates this to correspond with that, one may endure with heaven, transcending without perishing.

The deluded fail to awaken to its truth, fail to examine its function, and claim the body contains heaven and earth, requiring no external pursuit—this is erroneous. The methods of internal alchemy branch into three thousand six hundred side paths, but only the golden elixir’s true formula remains essential. At its inception, one pursues the two *qi* along the Yellow Path, unites the three natures in the Primordial Palace. In its completion, the yin soul vanishes without trace, the yang spirit merges with the Dao. According to the weight of merit and the rank of one’s endowment, one is appointed to the immortal bureaucracy, receives scriptures in the grotto heavens. Yet one cannot assert that within the body lies heaven and earth while outside, none exist; that within are spirit and form while outside, no spirits or gods. Grasping a fragment of technique, one presumes internality precludes externality—how grievously mistaken!

In recent times, such claims persist, yet they are fallacious. The regret lies in not encountering the Master’s intent, groping blindly without grasping the essentials. Neither wholly internal nor exclusively external, one fabricates a doctrine of neither within nor without—this strays even further from principle.

Behold the azure vault above—this is heaven. The sun, moon, and stars are heaven’s patterns. The boundless and unfathomable—this is earth. Mountains, rivers, and peaks are earth’s principles. The human body, with its four limbs and five constituents, is but one thing among heaven and earth, yet its nature surpasses all things. You bear heaven and tread earth—can you truly say there is no heaven or earth beyond? The discourse on the Primordial Net’s form reveals heaven’s constancy. Next, it describes the human body, modeling itself on heaven and earth, aligning with yin and yang—speaking of its resemblance.

Heaven is firm and ceaseless in its movement, thus heaven and earth endure. If one unites with the Dao and clarifies the spirit, one too may avoid perishing.

This is not the heavens existing independently within the body, nor is it purely internal or external—such misconceptions would mislead later generations. Thus, it must be clearly distinguished.

The Primordial Net is the essential path for ascending the spirit, the supreme vista of the celestial stages. Once the source of the Dao is discerned, the divine heavens reside above the hollows of Mount Kongtong, beyond words or perception. Those who awaken to its truth cultivate truth through truth, and external truth naturally responds. Those who recognize its subtlety attain subtlety through subtlety, and external subtlety naturally manifests.

As for the celestial deities’ forms, the position of the Primordial Net—whether distant or near—can be known. Within humans, the Primordial Net’s *qi* opens and unblocks the bones and meridians, ascending to the crown of the head, just as the Primordial Net’s path exists in the heavens. The human *hun* and *po* reside within the body as *qi* does in heaven: those who understand their egress and ingress achieve longevity and flight, while those who do not remain common and ignorant. It is like seeking an audience with the ruler without studying the arts or knowing the ranks of officialdom.

When primordial *qi* fuses and gathers, it nourishes the *hun* and *po*, giving rise to true essence. This true essence roots in the right kidney, which is the Gate of Life, located at the hollow of the spine. Below it lies a great bone, its marrow piercing the coccyx; this cavity is called the "Tortoise Tail," and its deity is the Queen Mother, who faces south to govern. As the Emperor faces this direction, it is called the "Western Tortoise Mountain"—a metaphor Daoists employ. It is also named the "Golden Palace" for its western location.

To the right is the Golden Palace; to the left is the Jade Chamber, signifying jade within the mountain, moistened by wood and residing in the east. It is also the source of Jade Water, the transformation of yang essence, where essence congeals—named "Pure Radiance." This is where the Primordial Net’s *qi* originates.

The Precious Diagram’s high terrace arises within this "Lush Rosy Cloud Terrace," directly aligned with the heart’s abode, called the "Spirit Terrace." Above the Upper Clarity’s realm, at the border of Great Clarity, lies below the heart. The heart’s suspended root descends to the liver. Below the liver’s two divisions reside the seven stars of the Northern Dipper. Its *qi* reaches the heart, its origin ascending to the tongue’s underside, named the "Bubbling Spring." Its *qi* descends to the right kidney’s *qi*. When the kidney’s *qi* leaks, the Bubbling Spring’s *qi* cannot be restrained—this is called "crossing blades." "Crossing blades" refers to the Dipper’s *Gang* star and the fierce *Taipiao*’s domain, a realm of stern severity, the abode of the Desire Realm’s deities.

Those who know this Dao press the tongue to the upper palate, guiding *qi* upward along the spine to connect with the head. The head’s summit is the vital path to the Jade Capital, where the Western Tortoise borders the Jade Capital. Yet people, unaware, mistakenly place the Western Tortoise behind the brain. In truth, the Western Tortoise lies four thousand myriad layers from the Jade Capital’s *qi*, centrally positioned. Its *qi* ascends directly to heaven, first reaching the lowest Fire Star. The heart, belonging to fire, rises to resonate with it. The sun, moon, and Fire Star align, thus traversing the sun and moon within the body, where the two breasts correspond to the heart.

The two breasts are the eyes’ root. Humans’ breasts store essence to nourish the eyes. Thus, in old age, when *qi* wanes and eyes dim, the breasts yield no milk, and the kidneys lack essence. The Winnowing Basket and Dipper lie in the heavens’ northeast, serving as the celestial pivot—this is the *Gen* trigram’s domain. In humans, this corresponds to the right shoulder’s "Shoulder Well" point. The body’s blood, *qi*, and vessels begin on the right, just as heaven’s course begins in the northwest. Proceeding west to the Ox Mansion completes heaven’s affairs, yet generation has not yet arisen. Thus, creation begins here, re-entering the Fire Star.

Though human *qi* completes one cycle, its ebb and flow depend on this—re-entering the heart. The heart’s course follows fire, wood, water, and metal. The great decline follows the heart, liver, kidneys, and lungs—these are the *qi* transport points along the spine. Observing the spine’s points reveals their positions above, below, left, and right. Pursuing their subtlety, one finds the throat’s circuit connecting to the crown gate, embodying the mystery of mysteries, ineffable and unnameable.

The formless realm lies below the heart, within the hollows of Mount Kongtong, to the left of the Dipper’s bowl. From the Dipper’s mouth, pressing the tongue to the upper palate—called the "Celestial Bridge"—one transcends Upper Clarity to reach Jade Clarity. Thus, the Jade Clarity’s realm is the head, the Upper Clarity’s realm is the Crimson Palace, the Great Clarity’s realm is the Cinnabar Field, and the heart is the Spirit Terrace—its principles now evident.

Here, one guards. Guarding resides in the heart. Here, one pays homage. Homage resides in the head. The Three Flowers’ separation thus reveals a wondrous court. The celestial heavens’ convergence of the "Peerless White Prime" occurs in the heart, naturally forming the true, meeting in the head. Practicing the Numinous Treasure’s Dao within the body culminates here. No further expression is possible.

The Primordial Net’s flow in heaven was previously described. Its embodiment in the human body is recorded here. Scholars must deeply understand why this body is so noble: it can match heaven and earth, refine form and spirit, and unite with the numinous and subtle. Daoists employ metaphors based on phenomena, modeling heaven and earth to establish names. From the cultivated body, one establishes methods of action, progressing from action to non-action, from form to formlessness. Only then does one’s lifespan equal heaven and earth, merging with the Dao in truth. This begins within the body but does not end there.

**Primordial Net Flow Diagram**
According to the *Declarations of the Perfected*, the various perfected ones’ Five Star Diagram is arranged facing south. With Venus in the west and Jupiter in the east, it is thus applied.

The Five Stars conceal and reveal, shifting unpredictably in their courses, unlike the Northern Dipper whose pattern remains constant. Thus, one first establishes position according to the Five Directions, not following the stars’ transient locations.

**Twenty-Eight Constellations’ Righteous Steps**
Totaling one hundred seventy-eight steps. The formula states: First, one must visualize one’s own spirit ascending from the Yellow Court, riding five-colored clouds directly through the Jade Tower to the Mud Pill Palace. Stepping through the Seven Stars, one follows each star upward, feeling the body rise far above the earth into the celestial clouds and qi. Then, moving horizontally across the Seven Stars, one turns the body to enter the Dipper’s mouth, taking six cumulative steps. Visualizing the body facing south with its back to the north, proceed to Mars, envisioning red. Passing Mars, move eastward, visualizing passage through the Sun Palace in red. After the Sun Palace, proceed westward, visualizing passage through the Moon Palace in white. From the Moon Palace, move southwest, turning left seven times, then exit northward. Traverse the celestial stars of the southeast, reaching the northeast corner, then retrace the steps, circling the stars of the four directions: north, west, south, and east.

Upon completion, return to the northeast corner, face east, and circle once around the Chief Star. Then exit, moving toward Mars, pass the west to see Venus in white. From Venus, proceed northward to Mercury in black. From Mercury, pass eastward to Jupiter in blue-green. From Jupiter, return to Mercury’s palace, then west past Venus, heading straight to the Central Palace of Saturn in yellow. From Saturn, return to Venus and Mercury, reaching Jupiter’s palace. Gazing northwest, ride the clouds upward to behold the Golden Towers.

The formula states: Pay homage to the Thirty-Two Heavens, beginning with the Supreme Yellow Emperor’s Layered Heaven and ending with the Level Nurturing Jia Yi Heaven. Then return to pay homage to the Twenty-Eight Constellations, one Dipper per constellation, starting from the Winnowing Basket and circling back to the Dipper, then facing the Dipper’s handle to depart. Pay homage to the Five Stars according to the prescribed form.

Ascend the spirit to the celestial realm, entering the Northern Dipper’s midst. The Three Terraces’ six stars form a canopy overhead as one steps through one Dipper’s seat. Next, take six steps corresponding to the Three Terraces to exit. Circle left forty-nine steps, encountering Mars. Then proceed east eighty-one steps to the Great Sun, paying homage to the Filial Dao Immortal King. Turn right sixty-four steps, entering the Dipper from the north to reach the Great Yin, paying homage to the Filial Dao Luminous King. Turn left to exit, then left again, and right again, seven cycles within the formless realm. Steadfastly visualize the perfected immortals coming and going, traversing the Ten Directions’ Twenty-Eight Constellations and Thirty-Two Heavens. Each constellation’s Righteous Steps number twelve; returning, the total is three hundred thirty-six steps. At the Winnowing Basket’s Righteous Steps, face directly back toward the Northern Dipper’s great handle. Turn right, facing south for forty-nine steps, re-enter Mars, and pass through the Great Yin. Thirty-six steps to pay homage to Mercury, then eastward to the side of the Great Sun. Turn right sixty-four steps, completing the Wood phase in the east, facing to pay homage to Jupiter, then return to proceed. Borrowing Mercury’s Righteous Steps, exit beside the Great Yin. Eighty-one steps complete the Metal phase; face west to pay homage to Venus. Proceed east to the Dipper’s mouth, thirty-five steps to enter the center and pay homage to Saturn. Reverse course to re-enter Venus and Mercury’s lodges, then gaze directly north toward the Jade Capital’s Golden Towers. Proceeding step by step, bow twice and kneel, praying:

“Your subordinate, [Name], by fortunate karmic affinity, has encountered the true wind. Entering stillness to concentrate the spirit, I reverently approach the celestial towers. The body beyond the body ventures to reach the Jade Capital. I am overwhelmed with awe, gazing toward the heavens and longing for the sagely presence.”

Bow twice again and continue:

“This subordinate’s mortal bones are stubborn and coarse, inherently difficult to ascend. By the grace of my teacher’s instruction, I dare to let my spirit fly. Unafraid of punishment, I boldly disclose the cinnabar script. [Recite the matter at hand.] I am utterly devoted to beseeching favor, awaiting your command.”

Bow twice, retreat, and return along the original path, guiding the spirit back into the top of the head. Pray:

“Now I pay homage to the true, ascending to meet the azure clouds. May the divine beings seal my form and close my debts. Lift me away, secret and efficacious.”

The above **Primordial Net Flow Diagram** embodies the wondrous practices of the celestial Brahma conduct. It begins with flying the spirit to tread the Dipper and concludes with paying homage to the Emperor and facing the origin. If one can practice with focused intention and precise execution, entering and exiting with familiarity, maintaining unwavering concentration, one may present memorials and conduct affairs, command ghosts and spirits, and ultimately shed the mortal shell to ascend as a perfected being, merging with the myriad qi. The methods of refining form and facing the origin begin here.

On the Three Origins, Eight Nodal Days, and days of Jiazi and Gengshen, enter the oratory, burn incense, sit facing north, close the eyes, still the thoughts, and concentrate the spirit. With qi and breath flowing gently and the spirit-wind undisturbed, raise the body from the crown like a cicada shedding its shell, ascending into the empty void. Proceed according to the method. From subtlety to manifestation, from visualization to realization, it rests with the practitioner.

*Highest Clarity Numinous Treasure Great Ritual*, Scroll Four concludes.
*Highest Clarity Numinous Treasure Great Ritual*, Scroll Five.

The Venerable Master of Subtle Mysteries, Illuminator and Savior of Suffering, Perfected Xiao Quan-Zhen, transmitted to the disciples of the Three Caverns of Highest Clarity and the Numinous Treasure lineage, Preceptor Wang Qi-Zhen, compiler of *The Gate of Refining and Regulating Breath*.

**Internal Audience of the Three Luminaries at the Golden Palaces**

The Master said: When practicing the great method, if one has not yet penetrated the celestial perfected, and the majestic transformation remains incomplete, demonic trials will assail, the spirits will not revere, and what is summoned will not respond—then one should practice the Dao of internally audienceing the Three Luminaries and flying as an immortal with a divided form.

The method is to perform the audience at the four hours of Chen, Xu, Chou, and Wei. First, visualize within the heart the Central Origin Controller of Destiny, whose name is Mysterious Firmness, who is the Supreme One of the Central Ultimate. Below, he resides in the Jade Hall Palace within the spleen, also called the Jade Chamber, which is the reclining abode of the Supreme One. He governs the nurturing of the adept’s entire bodily true form and qi-essence.

At the four hours, knock the teeth five times, visualize yellow qi filling the spleen, and upon the spleen, a true person like an infant, clad in yellow robes. Call upon him, saying: *"Supreme One of the Central Ultimate, Mysterious Firmness, Perfected Sovereign, I desire to attain the Dao of the Yellow Court of the True Person and the Immortal."* Call five times, then lie down, close the eyes for fifty breaths—this is the Elder of the Controller of Destiny of the Central Origin, who transforms below into the Supreme One, the Emperor, the father of the celestial deities of the Nine Heavens. He governs the Palace of the Supreme Ultimate. Those who know him will not descend into the earthly prisons; jade lads and jade maidens attend him, and he commands the myriad spirits.

Regularly at the four hours of Yin, Mao, Wu, and Shen, audience the Supreme One of the Upper Origin, titled the Old Man of the Southern Ultimate, who resides below in the Palace of the Supreme One. He governs the adept’s hun-soul, po-soul, womb spirit, life qi, and the father of the fetal palace. At these four hours, knock the teeth nine times, visualize a true person one inch above the head, named the Palace of the Supreme Ultimate, also called the Palace of the Supreme One. Visualize red and yellow qi filling the palace, and within the qi, a true person like a youth, clad in crimson robes. Call upon him, saying: *"Supreme One of the Southern Ultimate, Primordial First, Perfected Sovereign, I desire to attain the Dao of the divine elixir, longevity, and immortality."* Call nine times, then lie down, close the eyes for fifty breaths, and recite for ninety breaths before stopping. Those who practice this will prolong their years without dying, may transform into immortals, dispel demonic trials, and summon true immortals.

Regularly at the four hours of Zi, Hai, Si, and You, audience the Mysterious Origin Dao-Mother of the Lower Origin, who resides below in the Palace of the Dual Union—the kidneys. Opposite the Southern Ultimate above, it is thus called the Northern Ultimate. She governs the adept’s essence-qi, life and death, and is the mother of the talismanic registers. At these four hours, knock the teeth four times, visualize within the kidneys white qi, and within the qi, a divine tortoise. Upon the tortoise is the Mysterious Woman, clad in azure and white, like a maiden. To her left is the Controller of Destiny, clad in azure robes and a celestial crown; to her right is the Recorder of Deeds, clad in white robes and a celestial crown. Call upon her, saying: *"Mysterious Origin of the Lower Origin, Northern Ultimate Dao-Mother, named Mysterious Wonder, I desire to obtain the golden liquor and jade spring to drink and consume. I beseech you to command the Recorder of Deeds and the Controller of Destiny to erase my name from the register of death and inscribe me for long life, to command the Six Ding and Jade Maidens, and to establish a traveling kitchen."* Call four times, then lie down, close the eyes, and recite for forty breaths before stopping.

If this is practiced without fail at the proper times, over days and months, the responses will be boundless. After nine years, one may be appointed as an immortal minister of the Supreme Ultimate. After one year, there will be signs, and one may command spirits and deities, with every desire answered. Constantly maintain mindfulness, guard the mouth, and one may attain immortality on the appointed day. This is the practice of the Three August Emperors of the Cavernous Mystery, the secret mechanism of the Numinous Treasure, and must be performed with an oath to heaven and a vow to the master. One should wear the Five Directions’ Inner Sounds and Jade Characters, cultivate according to the method, and enter the subtle to attain the wondrous. Keep this secret.

**Internal Recitation of the Cavernous Chapters**

The Master said: The root of the Thirty-Two Heavens lies in the Primordial Record of the Western Origin Tortoise Mountain, which contains the *Cinnabar-Yellow Flying Mystery Purple Text* and the *Empty Cavern Numinous Chapters*. Thus, the chapter of the Form Realm’s Demon Kings states: *"I possess the Cavernous Chapters,"* which is precisely this text.

The *Flying Mystery Purple Text* says:
*The Flying Mystery Purple Qi congeals the root of spirit,
The net of jade numinosity binds the myriad spirits.
In the void, it surges and coalesces naturally,
Above, there are layered twelve transmissions.
Jade towers towering, radiant with luminous clouds,
Flowing essence and purple palaces girded with golden portals.
Jasper terraces gleaming, encircled by eight soaring,
Within, the Azure Gold Ninefold Immortals reside.
The Cinnabar August True Mother, named Essence-Prolonger,
Wears a cap of flying azure feathers at dawn.
In hand, she grasps a jade scepter and holds the numinous cord,
Five-colored life-demons face the imperial honored one.
Grasping the talismanic registers at the Gate of Life,
She chews the sun and moon, sips the liquor-spring.
The Net of Separation emits radiance, refining the five souls,
Internally replete, externally overflowing, the Crimson Palace rejoices.
Golden light shining, the form becomes perfectly round,
From the new moon, it enters the golden hue, turbid and indistinct.
Only the Enlightened One understands these words,
On the fifth and tenth days of the moon, the essence of the Northern Origin.
One may see the Flowery Canopy leading the Immortal Lords,
The purple qi revolving leftward, linked with the Dipper.
Passing through the four and seven, entering the Golden Gate,
This is where the Cinnabar August One reviews the myriad immortals.
Those who clearly understand this secret and apply diligent effort,
Should visualize the subtle scenes and contemplate them in detail.
When the wondrous vision responds and the essential text is attained,
In three years, one may securely preserve long life.
In nine years, one may ride the void and attain feathered skirts,
Lightly soaring in phoenix robes to ascend Dragon Mountain,
Looking up and down to the Ninefold Numinous Ones to pay homage at the Jade Dawn.*

For those who cultivate this Dao, from the first to the twelfth month of the year, each month select the third, fifth, ninth, fifteenth, and twenty-fifth days—five times in a month. On these days, purify with a fast, and after midnight, recite the *Flying Mystery Purple Text* once. Gaze upward toward the Golden Gate in the west. If in the mortal realm the sky is overcast and without light, perform this within the chamber: silently recite and internally visualize according to the method, imagining purple clouds revolving leftward from the Golden Gate, passing through the Dipper and Ladle, circling the Northern Dipper, and finally returning above the Golden Gate. Ensure each detail is clear.

After visualization, bow four times toward the purple clouds at the heart, knock the teeth three times, and raise the heart in prayer, saying: *"The night sky is bright and clear, the hidden and void reveal the true."*

The drifting clouds linger, golden radiance spreads in four directions.
The Cinnabar Emperor scatters his brilliance, the numinous flies as a purple disk.
On this night, the pure chamber unfolds the ranks of immortals.
Fulfill my highest aspiration, the body aligns with nature’s spontaneity.
Bind life to the moon’s essence, preserve the root of years and days.
The Three Spirits merge with the light, the light halts at Dragon Mountain.
In the secret night, I humbly petition—let it be as these words declare.

After the prayer, draw with mouth and nose the qi of the sun, moon, and purple clouds into the body, swallowing saliva twenty-eight times to conclude.
Visualize the body transforming into the Jade Void Emperor, encircled by the twenty-eight lunar mansions and starry constellations.
Practice this for three years, and during nightly repose, divine transcendents will descend to your chamber.
Your body will be suffused with purple clouds, illuminating your entire form, while the names of the Nine Heavens are inscribed in jade script upon the Jade Clarity.
After nine years, you will directly attain the rank of upper immortal.
This is the boundless merit of delivering beings—how noble is the Dao of immortality!
Let those who study the Dao exert themselves in its practice, lest they defile the numinous treasure of the Way, for then both the hidden and manifest realms will rely upon them.

The Master said: The heavens possess the qi of purple clouds, which intermingles with the sun, moon, five planets, and Northern Dipper. In every region and kingdom, there are those who align with the Dao and rulers who attain immortality.
When you perceive the sign of purple clouds, perform the rites as prescribed.
You need not wait for a fixed day—apply diligent mindfulness, and when the clouds descend, you will ascend to meet them.
Moreover, when purple clouds and yellow qi, luminous and drifting, linger over cliffs and valleys like a mat or canopy—whether crimson, white, yellow, azure, purple, or scarlet, or clouds of five colors with radiant halos and cinnabar auroras—these are the celestial lords and supreme deities traversing the mountains and valleys, where those who have attained the Dao reside.
You should hasten to such places to cultivate and refine yourself. If you gaze upward and behold a perfected one, prostrate yourself at once, burn incense, bow twice, and declare your heart’s vow. Persist in this practice, and you will soon behold the countenance of the imperial deity and swiftly ascend in flight.
Guard this knowledge within your heart; do not lightly reveal it to others.
If the Dao is divulged, its numinosity scatters, and immortality will never be attained.
Take as your model the Three Masters of Wen Shi, who served the Sage of the Golden Portals—let this be your standard. Strive to practice it.

It is said:
Within the true resides the divine—
The Great Lord of Longevity,
The Primordial Radiance Lord,
The White Prime Honored Spirit,
The Great One Who Oversees Destiny,
Peach and Health in harmonious extension.

The Master said: Within these two chapters lies the Dao of the Great Cavern, the forbidden scriptures of the upper Way. The *Central Scripture of the Nine Perfected* speaks solely of the Great Lord of Longevity, who transforms the myriad spirits.
When a person is born, the qi of the Supreme Subtlety descends to generate life, shaping form and shedding the womb.
From birth onward, thirty-six thousand spirits are complete, and one’s lifespan extends to thirty-six thousand days. When the spirits are exhausted and return to the Supreme Subtlety, one becomes a ghost.
The day of the ghost is the day of return.
Yet the transgressions of a lifetime deplete qi and scatter spirits, hastening one’s descent into the realm of death. Thus, some die young in swaddling, their spirits incomplete.
When spirits are incomplete, the body is not firm. Moreover, minor sins deduct a single count, and the Northern Dipper seizes the three-eyed spirit.
Great evil erases a year’s count, and thirty-six thousand spirits and qi are reclaimed.
A small good deed adds a single count, extending life by three days and replenishing spirits.
A great merit adds a year to one’s lifespan, extending it by three hundred sixty days and summoning spirits to descend.
Thus, the waxing and waning of life depend on these seven spirits—the yin spirits of the Northern Dipper, also called the Mysterious Cinnabar Great One, which are likewise among the forbidden scriptures of the upper Way.
If you master this Dao, you will replenish spirits and extend life, enduring for ten thousand kalpas.

The *Hymn of the Primordial Honored Lord of Longevity* says:
In the middle origin, the Dipper governs souls and spirits,
The Primordial Mysterious Great One, the seven yin spirits.
Wielding the numinous banner, they command the hundred spirits,
Bestowing and seizing, judging good and evil, shaping increase and decrease.
One count removes three days of life,
One year removes three hundred sixty.
Those who know how to move the seven numinous powers
Ascend into the Mysterious Heavens, opening the seven gates.
The three hun-souls dance and merge into one form,
The hundred spirits rejoice and return to the boundless.
How to attain this Dao? Where does it reside?
From the primordial valley, fire arises, and the seven spirits take flight.
They enter the body, opening the Mysterious Pass.
Bow twice, strike the breast, and traverse heaven and earth.
Return to the origin, expel evil and rebellion, erase the name of death,
Summon spirits, extend life’s count, and preserve life’s completion.
You may divide your form into billions,
Or reverse your bones to attain celestial immortality.
Silently, within and without, shun all things taboo—
When the ape and horse die, yin returns to yang.
This Dao is secret—do not recklessly transmit it.
Guard it for a billion kalpas, and you will endure forever.
Inscribe it in metal, swear an oath, and present it to the Three Heavens.
If lightly divulged, you will be eternally sealed at the river’s source.
Simply guard your heart, making it firm as stone,
And in a hundred days, your spirits will be complete, and the root of life activated.

**Summoning and Offering to the Spirits of the Body**

The Master said: The master of the body’s duality resides in spirit and qi.
When spirit and qi harmonize, one communicates with the true and reaches the numinous.
If spirit transforms and qi withers, how can prayers be answered?
Moreover, the *Five Numinous Talismans of the Body’s Spirits* and the *Secret Sequence* contain the method for summoning spirits—the foremost of the ten thousand Daoist arts, the precursor to all practices. You should put it into action.
The method: On the day of your birth (jiazi), your life’s origin, and on the second, sixteenth, and last days of the month—five times a month—enter the oratory. Prepare the foods and drinks you favor, along with pure wine and fruits, as offerings.
First, face east and sit upright. Collect the mind, regulate the breath, and concentrate the spirit. After a moment, offer incense three times and knock the teeth twenty-four times.

Recite:
The Perfected of the Cinnabar Heaven,
The Perfected of the Great One,
The Perfected of Peach and Health,
The Tamed Light of the Womb—
The Perfected One,
The Perfected of the Hidden Essence,
The Perfected of the Bright Spirit,
The Cloud of Heaven at the brows,
The Primordial Elder of the brain,
The Jade of the East at the crown,
The Maiden of the ears,
The Radiance of the eyes,
The Longevity of the hair,
The Penetrating Spirit of the nose,
The Cinnabar Vermilion of the mouth,
The Cinnabar Emperor of the tongue,
The Guardians of the teeth,
The Mighty Tiger of the throat,
The Spirit of the shoulders,
The Yin Soul of the hands,
The Joyous One of the heart,
The Watchful One of the liver...

The Lung Spirit, Zhuzhu,
The Navel Spirit, Jade Numen,
The Stomach Spirit, Zuzu,
The Spleen Spirit, Bibī,
The Kidney Spirit, Piaopiao,
The Gallbladder Spirit, Huohuo,
The Cinnabar Field Spirit, who stores essence,
The Large Intestine Spirit, Tuotuo,
The Small Intestine Spirit, Liangliang,
The Intestinal Spirit, Qiongying,
The Cavity Spirit, Yinyin,
The Knee Spirit, Ququ,
The Waist Spirit, Kongnan,
The Foot Spirit, Heavenly Ding Valiant.

Call their names three times, then recite:
You who emerge from within my body, each take your place before, behind, left, and right, returning to your proper positions. Today is an auspicious day for offering; you may freely partake in food and drink, feasting to your fill and contentment.

After the recitation, visualize the spirits—over a hundred—each resembling yourself, bowing and yielding. The practitioner then partakes of the food and drink, consuming as much as desired, with moderation as the principle.

Again recite:
Now that you are drunk and sated, rejoicing without end, come whenever summoned on auspicious days. On ordinary days, do not depart from me. Foretell all future fortunes and misfortunes before they befall. Know that as long as my body endures, so too shall you. When I am joyful, you share in my joy; when I grieve, you share in my sorrow. Should there be immortal medicines, bring them to me that I may consume them, granting us all eternal life, transformation through ten thousand kalpas, and fulfillment of our pact. Then return to your stations within my body, each to your domain.

Hasten, as the law commands!

The Master says: By sitting in awareness of what is yet to come, one may achieve liberation through the corpse, ascend to the origin, and attain transcendence. This is the foundation. After ten offerings, the practitioner shall receive instruction. After a hundred offerings, one may attain immortality, with golden elixirs, divine mushrooms, and all manner of sustenance made whole.

To reveal even a single word of this is to forfeit a decade of life. Should one fail to achieve efficacy, take heed and do not transmit it recklessly.

**Method for Unbinding Knots and Sealing Dead Gates**

The Master says: The true qi within the human body harmonizes with the qi of the myriad heavens. Born of the womb, one also receives perverse qi, which mingles with the upright without distinction. Thus, within the human body lie twelve knots and thirty-nine dead gates. First, unbind the twelve knots and seal the thirty-nine dead gates, so that one’s true qi may ascend and commune with heaven.

The method for unbinding knots involves reciting the *Scripture for Unbinding Knots*, invoking the qi of the Dao Father and Dao Mother. Begin by unbinding the knots of the lower cinnabar field, then the middle, and finally the upper. The method for sealing dead gates involves reciting the *Thirty-Nine Chapters of the Great Cavern Scripture*, invoking the upright qi of the thirty-six heavens. Starting from the lower cinnabar field, ascend through the middle to the upper, sequentially invoking the true qi of each heaven to merge with the thirty-nine upright qi of the heavens. Gathered into one body, this is called the Imperial Unity—none other than the true nature of the person, returning to the Yellow Court.
