I, [Name], with sincere devotion, take refuge in the Eastern Azure, Western White, Southern Vermilion, Northern Dark, the four directions and above and below, the Heavenly Worthies of the Ten Directions and the Numinous Treasure, the Thirty-Two Heavens’ Emperors, the Star Lords of the Twenty-Eight Constellations encircling heaven, the celestial perfected and upper saints, the True Lords of the Five Peaks, the mountains, rivers, seas, grotto-heavens, blessed lands, and all divine immortals and spirit officials.

First facing north, then bowing three times toward the north, kneel in reverence.

In my duly ordained ritual capacity, I, [Name], with wholehearted devotion, surrender body, spirit, and life to the Northern and Northeastern Boundless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy; the Eight Heavenly Lords of the North; the Perfected, Upper Saints, True Persons, and Immortals of the North; the Seven Star Lords of Dipper, Ox, Girl, Void, Danger, House, and Wall; the True Lord Black Emperor of Northern Peak Mount Heng; the grotto-heavens and blessed lands of the North; its mountains, rivers, and seas; all true numina; and the divine immortals and spirit officials of the Northern Realm.

I have heard that the Great Dao, in its boundless compassion, has revealed the path of repentance for past transgressions. The Perfected and Upper Saints, in their transformative wisdom, have specially opened the means to petition for absolution. Reflecting upon my own foolish and ignorant mortal form, I recognize that by virtue of karmic conditions accumulated in past lives, I have presumptuously encountered the flourishing of the Dao and been graced by the true wind, daring to stand among the ranks of the ordained. Unworthily, I have inherited the lineage of the Mysterious Origin. Yet I have failed to establish merit or benefit the world, and deeply fear that my conduct has strayed from the Way. Moreover, I dread that my myriad ancestors and countless forebears, those who have passed away in times past, as well as my own self across a thousand lives and myriad kalpas—spanning past existences and the present incarnation—have amassed transgressions as deep as the rivers and seas. These are bound within the celestial and terrestrial registers, recorded in the palaces of sun, moon, and stars, never to be pardoned, never to be released, forever subject to divine censure and obstructing the accumulation of good merit. Today, I humbly present this confession and earnestly beseech forgiveness. May the nine generations of my ancestors and the seven lineages of my forebears, along with this present self across ten thousand kalpas and a thousand lives—even unto this day—have all their towering sins dissolved like ice beneath the blazing sun. May the roots of evil be forever severed, and the foundations of goodness be nurtured and strengthened. May I swiftly fulfill my vows and aspirations, encountering the perfected ones. May my living kin and departed family—both ordained and lay—be granted joy in their spiritual rebirth, attaining union with the Dao and becoming true. May all sentient beings be blessed with fortune and together receive the great transformation.

I, your humble servant, am overwhelmed with trepidation and awe. Thus, I respectfully speak.

Next, repent toward the East, South, West, and Center, following the same form as above, altering only the names of the sacred ranks therein.

I, [Name], with wholehearted devotion, surrender body, spirit, and life to the Eastern and Southeastern Boundless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy; the Eight Heavenly Lords of the East; the Perfected, Upper Saints, True Persons, and Immortals of the East; the Seven Star Lords of Horn, Neck, Root, Chamber, Heart, Tail, and Winnowing Basket; the True Lord Bluegreen Emperor of Eastern Peak Mount Tai; the grotto-heavens and blessed lands of the East; its mountains, rivers, and seas; all true numina; and the divine immortals and spirit officials of the Eastern Realm.

To the Southern and Southwestern Boundless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy; the Eight Heavenly Lords of the South; the Perfected, Upper Saints, True Persons, and Immortals of the South; the Seven Star Lords of Well, Ghost, Willow, Star, Spread, Wings, and Axletree; the True Lord Red Emperor of Southern Peak Mount Heng; the grotto-heavens and blessed lands of the South; its mountains, rivers, and seas; all true numina; and the divine immortals and spirit officials of the Southern Realm.

To the Western and Northwestern Boundless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy; the Eight Heavenly Lords of the West; the Perfected, Upper Saints, True Persons, and Immortals of the West; the Seven Star Lords of Straddler, Harvester, Stomach, Hairy Head, Net, Turtle Beak, and Three Stars; the True Lord White Emperor of Western Peak Mount Hua; the grotto-heavens and blessed lands of the West; its mountains, rivers, and seas; all true numina; and the divine immortals and spirit officials of the Western Realm.

To the Upper and Lower Boundless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy; the Thirty-Six Heavenly Lords of the Three Luminaries, Nine Empyreans, Great Canopy, and Boundless Realms; the Five Elder Thearchs; the celestial bureaus and sovereigns; the innumerable Perfected; the true numina of the Ten Dark Realms of Fengdu; the Thirty-Six Earthly Sovereigns; the True Lord Yellow Emperor of Central Peak Mount Song; the grotto-heavens and blessed lands of the Center; its mountains, rivers, and seas; all divine immortals and spirit officials; and the divine immortals and spirit officials of the Upper and Lower Realms.

Three prostrations to the Boundless Supreme Great Dao.

The Thirty-Six Venerable Scriptures. The ancestral masters of Dao attainment, past and present.

Again, your servant [Name] respectfully reaffirms his sincerity, humbly invoking the Boundless Supreme Dao, the August Perfected of the Highest Realms, the majestic numina of the Three Realms, and the host of sages of the Ten Directions. On this day of entering the oratory to present offerings to the True, to confess transgressions and seek forgiveness, I humbly receive the great grace of boundless mercy. May my offenses be erased from the records of the Nether Courts, my name elevated in the registers of immortality, my studies free from demonic trials, and my merits perfected in completion.

How dare I not deeply reflect upon past errors, redouble my resolve, and vow to propagate the Great Teaching? May all beings be universally delivered, the Ten Directions benefited, and the blessings extended to the nine generations of ancestors.

Your servant’s heart is overwhelmed with awe and reverence. Thus, I respectfully speak.

Next, exit the chamber as usual.

This is the residual meaning of the *Natural Audience of the Numinous Treasure*. If one wishes to perform this monthly, the later form should be used, wherein only a general confession is made.

**Daily Natural Audience Rite**
First, enter the chamber, compose the spirit, and quiet the thoughts until inner and outer are luminously clear. Then engage in visualization and, having conveyed the intent to the sages, recite the prayer:

Your servant has heard that when the primordial qi first unfolded its radiance, it grasped the transformative mechanism in the boundless; when the Three Heavens inaugurated their course, they unfurled the mysterious pattern in the vast chaos. The five thousand four hundred sections of scripture were spread below to the dusty world; the thirty-six heavens’ Brahman qi governs above as the great principle. Impartial in bestowing fortune and misfortune, it determines the waxing and waning of all things by fixed reckoning. Transmitting the dharma records, it opens the path of deliverance for humans and devas. The Dao emerged at Crane Cry Mountain, where the Orthodox Unity expounded the essence of cultivating truth. Its merit was proclaimed in the Dragon Han era, when the Primal Origin established the gate of world-transcendence. The Great Dao is beyond naming, yet pure sincerity may reach it.

On this auspicious day of confessing transgressions and presenting offerings to the True, may the Golden Lads proclaim the mandate, the Jade Maidens attend to the incense, and the supplication ascend to the court of wondrous being, directly entering the realm of emptiness and nonbeing. May the seven chariots and eight reins float upon the vast qi through the void; may the Three Realms and Ten Directions be illuminated by numinous radiance, dispelling all defilements.

Your servant, a humble scholar at the threshold of the mysterious pass, newly enrolled in the register of the red tally, has yet to penetrate the subtleties of the profound. Having transgressed the precepts and statutes, I now reverently follow the canonical rites and specially present this confession.

May the August Ones of the Golden Towers and the Sacred Ones of the Jade Capital universally bestow their sagely blessings to wash away my deep transgressions. Grant me renewal, permit me to advance, secretly send down the qi of the Supreme Mystery, and conjoin it to form this body of Numinous Treasure. May I realize the true and constant, eternally dwell in the tranquil shade, and extend my merit to the hidden and manifest. May kindness reach both foes and kin.

May my progress in the Dao be free from demonic hindrances, and may I attain long life and enduring vision.

Your servant’s heart is overwhelmed with awe and reverence. Thus, I respectfully speak.

Kneeling in prolonged repentance.

Your devoted servant, with wholehearted sincerity, surrenders body, spirit, and life to the Three Pure Ones, sovereigns of transformation; to the Heavenly Worthies of the Numinous Treasure in the ten directions; and to the host of sages within the *Scripture of Limitless Salvation*.

I reflect again upon my offenses: from kalpas past to this present life, through the three karmic actions and six senses, the five passions and seven desires—my transgressions inscribed in the Black Register, recorded by the statutes of the Mystery. Today, before the radiant and exalted, I humbly offer this confession and repentance. May grace flow to these decayed bones, may the True Bureau bestow life, may my name be erased from the ledger of evil, and may the characters of meritorious deeds be inscribed. May the knots of the primordial womb be untied, the mind’s realm remain unstained, wisdom and insight attain perfection, and demonic obstructions dissolve. Thus may I, though unworthy, slightly aid the transformations of the Mystery, and above, praise the true wind. After attaining the Dao, may I ascend into the formless.

I make ten great vows:

To the Three Pure August Emperors, the Three Primordial Ladies of the Plain, the Most High and Lofty Spirits, and the Great Gods of the Immortal Capital:

On this auspicious day, I declare my aspirations:

First, to soar through the heavens as an immortal of long life;
Second, to harmonize heaven and earth with the radiant winds and clouds;
Third, that the Five Peaks may endure with this body forever;
Fourth, that the seven generations of ancestors be freed from karmic entanglements;
Fifth, that the August Lord sever the bonds of the primordial womb;
Sixth, that in life after life, wisdom and insight unfold;
Seventh, to extinguish malevolent ghosts and harm, cutting down the Six Heavens;
Eighth, to open and penetrate the hidden and reach the numinous;
Ninth, that at this assembly, all may be as spoken;
Tenth, to ascend as a flying immortal and attend the Three Primes.

Bowing again, I dedicate these merits.

I prostrate to the Lord of the Numinous Treasure, the Empty and Mysterious;
To the True Daoist Master of Limitless Salvation;
Whose qi embraces heaven and earth, yet bears no name of virtue;
Whose dharma pervades yin and yang, yet transcends thought and knowledge.
Responding to conditions, transforming to save the multitudes,
Surpassing the Three Realms and the ten directions.

O towering, peerless mountain of merit and virtue,
My heart turns to you, thought after thought, without cease.

Though I, unworthy and foolish, bear this great dharma,
I hope above to dispel the calamities and kalpic destinies of heaven,
And below, to deliver the multitudes of this floating world.
To turn death into life and restore the body,
To heal illness, dispel misfortune, and uphold the upright.
When merit is complete and conduct perfected,
May the Golden Liquid Elixir swiftly form.
When the heart is enlightened and the spirit numinous,
May the Jade Emperor’s decree be swiftly received.

Your servant’s heart is overwhelmed with fervent devotion.
Thus, I respectfully speak.

Then, departing the chamber as usual.

**Ritual for Worshipping and Invoking the Northern Apex**

It is heard that before the Great Ultimate divided, it embraced the Three Powers and encompassed the primordial qi. Once the Two Modes were distinguished, they harmonized the Seven Governors and balanced the Four Seasons. The Dipper’s pivot turns at the center of heaven, while constellations spread beyond the celestial forms, each assigned to unfold transformation, establishing the pole and upholding heaven. The Eight Kings serve as the origin of the ten thousand beings; the Seven Sages act as the ancestors of all living things. They govern the qi of the seventy-two seasonal nodes and direct the offices of the twenty-eight lunar lodges, revolving the Dipper’s enclosure and circling the earth’s axis. As a chariot, they regulate the cosmic order; as the Northern Apex, they govern the cosmos. Their tongue and throat administer decrees; their pivot and mechanism hold sway. Wherever the pointer stars indicate, the Four Seas know the seasons. When the qi of the Big Dipper shines, the Eight Directions all receive blessings. The Three Terraces align in radiance; the Nine Qi share the same light. They grasp the celestial armillary and balance, determining fortune and misfortune among humankind. Emperor Ming of Han beheld their sagely image; Heavenly Master Zhang received the true scriptures. They established the Mysterious Teachings in the dusty world, liberating beings from the snares of mundane existence. How much more do all things, moving and still, depend on them for life and growth!

Today, your servant reverently performs the Great Rite, vowing to deliver the living and the dead. Without drawing upon the revolutions of the Two Dippers and the transformative workings of Kan and Li, the Great Dao cannot be achieved, nor the Mysterious Barrier entered. Thus, on this auspicious occasion of the descending stars, I offer this earnest prayer. May the Seven Stars deign to look upon me, their cloud chariots briefly descending from the celestial sphere. May the Two Emperors graciously descend, their majestic presence alighting upon the altar’s tranquility. Inscribe my name in the register of the living; strike it from the ledger of the dead. May the true qi of the Seven Primes ever fill me; may the spirit-lords of the five viscera each be preserved. May I swiftly awaken to the principle of true constancy and receive the compassion of the supreme Dao.

Your servant’s heart is overwhelmed with fervent devotion. Thus, I respectfully speak.

**Talisman for Summoning Xuanwu**
The pure practices of all heavens encircle the ten directions. The boundless great spirits all issue from my body. Wherever this saving talisman arrives, it merges with the Mysterious Darkness. Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances.

**Talisman for Summoning the Northern Dipper**
Let the jade armillary and balance halt their turning. Holding the talisman and grasping the register, all assemble before the Emperor. A thousand harmonies, ten thousand unions—naturally they attain reality. Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the Great Statutes and Ordinances of the Numinous Treasure.

*Here ends Scroll Nine of the Great Rites of the Numinous Treasure of Supreme Purity*
*Scroll Ten of the Great Rites of the Numinous Treasure of Supreme Purity*

**The Three Realms’ Governance: The Sovereign of the Mysterious Heavens**
*Transmitted by Dongwei Gaoshi, Illuminating and Salvific Perfected One Ning Quanzhen, to Wang Qizhen, Lineal Master of the Lingbao Tradition and Disciple of the Three Caverns of Supreme Purity*

The Mysterious Master declared:
The lofty perfected and exalted sages collectively record the mysteries of the boundless heavens. In their wondrous existence and wondrous non-existence, they remain unfathomable. Only with the emergence of scriptures is their mechanism gradually revealed. The orthodox regulations of the Three Caverns are profound in principle.

After the Great Tang, scriptures and decrees scattered and were lost. Later generations patched and supplemented them, mingling the authentic with the spurious. Only those of discernment can distinguish the subtle and profound, barely grasping even a ten-thousandth part.

The Celestial Venerable of Primordial Beginning is the most revered of the Nine Sages, the source of all transformations. The mysterious qi of the Dao arises from spontaneity and non-being, beyond all comparison or conjecture. Dispersed, it becomes qi; gathered, it takes form. Within it dwells spirit, forcibly named the Celestial Venerable—hence the title *Celestial King of Primordial Beginning*. This is the exalted Dao of Supreme Purity, the Supreme August One of the Jade Registers, who dwells in the Sagely Realm of Jade Purity and governs the Jade Capital of the Mysterious Metropolis.

The Celestial Venerable of Numinous Treasure is the progenitor of the Nine Perfected, the lofty sage of Supreme Purity, the primordial qi of the Dao. In terms of teachings, the Primordial Beginning corresponds to the Cavern of Perfection; from here, it diverges into the Cavern of Mystery. The *Dao of Salvation for Humankind in the Highest Grade of Numinous Treasure*, received by the Jade Dawn, is the disciple of the Primordial Beginning, the patriarch of Supreme Purity, and the Supreme August One of Grand Purity. This is the *Celestial Venerable of the Mysterious August Jade Dawn*, who dwells in the True Realm of Supreme Purity and governs the Jeweled Palace of Liao Yang in the Golden Gates.

The Celestial Venerable of Dao and Virtue is the master of the Nine Immortals’ teachings, the primordial qi of the Dao’s inception. In terms of teachings, from the Primordial Beginning to this point is the Cavern of Divinity, known as the *Celestial King of Grand Purity, the Mysterious August Dao Lord of the Golden Gates, the Posterior Sage*. He receives the decrees of the Primordial August and the Void August, proclaims the texts of the Three Caverns and Four Supplements, responds to circumstances in all directions, expounds the teachings, and transmits the scriptures. Revered through the ages, he is venerated by all under heaven. Since the era of the Three Sovereigns, he has proclaimed the scriptures of Numinous Treasure, delivering countless beings across the ages. Celestial and human ranks honor him, and the Dual August Ones confer upon him the title *Supreme Venerable Lord Lao*, who dwells in the Immortal Realm of Grand Purity.

The August Emperor of the Vast Heavens is the emperor of all heavens, the king of immortals and perfected beings, the lord of sagely venerables. He holds authority over the ascent and descent of the myriad heavens and the mechanism of all beings’ generation and completion. The Three Caverns and Four Supplements are the standards of the scriptures of prohibitions. The Great Brahma is supremely wondrous, the divine might of non-action. He is the August Emperor of the Three Realms, the myriad deities, and the immortals and perfected beings of the Three Caverns. From the celestial progeny of the Three Qi and the imperial lineage of the Three Treasures, he transcends beyond heaven and earth, generating the myriad things yet not governing them.

When the Three Powers first took form, qi clarified and ascended, accumulating yang to become heaven. As the source of the myriad phenomena, how could it lack a ruler? Thus, in terms of form and image, it is called *Heaven*; in terms of governance, it is called *Emperor*. Hence, he is titled *August Emperor of the Jade Perfection, the Mysterious Heavens, the Most Sagely Jade Sovereign*. The scriptures state: *The realm of the Jade Perfection, the colorless heaven, is the practice of Brahma*. Born through transformation from the mysterious qi, he dwells below the Great Net and above Supreme Purity, governing the four kinds of Brahma heavens and presiding over the Three Realms. This is the Heavenly Lord, a title reluctantly bestowed out of necessity. He governs the Jade Purity Palace of the Grand Tenuity.

Such phrases as *the Celestial Venerable of the Unsurpassed Heaven of Maitreya* are expressions of reverence in the Daoist tradition. The titles *Supreme One Who Opens Heaven and Grasps the Talisman to Govern the Calendar* and the like are honorifics bestowed by the emperors of the Great Song.

The Celestial Venerable of Salvation through the Great One arises from the Primordial Qi of the First Azure, a manifestation of the Primordial Beginning. He is the teacher of the Nine Sages, Nine Perfected, and Nine Immortals, governing the primordial qi of universal salvation. He is titled *Celestial Venerable of Salvation through the Great One, the August Emperor of the Azure Mystery, the Primordial August Sovereign of the World of Everlasting Joy in the Eastern Ultimate’s Azure Palace*. He administers the ten directions and responds to transformations across kalpas. The Celestial Venerable is not a perfected one of cultivated attainment but a royal descendant of the Celestial Venerable of Primordial Beginning, a divine manifestation of the mysterious qi. He governs the Left Bureau of the Azure Mystery.

The Great Emperor of the Northern Culmen is the imperial throne within the Purple Tenuity Enclosure. According to the *Treatise on Astronomy*, the Southern Culmen sinks thirty-six degrees into the earth, while the Northern Culmen rises thirty-six degrees above it. The heavens tilt, half emerging above the earth and half encircling it. The myriad stars and qi all revolve leftward, with the Southern and Northern Culmina as their pivot, the only fixed points—thus enabling the heavens’ rotation. Though people perceive it in the north, it truly resides at the center of the heavens, serving as the ancestral lord of the myriad stars and the secondary lord of the Three Realms, subordinate only to the August Emperor of the Vast Heavens. It corresponds to the primordial qi and is titled *Great Emperor of the Northern Culmen and Purple Tenuity*, governing the Purple Tenuity Palace at the Center of Heaven. Some claim the Great Emperor of Purple Tenuity is the great deity of all heavens, the emperor of the myriad deities and spirits of the Three Realms, deceiving the mortal world and profaning the supreme mystery—such errors must be vigorously corrected.

The Great Emperor of the Celestial Sovereign is the star to the left of the Northern Culmen’s imperial throne, its form linked and slightly curved like a hook, named *Curved Array*. Below it lies a great star, positioned at its center—this is the Great Emperor of the Celestial Sovereign. He governs the myriad stars and is the emperor of all celestial bodies and constellations, equal in rank to the Northern Culmen. While the Northern Culmen serves as the pivot, the Celestial Sovereign revolves with the heavens, corresponding to the qi of primordial beginning. Below the Three Qi and above the myriad heavens, within the Three Realms, none fail to revere these Three Emperors. He governs the Jeweled Palace of the Curved Array. Some speak of the *Great Emperor of the Celestial Sovereign in the Upper Palace of Purple Tenuity*—this is even more deceptive. The present Celestial Sovereign is the one below the Curved Array within the Purple Tenuity Enclosure. Thus, it may be called the Purple Tenuity Enclosure or the Palace of the Curved Array. The *Upper Palace of Purple Tenuity* refers to the Mysterious Capital’s Jade Capital Mountain, not the Purple Tenuity Enclosure. A single character’s difference carries grave consequences.

During the Great Tang, the Venerable Lord Lao was honored as the *August Emperor of the Celestial Sovereign and Sagely Ancestor*—a temporary ritual of ancestral veneration by the Tang house, unrelated to the Celestial Sovereign of the Purple Tenuity Enclosure.

Do not recklessly invoke names and titles without examining past and present—this is a matter for careful discernment.

The *August Celestial Venerable, Great Emperor of Life-Preservation and Sagely Ancestor*, according to ancient texts, was originally the *True Lord of the Nine Heavens’ Life-Command*. On the twenty-fifth day of the tenth month in the first year of *Great Central Auspiciousness* under the reign of Emperor Zhenzong of the Great Song, he descended into the *Hall of Extended Grace*. Six perfected beings stood in attendance to his left and right, declaring themselves the primal ancestors of the Zhao lineage.

At the time, Wang Qinruo served as chief minister. He promptly issued an imperial edict conferring the exalted title: *High Dao, Supreme Numinous One of the Nine Heavens’ Life-Command, August Celestial Venerable, Great Emperor of Life-Preservation and Sagely Ancestor*. The consort of the Life-Command was also honored as the *Sagely Ancestral Mother*, receiving the exalted title *Great Sage Empress of the Primordial Heaven*.

From then on, he was ranked among the celestial emperors, occupying the highest of the nine positions. The realm had no choice but to comply with the imperial decree.

Some claim the *Yellow Dragon’s Unified Qi, Life-Commanding and Life-Preserving Celestial Venerable* is the sovereign of immortals and transcendent beings, the august one of emperors, kings, and feudal lords. What proof supports this? Before the *True Temple* era, before the Sagely Ancestor’s descent, who then was the august one of emperors, kings, and feudal lords?

The gentleman, in matters he does not understand, how can he speak with certainty, leading later scholars astray and leaving endless ridicule?

The Master said: Who does not know that the Three Clarities and Three Realms’ Celestial Venerables are the Primordial, Mysterious, and Originative Three Qi? Yet when qi gathers, it takes form; when it scatters, it returns to qi—this is the source of the myriad transformations, the ancestor of the Three Powers, the root of Heaven and Earth. It cannot be named, nor can it be discussed.

When the Crimson Clarity inaugurated the kalpa and the Great Dao radiated its light, whether through fire refining the firmament or the August Person wielding the brush, true scriptures descended to the world, and the Three Caverns were proclaimed. Thus arose the divisions of *Dongzhen* (Cavern of Perfection), *Dongxuan* (Cavern of Mystery), and *Dongshen* (Cavern of Divinity), and the designations of *Heavenly Treasure*, *Numinous Treasure*, and *Divine Treasure*. After the Middle Antiquity, rituals and laws were established, each of the Three Caverns possessing its own scriptural catalog—hence the term *Three Vehicles and Nine Grades*.

The Dao’s obscurity lies in its ineffability; thus, teachings were founded to reveal its function. Some, however, recount it thus: *Yuanshi* (Primordial Beginning) is the ancestor within the Dao, the patriarch of the *Lingbao* (Numinous Treasure) tradition; *Daojun* (Dao Lord) is the ancestor within the Dharma, the master of the lineage; *Laojun* (Lord Lao) is the ancestor within the teachings, the true master. The *Savior from Suffering Celestial Venerable* and the Ten Celestial Venerables are termed *Mystic Masters*. Alas! The Three Caverns and Four Supplements are the source of Dharma records; the Nine Grades and Three Vehicles interpenetrate. To claim that the Three Clarities each govern one division—this obstructs principle. If so, would not the propagation of teachings to deliver beings be erroneous?

The *Ten Directions’ Numinous Treasure Celestial Venerable* presides over the salvation of the living and the dead from the sufferings of the Three Realms, governing the Ten Heavens. The *August Lord of Eastern Florescence* is the one who bestows scriptures upon male and female perfected immortals, the master who instructs the *Life-Commanding* sovereign, ruling the *Palace of Square Cauldrons* in the Eastern Florescence. The *August Mother of Supreme Mystery of the Western Origin* is the sovereign who registers male immortals, female immortals, and perfected persons, ruling the *Tortoise Terrace of Western Numinosity*. The *Scriptural Masters of the Numinous Treasure* may receive exalted scriptures to oversee prohibitions, manifesting texts in response to kalpas to deliver beings—such is *Yu Luoqiao Perfected*. The *Register Masters of the Numinous Treasure* may govern the statutes of divine writ, presiding over the recording of merits to elevate ranks, bestowing talismans and immortality to deliver beings—such is *Zhen Dingguang Perfected*. The *Deliverance Masters of the Numinous Treasure* may follow primordial statutes to expound teachings, proclaiming the mysterious norms to accord with the true, responding to conditions and transforming accordingly—such is *Guang Miaoyin Perfected*. The latter three perfected beings jointly administer the three offices, collectively overseeing the thirty-six divisions of exalted scriptures, talismans, and charts, compiling the *Central Alliance’s Treasure Declarations*, which flow into the mortal realm to ferry celestial and human beings. These were entrusted to *Xu Laile*, the *Perfected of the Great Ultimate*, who transmitted them to *Ge Xuan*, the *Immortal Elder of the Great Ultimate*. Later generations, unaware of the truth, have seen genuine transmission continue unbroken.

Those like *Bao Nanhai* and *Feng Qingniu*, though they received talismans and charts, were not within the purview of the Three Masters. In the Jin dynasty, *Yang Yuan* and *Lord Xu* obtained the *Golden Writ of the Numinous Treasure*, which was bestowed upon them by the *Upper Perfected Wei Yuanjun*. Moreover, *Xu Miaoji Perfected Lord* received teachings from *Chenmu* and *Filial Dao Mingwang*—all within the purview of the *Mystic Masters*. Later scholars, inheriting teachings from their masters, each recognize their lineage and know their masters.

The *Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm* arose after *Yuanshi* established the teachings. By the first year of the *Upper Sovereign* kalpa, the five kalpas unfolded simultaneously, the Five Phases attained completion, and the Five Qi were fully endowed. From this, the various perfected beings and immortals were transformed, responding within the five kalpas to generate the essence of the Mystic Realm, and the mystic within the essence—all were the *Upper Sovereign*, hence the kalpa was named *Upper Sovereign*. Within the five kalpas, the *Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm* was transformed, receiving the quintessence of the Five Qi. Together with the *Heavenly Perfected August Person*, they assembled clouds into chapters, and from the dragon’s embryo and stone’s radiance emerged myriad talismanic writings. The three divisions and ten sections were all established as canonical texts, and only then did the *Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm* found the teachings.

*Yuanshi* transformed and gave birth to the heavens in the *Ancestral Kalpa*. The *Ancestral Kalpa* comprises the *Dragon Han*, *Yan Kang*, *Crimson Clarity*, *Inaugural Sovereign*, and *Upper Sovereign* kalpas. The *Great Veil Heaven* is the abode of the formless, encompassing Heaven and Earth, boundless and inexhaustible. The scriptures say: "Above, there is no further ancestor; only the Dao is its body." Within the five kalpas, Heaven and Earth were transformed. From the *Great Veil’s* single qi, the Three Heavens were born—these are the realms of the Three Clarities. From the Three Heavens’ qi descended to generate the Nine Heavens:

First, the *Boundless Heaven of No Shadow and Utmost Singularity*;
Second, the *Heaven of Supreme Goodness and Boundless Longevity*;
Third, the *Heaven of Cavernous Emptiness and Utmost Extension*;
Fourth, the *Heaven of Jade Void and Primordial Cavernous Stillness*;
Fifth, the *Heaven of Cavernous Extremity and Boundless Unarrogant Joy*;
Sixth, the *Heaven of Utmost Primordial Radiance and Cavernous Subtlety, Responsive to Sound*;
Seventh, the *Heaven of Supreme Namelessness and Mystic Treasure*;
Eighth, the *Heaven of the Great Ultimate and Boundless Cavernous Seclusion*;
Ninth, the *Heaven of Primordial Cavern and Harmonious Response*.

Each of the nine heavens further generates three heavens, totaling thirty-six heavens—these are what the scriptures call the heavens of *Upper Clarity*. The lofty and formless are all termed *Upper Clarity*, not merely designating a single realm.

Next, the *Seed People* were divided into the Three Realms and the Thirty-Two Heavens, governing the four directions, situated below the Nine Heavens and above the Three Luminaries. Palaces and chambers are apportioned with graded hierarchies, descending to connect with the constellations, their primordial qi interlinked, giving birth to and transforming the myriad things, refining and completing the ten thousand categories.

Beyond these lie the *Eight Poles and Eight Heavens*, and the *Outer Demon Heaven*, situated below the Thirty-Two Heavens and beyond the Three Luminaries. The *Eight Poles and Eight Directions*, from the *Heaven of Pure Tenuity* to the *Outer Brahma Heaven*, total eighty. Their palaces and towers are formed from natural qi. Thus, the *Vacuous Sovereign* appointed each with an *Imperial Lord*, assisted by *Heavenly Ministers*, and provided them with officials and subordinates, dividing among them the people and creatures. Together with the *Great Veil’s* single qi, they constitute the Eighty-One Heavens.

As the Dao’s qi descended, the Nine Earths were generated:

First, the *Earth of Colored Moisture*, named *Primordial Virtue*, its qi above blue and within yellow—governed by the *Minister of Primordial Earth*.
Second, the *Earth of Rigid Color and Moisture*, named *August Virtue*, its qi pervading—governed by the *Assistant Minister of Primordial Court*.

Third, the *Earth of Stone-Fat Color and Moisture*, named *Imperial Virtue*, its qi pervading with dark green—governed by the *Dragon-Mouth Earth Dragon*.
Fourth, the *Earth of Moisture*, named *Kingly Virtue*, its qi pervading with yellow—governed by the *Primordial Heart Earth Grand General*.
Fifth, the *Earth of Golden Millet Moisture*, named *Human Virtue*, its qi pervading with red—governed by the *Primordial Blessing Earth Magistrate*.
Sixth, the *Earth of Metal-Rigid Iron Moisture*, named *Water Virtue*, its qi pervading with white—governed by the *Primordial Bone Earth Elder*.
Seventh, the *Earth of Water-Restrained Moisture*, named *Village Virtue*, its qi pervading with purple—governed by the *First Earth Parents*.
Eighth, the *Earth of Great Wind Moisture*, named *Returning Virtue*, its qi pervading with blue-green—governed by the *Progenitor Earth Ancestral Minister*.
Ninth, the *Earth of Abyssal Depth and Colorless Network*, named *Flourishing Virtue*, its qi pervading with boundless hue—governed by the *Xuan-Progenitor Earth Subordinate of the Two Thousand Stone*.

These are called the *Nine Ramparts*, each rampart containing one layer of earth, water, and wind, stacked in sequence. Thus, the *Vacuous Sovereign* further appointed the *Four Earth Sovereign Lords* to jointly oversee the palaces, their assistance and descent equal, modeled after the heavens above. In all, thirty-six *Earth Sovereign Lords*, corresponding to the thirty-six emperors of the nine-tiered heavens.

Beneath the Nine Ramparts lies the vast and boundless *Obdurate Void*, enclosed by *Wind Moisture*. This *Wind Moisture* is the qi of the *Primordial Brahma Wind*. Harder than true metal, it is also called *Rigid Wind*. It upholds the Nine Ramparts, bearing all heavens aloft, floating high and hollow, suspended without fall, connecting above to the *Great Veil*—for it is the qi of the Dao. Thus, the scripture states: *"Wind Moisture pervades the void, the Metal-Rigid bears the heavens."*

As the *Three Caverns* intermingle and transform, the *Nine Qi* blend and arise, floating upon the *Grand Primal*, emptying into the *Four Voids*. In their vastness of form and image, only the Dao can encompass them.

The Five Kalpas are named:
*Primordial Progenitor Kalpa*
*Vast and Boundless Kalpa*

The Five Kalpas are further named:
*Dragon Han*
*Yan Kang*
*Yi Ming*
*Kai Huang*
*Shang Huang*

From these arise the manifold heavens, within the primordial chaos:
The *Great Veil’s* Two Realms,
The Nine Tiers and Thirty-Six Heavens,
The Jade Purity Realm’s Twelve Heavens,
The Highest Purity Realm’s Twelve Heavens,
The Supreme Purity Realm’s Twelve Heavens.

The *Seed People* dwell within the Three Realms and Thirty-Two Heavens.
The Thirty-Two Heavens correspond to the qi of the constellations.
To the right lie the twenty-eight heavens of the four directions,
each heaven aligned with the qi of one constellation.
The four heavens of the four cardinal interstices each correspond to one constellation,
while the qi of the *Brahma Heavens* descends and intermingles in equal measure.
The heaven of the northeast overlaps the constellation of the northwest,
for the birth of the supreme turns and ascends like the spiral of a ram’s horn.
Though the flow of principle’s current shares the same purport,
confusion arises from the cardinal and intercardinal directions—
thus this diagram is made to clarify.

The *Three Luminaries*:
The thirty-five divisions gather the primordial qi in the *Upper Mystery*.
The Seven Lords of the Northern Dipper,
together with the twenty-eight constellations of the four directions,
form thirty-five divisions,
collecting the primordial qi in the highest heaven to govern creation.

The Northern Dipper is the *Central Dipper*.
The *Treatise on the Celestial Offices* in the *Records of the Grand Historian* states:
“The Dipper is the Emperor’s chariot,
revolving through the center of heaven,
overseeing the four quarters,
dividing yin and yang,
establishing the four seasons,
harmonizing the Five Phases,
shifting the nodes and degrees,
and settling all affairs.”
Beyond the Eight Extremes lies the *Brahma Heaven*.

Within the realm lie immortal domains—
the Five Sacred Peaks, Three Isles, and Ten Continents of *Shenzhou*—
all beneath the *Three Luminaries*,
above the great earth,
amidst the vast seas.

The peaks are called *zhen* ("pillars"), for the earth’s profound virtue bears all things without shifting.
The Five Sacred Peaks, Three Isles, and Ten Continents are the abodes of immortals and sages.
*Shenzhou* is the Middle Kingdom, where the sovereign resides,
the greatest of all lands within the realm.
Its people cultivate the true Dao and ascend to become *xianzhen* (immortal perfected).
Above lie the Ten Great Grotto-Heavens, Thirty-Six Lesser Grotto-Heavens, and Seventy-Two Blessed Lands,
all governed by immortal officials.

Within the Grotto-Heavens stand Five Mountains, also called the Five Sacred Peaks,
serving as the pillars of the Middle Kingdom—lesser lands are not enumerated among them.

The *Nine Ramparts of the Grotto Abyss*:
The *Eight Mighty Beasts*—
dragon, *lin*, tiger, leopard, lion, cinnabar serpent, celestial steed, and fierce beasts.

The *Eight Sceneries*—
sun, moon, Jupiter, Mars, Venus, Mercury, Saturn, and the Five Dippers of the stars.

The *Eight Obscurities*—
eastern extremity, southeastern extremity, southern extremity, southwestern extremity,
western extremity, northwestern extremity, northern extremity, northeastern extremity.

The *Eight Gates*—
Eastern Gate of the Dharma Wheel of Heaven,
Southeastern Gate of the Dharma Wheel of Heaven,
Southern Gate of the Dharma Wheel of Heaven,
Southwestern Gate of the Dharma Wheel of Heaven,
Western Gate of the Dharma Wheel of Heaven,
Northwestern Gate of the Dharma Wheel of Heaven,
Northern Gate of the Dharma Wheel of Heaven,
Northeastern Gate of the Dharma Wheel of Heaven.

The *Thirty-Two Heavens* in Summary:
The Master states:
From *Taihuang Huangzeng Heaven* to *Shangming Qiyao Moye Heaven*—
these six heavens comprise the *Realm of Desire*.
From *Xuwu Yueheng Heaven* to *Wuji Tanshi Heaven*—
these eighteen heavens comprise the *Realm of Form*.
From *Haoting Xiaodu Heaven* to *Taisu Xiule Jin Shang Heaven*—
these four heavens comprise the *Formless Realm*, collectively known as the *Three Realms*.
From *Taixu Wushang Changrong Heaven* to *Taiji Pingyu Jiayi Heaven*—
these four heavens are the heavens of the *Seed People*.

This scripture is now examined and divided into twelve matters:
1. Heavenly names and kalpas—names established at the primordial division.
2. Imperial titles—titles bestowed by the *Yuanshi* (Primordial Beginning).
3. Imperial taboos—the names of the Heavenly Emperors.
4. The Heavenly Emperor’s governance—the office overseeing the Dao.
5. The palace of residence.
6. The domain of rule.
7. The *qi* of the constellations—descending through the twenty-eight lodges.
8. The name of the *qi*—the designation of the primordial *qi* received.
9. The color of the *qi*—the hues of the nine *qi* dividing the directions.
10. The *Great Brahma Hidden Speech*—the inner sound, compiled by the *Dao Lord*.
11. The boundaries—ascension and descent between upper and lower realms.
12. The number of heavenly citizens—their lifespans.

This diagram is the essence of the most precious scriptures;
those who recite and uphold it should study it in detail and practice accordingly.

**The Six Heavens of the Realm of Desire:**
*Taihuang Huangzeng Heaven*:
Emperor titled *Yuyi Yuming*, taboo name *Guanjue*,
oversees the register of longevity,
resides in the *Purple Tenuity Palace*,
rules the northwest, west of *Hai*,
aligned with the *qi* of *Kui* and *Bi* constellations,
*qi* named *Yuanyang*, yellow in color,
*Danlou Ahui*, *Wuhe Guanyin*,
bounding the Realm of Desire.
The lifespan of its heavenly citizens: nine million years.

*Taiming Yuwan Heaven*:
Emperor titled *Xu’anatian*, taboo name *Lanjue*,
oversees the deliverance of souls for rebirth,
resides in the *Purple Chamber Palace*,
rules the north, east of *Hai*,
aligned with the *qi* of *Bi* constellation,
*qi* named *Shangyang*, green in color,
*Xuyan Mingshou*, *Falan Putan*,
bounding the Realm of Desire.
The lifespan of its heavenly citizens: eighteen million years.

*Qingming Hetong Heaven*:
Emperor titled *Yuanyu Qijing*, taboo name *Dajue*,
oversees the dissemination of governance and deliverance of people,
resides in the *Nine Mornings Palace*,
rules the north, west of *Ren*,
aligned with the *qi* of *Shi* constellation,
*qi* named *Taiyang*, blue-green in color,
*Jiana Ayi*, *Huhu Liuyin*,
bounding the Realm of Desire.
The lifespan of its heavenly citizens: thirty-six million years.

*Xuantai Pingyu Heaven*:
Emperor titled *Liudun Neixian*, taboo name *Yuyuan*,
oversees the summoning of demons and elevation of immortals,
resides in the *Nine Sceneries Palace*,
rules the north, east of *Ren*,
aligned with the *qi* of *Wei* constellation,
*qi* named *Qingyang*, red in color,
*Huadu Quli*, *Xianpu Yuzhen*,
bounding the Realm of Desire.
The lifespan of its heavenly citizens: seventy-two million years.

*Yuanming Wenju Heaven*:
Emperor titled *Chou Falun*, taboo name *Fanyun*,
oversees the circulation of primordial *qi*,
resides in the *Vast Cold Palace*,
rules the north, west of *Gui*,
aligned with the *qi* of *Xu* constellation,
*qi* named *Dongyang*, dark green in color,
*Daluo Dafan*, *Sanyan Qingyun*,
bounding the Realm of Desire.
The lifespan of its heavenly citizens: one hundred forty-four million years.

*Shangming Qiyao Moye Heaven*:
Emperor titled *Tianhuai Yan*, taboo name *Yuzhen*,
oversees the revelation of mysteries and deliverance from tribulation,
resides in the *Great Yin Palace*,
rules the north, east of *Gui*,
aligned with the *qi* of *Nü* constellation,
*qi* named *Tongyang*, black in color,
*Feisa Yudu*, *Mingmo Shangmen*,
bounding the Realm of Desire.
The lifespan of its heavenly citizens: two hundred eighty-eight million years.

**The Eighteen Heavens of the Realm of Form:**
*Xuwu Yueheng Heaven*:
Emperor titled *Zhengding Guang*, taboo name *Wushang*,
oversees the illumination of the supreme Dao,
resides in the *Great Mystery Palace*,
rules the north, west of *Chou*,
aligned with the *qi* of *Dou* constellation,
*qi* named *Jianyang*, jade-green in color,
*Wuxing Shangshou*, *Huijue Liuxuan*,
bounding the Realm of Form.
The lifespan of its heavenly citizens: five hundred seventy-six million years.

*Taiji Mengyi Heaven*:
Emperor titled *Quyu Jiuchang*, taboo name *Xuyuan*,
oversees the refinement and deliverance of decaying bodies,
resides in the *Mystic Capital Palace*,
rules the north, east of *Chou*,
aligned with the *qi* of *Niu* constellation,
*qi* named *Jiyang*, purple in color,
*Atuo Longluo*, *Sixiang Xuyuan*,
bounding the Realm of Form.
The lifespan of its heavenly citizens: one billion one hundred fifty-two million years.

*Chiming Heyang Heaven*:
Emperor titled *Lijin Shangzhen*, taboo name *Huanming*,
oversees the refinement of immortals into perfected beings,
resides in the *Eternal Brightness Palace*,
rules the northeast, north of *Yin*,
aligned with the *qi* of *Dou* and *Ji* constellations,
*qi* named *Shiyang*, white in color,
*Nanyan Dongfu*, *Yumou Shenxian*,
bounding the Realm of Form.

The lifespan of its heavenly citizens: twenty-three billion forty million years.

*Mystic Brightness Reverent Splendor Heaven*:
Emperor titled *Empty Melody Harsh Tone*, taboo name *Shiyuan*,
oversees the transformation and manifestation of all things,
resides in the *Eastern Splendor Palace*,

**Five Directions, Five Emperors, Five Dipper Stars, Five Demon Kings**

The Five Heavens are endowed with the *qi* of the Five Spirits, dwelling in the midst of the Great Void. Above, they correspond to the Five Dipper Stars; below, they establish the Five Peaks, governed by the Five Emperors. These are the heavens of *qi*-directions, not the heavens of formed images.

The inner taboo names of the Five Elders, Five Emperors, Five Dipper Stars, and Five Heavenly Demon Kings, along with their respective domains, must be known by those who recite the scriptures.

**The Five Emperors**

*Eastern Azure Heaven*:
*Azure Spirit Primordial Elder*, surname *Yan*, taboo name *Weiming*, titled *Spiritual Might Lofty*, oversees the protection of souls.

*Southern Vermilion Heaven*:
*Vermilion Spirit True Elder*, surname *Dongfu*, taboo name *Liuyan*, titled *Red Standard Slave*, oversees the cultivation of *qi*.

*Central Yellow Heaven*:
*Mystic Spirit Primordial Elder*, surname *Tongban*, taboo name *Yuancheng*, titled *Containing Pivot*, oversees the governance of all spirits.

*Eastern Dipper*: *Jiao, Kang, Di, Fang, Xin, Wei, Ji*, oversees the recording of destinies.

*Southern Dipper*: *Jing, Gui, Liu, Xing, Zhang, Yi, Zhen*, oversees the bestowal of life.

*Western Dipper*: *Kui, Lou, Wei, Mao, Bi, Zui, Shen*, oversees the registration of names.

*Northern Dipper*: *Dou, Niu, Nü, Xu, Wei, Shi, Bi*, oversees the descent into death.

*Central Dipper*: *Tan, Ju, Lu, Wen, Lian, Wu, Po*, oversees the universal oversight of all spirits.

The *Six Inner and Outer Grotto Demon Kings of Fengdu*.

The above demonic spirits, also called the *Multitude of Demons*, specialize in corrupting human goodness, afflicting people with evil deeds, and testing scholars. None are more cunning than their leaders. Among the world’s birds and beasts, those that transform into ghosts and demons to harass and disturb are all manifestations of these beings, assuming forms at will to deceive. There are also *Outer Demons* that disguise themselves as True Immortals to delude the virtuous. One must rectify one’s thoughts and not fall into their snares, passing the trials to ascend to the immortal ranks.

The *Three Offices and Nine Bureaus* are called the *Three Origins and Nine Palaces*.

The *Upper Origin Palaces* reside above the Nine Heavens.
The *Middle Origin Palaces* reside between the Nine Earths.
The *Lower Origin Palaces* reside within the windy marshes and abyssal depths.

The Three Origins collectively comprise the Nine Palaces, Twenty-Seven Bureaus, and One Hundred Twenty Offices. The numinous immortals, Perfected Sages, boundless and infinite, and the spirits of Heaven and Earth all fall under their authority. The greatest of their offices are the Three Origins and Three Officials.

**Offices of the Resplendent Transcendent Administrations of All Heavens**

The Master said: Within the Jade Clarity, there reside the Resplendent Heavenly Generals and Great Divinities, all under the command of the Jade Clarity Divine Duke, Supreme Minister of the Great Mystery. Equal in merit to the Three Heavens’ Great Marshals of Lofty Numen, they style themselves the Jade Clarity Numinous Treasure Resplendent Office. They assist and protect the Jade Clarity, transform kalpas and renew epochs, extinguish demons and sweep away disasters, deliver the disciples of immortal study, inspect and regulate the Three Realms, expel malevolent spirits, strictly govern the Northern Feng, restrain and command spectral beings, search out demonic encampments, and purify the Dao-qi, preparing the seed-people of later generations to behold the Sagely Lord of Great Peace—all these are the divine powers of support and sweeping eradication.

Within the Jade Clarity exists the Heaven-Ascension Certificate, bestowed upon those who attain the Dao and ascend as immortals. When the Heavenly Worthy grants the certificate, it is also conferred upon suffering souls to be delivered, enabling them to proceed to the Southern Palace. Without this certificate, the gatekeepers of Heaven will bar their way and forbid their advance. Only by seeking and obtaining the certificate can one traverse the passes of all heavens, so that the gates of Heaven impose no hindrance.

Those who petition the Heavens to eradicate the Three Evils do so because, internally, the Three Karmic Actions summon them, while externally, the Three Poisons engender transgressions, leading to their fall into the Three Evil Paths of ghosts, beasts, and hells. Yet once they receive deliverance in the Jade Clarity today, they ascend according to their celestial stems, belonging to the Thirty-Two Heavens. As master and disciple traverse the passes, they petition for the eradication of the Three Evils: internally, they eliminate the Three Karmic Actions of body, mind, and speech; externally, they sever the Three Poisons of greed, hatred, and delusion. Thus, hells have no cause for their descent, ghosts no means of entry, and beasts no path of transformation. Even after receiving deliverance and eradicating the Three Evils, if the internal and external karmic poisons of the Three Evils remain unremoved, they still cannot escape falling.

When a person is born, above lie twelve joints, the roots of dead qi transmitted by parents. In the center are twelve knots, the roots of dead qi inherent in the body. Below are twelve wombs, the roots of dead qi passed to descendants. All these harbor hells. Therefore, when receiving talismans, one must also sever them: internally, eliminate the thirty-six roots; externally, restrain the six roots from evil destinies. Once the earthly roots are severed, debts sealed, and forms enclosed, one soars through the Five Gates, gains inscription in the Great Mystery, and under the surveillance of demon kings, ascends the gates of Heaven. On this day of ascending the Jade Clarity with flesh and bone together, the decree of deliverance is fulfilled.

The aforementioned Divine Duke receives the mandate of sweeping eradication. This Divine Duke is the minister Ma Zu of the Earthly Sovereign, the heir of the Great Thearch’s Horned Dragon, and the father of the celestial gods of the lunar lodges. His rank is Jade Clarity Divine Duke, Supreme Minister of the Great Mystery, styled Ma Long, with the personal name Kuo Yi. Whenever one wishes to employ him, summon him with the Resplendent Talisman of Myriad Divinities, and he will descend in accordance with the command. Ghosts and spirits preside over the hidden darkness, fundamentally beyond the comprehension of worldly people. Yet practitioners must somewhat grasp the correct principles of heaven and earth and roughly understand the origins and development of the teachings. Without knowledge of past and present or examination of the scriptures, how can one recklessly conjecture and mislead later learners? Is this not grievous?

Moreover, in matters of memorials and petitions, what is sought must have a basis to be spoken of. One should observe the forty-nine ranks of methods, wherein the Three Realm Lords are regarded as the Three Masters, the Savior from Suffering Heavenly Worthy as the True Master—also called the Mysterious Master—differing somewhat from the old ways.

Moreover, there exist designations such as the *Office of Bestowed Transcendents*, the *Office of Radiant Transcendents*, and the *Office of Transcendents Revered by the Three Realms*, each derived from a single sentence in the scriptures to form a bureau. For instance, the prohibition against "detaining or coercing ghostly multitudes" refers to souls destined for deliverance, who, having departed the hidden darkness, must not again be subjected to detention or coercion among ghostly throngs—this merely extends the meaning of the preceding text. Yet now, a single sentence is arbitrarily taken to establish an office.

Another example is the phrase "nothing it does not repel," which describes the efficacy of the middle section of the text. Yet without careful consideration of the scriptural intent, it too is appropriated as an office. Such fragmentation of passages and disruption of sentences utterly lacks coherence or principle. Given that the *Three Caverns* and *Four Supplements* comprise tens of thousands of scrolls, if every phrase were thus extracted to name a bureau, would this not be excessive?

Wang Shengqing’s *Comprehensive Examination of the Lingbao Great Rites* contains many corrections, yet in this regard, he failed to excise these errors, which is deeply regrettable. Since these designations have long circulated among the various schools, they must now be preserved as they stand. Among them, only the *Office of Radiant Transcendents* retains some semblance of coherence, though upon closer examination, it merely extols the might and virtue of demonic kings. Other offices, such as the *Bureau of Ritual Offerings* or the *Bureau of Descending Sages*, are likewise unsound.

From ancient times to the present, the transmitted registers of the *Luo Tian* rites for invoking the sages have been comprehensive and complete, yet they contain no such bureaus. The *Celestial Pivot Institute* resides beneath the *Three Celestial Gates*, as detailed in the *Rituals for Memorial Petitions*. It is properly called the *Southern Culmen Celestial Pivot Institute*. The *Northern Culmen* marks the center of heaven, and only beyond it does one reach the *Celestial Gates*. The *Southern Culmen*, by contrast, descends thirty-six degrees into the earthly portal, directly opposing the *Northern Culmen*. Yet now, these are confused and inverted, ignorant of north and south. How can petitions submitted through such error not be contrary to the Dao?

Therefore, this text first expounds the *Mysterious Vault’s Sovereign*, clarifying the source of the *Three Qi*. It then severs these from the *Three Realms’ Offices and Bureaus*, providing a complete register for memorials and petitions. Whether aiding the living or delivering the deceased, all may be referenced accordingly.

Though the *Transcendent Offices and Mysterious Bureaus* are not entirely abolished, they must not be employed in perpetuation of error. One must weigh them carefully and act in accordance with principle.

*Shangqing Lingbao Great Rites*, Scroll Ten, concludes.
*Shangqing Lingbao Great Rites*, Scroll Eleven, begins.

The Venerable Master of Subtle Mysteries, Radiant Light Savior of Suffering Perfected One Ning Quanzhen, bestows upon the Shangqing Three Caverns Disciple, Lingbao Preceptor and Lineage Master Wang Qizhen:

**Gate of Descending Perfected Ones and Summoning Spirits**

The Master states: The *Celestial Sovereign’s Descending Perfected Talisman* and the *Vacuous Sovereign’s Summoning Spirits Talisman* are the *Flying Mystery Qi* of the Three Heavens, natural scriptures for summoning the myriad spirits of the Three Origins. Disciples who hold office in the pure celestial ranks and govern the numinous void’s true grades—should they wish to descend the hundred Perfected Ones and command the thousand spirits—must use a cyan silk cloth seven feet and two inches in length, inscribing at its center the *Descending Perfected Talisman* in vermilion and the *Summoning Spirits Talisman* in flying yellow script, then place it within the oratory. Spread a mat of yellow brocade or yellow silk for the offering rite. After a hundred days, the *Descending Perfected and Summoning Spirits Envoys*—jade maidens and golden lads, three each—will descend in response to the rite, standing guard over the true scriptures. All the thousand Perfected Ones and myriad spirits summoned will descend into the chamber.

If one’s learning is not sincere and steadfast, the Five Marchmounts will test them. To lightly reveal these secrets is to render the summons inefficacious. When invoking the Perfected Ones, spirits, and deities of the Three Heavens, all must arrive before the talismans; without the divine scriptures, it is a false summons. Even with utmost devotion and exhaustive effort, not a single spirit will descend. Should any appear, they are often demonic trials.

Recipients must adhere to the statutes of the *Mystic Capital’s Regulations*: prepare three plain silks, measure them by the year’s span, and present them to a master versed in the scriptures. The talismans are drawn in the air and memorized by heart, never recorded in writing, lest ghosts, spirits, birds, or beasts steal and leak them.

Within these two talismans are twelve talisman officials who oversee the altar. When establishing an altar with these talismans, they transform the space into the realm of the *Golden Gates’ Brahmanic Practices*, enabling the performance of rites and transformations. Only then does one proceed to the inner audience of the Three Heavens’ Golden Gates, practicing the Dao of *Descending Perfected Ones and Summoning Spirits*. When inscribing, use the *Jade Purity Mudra*, inhale the *Heavenly □ Gate Qi* three times, and blow it onto the talismanic script to complete it.

**Incantation for Proclaiming the Summons to Myriad Spirits**
The thirty-two heavens, the thirty-two emperors,
the hidden names of the heavens, the hidden sounds of the heavens.
The empty vastness within Heaven, the natural numinous script,
the hidden tones of the heavens, the celestial voices.
The honored within Heaven, the gods within Heaven,
the great demons within Heaven, the numina within Heaven.
Nine harmonies and ten unions transform into the Highest Clarity,
boundless mysteries too profound to fathom.
The divine Perfected descend, universally delivering heaven and humanity.
Today, in joyous celebration of this deliverance,
pass through the gates of the heavens, beseech the eradication of the Three Evils,
sever the roots of earthly bonds, ascend through the Five Passes,
and inscribe your name in the Great Mystery.
The Demon Kings oversee; none are barred at the celestial gates.
The Eastern Dipper governs the tally, the Western Dipper records the names,
the Northern Dipper decrees death, the Southern Dipper bestows life,
the Central Dipper, the Great Chief, oversees all spirits.
The Azure Emperor guards the hun-soul, the White Emperor attends the po-soul,
the Vermilion Emperor nurtures the *qi*, the *Qi* Emperor circulates the blood,
the Yellow Emperor presides at the center—none among the myriad spirits transgress.
The Azure Heaven Demon King, Bayuan Choubo;
the Vermilion Heaven Demon King, Fu Tian Danshi;
the White Heaven Demon King, Fanshan Liumu;
the Black Heaven Demon King, Jianchou Langfu;
the Yellow Heaven Demon King, Hengtian Danli.
The Five Thearch Demon Kings, lords of the myriad spirits,
fly with drums in tow, commanding the ghostly legions.
Wielding banners and drums, they roam the vast heavens,
self-styled as radiant, their merits acknowledged by all heavens.
Ascending to deliver humanity, they sternly govern the northern darkness.
The divine lords receive the command, universally sweeping away misfortune.
The Eight Mighties spew poison; fierce steeds bare their fangs in four directions.
Heavenly Soldiers lead the way; the Great Marshal bears the banner.
Fire is hurled a thousand miles; the flowing bells surge in eight directions.
Should any dare to resist or obstruct the Highest Perfected,
they shall be struck down by blades of iron, punished by the mighty Queen of Heaven.
The souls of demons shall be butchered; wind and fire shall not cease.
A thousand thousand heads severed, ten thousand ten thousand forms destroyed.
No demon shall trespass, no ghost shall manifest as a specter.
The Three Officials and Northern Fengdu shall inspect the ghostly encampments,
permitting no concealment—swift as the golden horse’s course.
Universally proclaimed without end, let all spirits heed.
The Five Emperors of the Three Realms, declare this to the Highest Clarity.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as the Jade Dawn Dao Lord commands by the Celestial Emperor’s decree!*

hearing this proclamation, swiftly come in resonance.
Drums and banners descend from the Milky Way,
riding the wind, driving the *qi*, arriving from the floating void.

arise in grandeur, arrive in solemn procession.

receiving the Jade Clarity’s command, responding with auspicious radiance.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as the Primordial Celestial Emperor decrees!*

This method follows the Three Heavens and Ten Heavens’ esoteric techniques, employing breath and exhalation.
When summoning the Radiant Host, inscribe the Three Heavens’ true forms with your gaze toward the Celestial Gate,
inhale into the Three Palaces, and transform them into the Three Clarities.
Visualize yourself assuming the form of the Divine Lord—
wearing the Jade Clarity’s Great Receiving Cap of gold and kingfisher feathers,
a robe of crimson radiance with flying sleeves, a grand sash, vermilion shoes, and a crimson skirt,
seated amidst clouds of three hues.
In your right hand, cast the Seven Stars of the Dipper to form the Purple Tenuity Seal;
in your left, cast the Three Fires to hold the Jade Clarity mudra.
Knock your teeth nine times, recite the incantation, then knock them twenty-seven times.
Proceed to summon according to the matter at hand.
For all divine mudras, follow the matter at hand, matching the *qi* with breaths and gestures—
grasp firmly, never superficially, and let no person or beast witness.
Employ the *qi* of the northwest, and the summoned shall arrive at once.
Upon completion, swiftly bid them return to their domains.

**Incantation for Summoning the Jade Lads and Jade Maidens of the Five Thearchs**
Hongxing, Mohei, Mozhen, Walà, Lingbao.

For this method, hold the Jade Clarity mudra in your left hand while inscribing the Jade Clarity’s true form in the air with your right.
Recite the incantation, inhale the *qi* of the five directions, and hold your breath.
With your left hand, enclose the true form, then exhale with an open mouth.
Recite the incantation again, raise the Five Peaks mudra, and draw the *qi* of the five directions to blow upon it.
This is the general esoteric technique for entering the altar and summoning the Perfected.
All other methods derive from this—only when the Jade Lads and Jade Maidens appear may you summon the remaining Perfected.

Should one deviate even slightly from this incantation, the summons will go unanswered.

**Esoteric Incantation for Summoning the Celestial Clerks**
"Supreme Mysterious Origin, Most High Dao Lord, summon forth from within this servant’s body the Three and Five Celestial Clerks, the Attendant Officials of Left and Right, the Courier Dragon Riders, the Incense-Bearing Golden Lads, the Message-Transmitting and Flower-Scattering Jade Maidens, the Five Thearchs’ Direct Talismans, and the Incense-Officials of the Day—thirty-two of each—let them emerge.
Let those who emerge be clad in solemn attire, their robes and sashes adorned with hanging tassels, their dignity and bearing impeccable. Let them stand in attendance before, behind, and to the left and right of this servant, heeding this servant’s instructions, conveying and fulfilling this sincere command, ascending to serve the Three Heavens.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Most Honored Decree of the Primordial Celestial Thearch commands."

Recite this incantation in a soft voice, so that outsiders may not understand. If not during the extended fasts of the first, seventh, or tenth months, simply state: "On this auspicious and fasted day, this servant, [insert name], humbly petitions for [state purpose]," speaking directly as the matter requires. If making a petition on the same day, conclude with: "Supreme Mysterious Origin, halt." Swiftly, swiftly, as the Most Honored Decree of the Primordial Celestial Thearch commands.

For this method, form the Upper Clarity mudra with both hands, visualize the true form of Jade Clarity in your gaze, inhale through the mouth, recite the incantation, draw the *qi* of the Qian direction, and swallow it. Envision it residing in the Upper Cinnabar Field, the Central Crimson Palace, and the Lower Gate of Life. Mounting the *qi* of the Three Pristine Ones, emerge and stand facing the west, then proceed with the matter at hand as required.

**General Invocation for Summoning the Celestial Clerks**
"In the heavens above, Jade Clarity presides.
Within the Great Vault of the Mysterious, the Palace of the Great Mystery is born.
Therein dwell the Imperial Lords and the Jade Mother of Numinous Emptiness.
They govern the chanting and recitation, the jade texts and golden talismans.
They oversee the celestial prohibitions, the Golden Lads and Jade Maidens.
They examine and discern demons, governing the hundred clerks.
They ascend to the Three Heavens, forming the Bureau of Manifestations.
They transmit and proclaim decrees, rescuing from illness and suffering.
They guard and protect the Dao, binding and restraining demonic insults.
They traverse the myriad heavens, delivering the living and transcending the dead.
They resolve calamities and shatter monstrosities, communicating with the Purple Palace.
By the command of the Ten Heavens, summon those who preside.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the statutes and decrees of the Primordial Celestial Thearch command."

The method on the right inscribes the True Forms of the Three Heavens. At the direction of the Heavenly Gate, visualize them in three colors. First, form the Jade Clarity mudra with the left hand and the Highest Clarity mudra with the right, strike the teeth nine times, and with eyes closed, trace the talismans while reciting the Three Heavens’ secret names: *Hong, Liu, Jing*. Heaven, Earth, Humanity—within these, the virtue of defense is established. Draw in the breath through the mouth, guiding it into the Three Palaces, and visualize the body assuming the form of the Divine Lord. Silently recite the incantation once, then draw in the qi of the ten directions and blow it toward the east, south, west, and north. When complete, summon and invoke the celestial bureaus of the myriad heavens, the mysterious offices of the spirit administrators, using the Great Incantation of the General Petition—no other text is required. Do not recklessly recite it, lest you confuse the celestial bureaus.

**Incantation to Summon the Celestial Officials**
In the highest heavens, Jade Clarity is the origin. The Three Qi of Numinous Treasure govern the three provinces’ pivotal offices. The Celestial Thearch presides over them, the celestial bureaus’ life-palace. Each has its appointed duty, assisting the Jade Statutes below. Ranked by grade and arranged by position, each office has its place. At the first summons, descend; at the first command, obey the Heavenly Seal. Swiftly, swiftly, as the statutes and decrees command.

**Incantation to Summon the Divine Lads**
With reverence, I invoke the twelve divine lads beneath the Jade Clarity of Numinous Treasure, known as the Jade Radiance. By imperial decree, hasten to descend. Swiftly, swiftly, as the statutes and decrees command.

**Incantation to Summon the Jade Maidens**
With reverence, I invoke the yin of supple origins, the Nine Numinous and Nine Perfected, called the Jade Maidens, clad in phoenix robes and light skirts. By the command of the True King, hasten to the altar court. Swiftly, swiftly, as the statutes and decrees command.

**Incantation to Summon the Merit Officers**
The mysterious bureaus’ jade texts appoint the merit officers. They uphold Jade Clarity and memorialize the Three Heavens. Hearing my summons, hasten to the altar court. Swiftly, swiftly, as the statutes and decrees command.

**Incantation to Summon the Thunder Gods**
Southern Controller of the Fire Palace, Lord Han of the Upper Palace. Dragon-circled Rain Division, thunder’s divine court. Masters of the five directions’ lightning, the thunderclap’s Ding spirits. Receiving the command of the direct talisman, summoned by the Mysterious Numinous. By the Celestial Venerable’s decree, wind and fire cease not. Swiftly ride the ten directions, bringing the Dharma rain and compassionate clouds. Swift thunder searches out dragons, fierce lightning and fire bells. Sweep away inauspiciousness, shatter demonic hordes. The celestial prisons seize the monstrous; swiftly descend, true spirits. Swiftly, swiftly, as the statutes and decrees command.

**True Form of the Three Heavens’ Celestial Thearch Heart Seal**

For all adepts who receive and uphold the great method, at dawn each day, take four pieces of bamboo membrane, inscribe them according to their respective colors, and swallow them. Thereafter, govern the unseen and manifest realms—none shall fail to respond. After three years of this practice, one may seal and command mountains and rivers, summon and bind true spirits, and govern the Six Heavens, calling to account the palaces of the yin. After seven years, one may sit and manifest the traveling kitchen; a thousand true spirits and ten thousand numinous beings shall attend and guard the body. After nine years, when merit is complete, one shall ascend in flight to Highest Clarity.

**True Talismans of the Three Heavens and Three Realms**
The Master said: Within the *Lingbao Scripture of Salvation for the Limitless*, there resides the supreme Dao. By refining the body internally and absorbing the correct *qi* externally, one’s name is inscribed in Jade Clarity, and one is ranked among the Perfected. One may dispel demonic trials, revive the dead, and restore the skeleton—such merit and virtue penetrate between Heaven and Earth.

This Dao is most sacred, most wondrous, most numinous, and most revered. It takes the Terrace of Supreme Mystery as its administrative center, the Bureau of Celestial Mechanisms as its inner sanctuary, and the Upper Court of the Celestial Pivot as the master of its teachings. The Perfected Lord of Wondrous Salvation and Divine Merit serves as the first scriptural master of the Celestial Pivot Court.

In former times, the Thearch bestowed these true talismans of the Three Realms to govern the essentials of the Celestial Pivot. They enable the Dao to command the Northern Palace, oversee the Yellow Court, pacify the spirits, nurture the true, dispel calamities, and still misfortunes—assisting the gateway of salvation and honoring the primordial virtue of the scriptural masters. Today, within the Southern Upper Fire Palace of the Celestial Pivot Court, these talismans are stored.

The Three Realms’ Talismans originated at the dawn of the Five Kalpas of the Supreme Three Heavens, when the true essence of the Three *Qi* and the numinous emptiness of wondrous *qi* coalesced into true script, the natural sounds of all heavens, and the root and origin of the Great Dao. They may be used to summon and command spirits, or swallowed to attain perfection, responding to all affairs with resonance.

Originally, these were not transmitted to the lower world, but passed down through oral instruction and heart-to-heart transmission by the Perfected. Those who receive this script are born with the bones of the Dao. Diligently practicing it, one shall attain divine transcendence. If one observes prolonged abstinence in mountain forests or pure halls, recites and practices the true teachings of the Eight Latitudes, cultivates the wondrous applications of the Seven Scriptures, and swallows the true talismans, then after eighty-one days, the Three Corpses shall perish of themselves, grain *qi* shall naturally arise, the body shall become light and strong, the face shall radiate jade-like luminosity, and the form shall gleam with golden luster—unlike the *qi* of medicinal stones or saliva, for this is the true *qi* of nature. One shall attain longevity and transcend the world, forever free from decline and decay. With prolonged ingestion, one shall surely ascend as an immortal.

When inscribing, recite the Three Realms’ incantations, and with the *qi* of the Heavenly Gate, write in cinnabar on bamboo membrane and swallow it. This can also cure a thousand calamities: for minor matters, use only the Supreme Clarity talisman; for major affairs, employ all three talismans together.

Alternatively, inscribe the talisman in cinnabar on an iron plate, nine inches long and five inches wide, and submerge it in clear spring water. Let the afflicted drink the water, and the effect shall be immediate. Or, write nine cinnabar lines on green bamboo leaves and place them by flowing water; drinking this can cure epidemics—its efficacy is beyond description.
