The above officers descend in accordance with the duty day. For example, on the day of **Taihuang Huangzeng Heaven**, the *hai* day is used. If the branch is summoned first, the stem is employed; if the stem is summoned first, the branch is used instead.

The Master states: The twenty-eight constellations may also be used to summon officers on duty days. For major affairs, a single **Brahmā Heaven** is employed together.

This refers to: **Eastern Direction** (nine *qi*), **Southern Direction** (three *qi*), **Western Direction** (seven *qi*), **Northern Direction** (five *qi*), and the four corners (one *qi* each).

The Master states: The **Flying Celestial Divine Kings** of the ten directions possess the greatest majesty and virtue, their sagely transformation beyond measure. At the dawn of the **Red Clarity Kalpa**, within the **Floating Black Realm**, on the day of unfolding charts and reviewing records, they received the august command of the **Primordial Originator** to oversee all registers of the three realms and ten directions, assessing transgressions and blessings, recording merits and faults, measuring ranks, and classifying beings. Each is attended by officers and soldiers. Whenever one approaches the origin, the Divine Kings open the path and lead the way. For major affairs, the Divine Kings are summoned; for minor matters, only their envoys suffice.

Disciples who revere and honor them may, when aiding the living or delivering the dead, dispatch Flying Celestial Envoys and officers to memorialize the Divine Kings and request salvation. Inscribe their names in vermilion, annotate the matter below, wear or burn the talisman for protection—all shall receive divine response. The methods of summoning and wearing are detailed in secret instructions. Each summoning follows a duty day: from the first to the tenth day, each direction is assigned one day; on the eleventh day, the cycle repeats as before. The sequence begins with the **Eastern Direction** on the first day, proceeding in order. If the month has only twenty-nine days, the final day combines the upper and lower directions. The following month begins anew.

Choose an auspicious day to craft a **Nine Palaces Plate** from ancient maple wood, six inches square, inscribed with the **Nine Palaces** and **Eight Trigrams**. Position the upper and lower directions at the central palace, painted with three plain colors, and arrange accordingly. Carve **Divine King Position Tablets** from wood, one inch in size. Beginning on the first day, summon the Divine King of the day’s duty. For any deliverance, inscribe the matter in vermilion, cast it toward the direction of the duty day, and the response shall arrive instantly. Thus, there is nothing that cannot be governed, nothing that cannot be subdued, no summons that goes unanswered, and no deliverance that fails.

**The Wondrous Canon of Highest Clarity and Numinous Treasure, Scroll Twenty-Two Concludes**
**The Wondrous Canon of Highest Clarity and Numinous Treasure, Scroll Twenty-Three**

*Transmitted by Dongwei Gaoshi, Radiant Master of Opening Light and Deliverance from Suffering, Perfected Ning Quanzhen, to the Numinous Treasure Lineage Master Wang Qizhen, Disciple of the Three Caverns of Highest Clarity*

**Section on Scriptural Passages, Talismanic Writing, Vermilion Ink, Black Ink, and Incantations**

**Highest Clarity Formula**
Vermilion ink draws upon the southern *qi*; black ink draws upon the *qi* of the ink.
The Great Mystery’s killing *qi*, vermilion cinnabar’s flowing light,
enters within—ten thousand evils flee in terror.
*Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the talismanic command of the Numinous Treasure, as decreed!*

**Incantation for the Brush**
Divine brush, attuned to the numinous,
in harmony with Jade Clarity above,
writes talismans to slay demons,
to heal illness and bring peace.
Ten thousand calamities and misfortunes,
wherever directed, are overthrown and toppled.
When the talisman arrives, act accordingly.

**Incantation for Dispatching Talismans**
*Jade Clarity mudra.*
*Heavenly Gate qi.*
The Great Law of the Numinous Treasure,
the True Writ of Primordial Beginning,
the Void Origin of the Great Dao,
condenses and transforms into the Three Clarities.
*Qi* descends into the talisman;
when the talisman arrives, peace is restored.
Demons are slain, humans live—
eternally preserved, without end.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed!*

**Incantation for Opening the Seal**
*Jade Clarity mudra.* Gaze upon the seal and employ it.
The Supreme Jade Emperor,
the True Mandate of the River Chariot,
the Utmost Numinosity of Jade Clarity,
the Precious Decree of Highest Clarity,
enforced by Grand Clarity—
nothing is not repelled.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed!*

**Incantation for Using the Seal**
The divine seal of Jade Clarity,
crimson radiance of cinnabar script,
illuminates the Ten Heavens,
summons the true and invokes the numinous.
Wherever the seal arrives,
the myriad spirits pay reverent obedience.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed!*

*For the above method:* Knock the teeth three times, visualize the blue, yellow, and white *qi* descending from the Heavenly Gate to cover the seal. Hold the seal in the right hand and employ it.

**Incantation for Withdrawing the Seal**
Nine numina, nine perfected,
nine immortals, nine sages,
nine heavens, nine *qi*,
envelop the divine seal.
Jade maidens and jade lads,
attendants interlaced in guard,
spirit officials and divine warriors,
eternally protect the myriad perfected.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed!*

**Incantation for the Seal of Delivering Life**
Highest Clarity issues its command,
the primordial *qi* of the Void Origin.
Cloud-dragons intertwine in script,
instantly inscribing the cinnabar writ.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the Primordial Beginning Supreme Emperor!*

**Incantation for the Seal of Delivering the Dead**
The ancestral *qi* of the Void Sovereign,
the great Brahmā soars in flight.
Numinous light infuses the brush,
erasing suffering and ending opposition.
Dark and sinful souls,
universally ascend to higher rebirth.
*Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the Primordial Beginning Supreme Emperor!*

**Incantation for Burning Incense**
The great divine kings of utmost truth,
from the ten directions and all heavens.
*For the above method:* Begin by invoking and descending from the East, as with the Five Elders opening the way and the host of immortals escorting the chariot, descending from the ten directions. Then, from the heart’s intent, offer prayers, and finally, present the incense to settle the mind.

**Incantation for Settling the Mind**
Spirit and soul, serene and upright,
the myriad *qi* eternally endure.
Unmarred by suffering and affliction,
the body radiates light.
The Three Realms attend in guard,
the Five Emperors oversee and welcome.
The myriad spirits pay homage,
names inscribed in the heavens above.
Merits complete, virtue perfected—
ascend in flight to Highest Clarity.
*For the above ten phrases:* Draw in the *qi* from the direction of one’s life-star, swallow it, and proceed with affairs. Whatever is wished, following the *qi*, will ascend without fail.

**Incantation for Curing All Illnesses**
The great Brahmā *qi* circulates
throughout the ten directions.
Within it dwells the spirit who delivers people from death,
the Lord of Longevity of the Southern Culmen,
the Great Spirit Sima who delivers the world,
the Benevolent Lord Han, the Venerable Man,
the Lords of Life and Record of the Southern Supreme,
who extend years, increase destiny, and deliver from calamity—
they turn bones back to life, raise the dead,
and deliver boundless multitudes.
*For the above nine phrases:* For blood stasis, stagnation, or minor ailments of the body, sit upright, form the Jade Clarity mudra with both hands, recite once, and draw in the *qi* from the southeast. Hold the breath, visualize the *qi* as a yellow mist penetrating the five viscera, bones, joints, and skin, all suffused with yellow *qi*. After a while, if the body feels slight warmth, the illness is cured. *For all healing methods, employ the projection of qi.*

**Incantation for Generating True Qi**
The Crimson Writ of Chaos Primordial,
the primordial perfected of the Supreme Origin.
From the ancestral kalpa of Primordial Beginning,
the myriad heavens were born.
The Three Luminaries revealed,
becoming the root of heaven.
Above, there is no further ancestor—
only the Dao is the body.
The Five Scripts unfold and expand,
universally engendering spirits and numina.
No script is unilluminated,
no script is unbright,
no script is unestablished,
no script is unaccomplished,
no script is undelivered,
no script is unborn.
*For the above fifteen phrases:* Each morning, form the Jade Clarity mudra with both hands, face the southeast, recite five times, and visualize five-colored clouds descending from heaven. Draw them in through the nose, swallow them, and visualize them returning to the Three Fields. Thus, the five viscera become replete, the Three Fields overflow, all transforming into true *qi*—no evil dares to intrude.

**Incantation for the Five Marchmounts Upholding the Body**
Chaos divides its light,
the primordial kalpa unfolds.
The Three Terraces and Four Saints,
the Nine Heavens of North and South.
The great spirits of the Eight Trigrams,
the Five Stars and Three Sovereigns.
The Perfected of the Three Heavens,
the Five Marchmounts uphold the body.
The Three Paths and Six Dings,
the immortals of the Six Jia.
The divine tigers of the Four Watches,
the Supreme Emperor descends his *qi*.
Internally refined and transformed,
the Dark Maiden communicates the true.
Clouds and thunder erupt in thunderclaps,
life and transformation arise naturally.
*Swiftly, swiftly, report above—*
may one’s years equal those of heaven!
*For the above method:* Use the Zi-Wu mudra, and the *qi* of the five directions envelops the body.

**Incantation for Settling the Spirit and Stabilizing the Will**
The Green Emperor guards the soul,
the White Emperor attends the corporeal spirit,
the Red Emperor nurtures the *qi*,
the Black Emperor circulates the blood,
the Yellow Emperor presides at the center—
the myriad spirits do not transgress.
The Demon King of the Green Heaven,
Ba Yuan Chou Bo.
The Demon King of the Red Heaven,
bears heaven and carries stones.
The Demon King of the White Heaven,
six-eyed, overturns mountains.
The Demon King of the Black Heaven,
oversees the ugly and fragrant.
The Demon King of the Yellow Heaven,
bears heaven with transverse strength.
The great demons of the Five Emperors,
ancestors of the myriad spirits.
They fly and drum in retinue,
commanding the ghostly legions.
Wielding banners and beating drums,
they roam and observe the great void.
Proclaiming themselves resplendent,
their merits equal those of all heavens.
Delivering people above,
sternly subduing the Northern Feng.
Divine powers receive the mandate—
universally sweeping away inauspiciousness.
The Eight Awesomenesses spew poison,
fierce horses open their four jaws.
Heavenly soldiers advance as vanguard,
great marshals wield banners.
Hurl fire for ten thousand leagues,
the Eight Directions resound with bells.
Dare any oppose or obstruct
the perfected above?
Gold and iron strike first,
the Great Queen inflicts punishment thereafter.

Slaying and severing ghostly brilliance,
wind and fire never cease.
Thousands upon thousands behead,
ten thousands upon ten thousands shear forms.
Demons dare not trespass,
ghosts dare not turn monstrous.
The Three Officials of Northern Feng
inspect the ghostly camps with clarity.
No concealment permitted—
golden horses speed the journey.
Universally proclaimed without end,
all spirits heed in unison.
The Three Realms and Five Emperors
declare to the Supreme Clarity.

Recite this incantation once each morning,
regardless of going out or staying in.
This stabilizes the heart and spirit,
unblocks the blood and vessels,
enables transformation without obstruction,
and circulates throughout the world.

**Incantation for Alleviating Pain**
The Azure Emperor guards the soul,
the White Emperor attends the spirit,
the Vermilion Emperor nurtures qi,
the Black Emperor circulates blood,
the Yellow Emperor presides at the center—
no spirit transgresses these bounds.

Recite these six lines:
*Zhen* script, eastern qi,
*Gao* script, southern qi,
*Dui* script, western qi,
*Kan* script, northern qi,
*Central* script, central qi.
Recite the incantation once, blow upon the afflicted area,
and have the patient cough once.
Within three repetitions, the pain ceases.

**Incantation of the Five Dippers for Preserving Life**
The Eastern Dipper governs fate,
the Western Dipper records names,
the Northern Dipper decrees death,
the Southern Dipper bestows life,
the Central Dipper, Great Chief,
oversees all spirits.

Recite these six lines each night when the stars are bright,
facing the five directions, chant once each,
draw in the qi of the five directions and blow it forth.
Wear the Five Dipper talisman on the body—
no evil shall approach,
a thousand calamities shall depart.

**Method for Curing Illness and Expelling Evil**
When expelling evil, present only the Heart Petition
to distinguish between human and ghost,
lest one rashly entangle in the emotions and transgressions of spirits.
First use the Five Dipper and Five Demon talismans
to pacify and secure the five viscera,
preserve life and generate fluids,
and expel perverse qi.
After half a month,
perform the Morning Audience and submit a petition,
harmonizing the five qi at the center.
Merge with the Hundred Spirits talisman, ingest it,
and guard the Yellow Court.

**Method for Curing Madness and Evil**
For those afflicted with madness and evil,
visualize the Three Palace Heavenly Worthies
ascending to the Mud-Pill Palace,
seated in jade arrays.
Summon the upright qi of the five viscera within the body,
ascending to the five stars in the heavens,
each transforming into an Emperor,
clad in the colors of their directions,
holding jade scepters.
Then transform the five viscera and five stars
into the Five Dippers,
each resembling a Daoist priest,
clad in the colors of their directions,
standing according to their positions,
holding green tablets.
Next, transform the five viscera and five stars
into the Five Heavenly Demon Kings,
resembling human warriors,
clad in the colors of their directions,
wielding halberds, bows, and swords,
standing according to their positions.
Then visualize your spirit generals ascending,
the Five Emperors, Five Dippers, and Five Invocations
commanding the demons to advance,
seize the ghostly brigands,
bring them before the Heavenly Worthy for restraint,
and escort them to the Three Officials’ Central Bureau for judgment.

Recite the incantation:
Divine powers receive the mandate—
universally sweeping away inauspiciousness.
The Eight Awesomenesses spew poison,
fierce horses open their four jaws.
Heavenly soldiers advance as vanguard,
great marshals wield banners.
Hurl fire for ten thousand leagues,
the Eight Directions resound with bells.
Dare any oppose or obstruct
the perfected above?
Gold and iron strike first,
the Great Queen inflicts punishment thereafter.
Slaying and severing ghostly brilliance,
wind and fire never cease.
Thousands upon thousands behead,
ten thousands upon ten thousands shear forms.
Demons dare not trespass,
ghosts dare not turn monstrous.
The Three Officials of Northern Feng
inspect the ghostly camps with clarity.
No concealment permitted—
golden horses speed the journey.

Recite this incantation nine times,
issue the Five Emperors, Five Dippers, and Five Demon talismans,
and have the afflicted ingest them for a month.
If seeking retribution,
at the patient’s nighttime repose,
use one talisman for ingestion,
one placed in the topknot,
another affixed to the bed-curtain ties,
and another burned in the censer with dramatic effect.
Notify the Six Spirits
and the Three-Five Generals to pursue and capture retribution.
When using talismans,
first perform the Morning Audience to request descent before proceeding.
Once retribution is achieved,
retrieve the talismans and burn them in a cold place.

**Method for Averting and Pacifying**
For major inauspicious events,
use five iron plates,
three inches wide and nine inches long,
inscribe the Five Demon talismans,
and on the reverse write the cause, year, month, day, and hour.
First present the Heart Petition,
secretly submit it to the Supreme Mystery,
and request the descent of talismanic commands before proceeding.

**Incantation for Wearing Talismans**
Attending the scriptures are the Five Emperors,
twenty-four Jade Lads and Jade Maidens,
guarding the divine script.
Protect the body of the scripture’s recipient.

Recite this incantation:
For those of Wood destiny, draw eastern qi;
Fire destiny, southern qi;
Metal destiny, western qi;
Water destiny, northern qi;
Earth destiny, upper qi.
Blow upon the talisman with the Supreme Clarity mudra.

**Incantation for Delivering All Departed Souls**
Universally proclaim to the Three Realms,
the boundless divine realm,
the Yellow Springs’ abode,
the Northern Capital’s Luo Deng,
the Three Officials and Nine Bureaus,
the Twelve River Sources.
Release the ancestors,
the karmic kin of countless kalpas,
swiftly erase their ledgers of transgressions,
extinguish their roots of evil,
lest they be detained or coerced into ghostly throngs.
By the Primordial Beginning’s talismanic command,
ascend and be promoted at this very moment.
In the Northern Capital’s icy pools,
guard and escort their forms and souls.
Restrain demons and ensure promotion,
deliver them to the Southern Palace for refinement.
Departed souls undergo refinement,
transforming into immortals.
Those who receive deliverance in life
shall endure through kalpas.
Through kalpas they transmigrate,
their years equaling Heaven’s.
Forever delivered from the Three Ways, Five Sufferings, and Eight Difficulties,
they transcend the Three Realms,
roaming carefree in the Supreme Clarity.

Recite this incantation with the Jade Clarity mudra and eastern qi.

**Incantation for Pacifying the Earth When Building a Dwelling**
For seven days and nights,
the sun, moon, and starry hosts of all heavens,
the Jade Armillary and Jade Balance,
halt their revolutions in unison.
Divine winds fall silent,
mountains and seas conceal their clouds.
Heaven is free of drifting veils,
the four qi shine clear and bright.
A nation’s lands, mountains, rivers, forests, and trees
are leveled as one,
no longer high or low.
The earth becomes azure jade,
uniform in color,
with all perfected ones in attendance.

Recite these fifteen lines whenever moving earth.
Step the *ding* *Gang* seven times,
take a handful of earth from the prosperous direction,
face north, form the Jade Clarity mudra,
chant seven times,
draw in the northwest qi and blow upon the earth,
then place it at the construction site as an offering.
Afterward, mix it with water and apply it to the central courtyard—
all myriad slayings and thousand monstrosities shall retreat.

If a household suffers from earth-related disturbances and restlessness, follow the method to consecrate earth, mix it with water, and sprinkle it throughout the home.

**Yuandong Incantation for Water**
Water of the Yuandong Jade Calendar,
Dragon Han’s Yan Kang era.
In the boundless kalpas,
amidst primordial chaos—
above, no returning hues;
below, no returning abyss.
Wind and marsh pierce the void,
Vajra ascends the heavens.
Between heaven above and heaven below,
no darkness, no obscurity,
no form, no shadow,
no limit, no end.
The vast expanse of the Great Brahma,
boundless and lightless.
When the Crimson Clarity unfurled its chart,
the cosmos moved by its own nature.

These sixteen lines: draw flowing water from the east and place it in a vessel. Visualize the Divine as the Numinous Treasure Perfected, the Three Clarities dwelling within the Three Fields, the sun to the left and moon to the right, the Five Stars stationed in the five directions, the Five Emperors attending the water, the Five Stars and sun and moon casting their radiance into the water, the Five Numinous Spirits guarding the water, Jade Lads and Jade Maidens standing to either side. Point the Dipper’s Handle at the water, then knock the teeth thirty-two times and chant the incantation thirty-two times. Draw the qi of the five directions into the water—even if stored through the height of summer, it will remain free of insects or filth. For treating illness, it may be used to swallow talismans, or to cook congee or decoct medicine. When epidemics spread, consecrate this water and sprinkle it with a willow branch throughout the area—the pestilential toxins will disperse, and recovery will be swift.

**Incantation to Command Demons and Expel Malevolent Qi**
Green Heaven’s Demon King, Bayuan Chou and Bo.
Red Heaven’s Demon King, bearing heaven and shouldering stone.
White Heaven’s Demon King, overturning mountains with six eyes.
Black Heaven’s Demon King, overseeing Chou and Lang Fu.
Yellow Heaven’s Demon King, spanning heaven with boundless strength.
The Five Emperors, Great Demons,
lords of the myriad spirits.
They soar and drum in procession,
commanding ghostly legions.
Brandishing banners and beating drums,
they roam the vastness of the firmament.
Proclaiming their radiant might,
all heavens unite in merit.
Ascending to deliver humanity,
they sternly govern the Northern Feng.
The Divine Lords receive their mandate,
sweeping away all misfortune.
The Eight Awes spew venom,
fierce steeds bared in four directions.
Heavenly Soldiers lead the vanguard,
Great Marshals wield their banners.
Hurling fire for ten thousand leagues,
streaming bells in eight directions.
Should any dare to test or resist
the ascent of the Perfected,
iron blades will strike them down,
the mighty Queen of Heaven will mete out punishment.
Dismembering ghostly souls,
wind and fire never cease.
Severing a thousand thousand heads,
shearing ten thousand ten thousand forms.
Demons shall not trespass,
ghosts shall not haunt.
The Three Officials and Northern Feng
inspect the ghostly encampments.
No refuge shall be granted,
the Golden Horse relays the decree.
Proclaimed without end,
all spirits heed the summons.
The Three Realms and Five Emperors,
in ranks, report to the Upper Clarity.

**Method:** Form the Jade Clarity mudra. For all talismans used to treat the body’s malevolent qi, employ the qi of the north to govern it.

**Incantation for Dispersing Qi**
Within the true resides the divine,
the Great Lord of Longevity.
The Lord of Wu Ying,
the Venerable White Prime.
The Great One, Controller of Destiny,
Peach and Plum unite in extension.
Holding talismans and grasping records,
they safeguard life and root its essence.
Ascending to the Upper Clarity,
entering and exiting the Flowery Chamber.
Within the Eight Obscurities,
in the subtlest of realms.
Below, they guard the human body,
the Muddy Pellet and Crimson Palace.
Within, they harmonize the five qi,
uniting the hundred spirits.
Ten revolutions restore the numinous,
the myriad qi ascend as immortals.

These eighteen lines: Form the Jade Clarity mudra, knock the teeth three times, chant the incantation three times, blow the northern qi upon the afflicted body, then inhale the qi and rub the painful area—peace will be restored.

**Incantation for Harmonizing All Matters**
A thousand harmonies, ten thousand unions,
naturally attain the true.

**Method:** For all harmonizations, hold water and face north, chant the incantation seven times, then blow the southern qi upon the water. Recite the matter in your heart seven times, spray toward the direction, and harmony will be achieved.

**Incantation for Treating Eye Ailments**
All heavens’ sun, moon, and starry hosts,
the revolving jade mechanism halts in unison.
Divine winds fall silent,
mountains and seas conceal their clouds.
Heaven is free of drifting veils,
the four qi shine clear and bright.

These seven lines: Take a piece of pure earth, face southeast, chant the incantation nine times, blow upon the earth, and use the consecrated water to wash the eyes—redness will immediately subside. For all eye ailments, use talismanic water.

**Incantation for Treating Epidemics**
Expel the demonic essences,
sever the heads of the Six Ghostly Blades.
The qi of all heavens surges,
my Dao daily ascends in glory.

These four lines: When entering a plague-stricken household to treat illness, use this to consecrate water and disperse qi.

**Incantation for Millet**
Thus did the Primordial Beginning suspend a precious pearl,
as large as a grain of millet,
within the empty mystery,
five measures above the earth.
The Primordial Beginning ascended and guided
the Heavenly Perfected, Great Spirits,
the Most High and Venerable,
the Perfected of Wondrous Conduct,
the boundless and utmost true Great Spirits of the ten directions,
countless multitudes,
all entering the pearl.
Heavenly beings gazed upward—
they saw only a shimmering haze,
entering through the pearl’s mouth,
and once inside, knew not where they were.
The people of the land dispersed,
the earth returned to levelness,
no longer slanted or sunken.
Within the pearl,
the Primordial Beginning expounded the complete scripture.
The Perfected oversaw the deliverance,
bestowing it upon me.
At that moment,
joy and celebration were beyond words.
The ritual matters were roughly complete,
the myriad heavens resumed their positions,
and in an instant,
all was silent, without lingering echo.
At that time, the heavenly beings who encountered the scriptural Dharma
were universally delivered,
preserving their allotted years,
free from harm.
The lands turned in reverence,
all embraced virtuous hearts—
no killing, no harm,
no envy, no jealousy,
no lewdness, no theft,
no greed, no desire,
no hatred, no resentment.
Words were free of embellishment,
speech free of evil sounds.
United in compassion and love,
even those of different bones became kin.
The land was at peace, the people prosperous,
rejoicing in great tranquility.
When the scripture first emerged as teaching,
a nation followed the Dao.
Those who held sincere devotion,
honored and revered it,
all attained deliverance across the ages.

**Method:** Hold red millet in the left hand, regardless of quantity. Form the Jade Clarity mudra with the right hand. Beginning with the east and proceeding to the lower direction, chant the incantation ten times for each direction. Visualize the Heavenly Perfected and Great Spirits of each direction, the Flying Heavenly Spirits and Divine Kings, a thousand chariots and ten thousand riders, all entering the millet. Chant a total of one hundred times for the ten directions. Draw the northwest qi and blow it upon the millet to treat all illnesses.

**Incantation for Numinous Treasure Water**
Heavenly Perfected, Heavenly Ford,
numinous essence, divine clarity.
Chant once to sever ghosts,
forever banish demonic essences.

The Celestial Stem’s true qi,
slays and exterminates perverse pestilence.
The water of true yang,
forever banishes ten thousand leagues away.

**Method:** With the left hand, form the Invocation mudra and hold the water. With the right hand, form the Jade Clarity mudra and point at the water. First chant the preceding incantation seven times, then chant the following incantation three times. Draw the southeast qi into the water, then trace the mudra within the water. Divine officials will attend the water as it flows.

**Numinous Treasure Needle**
Use a divine peach branch, five inches long, as the needle. Form the Jade Clarity mudra and blow the qi of the five directions upon the needle. Insert the needle into the afflicted area, then instruct the patient to inhale three times and cough three times before withdrawing the needle.

**Recitation of the Numinous Writ**
For all major matters of healing, visualize the body as the Primordial Beginning, seated upon a five-colored lion. Further visualize within the crown the Primordial Beginning, golden countenance and jade visage. Then, with the left hand form the Jade Clarity mudra and with the right the Upper Clarity mudra. Silently recite without regard to the number of repetitions. Draw the southeast qi and blow it into all talismanic water, using it as desired.

For all talismans, aside from their specific incantations, employ this invocation. From the main scripture, various incantations are briefly extracted. For all talismans, use their respective incantations and mudras, or employ specialized incense invocations as needed. Upon completion, recite the middle section while forming the Jade Clarity mudra. First draw the southeast qi and blow it, then recite the Great Jade Clarity Incantation and draw the northwest qi to blow it.

**Incantation:**
The thirty-two heavens,
the thirty-two emperors.

The myriad heavens conceal their secrets,

Within the heavens, emptiness and cavernous void,
the spontaneous numinous scripture.
The myriad heavens conceal their tones,

The Demon Kings oversee and raise,

The Azure Emperor guards the hun-soul,

The Azure Heaven Demon King, Bayuan Choubo.
The Vermilion Heaven Demon King, Fu Tian Dan Shi.
The White Heaven Demon King, Fan Shan Liu Mu.

The Yellow Heaven Demon King, Heng Tian Dan Li.
The Five Thearch Demon Kings,

Soaring and marching with drums,

Brandishing banners and beating drums,

Delivering humanity above,

The Three Officials of the Northern Feng,

*Concluding the Twenty-Third Scroll of the Great Rites of the Numinous Treasure of the Upper Clarity*
*Beginning the Twenty-Fourth Scroll of the Great Rites of the Numinous Treasure of the Upper Clarity*

The Illuminating and Merciful Perfected Lord Ning Quanzhen of the Cavernous Subtlety, Initiate of the Three Caverns of the Upper Clarity, bestows upon the Numinous Treasure Lineage Master Wang Qizhen, Disciple of the Dao

*Section on Ritual Recitation and Invocatory Procedures*

The scripture states: The sagely perfected who have attained the status of Perfected Ones penetrate the mysterious and fathom the subtle. This passage is not for recitation by ordinary worldly persons. Those who penetrate the mysterious and fathom the subtle, fully grasping its chapters, shall obtain the ten grades of merit and virtue.

For the most devoted scholars—those who recite and attain mastery—six grades of merit and virtue are conferred. For scholars of the worldly path who recite, three grades of merit and virtue are granted.

In reverent offering and solemn veneration, all scholars who perform these meritorious deeds shall obtain the five grades of blessed reward.

For those who recite this scripture—even the already perfected—it is said that the natural karmic retribution of merit and virtue shall deliver ten thousand generations of suffering ancestors, ascending them to the Vermilion Palace, where they shall be ranked according to the standards of the Vermilion Mound. After nine years, they shall be reborn, transformed, and attain noble status. When the merit of one’s own person is fulfilled, they shall ascend to the Golden Towers of the Upper Clarity and wander in revelry through the Jade Capital.

As for those who have merely attained learning, they may only deliver themselves, ascending to the Southern Palace, yet their merit cannot extend to their ancestors.

For worldly persons who recite, they may only prolong their lives and achieve liberation through the dissolution of the corpse, returning their form to the Great Void. They shall not attain the blessing of ascending to the Vermilion Mound, nor shall their ancestors be reborn and transformed.

The Song of the Demon Kings—recited a hundred times, one ascends to the Southern Palace; a thousand times, the Demon Kings come to escort; ten thousand times, one ascends to the Great Void. These are the hymns of the Three Realms, not mere refined texts.

Those who hear the numinous sound—whose hearts and forms return to faith, listening sincerely to the recitation—shall obtain the nine grades of blessed reward.

Those who perform these meritorious deeds—who resolve to conduct purification rites, burn incense, and recite the scriptures—shall obtain the three grades of blessed reward.

For the most devoted scholars who perform these meritorious deeds, they shall assuredly attain the status of ministers to the Later Sagely Thearchs of the Upper Clarity in the Golden Towers.

Those who comprehend its sound—the middle section—shall, by equalizing the power of its words, obtain the eight grades of blessed reward.

This sound—the sound of the middle section—possesses the four immeasurable and majestic spiritual powers of exorcism, deliverance, and perfection. Those who recite it shall obtain sixteen grades of auspicious response.

To pledge with golden treasures and a sincere heart, swearing an oath to Heaven, transmission follows the Twofold Dependence upon the Mysterious Regulations, once every forty thousand kalpas. To truly offer golden treasures and a sincere heart, one must adhere to the ancient statutes and proclaim the oath before the Ten Heavens.

These three clauses pertain to the procedures of transmission and reception, the statutes of the Upper Heavens, established once every forty thousand kalpas, in accordance with the ancient kalpic regulations. Since the Yellow Thearch received the Chart, Great Yu received the Talisman, and Gaoxin received the Heavenly Scriptures, down to the teachings bestowed by the Great Ultimate, how could there have been forty thousand kalpas? According to the new statutes revealed by the Celestial Matriarch upon her descent into the world, the teachings are transmitted once every four hundred years, with a forty-year period for transmission to a qualified recipient, and then another four hundred years before the next transmission. Altogether, no more than seven transmissions may occur. If a perfected one appears within four years, a single transmission of the three clauses may be permitted. These are the statutes governing the transmission and reception of the two great chapters of the Dharma and the forms of scripture recitation.

*Regulations for Extended Purification and Recitation*

The Dao states: During the extended purification of the first month, recite and intone this scripture on behalf of the departed souls of former generations, severing their bonds to earthly servitude and delivering them to the Southern Palace.

The first month is the month of the Upper Prime, when the Heavenly Officials convene, and the Earthly and Water Officials gather at the Purple Tenuity Palace of the Upper Prime to review all meritorious deeds, record names, and confer ranks and rewards.

Servitude entails the three paths of toil: the Heavenly Path of thunderous nets and lightning servitude, which is the labor of the Heavenly Officials; the Earthly Path of bearing sand and carrying stones, which is the labor of the Earthly Officials; and the Watery Path of drawing waves from the Milky Way, which is the labor of the Water Officials. There are also those conscripted as ghostly officials—sweeping the Five Marchmounts, laboring in the Prisons of Fengdu, or constructing embankments along the rivers and mountains—these are the servitudes of ghostly officials. Fearing that the departed souls of former generations may suffer these various paths of servitude, it is fitting in this month to undertake extended purification and recite the scriptures, delivering their souls to the Southern Palace.

During the extended purification of the seventh month, recite and intone this scripture to attain divine transcendence and immortality, with one’s name inscribed in the registers of the various heavens—the Yellow Register and the White Tablet—erasing death and inscribing life.

The seventh month is the month of the Middle Prime, when the Earthly Officials convene, and the Heavenly and Water Officials gather at the Solar Torch Palace of the Middle Prime to review merits and transgressions, recording names and celebrating the Assembly of the Middle Prime of Life. The Yellow Register is the Golden Register of Heaven, where the names of the living are inscribed. The White Tablet is the register of the dead. The so-called Golden Tablet records the names of the living, while the White Tablet erases the names of the dead. The transgressions of divine transcendents are recorded in the Cinnabar Tablets of the ledgers of sins, while the deaths of worldly persons are recorded in the Black Ledgers, all of which belong to the registers of the dead. Therefore, it is fitting in this month to undertake extended purification and recitation to deliver oneself, with one’s name inscribed in the registers of the various heavens, proclaiming life in the Yellow Register and the White Tablet, erasing one’s name from the death registers of the Northern Capital, inscribing life, and attaining divine transcendence and immortality.

During the extended purification of the tenth month, recite and intone this scripture on behalf of the king, the thearch, the lord, ministers, fathers, and sons, to pacify and secure the royal destiny, preserving the eternal endurance of Heaven, ensuring the dynasty’s perpetuity, and that they may forever remain as rulers of men.

The tenth month is the month of the Lower Prime, when the Water Officials convene, and the Heavenly and Earthly Officials, along with the true sages, immortals, and numinous spirits of all heavens, earths, and waters, the stellar bureaus, and the lords and masters of ghosts and spirits, universally review all merits, transgressions, good, and evil at the Tail Gate of the Eastern Ultimate, the source of the flowing waters, in the Clear and Cold Mansion. This is the month of the Universal Review and the Great Assembly of Established Life. It is fitting to undertake extended purification and recite the scriptures on behalf of the king, the thearch, the lord, ministers, fathers, and sons, ensuring the perpetuity of their lineage and their eternal rule as lords of men. By performing these meritorious deeds, the various heavens shall protect and commend them, recording their virtuous accomplishments.

The Master said: In the world, when lawsuits entangle the living, it is because the departed ancestors have brought suit in the courts of the unseen, dragging the living into their plight. This disrupts the reckoning of fate and brings misfortune, extending even to descendants. As a disciple of the Dao, one should first, during the Upper Prime, deliver the seven ancestors and nine lineages, severing the bonds of karmic retribution and ascending to the Southern Palace. Next, during the Middle Prime, deliver oneself—erasing the register of death, inscribing the ledger of life, and recording one’s name in the heavens—to attain the immortal Dao. Only then, during the Lower Prime, may one pray for the peace of the kingdom and the sacred mandate of the thearch, and, in accordance with the method, stabilize the afflicted regions by invoking the thirty-two celestial jade scripts of the heavens to secure those directions. This summons the harmonious qi of the various heavens, bringing the people to acclaim the Great Peace.

If a practitioner of immortality dies before achieving liberation, they remain bound in servitude to the Three Bureaus, their karmic debt extending to themselves, their name inscribed in the Black Register. Without their own immortal name recorded, how can they find leisure to perform meritorious deeds for the kingdom and the people? Therefore, at the beginning of each of the Three Primes—from Upper to Middle to Lower—one must practice the Dao and recite the scriptures to avoid transgressing the statutes and regulations.

On the days of the Eight Nodal Points, reciting this scripture enables one to become a Perfected of the Nine Palaces. The Eight Nodal Points are the four *li* (Beginnings of the Seasons), the two *zhi* (Solstices), and the two *fen* (Equinoxes). On these days, one should face the corresponding direction and recite the scripture to dispel and avert the calamities of the preceding half-season, as well as to pacify the nine provinces, mitigating disasters of flood, fire, blade, drought, and famine. By performing these meritorious deeds, one may attain the rank of Perfected of the Nine Palaces.

On one’s *benming* (natal destiny day), reciting this scripture purifies the hun-soul and spirit, ensuring the eternal preservation of the myriad qi. One avoids suffering and affliction, the body radiates light, the Three Realms provide guardianship, the Five Thearchs dispatch their attendants, and the myriad spirits pay homage. One’s name is inscribed in the heavens, and upon the fulfillment of merit and virtue, one ascends to the Highest Clarity.

The *benming* is the day of one’s original generation and transformation, revered by the various heavens. Yet in this Lower Prime, born into the world of the Five Turbidities, the five emotions assail one another, the six desires bind one, the seven *po* prevail, and the three *hun* weep in sorrow. Spirit and qi are both lost, the empty corpse moves, and the hundred demons vie for dominance. Moreover, the three *hun* are inherently linked to the Three Terraces, governing the qi of the Great Mystery’s generative mansion. By nature, they delight in wandering and soaring through the Three Realms. Upon encountering the root of life, they establish the *benming* and return to the body. If one recites the scriptures on this day, one can restrain the *hun* and *po*, thus purifying and settling the spirit, preserving the myriad qi without dissipation. Evil is kept at bay, the body radiates light, and the deities of the Three Realms stand guard, while the numinous officials of the Five Thearchs receive one.

Yet recitation alone is not sufficient. On this day, one may also practice the various methods of the *Great Cavern*, the supreme Dao of Highest Clarity, and the arts of nourishing life. All such practices make this an auspicious day, free from the trials of demonic testing. By accumulating such merit, the myriad spirits pay homage, and one’s name is inscribed in the heavens. When merit and virtue are complete, the *hun* ascends to Highest Clarity.

As for the Three Clarities: above the Four Brahmā Heavens lies the Heaven of the Nine Immortals, governed by the Palace of the Great Ultimate, where the Twelve Heavens of the Grand Clarity are inhabited by the Nine Immortals and ruled by the Nine Elders, with the Golden Portals of the Later Sages as their seat. This is the domain of the Lord of the Morning Dao. Above this are the Twelve Heavens of Highest Clarity, inhabited by the Nine Perfected, governed by the Lord of the Jade Dawn. Above that are the Twelve Heavens of the Great Peerless Jade Clarity, inhabited by the Nine Sages, ruled by the Primordial Beginning. This is the Heaven within Heaven, comprising the Thirty-Six Heavens. Highest Clarity lies above the Grand Clarity and below the Jade Clarity.

In the first month, recite the scripture for *Longevity and Enduring Vision*, the *Jade Talisman of the Great Tenuity*, the *Mysterious Pearl of the Jade Tablet*. The qi descends into the Three Fields, the hundred spirits stand in attendance, and the myriad sages approach the throne. The flying Brahmā net-wheel connects the hidden and the numinous.
*Right Talisman*: Wear this in the first month to summon the qi of the True Fire of Eastern Florescence, which enters the body, granting longevity and enduring vision, with boundless post-celestial potential.

In the seventh month, recite the scripture for *Longevity and Enduring Vision*, the *Mysterious Register of the Nine Immortals*, the *Golden Tablet of the Dragon Script*. It illumines the Great Mystery, the myriad thearchs offer rites, the Five Phases revolve, and the Golden Cavern and Jade Chamber receive the mandate to prolong life.
*Right Talisman*: Wear this in the seventh month to summon the qi of the Numinous True Mother’s *tang*-colored essence, which enters the body to generate the qi of metal, wood, and earth, granting longevity and enduring vision. With prolonged practice, the body ascends to Highest Clarity.

In the tenth month, recite the scripture for *Longevity and Enduring Vision*, the *Precious Register of the Jade Thearch*. The true origin disperses and spreads, brightly illuminating the nine thoroughfares. The spirit transforms upon the Thearch’s terrace, the Brahmā resonance fills the Great Void, and one circulates through the Six Directions, with the true qi secretly aiding.
*Right Talisman*: Wear this in the tenth month to summon the qi of the Five Lords of the Five Qi of the Northern Direction and the myriad worthies, which enters the body to generate the qi of water and wood, granting longevity and enduring vision with boundless post-celestial potential.

On the Eight Nodal Points, recite the scripture for *Longevity and the Great Thearch’s Enduring Vision*. The true qi forms a net, the empty ascends to the Mysterious Flower, the Three Passes are unobstructed, the Eight Effulgences are arrayed, and one merges with the sun to become a Perfected.
*Right Talisman*: Wear this on the Eight Nodal Points to summon the qi of the Yellow Thearch, Lord of the Gathering of Plans, which enters the body to generate the qi of earth and fire, granting longevity and causing the spirits to attend the Jade Perfected.

On one’s *benming*, recite the scripture of the *Precious Register of the Descent of the Perfected of the Jade Clarity of the Divine Empyrean*. The fetal immortal ascends to the upper effulgence, refining the essence-spirit. The left commands the Jade Flower, the right whistles to the Golden Dawn. One commands spirits and employs deities, ever preserving integrity and uprightness.
*Above Talismans*: Inscribe these on plain silk with cinnabar, practice them in secret, and do not speak of them to others. On the birthday of a cultivator of the true, face southeast, burn them in fire, and ingest them with pure water.

The Three Bureaus’ secret recitation:
The Master said: The supreme method of delivering beings emits a luxuriant radiance, dispelling celestial disasters above and averting terrestrial calamities below, aiding the myriad beings externally while refining the hundred spirits internally. The gateway to its practice begins with single-minded devotion. The method of recitation prioritizes focused contemplation. Thus, one harmonizes breath and qi, modulates the voice to be harmonious and flowing, visualizes the lushness of the three qi, and gathers the forest of the hundred spirits. This refines the self within and nurtures beings without.

The essence of recitation and cultivation: Enter the oratory, burn incense, settle the mind, and harmonize the qi. Withdraw the radiance to manifest internally, free from the intrusion of myriad thoughts. Sit upright without leaning or slouching, ensuring the path of the ox-cart remains unobstructed and the qi of the dragon and tiger flows ceaselessly. Only then may one recite the scriptures, each with its proper focus.

There are recitations of the spirit, the heart, and the qi—beyond these lies the recitation of intent. For the rulers of heaven, earth, and state, and for celestial phenomena, employ the recitation of the spirit. To avert calamities and perform supplications for others, use the recitation of the heart. To deliver all departed souls, apply the recitation of qi. For urgent matters, retire to a secluded chamber, silently recite the divine texts, and proceed with the ritual. From beginning to end, maintain proper visualization.

Recite the preface once, then pause. From the scripture’s opening, recite ten times as one cycle. Upon completion, submit the memorial in secret to the celestial bureaus, and ascend the spirits from the dwelling.

The oral instructions state:
In the first month, it is the Upper Prime; the practice resides in the Upper Palace. Visualize your infant self within the cinnabar field, ascending with the three-colored cloud-qi to return and abide in the Upper Palace. The sixth month follows the same method.
In the seventh month, it is the Middle Prime; the practice resides in the Middle Palace. Visualize the infant self within the middle field.
In the tenth month, it is the Lower Prime; the practice resides in the Lower Palace. Visualize the infant self within the lower field. The twelfth month follows the same method.
For prayers and averting misfortune, use the Upper Palace. For refining qi, use the Lower Palace. For delivering departed souls, use the Middle Palace.

When performing the nine kinds of yin merits, dispelling calamities, or establishing merit for one’s own deliverance, visualize yourself as the Primordial Beginning, seated upon a five-colored lion suspended in empty space, dwelling within the radiance of the sun. Each time you recite scriptures for others, visualize the Primordial Beginning in the Mud-Pill Palace of the upper field descending into the Crimson Palace, and gather the yang soul of the supplicant to receive the scriptures. As the Primordial Beginning bestows the scriptures, it is akin to the Lord of the Dao. When reciting, first perform the stabilizing method, then listen with focused attention as the Heavenly Worthy recites the scriptures, their resonant voice like a bell sounding into the lower cinnabar field. Recite three thousand times in the qi-field, three thousand times in the middle field, and four thousand times in the upper field, completing ten thousand cycles of merit.

**On the Practice of the Dao and Recitation**
The Scripture states: On the day of practice, one must bathe with fragrant water, fast, and enter the chamber.

The Master said: The "day of practice" refers to the appointed day for reciting scriptures, when one must bathe with fragrant water.

**Method for Bathing with Five-Fragrance Decoction**
Use:
- *Qingmuxiang* (Aucklandia root),
- *Baizhi* (Angelica dahurica),
- *Chenxiang* (Aquilaria),
- *Baitanxiang* (Sandalwood),
- *Gansong* (Nardostachys).

Take twenty-four *zhū* of each, grind and sift, then boil in one *dàn* of east-flowing spring water until it reaches a rolling boil.

Regarding *Qingmuxiang*, the *Great Possession of the Three Marvels Scripture* of the Celestial Mother states: It is the pure fragrance of the five seasons, dispelling the filth of the dusty world. When sincerely offered to the Supreme Mystery, burning it opens the path through the dust and filth, spanning five *zhàng* to connect with the celestial realms.

**Oral Instructions:**
Place the five-fragrance decoction in a vessel. First disrobe, burn incense, and sit to the left. Visualize the radiant essence of the sun and moon, their five-colored lights intertwining and entering the decoction. Next, visualize five colored immortals and five jade maidens arriving from the five directions, burning incense, scattering flowers, and holding towels and water at your sides. Stir the decoction thirty-two times with a ladle and recite the incantation:
*"Five-fragrance mysterious water, essence of sun and moon,
Purify and refine the body, dispel the turbid and retain the clear.
The dust of the corpse falls away, foul qi is swept clean.
The root of the fetal knot scatters, soaring through empty space,
Ascending into the Supreme Clarity."*

Upon finishing, click the teeth together and recite again:
*"Primordial true fluid, refining qi to quicken the spirit.
Bathed in the azure blossom, reciting the cavernous scriptures.
May my seven ancestors ascend as immortals,
As I soar into the Supreme Clarity."*

After reciting, click the teeth thirty-two times. First, drink a vessel of the decoction, adjusting its temperature to suit. Then, use another vessel to wash the hair. Begin by reciting the hair-unbinding incantation:
*"The divine palace shakes the heavens, black clouds disperse.
Molten gold and fire bells gleam boundlessly.
Grant me passage to the true, roaming the celestial realms,
Delivering boundless beings, summoning the immortal fate."*

After unbinding the hair, recite the hair-washing incantation:
*"Essence of sun and moon, flowing crystals in the Mud-Pill Palace.
Nourishing the nine palaces, the hundred spirits rejoice in awe.
The corpse’s residue vanishes, the true master gazes below.
Bestowed the divine tiger, I become an imperial guest."*

Upon finishing, recite the disrobing incantation:
*"Five Bushels array my robes, dragon and tiger attend the true.
The Three Luminaries shine brightly, ascending to the Jade Capital.
Disrobing to become immortal, grant me eternal life."*

After disrobing, recite the bathing incantation:
*"Jade spring of the Celestial Pond, bathe my form.
Internally refine the five viscera, externally open the nine gates.
Dispel the black and unblock the paths, cleansing the corpse’s filth.
Ten thousand recitations ensure my ascent to the imperial court."*

Upon completing the bath, recite the crown-donning incantation:
*"Azure clouds layer the mystery, granting me passage to the true.
The crown and topknot summon immortals, the five qi gather the true.
Divine radiance shines forth, ascending to the imperial court."*

After donning the crown, recite the clothing incantation:
*"Divine lads attend my robes, jade maidens burn incense.
Ascending to bow in the scripture chamber, jade tones resound.
Deliver my seven ancestors, wash away misfortune.
Prolong life and preserve existence, cloud-rooted treasure nectar."*

Recite the decoction-drinking incantation:
*"The Yellow Spirit guards the pass, the Azure Emperor protects the soul.
Heavenly hounds roar, myriad demons lose their essence,
The corpse’s blood is cleansed, the green worms vanish.
The seven *po* are refined and transformed, purple clouds arise.
Roaming and feasting in the Great Mystery, high immortals ride alongside."*

**Protocol for Entering the Chamber to Cultivate and Recite**
The Scripture states: Upon entering the chamber, face east, click the teeth thirty-two times to ascend to the thirty-two heavens, and bow thirty-two times with the heart. Close the eyes, still the thoughts, and visualize the body seated amidst the azure, yellow, and white cloud-qi, shrouded in mist within and without. A green dragon and white tiger, vermilion bird and dark warrior, lions and white cranes array to the left and right. The sun and moon illuminate brilliantly, suffusing the chamber with radiance. A circular image emerges from the nape, its light shining in all directions. Maintain this visualization with utmost clarity.

As stated in the *Scripture of Salvation* annotated by the Daoist Sovereign Emperor: Facing east is because the mortal realm gazes toward the Dark Capital, where the Jade Dawn resides in the east. Moreover, the Primordial Azure lies in the northeast, and the east is the source of generative qi. Thus, when performing the Dao or entering the chamber, one turns to face it to summon and extend the numinous qi.

The method of clicking the teeth: the left is the Heavenly Bell, used to strike down demonic spirits; the right is the Heavenly Chime, used to gather the hundred spirits; the center is the Heavenly Drum, used to summon the perfected sages. When entering the chamber to recite scriptures, contemplating the true and invoking the Dao, one clicks the teeth thirty-two times and bows thirty-two times with the heart. Internally, this exhausts one’s sincerity; externally, it corresponds to the numerological pattern. Internally, it gathers the divine spirits; externally, it extinguishes malevolent essences. Laterally, it encompasses the perfect principle; upward, it reaches the lofty perfected. Practicing and preserving this superior method leaves nothing unaddressed.

The method of bowing with the heart: one should visualize the Celestial Palace and its Emperor, who descends to pour down the qi of the Heavenly Perfected, like the radiance of jade clouds, entering one’s body. Swallowing and circulating it throughout, the act of bowing with the heart moves the spirits through sincerity. When devotion reaches its utmost, this is called "bowing with the heart surpassing bowing with the form." It is also said that in cultivating the superior Dao, one need only bow with the heart, thus avoiding disturbance to the brain palace—this is the meaning here.

The primary purpose is to summon forth the divine envoys within one’s body, such as the Merit Officers and Messengers, all transformed by the Dao-qi within oneself and in communion with the Dao. When one circulates the utmost true, the summons elicits wondrous response, transmitting the message to the celestial realms, penetrating one’s will and intent to harmonize with the Great Dao.

**Internal Practices for Cultivation and Recitation**
The Master states: For all cultivation and recitation, first bathe and change garments as before. After concentrating the spirit and contemplating the Dao, before entering the oratory chamber, first click the teeth and recite the *Entering the Chamber Spell*:

*"Fourfold Luminous Merit Officers, Dragon-Tiger Messengers, Orthodox One’s Generative Qi, Handmaidens of the Oratory—may the Radiant Youth and the Supreme Maiden enter the Yellow Chamber, convey my entreaty, and ensure it is heard above. Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by statute and ordinance!"*

Next, step forward with the right foot, approach the scripture stand, light incense facing east, click the teeth nine times, and recite the *Heart Incense Spell*:

*"The Dao unites with the heart; faith is conveyed through incense. Holding the jade censer, the heart abides before the Emperor. The True Sovereign gazes below; the immortal sashes descend to the hall. Let my petition be transmitted, reaching the profound mystery."*

Then, sit upright and first recite the *Purification of the Mouth Spell*:

*"Cinnabar Mouth Spirit, expel filth and dispel miasma. Tongue Spirit of Rectitude, link life and nourish the spirit. Thousand-Teeth Spirit of the Net, repel evil and guard the true. Throat Spirit of the Mighty Tiger, qi-spirit guides the fluids. Heart Spirit of the Cinnabar Origin, let me commune with the true. Contemplate the spirit, refine the fluids, and the upright qi will ever abide."*

Next, recite the *Purification of the Body Spell*:

*"Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, pacify this bodily form. May the disciple’s soul and ethereal soul, the five viscera’s mysteries, be shrouded in darkness. Green Dragon and White Tiger, arrayed in splendid ranks; Vermilion Bird and Dark Warrior, guarding this bodily form."*

Then recite the additional spell:

*"I wash my body with the sun, refine my form with the moon. Immortals assist me; Jade Maidens protect my form. The twenty-eight constellations unite with me. A thousand evils and ten thousand afflictions are dispelled by the spell and purified."*

Next, close the eyes and still the heart, visualizing the Green Dragon of the east, whose mouth exhales the white qi of moon essence and kidney water, as if bathing the body in the great sea, washing away the impurities of the five viscera. After a long while, descend the true fire from the south, merging with the red qi of solar essence at the heart. The fire burns the body and the oratory, inside and out, leaving not a trace of smoke or filth. One then perceives a great wind blowing away all dust and grime. Visualize an infant within the cinnabar field, ascending from the earthly gate, pacing the Dipper, mounting the altar, and merging with one’s body.

Silently recite the *Purification of Heaven and Earth Spell*.

Within the cavern’s mysterious void, radiant and vast is the Great Origin.
The mighty spirits of the eight directions render me natural.
The talismanic commands of the Numinous Treasure universally proclaim to the Nine Heavens:
*Qianluo Danna*, the cavern’s mighty *gang*, the Supreme Mystery.
They sever demons and bind evil, slaying a thousand ghosts.
The Central Mountain’s divine spell, the Primordial Jade Script of Yuanshi.
Recite it once, and demons retreat while years extend.
Treading the Five Peaks, the Eight Seas take heed.
The Demon Kings bow their heads, attending my chamber.
Malevolence and filth dissolve, the Dao’s *qi* ever abides.

Gently inhale the true *qi* of the four directions, lightly blow it over the body, then visualize heaven and earth purified.
Next, envision the infant transforming into my form, becoming the True Person of Original Destiny—crowned, robed, and shod in the colors of my natal year’s *nayin* element.
Once the visualization is settled, gather the spirit and take one’s seat.
Then, imagine one’s own dignified bearing, and with the heart, pay homage to the ten directions, beginning in the east. For each direction, bow once in the heart.
Afterward, sit upright facing east and silently recite the *Mystic Essence of the Scripture’s Opening*:

Cloud-script fills the Great Void, at the dawn of kalpas.
Now distant, now near, now sinking, now floating.
Wandering the five directions, over a *zhang* and more.
The Heavenly True Sovereign took brush in hand and inscribed,
expounding the cavern’s chapters, then writing the numinous talismans.
Yuanshi descended, the true scriptures unfurled.
Luminous in presence, obscure in absence.
Sinking illness heals itself; worldly toil may be floated away.
The dark realms find solace, and thus one ascends to the Immortal Capital.

Then, recite the scripture’s preface from the beginning, up to the passage on the recipient’s body.
Visualize the Jade Lads and Jade Maidens of the Five Directions and Five Emperors—twenty-four for each direction, totaling one hundred twenty—descending to attend beside the scripture table.
Next, recite up to the passage on ascending to the Upper Clarity.

The method states:
Close the eyes and silently contemplate the Thirty-Two Heavens, beginning at the northern quadrant with the Great Yellow Sovereign’s *Huangzeng* Heaven.
Proceed eastward into the south, circling through the four directions, each with eight heavens, situated within the Azure Empyrean and amid purple clouds.
Envision the eight eastern heavens positioned above the left ear’s tendon,
the eight western heavens above the right ear’s tendon,
the eight southern heavens before the forehead,
and the eight northern heavens behind the head,
each heaven layered with clouds of various hues.
Within each celestial palace’s towering halls, visualize the Emperor seated in solemn dignity.

The eight eastern heavens: azure crowns, azure banners, azure robes, azure skirts—beginning in the north and proceeding south.
The eight southern heavens: azure crowns, crimson banners, vermilion robes, yellow skirts—beginning in the west and proceeding east.
The eight western heavens: azure crowns, golden banners, white robes, white skirts, swaying—beginning in the south and proceeding west.
The eight northern heavens: azure crowns, white banners, vermilion skirts, black robes—beginning in the west and proceeding east.
Each is arrayed with attendants in formation.

Next, visualize the spirits beginning from the Great August Heaven. For each heaven, first silently knock the teeth together once, allowing the resonance to correspond to that heaven. Silently recite the Emperor’s taboo name, directing the mind’s sincerity upward to be heard in that heaven. Bow once in the heart, without moving the body, letting the mind’s reverence manifest as if the body were prostrating.

Circulate through the ten directions, completing thirty-two cycles. Then, circulate and transform the qi: from the upper cinnabar field at the Hall of Impression, emit the dark azure *xuanwu* qi; from the middle cinnabar field at the heart, emit the yellow *yuan* qi; from the lower cinnabar field below the navel, emit the white *shi* qi. Initially, they emerge like threads, gradually thickening until they merge with the external eastern azure qi, southern vermilion qi, western white boundary, and northern black qi, descending from each direction to blend with the *xuan*, *yuan*, and *shi* qi, forming clouds of three-colored qi.

First, they intertwine around the body’s form; next, they suffuse the entire chamber and the seat where one sits, leaving no space untouched. The practitioner’s body sits amidst a radiance of a hundred treasures, the qi of clouds penetrating through the entire body, filling the five viscera within and without with lush abundance. The qi swirls around the chamber, then extends outward to envelop one direction. The practitioner swallows saliva three times and sends forth a breath of qi, both entering the cinnabar palace, where they transform into a golden beam of three colors, piercing straight through the Mud Pill and dispersing to circulate and emanate. A single perfected one ascends to pay homage, while the Primordial Beginning Supreme Emperor sits majestically at the center. One breath transforms into Jade Dawn on the left, another breath transforms into the Venerable Lord on the right—all distinctly clear.

After a long while, the vision merges with heaven and earth.

Next, circulate the left hand’s Jade Purity mudra, extending it to the *chen* line. Direct the liver’s qi: one text says from the left eye, another from the left ear. It emerges as the Azure Dragon, attending on the left. One version states that the qi ascends with a blue-robed perfected one riding upon it, ascending to pay homage to the Three Heavens.

Next, direct the white qi from the lungs: one text says from the nose, another from the right ear. It emerges as the White Tiger, guarding the right. One version states that the qi ascends with a white-robed perfected one riding upon it, ascending to pay homage to the Three Heavens.

Next, direct the red qi from the heart: one text says from the mouth, another from the crown of the head. It emerges as the Vermilion Bird, leading the way. One version states that the qi bears a ruler in courtly attire, holding a jade tablet, ascending to pay homage to the Three Heavens.

Next, direct the black qi from the kidneys: one text says from the ears, another from the feet. It emerges as the Dark Warrior, following behind. One version states that the qi ascends with a black-robed perfected one, ascending to pay homage to the Three Heavens.

Next, direct the yellow qi from the spleen, emerging from the lower cinnabar field below the navel as a lion standing below, while the cinnabar field above bears the perfected one aloft, head raised to ascend and pay homage. One text says twelve emerge from the root of the tongue, arrayed to the left, right, and front. Another says the azure qi from the gallbladder emerges from the right eye to transform.

Next, circulate the white qi from the Abyssal Mystery Palace at the navel. With the left hand, trace the twelve qi mudras, returning to the *wu* position to manifest thirty-six auspicious cranes arrayed in the four directions. One text says nine emerge from the Mud Pill, stationed beyond the lion.

Next, with both hands, trace the mudras of the *si*, *wu*, and *wei* palaces at the celestial court above. Raise the eyes to the heavens, and the radiance of the sun and moon, the golden and plain qi, flashes forth six cranes, which disperse before the two eyebrows at the celestial court above, riding the qi as they float.

Next, visualize the Six Harmonies mansion behind the eyebrows in the two small cavities. The sun and moon emerge there: the sun with nine rays of purple and red, the moon with ten rays of yellow and white, nine inches from the face, illuminating the chamber with a brilliance like gold and jade.

Next, visualize the radiance of the sun and moon pouring into the nose, entering the Golden Flower Palace four inches behind the brain. Then, from the Purple Tenuity Jade Pillow Palace, the light congeals into a luminous sphere, emitting from the nape of the neck a nine-colored circular image, its rays like rainbows, as large as a chariot wheel, illuminating the ten directions. Visualize each detail clearly.

When this is complete, silently recite the secret incantation: *Tanluo Yuluo*. "Silently" means the words do not pass the lips, and the ears do not hear the sound.

Next, move the mouth slightly to vocalize the sound, uttering: *Wushang Xuanyuan yunyun*. When reaching the section on "opening the petition," state one’s position and silently present the petition, expressing all that the heart desires. For example, if today is an auspicious day for prolonged fasting, state accordingly. If not fasting, proceed according to the day’s practice, such as "purifying the hall to cultivate the scripture." If practicing the Dao of the Three Caverns’ covenant, state "cultivating the practice." If regularly reciting scriptures, state "purifying the hall to recite scriptures," or "for the immeasurable deliverance of beings," or "universal deliverance of the living and the dead," using "immeasurable" as appropriate. If for a specific matter, state "for such-and-such a matter," concluding with "your servant, so-and-so." If it is not fitting to name oneself, simply state "your servant, reciting the scripture for rebirth," or if performing divination for another, state "on behalf of so-and-so." If reciting for oneself or another according to the text, follow the principle of circulating through ten cycles.

When the petition is complete, state: "May the prayer ascend to the presence of the Most Revered Primordial Beginning Supreme Emperor in the thirty-two heavens above the Primordial August Upper Realm." One version states that from here, one may also ascend to pay homage to the Three Heavens or the Nine Heavens.

For each of the thirty-two breaths drawn, begin again from the Supreme Yellow Emperor Layered Heaven, visualizing the descent of true qi like the radiance of jade and rosy clouds, pouring down to bathe the practitioner’s body, which is absorbed and swallowed through the nose.

For the qi of the eight eastern heavens, visualize it entering the liver, gallbladder, sinews, and vessels, where its essence transforms into the Lord of Primordial Flower, residing in the liver.

For the qi of the eight southern heavens, visualize it entering the heart and pericardium’s divine palace, where its essence transforms into the Lord of Life Mandate, residing in the heart.

For the qi of the eight western heavens, visualize it entering the lungs, spleen, and stomach, where its essence transforms into the Venerable White Prime Spirit, residing in the lungs.

For the qi of the eight northern heavens, visualize it entering the kidneys and bones, where its essence transforms into the Lord of Peach Vitality, residing below the navel.

After circulating the qi through the ten directions, visualize the perfected one within the cinnabar field, reciting the scripture in a soft voice. For the first recitation, begin with "Once, in the Primordial Azure Heaven..." and continue to the end of the preface, concluding the visualization. Next, begin reciting from the *Primordial Beginning Cavern Mystery* and continue to the end of the scripture.

For every ten recitations, perform one visualization, taking ten recitations as one *pass*, and ten *passes* as one *cycle*. Once ten *passes* are complete, visualize the spirits entering their respective palaces according to the prescribed method.

The Master said: The methods of scripture recitation each have their own focus. There are *mind invocations*, *soft invocations*, and *silent invocations*. Thus, *mind invocation* means visualizing the spirit within the heart and invoking with intent; *soft invocation* means reciting in a voice audible only to oneself; *silent invocation* means merely mouthing the words so that others cannot hear. There are also *spirit recitation*, *heart recitation*, and *qi recitation*—these correspond to the upper, middle, and lower cinnabar fields. Beyond these, there is *intent recitation*, each varying according to the weight of the matter, distinguishing between inner and outer recitation. When reciting, do so in a low voice; when chanting, intone clearly. Swallow saliva once every ten words to nourish the qi and moisten the inner palaces. Tap the teeth once every hundred words to gather the perfected and harmonize the spirits, externally preserving the body from becoming an empty husk devoid of spirit. If a single character is mispronounced, recite the preceding thirty characters again. If a character is skipped, recite the preceding fifty characters again before continuing. Do not rise or move until two chapters are completed. After ten recitations, perform one visualization; at the end of a chapter, one may rest and take nourishment. Whenever resting or taking nourishment, immediately resume visualization as before. Do not allow the mind to wander into confusion or vulgar thoughts, nor let intent stray from the supreme Dao, the lofty sagely, and the true method. The heart must revere the scriptures of the Three Treasures, the Lords, the Masters, and the parents; the will must honor the *Emerald Jade Flower Precious Chapters*; the body must pay homage with incense, morning and evening devotions, bowing, and kneeling. If the mouth recites while the heart wanders, if form and voice diverge from intent, if one merely chants for merit or seeks swift completion for the sake of numbers, if characters are mispronounced or scriptures recited carelessly, how can ten thousand recitations bring one to ride the clouds and plow the heavens? Even a hundred million recitations will only sink one deeper into the mire, rendering the practice an empty husk. Those who fault the Dao as empty words do not realize their own failure to attain it. One must receive instruction from a master and recite in accordance with heavenly principles. If after ten thousand recitations one does not ascend to the Great Void, the fault lies with the practitioner’s own deception, and no immortal or perfected rank will be attained. Disciples who receive and recite these scriptures must strive diligently, avoiding the transgressions of careless recitation and reckless disclosure. To violate these is to lack the Dao and compassion. Heaven has its clear statutes; the spirits dare not show partiality.

**Essential Instructions for Reciting the Supreme Scripture**
Middle finger at the middle joint, offer incense, and visualize three bows.
The Dao says: Pinch the upper joint of the middle finger, bow with the heart, and offer incense.
*"Once, in the Primordial Stillness, I attained long life..."*
Hold the tablet and rise.
The Dao says: *"Ascend to the floating void..."*
Offer incense, bow with the heart, and bow once to each of the ten directions, offering incense and bowing once for each.
The ten directions extend five *zhang* above the earth.
Offer incense, bow with the heart, and bow three times.
*"From the Primordial Beginning to the ascent into the Upper Clarity..."*
Upper Clarity mudra.
The Dao says: *"Cease bathing and observe the fast."*
Middle finger at the middle joint, offer incense, hold the tablet, and stand.
Enter the chamber and proceed thus clearly.
Visualize and bow to the Three and Two Heavens.
Silent incantation: Bow three times, offer incense, and recite the silent incantation.
*"Supreme Mysterious Origin..."*
Exit the palace and present the petition.
Before the Most High Primordial Lord’s honored seat:
Bow three times, guide the qi twenty-two times, and bow with the heart thirty-two times.
*"Primordial Beginning Cavern Mystery..." to "encircling the ten directions."*
*Gen* mudra.
*"Within... approaching the throne."*
Offer incense and bow three times.
*"Eastern Limitless..." to "delivering immeasurable beings."*
*Zhen* mudra.
South: *Li* mudra.
West: *Dui* mudra.
North: *Kan* mudra.
Northeast: *Gen* mudra.
Southeast: *Xun* mudra.
Southwest: *Kun* mudra.
Northwest: *Qian* mudra.
Above: Middle finger at the upper joint.
Below: Middle finger at the middle joint.
For each direction, offer incense, bow with the heart once, and visualize the divine king of that direction, clad in crimson robes, a black sash, jade pendants, and holding a jade tablet. Communicate the intent, proclaim the white scripture, burn a talisman in the incense burner, and visualize each spirit bowing in reverence.
*"The perfected of the ten directions..." to "whistling and singing in harmony."*
*You* mudra.
The Five Elders open the path.
Middle finger at the middle joint.
*"The host of immortals..." to "turning the light and returning the carriage."*
*Wei* mudra, overseeing the perfected and delivering the living.
*Yin* mudra.
*"All heavens..." to "liberating your servant’s ancestors."*
Your servant, so-and-so, humbly prays...
*"To the formless realm of pure conduct."*
East: azure; West: white; South: cinnabar; North: black; the four corners: multicolored radiance; above and below: yellow and mysterious. Adorned and guarded, the Supreme Feathered Talismans and their thousand chariots and ten thousand riders follow the colors of their directions. Recite the *Mysterious Pledge*, visualize the divine image, bow three times, recite the incantation, bow again, and visualize the audience.

When the scripture has been recited ten times, click the teeth thirty-six times, swallow saliva thirty-six times, bow to the ten directions with the heart, then rise facing south and descend from the seat. Next, stand facing east, bow three times with the heart, close the eyes, and silently pray:
*"Your servant So-and-So respectfully recites the Golden Writ and Jade Scripture. Ten cycles now complete, I beseech the dragon palanquin’s descent. Heavenly spirits descend, dispatching the Six Dings. Nine ancestors ascend in flight; I soar to Highest Clarity."*

Next, close the eyes, click the teeth nine times, swallow saliva ten times, then turn north, bow three times with the heart, and silently intone:
*"Supreme August Perfected, enable my ascent to perfection. Purified fast, refined through ablutions, I chant and sing the Golden Writ. Seven Mysteries dispersed, I ascend to the Great Void. Prolong years and abide forever, inscribe my name in the Registers."*

Reenter your palaces and chambers; let no disorder arise. When next summoned, return as before, in accordance with precedent."*

**Inner Recitation**
The master says: In all practices of recitation—delivering from distress, dispelling calamities, subduing and rescuing, incanting over objects, crushing malevolent spirits, exorcising and suppressing inauspicious omens, repelling and expelling strange lights, summoning dragons to govern rain, praying for clear skies and luminous vision, halting floods and extinguishing fires, eliminating plagues and removing harm, issuing talismans and consecrating water, restraining venomous beasts, seeking transcendence—cultivate the seven classics and eight wefts.

Invocation of the Perfected and summoning of spirits both require the secret recitation of the *Divine Scripture*. After ten thousand repetitions, whatever one desires shall swiftly manifest through numinous efficacy. Upon reaching one hundred thousand repetitions, one attains spontaneity in sitting meditation, and transformation knows no bounds. In times of great need, one may inscribe cryptic words, burn them, and scatter the ashes, or write them upon cliffs and boulders in mountain valleys, bury them in the earth, or submerge them in water. For gathering immortal medicines to cure illness, this *Divine Scripture* is employed—those who recite and uphold it follow the oral instructions.
