**Classification of Scripture Passages**
The master says: The *Great Rites of the Numinous Treasure* contain sixty-four sentences of *Great Brahmā* cryptic speech, corresponding to the numbers of the *Sūtra of the Sun*. They emerged before heaven and earth, prior to the hexagrams, embodying the ancient and present symbols of yin and yang. When the *Great Brahmā* unfolded the chart, at the inception of numbers, the Primal Mother of Kun was already revealed, binding and covering, while the nine suns guided Qian, and the names of the two hexagrams were established.

By the time of Emperor Wu of Han, the Queen Mother of the West descended to transmit this scripture, revealing the secret words of the unfolding chart to manifest the symbols of the sixty-four hexagrams, which permeate the sixty cyclical years. Qian, Kun, Kan, and Li emerge beyond the bounds of the sixty cyclical years, unbound by the limits of the celestial stems and earthly branches. Within this scripture, there is only one woman, whose name contains the character for "fire" but lacks the character for "water." There is, however, the character for "spring," signifying true water. Its principles are profoundly subtle. Thus, the inception of numbers arises before the existence of heaven and earth. The breath of inhalation and exhalation harmonizes with yin and yang, constituting the breath within the ceaseless breath. Where breath settles, the myriad convergences pay homage; the eight obscure and subtle meridians. Where the meridians settle, one breath encompasses four audiences: one exhalation issues commands, one inhalation pays homage, one exhalation spans three inches, one inhalation spans three inches. The progenitor of the three qi, the great circulation of *Brahmā* qi. One audience comprises fifteen divisions. The nine and six of heaven and earth, yin and yang interweaving, great numbers may be deduced from this to reach lengths of feet. Thus, accumulating divisions forms inches, piling inches makes feet, and feet compose yards. Hence, the finger serves as an inch, the forearm as a foot, manifesting in physical form. Thereafter, the standards of pitch pipes, calendars, measurements, weights, the five planets, seven luminaries, eight trigrams, nine palaces, twenty-four solar terms, and seventy-two pentads all arise from this. The sages took these as models, crafting instruments and establishing the myriad patterns. Truly, within emptiness lies treasure—this is the transformation of the primordial unity of qi.

Within this scripture, the myriad rites are complete, such as the cinnabar of yin and yang, celestial patterns and prohibitions, divination of fortune and misfortune, observation of shadows to foretell the future, and the safeguards of knowing what is to come—all are concealed herein. It further elucidates the primordial qi, the mother of the great Dao, the methods of returning to the essence of lead and mercury, the root of the three qi in the Western Prime, the secret name of the Primal Mother of Kun and the mysteries of the Dark Obscurity, the great cavern’s revolving winds to escape death, the Dao of blending and attaining perfection, extending to the salvation of the living and deliverance of the dead, summoning the Perfected and invoking spirits, blessing the state and pacifying families, prospering the times and enriching all things, quelling and protecting, repenting and beseeching—nothing is left unaddressed.

Additionally, it includes the implements of ritual and music, the forms, names, robes, colors, weapons, and measures for demons and spirits, the Dao of the five constants and the protocols of posture and movement—all were prepared in the primordial era, as spoken by the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning. Thus, the Dao Lord arranged and compiled them, and they were inscribed by the Heavenly Perfected Sovereign. In the middle antiquity, the Confucians established the teachings of governing the world, solely emphasizing benevolence and righteousness, benefiting only one school, and the great Dao was thereby concealed. Little did they know that its source lay in the primordial era. Originally arising from one source, it branched into ten thousand streams. Colors return to the colorless, and the hundred rivers merge back into the sea, ultimately reverting to the Primordial Ancestor.

Those who comprehend this scripture become teachers of emperors and kings; those who penetrate its mysteries become Heavenly Perfected. In accordance with the esoteric regulations, it is transmitted to celestial beings once every forty thousand kalpas. Formerly, the Queen Mother of the West of the Sacred Realm translated celestial symbols into worldly script and transmitted them to Emperor Wu of Han, employing them to establish instruments, model the myriad things, and transmit them to the human world. The scripture contains forty-seven categories, universally following the instructions of the sages, all determined by the ancient rituals. Today, following the Han system, we may clarify the primordial qi of the Primordial Ancestor.

**Preface to the Scripture’s Categories**

casting dragon and jade into the abysses of the sea,

Curing illness—following the rites to restore harmony.

The above three items serve as examples for averting poison and harm.

soaring to the Golden Gates,

feasting in the Jade Capital,
roaming the Great Void,
ascending to the Southern Palace,

wandering freely in Highest Clarity,
ascending to the Southern Palace by rank,
being named to ascend to the Southern Palace,
soaring through the Great Void,
the soul ascending to the Vermilion Mound,
roaming the Three Realms.
The above thirteen items serve as examples of ascension.

All attain longevity, preserving their allotted years.
All achieve deliverance from the world, enduring through kalpas.
Lineages flourish, ancestors receive deliverance.
One thereby attains immortality, prolonging life and years,
achieving liberation through simulated death,
becoming a Perfected of the Nine Palaces,
ensuring the nation’s peace,
ascending to the rank of Immortal Elder,
the Demon Kings respecting one’s form,
refining the body in the Great Yin.

As a minister of the Golden Gates to the Sagely Lord,
receiving the homage of the myriad spirits,
recommended by the Demon Kings.

The above seventeen items serve as examples of meritorious responses to virtue.

Presenting golden treasures and sincere devotion,
pledging oaths to the Ten Heavens.

The above one item serves as an example of transmission and ordination.

According to ancient texts, one offers gold and treasures,
devotes the heart, and pledges oaths to Heaven for transmission.
Following the Mysterious Regulations, transmission occurs once every forty thousand kalpas.
Again, one pledges oaths to the Ten Heavens before transmission.
Divided into three clauses, as in the scripture’s preface, it states that what the Upper Heavens treasure is not transmitted to the lower world.
When a scholar examines gold and treasures, devotes the heart, and pledges oaths to Heaven for transmission, this is deemed proper for the recipient.
Within the scripture, it states: following the Mysterious Regulations, transmission occurs once every forty thousand kalpas.
If a perfected person examines gold and treasures with a sincere heart, adheres to the old statutes, and pledges oaths to the Ten Heavens, only then is the transmission bestowed.
This precisely describes the standard for transmission and ordination.
It should not be separately listed; thus, only one clause is retained.

The body incurs calamity,
calamity extends to the nine ancestors,
leaking and negligence lead to descent into hell.

The above three items serve as examples of offenses and their consequences.

The scripture states that those who recite without fasting, bathing, or burning incense incur the sin of calamity.
If one lightly violates the regulations and prohibitions, recklessly discloses secrets to the uninitiated, leaks the Mysterious Mysteries, fails to adhere to the time limits, receives transmission without fasting or pledging oaths, divulges secret prohibitions, or shares them with the unworthy, showing disrespect and disbelief in the Mysterious Texts—all fall under the middle category, with calamity extending to the nine ancestors.
If one leaks or neglects these matters without regard, cunningly seeks novelties, debates the sacred canon, slanders the Mysterious Texts, or steals celestial treasures—all fall under this clause, with misfortune extending to the seven ancestors and their forebears.

**The Human Dao**
The human Dao is subtle and distant, standing at the gate of human life. One must not allow the human Dao to become exhausted, obstruct human destiny, or sever the gate of human life. Ah, humanity—how few are those who attain deliverance! The human Dao resides in the heart; the human Dao values flourishing. The Most Sagely Divine Persons, those who study alongside the Perfected, the multitudes of the people, masters and friends—these are distinguished as the Perfected. They record the merits and faults of others, deliver those in secluded stillness, and are the August Persons.

**Volume Twenty-Six of the Supreme Purity Numinous Treasure Great Ritual**

*Transmitted by Dongwei Gaoshi Kaiguang Jiuku Zhenren Ning Quanzhen to Wang Qizhen, Disciple of the Three Caverns of Supreme Purity and Successor in the Teaching of the Numinous Treasure*

**Chapter on the Exegesis of the Scripture’s Essence**

The Master said: Of the three hundred and sixty categories of scriptures expounded by the Primordial Heavenly Worthy, thirty-six are revered as the foremost. Yet all trace their origin to this single scripture, the ancestral source of the ten thousand methods. It encompasses the utmost of *Dongzhen* (Cavern of Perfection), penetrates *Dongxuan* (Cavern of Mystery), and embraces *Dongshen* (Cavern of Divinity)—hence it is called the *Great Ritual*.

**The Descent of the Luminous Pearl**

In ancient times, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy expounded this scripture in the Azure Beginning Heaven and bestowed it upon the Dao Lord. Later, in the Heaven of Great Cinnabar, he conferred it in the voice of the Great Brahmā. After the Dao Lord compiled it, the heavens treasured it, secreting it within the Purple Tenuity Palace of the Jade Capital in the Mysterious Metropolis. Its transmission was most solemn, reserved for the sagely alone.

Later, the Queen Mother of the West petitioned the Heavenly Emperor to descend it for the salvation of the *jiashen* calamity, entrusting it to the adepts of cultivation. Thus it remained in the mortal realm.

This scripture comprises the esoteric hymns of the Heavenly Thearchs and the concealed chants of the Numinous Demon Kings. Within it are expounded the kalpas of heaven and earth, the names of the myriad spirits, the intercourse of yin and yang, and the generation and transformation of primordial *qi*. Its meanings cannot be fully exhausted; those who attain the Dao will naturally fathom its depths.

The heavens transmit it but once every forty thousand kalpas, and even then, only once every forty years. To leak or profane it brings misfortune upon nine generations, condemning them to eternal servitude in the nether darkness. How could one not be cautious?

**The Origin of the Inner Sound**

Once, the Heavenly Worthy was seated in the Xiangling Lodge of the Vermilion Clarity World. At that time, clouds and mist surged thickly for three days and nights, and the gloom of yin did not disperse. The Five Elder Thearchs petitioned the Heavenly Worthy, saying: "Never before have we witnessed such a sight during your teachings. When you expound the Dao, mountains and seas fall silent, and heaven and earth grow solemn and clear. Yet today, this murky darkness has left heaven and earth in dread. We are perplexed and dare not presume the cause."

The Heavenly Worthy replied: "Today, the numinous portents of the myriad heavens arise spontaneously. The Jade Script shines resplendently, veiling heaven and earth, compelling all in attendance to close their eyes in reverence. Suddenly, the Brahmā *qi* of the heavens manifested, dispelling the gloom. Five-colored radiance illuminated the ten directions, and sacred writings—each character a *zhang* in size—appeared in the void. Their brilliance dazzled the eyes, their eight corners trailing beams of light, too resplendent to behold directly."

The Heavenly Worthy proclaimed to the assembled spirits: "These eight scrolls of numinous script bear no fixed form; their purport is profound and abstruse. None among you can fathom their depths." He then commanded the Heavenly Perfected Sovereign to transcribe the characters and elucidate their sounds, bestowing them upon the Dao Lord. In total, there were two hundred and fifty-six characters. The Dao Lord arranged them into text, forming the *Great Brahmā Hidden Speech*, which he appended to the two chapters.

The Sovereign had once descended upon Mount Emei during the reign of the Yellow Emperor, transmitting the Method of the Three Ones and Five Sprouts, before ascending once more to heaven.

**Division of the Scripture’s Beginning, End, and Sections**

The Heavenly Worthy’s two chapters of scripture are bookended by prefaces, as are the *Great Brahmā Hidden Speech* before and after—all composed by the Dao Lord. Here, we separate the beginning and end, dividing the sections and organizing the characters and titles according to the repository text, totaling four thousand five hundred and seventy-four characters.

**Preface to the Two Chapters of the Supreme Purity Dao Lord**
From *"The Dao speaks of former times in the Azure Beginning Heaven..."* to *"facing east to recite the scripture,"* comprising one thousand five hundred and ninety-five characters.

**First Chapter of the Primordial Heavenly Worthy’s Precious Scripture**
From *"The Primordial’s Cavern of Mystery..."* to *"proclaiming the words of Supreme Purity,"* comprising one thousand two hundred and seventy-eight characters.

**Latter Chapter of the Primordial’s Precious Scripture**
From *"The Primordial’s Jade Calendar..."* to *"calamity extending to the seven ancestors,"* comprising seven hundred and eighty-six characters.

**Preface and Postface to the Two Chapters of the Supreme Purity Dao Lord**
From *"The Dao speaks of these two chapters..."* to *"thus one shall thoroughly comprehend the profound words,"* comprising four hundred and forty characters.

**Preface to the Great Brahmā Hidden Speech**
From *"Among the heavens..."* to *"the middle scroll of the numinous script,"* comprising nineteen characters.

**The Correct Sounds of the Hidden Speech**
From *"Danlou Ahui..."* to *"transcending the silent and tranquil,"* comprising two hundred and fifty-six characters.

**Postface to the Great Brahmā Hidden Speech**
From *"The Dao Lord, among these heavens..."* to *"the vast and mysterious,"* comprising one hundred and eighty characters.

**The Jade Dawn’s Illumination: Ten Recitations of the Scripture**

When the scripture is recited, it summons the hosts of the ten directions—those of the Primordial Ultimate and Primordial Measure—and the lands and peoples of the ten quarters come to hear the Dharma, their responses manifesting instantly.

**First Recitation:** The perfected great spirits of the East arrive floating through the void. The realm of *Antai Tangxiang* in the *Nashan* world. The deaf regain their hearing.

**Second Recitation:** The perfected great spirits of the South arrive floating through the void. The domain of *Wanli* in the *Benxian* world. The blind regain their sight.

**Third Recitation:** The perfected great spirits of the West arrive floating through the void. The realm of *Futang Yuanxian* in the *Xing* world. The mute regain their speech.

**Fourth Recitation:** The perfected great spirits of the North arrive floating through the void. The realm of *Yuzhi Yeqing* in the *Leng* world. The lame and chronically ill rise and walk.

**Fifth Recitation:** The perfected great spirits of the Northeast arrive floating through the void. The realm of *Fuji Xiang* in the *Chang’an* world. Chronic ailments and afflictions instantly restore their forms.

**Sixth Recitation:** The perfected great spirits of the Southeast arrive floating through the void. The realm of *Yuanfutian* in the *Yongxian* world. White hair returns to black; fallen teeth regrow.

**Seventh Recitation:** The perfected great spirits of the Southwest arrive floating through the void. The realm of *Yanfu Xiang* in the *Ranjing* world. The aged regain their youth; the young grow strong.

**Eighth Recitation:** The perfected great spirits of the Northwest arrive floating through the void. The realm of *Fude Ye* in the *Yanxian* world. Barren women conceive; birds and beasts bear young. All that is born or unborn attains completion.

**Ninth Recitation:** The perfected great spirits of the Upper Realm arrive floating through the void. The palaces and towers of the *Yizhu* heavens.

**Tenth Recitation:** The perfected great spirits of the Lower Realm arrive floating through the void. The *Dongyuan* Nine Ramparts, the true traversal of the *Youfan* Four Sounds, the Thirty-Six Palaces of Heaven and Earth. Withered bones revive; all rise as whole persons.

**Preface to the Mysteries**
The Master said: The Dao speaks of the supreme and boundless upper grade, which is the great *Donghui* cyclonic fusion, the uppermost Dao of the *Duren* scripture. Of old, the *Shiqing* Heaven was the *Yulong Tengsheng* Heaven. *Dafuli* is the inner taboo name of the Heavenly Emperor. *Biluo* is the pulse of the *Shiqing* Heaven, like the meridians of a single body. The *Yuchen* Dao Lord first uttered these words, thus it is called the *Preface to the Mysteries*.

**Initiating the Kalpa**
The Master said: The Primordial Beginning summons the ten directions, meaning that when it is time to expound, at this kalpic turning, the charts are revealed and the teachings emerge, thus this scripture is spoken. First, the ten directions are summoned, as in the ten revolutions of the *Dadong*, calling the ten directions thrice, summoning the immortal officials as designated, calling the Three Officials of the Five Peaks. The Primordial Beginning Emperor expounds the scripture, thus it is called *Initiating the Kalpa*.

**True Response**
The Master said: When first approaching the throne, until the five colors surge and billow, this is the divine palace of the ten directions in the *Dadong* realm, the natural truth. Following the Heavenly Worthy’s summons, they respond and come to the assembly of *Dafuli*, ascending the *Jieren* Jeweled Terrace to hear the proclaimed scriptural Dharma, thus it is called *True Response*.

**Attaining the Ultimate**
The Master said: For seven days and seven nights, until the host of perfected ones attend the throne, this is the inner workings of the celestial mechanism, dividing the sevenfold cycle of day and night. The outer manifestation of numinous power produces the auspicious sign of the wheel halting for a time. Speaking inwardly, in the settled contemplation of seven days, one forgets day and night, observing the mind as the primordial mind, thereby perceiving the true primordial mind. Observing form as primordial form, one recognizes the original true form. When mind and form are wholly primordial, one naturally enters the Dao of primordial form, clearly beholding the sacred realm of *Yuqing*, the way of ascending in broad daylight, the method of entering samādhi. Those who have lost their original rank are thus called *Attaining the Ultimate*.

**Returning to the Origin**
The Master said: The Primordial Beginning Heavenly Worthy on the mysterious throne, until all attain long life—this is the Dao of the Primordial Beginning Emperor expounding the scripture, the tenfold revolution of the Dharma, established in the generative numbers, completed in the consummative numbers of the Five Phases. Those who practice this Dao ascend in broad daylight, riding dragons and cranes to reach *Yuqing*, receiving the scriptures and becoming immortal lords. Clarifying this Dao ensures long life without death; applying this Dao verifies these ten great merits. The *mysterious throne* is the seat of the Dharmakāya. The *lion* is the numinous power of the Primordial Beginning. Speaking inwardly, the six qi and eight obscurities converge upon the heart, transforming into a lion within the lower cinnabar field. Thus, to the left is azure, to the right is white, in front is red, behind is black, and at the center is yellow, forming the image of the five-colored lion. Having fully realized the original rank, it is thus called *completing the Five Phases*, which is named *Returning to the Origin*.

**Mystery and Origin**
The Master said: The Dao speaks until *rejoicing in great peace*. This follows the auspicious responses of the Five Phases’ generation and completion, the ten revolutions of salvation, summoning the ten directions and the ten ranks of great spirits, all arriving simultaneously. Due to their towering merit and virtue, which cannot be measured, there arise transformations sweeping through nations and concerns of widespread peril. Thus, a single precious pearl is suspended, distinguishing the refinement and coarseness of the Dao’s grades, corresponding to the profundity or shallowness of the mysterious. Heavenly and mortal beings gaze upward but cannot fathom the subtlety of the millet-like pearl. The perfected and sages, following the transformations, all ascend into the depths of the *Naxuan*. Having received salvation, the Dao Lords and heavenly beings preserve their original years, all practicing the twelve virtuous minds, thereby aligning with the Dao of universal compassion and love, transforming alien bones into kin. Prior to this, when the men and women of a nation wholeheartedly turned in reverence, the heavenly beings of the ten directions entered the land of *Dafuli*. The *millet* is the chief of the five grains and the youngest of the myriad numbers, hence it is the origin of mysterious transformation, designating the chapters and grades.

**Expounding the Brahma**
The Master said: When the scripture first emerged as a teaching, until all attain salvation and deliverance—after the universal salvation of heavenly and mortal beings, the scriptural Dharma flows forth, emerging as teachings to deliver people. In any nation where the scripture is heard, even those who have not received the teachings but nurture a sincere aspiration for learning, and who initiate the sincerity of the great Dao, practicing the middle way and revering the four matters, attaining even one aspect, all achieve salvation and deliverance. The myriad heavens each practice the fourfold Brahma conduct, thus it is called *Yin Brahma*.

**Proclaiming the Secrets**
The Master said: The Dao speaks until *words beyond the world’s common speech*.

**The Secrets Proclaimed**
The two preceding chapters from the scriptures spoken by the Heavenly Worthy contain the inner names of the hundred spirits of the Great Cavern, as well as the inner taboos of the Heavenly Emperor, or the hidden names of demon kings and the hundred numina—thus they are called *Proclaiming the Secrets*.

**The Supreme Sages**
The Master said: The supreme sages have already become perfected persons, even to the point of transforming white bones into living beings. These are the great celestial perfected deities who have attained the status of the Three Clarities, responding to their inner virtue. Having penetrated the mysteries and investigated the subtleties, they fully grasp the scripture’s chapters and thus comprehend the secret taboos of the Great Cavern. Only then do the myriad heavens chant from afar, and the ten thousand emperors perform rites of reverence. Below the sun and moon, there is also the method of *great concentration*. Within concentration, one sees all the primordial Dao spirits, ghosts, demons, and essences manifest in bodily form, which may be commanded or questioned. If the power of concentration is not yet perfected, one cannot control or master them, and must rely on the *Nine Palaces’ Cavern-Viewing Method*.

**The Devoted Learners**
The Master said: The devoted learners cannot be reborn again. These devoted learners are attended by the Five Emperors, revered by the Three Realms, and joined by the distant chants of the myriad heavens and the rites of the ten thousand emperors—such cannot be spoken of in the same breath. Even those who save and deliver the dying, transforming white bones into living beings, cannot ascend by degrees to achieve such effects. Moreover, learners can only subdue and bind earthbound spirits and demonic essences, merely averting death, but cannot be reborn.

**Exhorting the Dao**
The Master said: To recite these chapters lightly is merely to have divine spirits guard one’s gate. If one has not received transmission from a master, nor observed fasting, bathing, and purification, and still neglects the visualization of inner cultivation, treating the rituals as common speech and mixing them with vulgar words, one will incur misfortune upon oneself. It would be better not to recite them at all—seeking blessings to avoid calamity, making offerings and revering the honored, one may thereby obtain auspiciousness. Thus it is called *Exhorting the Dao*.

**Praising the Mysteries**
The Master said: This scripture is most venerable and wondrous; its virtue and power are beyond compare. Within the Cavern of Mystery, this scripture wondrously enters the Dao of the Great Cavern, thus it is exalted above the Three Caverns and surpasses the mysteries of all teachings, uniquely traversing the Jade Capital. Above the Great Luo Heaven lies the Mountain of the Jade Capital, where golden towers, seven-jeweled jade terraces, and the Purple Tenuity’s upper palace stand. There are thirty-six Jade Capital Halls, each with eaves spanning ten thousand leagues, encircling an area of five thousand five hundred leagues. At its center lies the Upper Palace of the Jade Void, where the Radiant Sovereign of Numinous Treasure, the Perfected Lord of the Dao, uniquely presides over this scripture. The ten thousand perfected and ten thousand sages pay homage thrice daily, making it the source of the myriad Dao. Majestic is this mysterious scripture, the supreme great Brahma—its primordial virtue is matchless, its primordial power unrivaled. Thus it is called *Praising the Mysteries*.

**Cultivating and Reciting**
The Master said: The Dao speaks: In all recitation... to roam and feast in the Jade Capital. The Master instructed those who have received the scripture: If one does not cultivate and uphold it but merely recites the scripture ten times, this mysterious response arises for the sake of one’s ancestors. All beings are born with an indestructible numinous nature, eternally cycling through kalpas, whether born in the four continents, the six paths, manifesting among the four kinds of birth, or dwelling within the Three Realms. All sentient beings are our fathers and mothers. Therefore, learners possess two great virtues: first, compassion—refraining from killing or harming, lest they mistakenly injure their sovereigns, teachers, or parents from past kalpas; second, purity—refraining from lust and desire, lest they defile or offend the three teachers of transformation, the Dharma-body of those who have left the household life, or their sovereigns, teachers, and parents from past kalpas. Thus, when learners cultivate and recite, they should first repay the countless generations of ancestors, delivering the suffering souls of the hidden departed, who then ascend to the Vermilion Palace. Those who undergo the refining disciplines of the Vermilion Mound’s ranks—those who achieve liberation of the corpse in broad daylight, or those who reverse their forms in the Great Yin—are refined for seven years to attain the rank of immortals. Their descendants are delivered to the Azure Palace, and the souls they uplift to the Vermilion Palace are refined for nine years, reborn as noble persons. If their spiritual nature is unobscured and they diligently study the scripture, their merit complete and virtue perfected, they all become immortals, ascending to the Golden Towers of the Upper Clarity Heaven, permitted to roam and feast in the Great Luo’s Jade Capital. Those who diligently study the scripture have not obscured their spiritual nature from past lives, and their merit surpasses that of mere reciters. Even if they are not noble persons, they will surely achieve liberation of the corpse within nine years. If they pursue fame and nobility, they will ascend through the Nine Passes in nine years to become renowned and noble. Those whose dull natures are bound by karma and whose merit is consumed often fall back into suffering souls. How can they compare to the pure and humble learners, whose lives are guided by diligent study, free from karmic obstacles, and who are certain to attain the Dao and ascend as immortals?

**The Advanced Learners**
The Master said: The advanced learners... roam the great void. The preceding refers to those who have received and recited the scripture, penetrating the mysteries and investigating the subtleties. This refers to advanced learners who both cultivate and recite, yet cannot deliver their countless generations of ancestors, only attaining deliverance for themselves. They ascend to the Southern Palace, becoming scholars in the world. Those who approach a master to receive and recite the scripture may extend their years and live long, and when their destined cycles come to an end, they all achieve the Dao of liberation of the corpse. Their souls are not extinguished, nor do they pass through hell, but immediately regain their forms and roam the great void. The methods of liberation of the corpse include the *Great Cavern’s Five Stones’ Life-Securing Method*: when the body decays and rots, the five viscera regenerate on their own. When the allotted years are fulfilled, the Great One unites with the spirit, and one is reborn with the body of a true immortal, receiving the scripture and ascending the Dao. Dwelling in the cavern heavens, their merit and virtue complete, they are appointed to the rank of high perfected. There is also the *Central Scripture of the Nine Perfected*, the Dao of the Great Lord of Longevity who guards the primal unity: when the physical form perishes, the body is entrusted to the heavy Yin, the spirit guards the hundred passes, and the five viscera regenerate on their own. When the allotted years are fulfilled, spirit and form unite, and one ascends to the Ten Heavens, receiving the scripture and attaining rank. On the day their merit is complete, they are appointed as perfected persons. There are also those who wear the precepts of the Nine Perfected on their bodies, reflect the talismans of the Golden Register in their hearts, receive the mysterious scriptures, their merit manifest in the Three Heavens, their virtue harmonizing with the Five Constants. Their spirit and qi are inwardly whole, but if their merit and virtue are not yet complete and their destined cycles return them to darkness, they are still ranked: those who achieve liberation in broad daylight are foremost, those who do so at midnight are next.

Those whose complexion remains unchanged, whose nails do not turn pale, and whose eyes do not darken are the immortals of corpse-liberation. Their ethereal souls temporarily dissolve, their lives pass through the Great Yin, and their forms return to the Palace of Vermilion Clarity. They do not traverse hell but roam the vast heavens, traversing the Ten Heavens, receiving the scriptures and ascending the Dao. When their merit is complete and the Dao fulfilled—after thirty, seventy, or one hundred twenty years—they, prompted by others, awaken the Dark Palace. Spirit and form unite, and they ascend to the Three Heavens, where they are ranked and appointed as perfected immortals according to their grade.

There are also the supreme sages and lofty perfected who, having enlightened the world to its true nature, ascend in secret to the Highest Clarity, leaving behind their caps and swords. Those below the Great Clarity who rely on talismans, elixirs, or methods of the Eighth Rank—such as miscellaneous arts for resolving calamities, evading the world, or substituting forms with staffs and sandals—cannot return to their former homes. They are inevitably seized by the Three Offices and do not share the same rank as the previous four grades of corpse-liberation immortals.

**Expounding the Subtle Chapter**
The Master said: This scripture is subtle and wondrous, bestowing grace upon life and death. It speaks of the highest perfected sages who receive deliverance and preserve the cosmic order, ensuring the heavens endure forever. It extends to all heavenly beings, preserving their allotted years, and none fail to receive deliverance. In clarity, it can deliver beings beyond measure; in obscurity, it can rescue the dead and liberate the departed. Thus, it bestows grace upon life and death, expounding the most subtle wonders among all scriptures. Each must abide by the regulations of their original rank.

**Pledging the Covenant Chapter**
The Master said: What heaven treasures most is the perpetual servitude of ghost officials. If a person of attainment offers gold and treasures, pledges sincerity, and swears an oath to heaven before transmitting this scripture, and should they lightly disclose or profane it, calamity will extend to their nine generations. Moreover, all worldly people are bound by the prohibition against transmission. This is a treasured scripture of heaven, concealed in the Mysterious Capital. If one carelessly profanes it, the consequences will not merely afflict nine generations. They will be consigned to the perpetual servitude of ghost officials, including those of the Northern Bureau, the Three Offices that govern ghostly servitude. Previously, careless recitation brought harm to oneself; now, careless transmission brings harm to one’s ancestors. Only by keeping the covenant, sealing one’s lips, and practicing in accordance with the regulations can one ascend the ladder to perfected attainment.

**Mysterious Bureau Chapter**
The Master said: Those who serve the scriptures of the Five Emperors, down to those who receive the scriptures in their own bodies...

The Master said: When a covenant master transmits the scriptures, the Five Emperors each dispatch twenty-four jade lads and jade maidens to encamp and guard the sacred writ, preside over the prohibition, burn incense, and protect the body of the recipient. Should one disclose it to a single person, one jade lad or maiden is punished, and the matter is promptly reported to the Five Emperors, who memorialize the Most High. These are the spirits of the Five Phases, the four seasons, the Nine Palaces, and the twenty-four qi—totaling two hundred forty in all—who attend and guard the Five Emperors. Without a covenant master to transmit the scriptures, how could there be the regulations for encampment, guardianship, and prohibition?

**Three Origins Chapter**
The Master said: The Dao speaks of ascending to fly and rise to the Upper Clarity. The first month’s Upper Origin is fitting for delivering the souls of past generations. The seventh month’s Middle Origin is for delivering oneself. The tenth month’s Lower Origin is for pacifying the state and securing the people. On the eight nodal days, one dispels the disasters of the nine lands and averts the calamities of the eight nodes. Reciting and chanting toward their directions, aligning with the palaces and establishing the pointer, one’s merit is recorded by the Five Emperors, and one’s virtue transforms the nine lands—thus attaining the rank of Perfected of the Nine Palaces. This is precisely: three on the left, seven on the right, nine worn on the crown, one trodden beneath; two and four form the shoulders, six and eight the feet; the body abides in the Central Palace, securing the five. This is the Dao of the Nine Origins of the Upper Clarity, the Vast and Unobstructed. On the day of one’s original destiny, the day of the inception of one’s primal qi, reciting and chanting stabilizes the hun-soul and restrains the po-soul, preserves life and pacifies the person, clarifies and rectifies the five viscera, and gathers the myriad qi into the body. Next, on the day of one’s counterpart destiny, reciting twice ensures one escapes suffering and affliction, the body radiates light, and practicing this merit summons the attendants of the Three Realms, the Five Emperors to receive one, and the myriad spirits to pay homage—one’s name is inscribed in the heavens above. When merit is complete and virtue perfected, one ascends to fly and rise to the Upper Clarity. Now, the day of one’s original birth—for example, if it is a *jiazi* day, then the *jiawu* day is the day of one’s counterpart destiny. The Upper Clarity lies above the Four Brahmā Heavens, within the Three Clarities. The first is the Great Clarity, twelve heavens where the Nine Immortals dwell. Above it is the Upper Clarity, twelve heavens where the Nine Perfected dwell. Highest is the Jade Clarity, twelve heavens where the Nine Sages dwell—thirty-six heavens in all. The Upper Clarity resides above the Great Clarity and below the Jade Clarity.

**Practicing the Dao Chapter**
The Master said: The Dao speaks of the day for practicing the Dao... so clearly distinguished.

The methods include visualization incantations and oral formulas, all detailed in this section.

The Three Qi are: Mysterious Qi (azure), Primordial Qi (yellow), and Original Qi (white)—these are the Three Qi. From the One Qi arise the Three Qi; from the Three Qi arise the Nine Qi; from the Nine Qi arise the Ten Thousand Qi. The lord of the Three Qi, the honored of the One Qi, is the Primordial Celestial Worthy. The ancestor of the Nine Qi is the Azure Lad Dao Lord. The mother of the Ten Thousand Qi is the Queen Mother of the West. Humans dwell within the Three Qi, transforming and responding to the gods of the Three Ones—the perfect and constant supreme Dao, the root and origin of the Ten Thousand Qi.

**Secret Incantations Chapter**
The Master said: "Primordial Supreme Mysterious Origin, when present, face east to recite the scriptures. For petitions to the Great Clarity, address only the Five Numinous Venerable Lords to summon forth the gods of one’s body. For petitions to the Upper Clarity, address only the True Primordial Teaching Master, the Most High Lord Lao. For petitions to the Jade Clarity, address only the Most High Dao Lord. The meaning of the petition and scripture recitation to summon forth the gods of one’s body has already been detailed in this section. Facing east to recite scriptures is because the east is the direction of longevity, revered by all the heavens. All talismans and sacred writings of the Numinous Treasure should be inscribed facing east, drawing forth the qi of the Thirty-Two Heavens to spread it—divine efficacy will arrive instantly. All those who practice the Dao must begin and end facing east."

**Cavernous Mystery Chapter**
The Master said: "Primordial Cavernous Mystery, reaching to the union and separation of the natural... These twenty-four characters form the opening of the *Cavernous Mystery* original chapter. *Primordial* is the ancestor of the Ten Thousand Dao. *Origin* is the origin of the multitude of qi. *Cavernous* is divine and numinous response. *Mystery* is transformation and radiance beyond measure. *Numinous* is the fulfillment of all prayers. *Treasure* is the root of immortals and sages. These six characters are the ancestor of the Ten Thousand Dao, the origin of the multitude of qi, returning to the Great Cavern—divine and numinous response, transformation and radiance beyond measure, the fulfillment of prayers and transformation into treasure, thus forming the wondrous beginning of the highest grade. The *Ten Recitations for Deliverance* have already clarified this section. The purport of this chapter lies in the hidden rhymes of the Hundred Demons, sometimes separated, sometimes united, neither forcibly harmonized nor regulated by tonal patterns, but arising naturally of themselves. The Hundred Demons are the kings of the Great Demon Lords of the Nine Empyreans, who attend upon the Celestial Worthy Primordial Origin. They are the descendants of the Jade Clarity’s Primordial Qi Imperial Lineage: the Jade Clarity King of the Divine Empyrean, the Purple Empyrean Jade Clarity Demon-Quelling King, the Vermilion Empyrean Central Ultimate Radiance-Preserving King, the Azure Empyrean Jade Clarity Cavernous Brightness Womb King; next, the Jade Empyrean Wondrous Transformation King; then the Kings of the Great Empyrean, Scenic Empyrean, Azure Empyrean, and Jade Empyrean—all emperors of the Great Demons. Following them are the Great Demons of the Nine Heavens, the Great Demons of the Three Heavens, the Great Demons of the Three Realms, the Great Demons of the Three Clarities, the Great Demons of the Five Emperors, the Great Demons of the Five Heavens, the Demon Kings of all the heavens, and the Demon Lords of the Brahmā Heavens. Then come the demons of the Three Ministries of Heavenly Ministers and the Great Mystery, as well as non-demons, numinous demons, controlling demons, divine demons, and so forth—down to the hidden rhymes of the Great Demons of the Six Heavens, all contained within this second chapter. With the rhymes of the Hundred Demons of the Cavernous Mystery, separated and united naturally to form the chapter, profound and unfathomable, only the Primordial Origin fully comprehends it to expound these two chapters. The *Ten Recitations for Deliverance* is thus also called *Cavernous Mystery*. Those who respond to deliverance universally receive it. What follows is the solemn proclamation of the decrees of all the heavens."

**Universal Proclamation Chapter**
The Master said: "Universally proclaim to the Three Realms, reaching to the coercion and reunion with ghostly fetters. The Three Realms are: the Upper Primordial Realm of the Ultimate Divine Land, the Middle Yellow Springs Court, and the Lower Northern Capital of Luo and Deng. The Three Officials are: the Upper Primordial Heavenly Official of the Purple Tenuity Palace, the Middle Earthly Official of the Azure Florescence Terrace, and the Lower Water Official of the Clear and Cold Palace. The Nine Bureaus are: one official with three bureaus, dividing the registers of water and fire for examination—thus, the Three Officials and Nine Bureaus. The Twelve River Sources are the twelve terrestrial divisions, each with a watercourse source, flowing into the Primordial Ultimate Mixed Sea and returning to the source of the Draining Waters. The deliverance of ancestors and forebears, extending to karmic kin of countless kalpas, swiftly erases the ledgers of sins, extinguishes evil roots, preventing further confinement, allowing moment-by-moment ascension, avoiding coercion and reunion with ghostly fetters. The Twelve River Sources drain into the Celestial River, the source of the Eastern Well. The sun, moon, and eight luminaries refine and forge the Golden Immortals. The Eastern Well’s Yellow Waters govern the Flowering Spirit Pool, where bathing renews one’s radiance. This is detailed in the *Scripture of the Three Dao Following the Upper Clarity*. This is also the place for refining and delivering the hun and shen. The preceding forty-eight characters are the proclamation to the Three Realms."

**Talismanic Decree Chapter**
The Master said: "The Primordial Talismanic Decree, reaching to wandering carefree in the Upper Clarity. The Three Paths are the karmic retributions of hell, hungry ghosts, and animals. There are also the labors of the Heavenly, Earthly, and Water Officials. The Five Sufferings are: sorrow, illness, death, the grave, and severance. There are also water, fire, wind, the blade, royal law, famine, and pestilence. There are also boiling cauldrons, furnaces, slaughter, icy pools, and torture. There are also the Five Suffering Entanglements of form, desire, emotion, love, and nobility. The Three Paths and Five Sufferings together form the Eight Difficulties. The sixty-four characters are the Primordial Talismanic Decree. The two kinds of talismanic proclamations are found in the Yellow Register Retreat Methods."

**Sacred Taboo Chapter**
The Master said: "In the heavens of the Upper Clarity, reaching to the Brahmā conduct."

The Brahmā-conduct is the Dao within the Dao, the Heaven within Heaven, the Mystery within Mystery, the true emptiness of the primordial obstruction. Above the Three Realms and below the Jade Clarity, above the Upper Clarity, there is the Heavenly Emperor named the Jade True Heavenly Emperor, who is the August Jade Emperor of the Vast Heaven, the Supreme Emperor of the Lofty Dark Vault, governing the realm of the formless Brahmā-conduct—this is the celestial realm of the Seed People.

Below this are the thirty-two heavens, where the emperors’ tabooed names and hidden titles, the concealed rhymes of jade tones, are spoken of as the Heavenly Worthies’ secret taboos, or the hidden sounds of heavenly demons, or the inner names of luminous gods, or the wondrous tones of celestial spirits. Their subtlety is unfathomable, their mystery unplumbed. Nine harmonies enable transformation; ten unions enable transmutation. The primordial exhausts divine response; the boundless holds profound principles. Mysterious transformations and wondrous changes occur in the Upper Clarity—hence it is called the Sacred Taboo.

Moreover, the celestial decrees of this Heavenly Emperor are inscribed as contracts to deliver boundless beings.

**Receiving Deliverance Chapter**
The Master said: "Today is a joyous celebration, reaching the Gate of Heaven."
These twenty-eight characters form the great contract for announcing at the Gate of Heaven. When the delivered souls receive the Heavenly Worthy’s contract and talismanic decree, they announce to the demon kings of the Three Realms, ensuring their passage to the Gate of Heaven without hindrance.

The thirty-two Heavenly Emperors’ contracts for ascending to heaven conceal within them the Jade Emperor’s inner text, including the sixty-eight characters of the Human Sovereign’s script, totaling three hundred thirty-nine characters.

**Five Phases Chapter**
The Master said: "The Eastern Dipper records destiny... to the primordial surpassing of the myriad spirits."
All arise from the Red Clarity, emerge from the Five Kalpas, and govern the Five Directions to deliver heavenly and human beings.

**Guarding the True Chapter**
The Master said: "Green Heaven Demon King... to the ranks proclaimed in the Upper Clarity."
These are the commands for support, sweeping, and purging, ordering demon-slaying spirits to serve as vanguards—all are the resplendent great spirits of the Jade Clarity. The Divine Duke is the Supreme Minister of the Great Mystery.

These thirty-two characters are the mandate the Divine Duke received from the Primordial Beginning, and may also serve as the incantation of the Thunder Spirit. When one feels fear or timidity, knock the teeth thirty-two times, visualize oneself as the Divine Duke, and recite it ten times—then the myriad demons will flee, and a thousand specters will vanish.

**Jade Calendar Chapter**
The Master said: "Primordial Cavern Jade Calendar... to the natural operation of deliverance."
This is the essential form of the Great Cavern’s true text. The Jade Calendar records the unfolding of the Five Kalpas and the transitions of billions of kalpas.

The Great Cavern is the Primal Cavern. During the Dragon Han and Yan Kang kalpas, the Great Cavern remained undivided. Above were thirty-six qi, below thirty-six marshes—all were the qi of metal, water, fierce winds, and Brahmā marshes, without color or light. By the Red Clarity kalpa, the Primordial Beginning opened the chart, and the movements responded to the unfolding. Calculations extended, and forms naturally divided, giving rise to the true text of the Red Script.

"Deliverance" means one degree per day. "Kalpa" refers to the great and small kalpic cycles. A small kalpa occurs when yang reaches its ninth extreme and generates yin, or yin reaches its hundred-sixth extreme and generates yang, with water disasters and fire calamities alternating to renew beings. A great kalpa occurs when the Jade Clarity Heaven’s Wan Chang Terrace—a hundred-jeweled jade platform, ninety thousand *li* high and sixty thousand *li* wide—receives the first degree of the sun and moon’s emergence each day. Heavenly beings ascend the terrace, chant the Cavern Chapter, gather the morning essence of the sun and moon, pluck branches of azure celestial jewels to brush the light of the sun and moon, and collect the finest mustard-seed pearls of azure celestial essence, casting them into the Western Primordial City. When the robes of the heavenly beings are brushed clean of all jewels, azure essence, and mustard-seed pearls, filling the Western City, one kalpa is complete. At this time, heaven and earth clash, water, fire, and wind disasters purge the filth across the sky, and all below the Three Realms is destroyed. The Dragon Gate converges, the Raven Mother delivers the kalpa’s passage, and the Seed People descend to assist the Sagely Lord of Great Peace.

From the Yan Kang and Dragon Han kalpas to the opening of the Red Clarity’s chart, billions of kalpas have passed.

**Red Script Chapter**
The Master said: "Primal Cavern Red Script... to the primordial text unborn."
Since the jade characters arose before the Great Brahmā, until the Red Clarity’s chart opened, they became the Red Script. Before enlightenment, they were concealed within the Primal Cavern—also called the sixty-four characters of the Red Script, illuminated in the marsh’s register. In inner contemplation, they are the Dao of the Great Cavern’s jade characters merging. They are also lost within inner practices and not further expounded.

**Great Brahmā Chapter**

The Master said: "This is the Great Brahmā, extending to the vast array of pure radiance. The Great Brahmā is the essence of the Great Cavern. Above all heavens, there is the Heavenly Emperor of the Great Luo, with Yu Luo Xiao Terrace, formed of seven treasures within the empty mystery. The terrace has nine tiers, towering into the vastness of the firmament, standing atop the Jade Mountain’s peak in the White Jade Capital. Its height reaches the utmost primordial above—this is the Mystic Capital governed by the Primordial Lord of Jade Clarity in the Great Luo. Its kalpas stretch boundlessly, beyond perception, neither existing nor absent, without fixed location. Above are the Three Flowers Hall, the Departure Palace, the Palace of Great Possession, and the Palace of Wondrous Courts, golden towers and jade chambers, the vast array of upper halls, and the two pure radiant pools. Speaking inwardly, these are the nine palaces of the mud-pill. The Jade Emperor’s Palace, where the Primordial Lord dwells, aligns with the nine palaces spoken of in the Highest Clarity—this is precisely the Dao of the inner audience with the Primordial Lord."

**Qi of the Brahmā Chapter**
The Master said: "The great practice of Brahmā qi reaches the immeasurable salvation of beings. This is the secret essence of the Great Cavern, circulating through the ten directions, also the tenfold salvation of beings, the root of the five phases’ generation and completion. Within it is the divine power of salvation and immortality, the August One, the Venerable Sovereign. The Lord of Longevity at the Southern Culmen, the Supreme One, the Red Child, divides his form into the Nine Perfected. The Marshal of Salvation, the great spirit, is the spirit of the Great One. The Elder Han, who cherishes life, is the True Person Elder within the heart. The Supervisors of Fate and Records in the Southern Upper, along with the Lord of Turning Bones and Reviving the Dead, reside in the Lower Primordial, extending life and increasing destiny to guard the Elder in the Middle Primordial, while the Lord of Salvation from Calamity and Ascension assists the One in the Upper Primordial. All gather qi from the Nine Heavens, and the Nine Heavens gather qi in the Supreme Tenuity. The qi of the Supreme Tenuity’s Brahmā is the qi of the Highest Mystic Cavern, the mist that dispels negativity. Entering the adept’s body, it immediately brings immortality. Practicing for three years, one attains the Dao. This has already been lost within the original scripture."

**Summoning the Perfected Chapter**
The Master said: "Today’s collation and recording extend to the strict examination of all heavens. At the beginning of the Red Clarity kalpa, within the Primordial Azure Heaven, in the Great Floating Li Land, on the day of opening the collation charts and records, the divine kings and great sages of all heavens presided over their celestial registers, descending to the imperial terrace to weigh the gravity of sins and blessings, recording the depth of merits and transgressions. In Jade Clarity, there is the Eight Sceneries Hidden Mystery Luo Chart; in Highest Clarity, the Twenty-Four Qi Eight Sceneries Mystery Chart—all charts opened by the Primordial Lord, along with the primordial charts of the heavens’ Brahmā qi. The records are: the Upper Primordial’s golden record script, the Middle Primordial’s jade record script, and the Lower Primordial’s yellow record script. There are also the Jade Clarity Flying Transformation Mystery Record Treasure Chart, the Highest Clarity Azure Perfected Purple Record Dawn Chart, and all heavens below the Grand Clarity possess their own charts and records, numbering in the billions, impossible to enumerate fully. All proceed to the presence of the Primordial Lord of the Dao to be collated. These ten directions’ great sages hold exalted ranks, equal in station to the Lord of the Dao, yet serve under the Primordial Lord. The five-colored mystery dragons are not forms with appearance but transform through the qi of the five phases’ supreme mystery. The nine-colored nodes are azure, yellow, red, white, dark green, jade green, green, crimson, and purple—nine-colored feathers forming the nodes. The ten divine silken cords are formed within the five divine brocades, serving as the divine cords. Flying clouds are the light, pure, soaring, and efflorescent rosy clouds, riding the cinnabar jade chariot and azure jasper brush. Above is the canopy of five-colored mystery feathers, below the forest of hundred-word jasper and jade. Some ride the vermilion phoenix with trailing banners, or guide the five-colored mystery dragons. The Five Elders open the path, the Wei Immortals adorn the shafts. Inclining their light, they descend and turn their chariots to the terrace, overseeing the multitudes of perfected in all heavens, universally collating the salvation of beings. Those who hold records and grasp registers are the prime ministers of all heavens, presiding over collation. The one who determines ranks is the Elder Han, Supervisor of Affairs. The overseers of beings’ salvation, the great spirits of the Nine Heavens, all proceed to the presence of the Primordial Lord of the Dao. According to their ranks, the thirty-six qi descend, and below are the thirty-six marshes—all qi of metal, water, firm winds, and Brahmā marshes, without color or light. At the Red Clarity kalpa, the Primordial Lord opened the charts, responding to the movement and beginning the reckoning. The degrees of salvation naturally divide forms, and only then do the true texts of the Red Script appear. Salvation occurs once daily. A kalpa is the great or small cycle of kalpic destiny. A small kalpa occurs when yang reaches its ninth extremity and generates yin, or yin reaches its hundred-sixth extremity and generates yang, with water disasters and fire calamities alternating, renewing all beings. The great kalpa occurs when in the Jade Clarity Heaven there is the Wan Chang Terrace, made of a hundred treasures and jade stones, nine myriad miles high and six myriad miles wide. Each dawn, as the sun and moon first rise, the heavenly people ascend the terrace, singing the Cavern Hymns and gathering the morning blossoms of the sun and moon, plucking branches of empty azure treasure to brush the light of the sun and moon, taking the finest mustard-seed pearls of empty azure and casting them into the Western Primordial City. When the people’s garments are brushed clean of treasure stones, empty azure, and mustard-seed pearls, filling the Western City, this constitutes one kalpa. At this time, heaven and earth clash, water, fire, and wind disasters sweep away filth across the sky, and all below the Three Realms are destroyed. The Dragon Gate converges, the Raven Mother delivers the kalpa’s passage, and the Seed People descend to assist the Sagely Lord of Great Peace. From the Yan Kang and Dragon Han kalpas to the opening of the Red Clarity’s chart, billions of kalpas have passed."

**Flowing Transformation Chapter**
The Master said: "Since the Primordial Lord’s pacification and stabilization, the myriad patterns have unfolded. From the beginning of the chart’s opening, the Primordial Lord’s five true texts of the Red Script descended to pacify and stabilize the five directions, commanding the Five Emperors to govern and transform, nurturing beings, stabilizing and aiding salvation, preserving heaven’s eternal existence. Even through kalpic destiny, it remains uncorrupted. The Three Strategies endure as before, with the qi of the Great Brahmā’s jade characters pervading all heavens. From this, the myriad patterns of the Three Realms unfold. The above sixty-four characters, together with these thirty-two characters, are the ultimate will of heaven and earth, the Brahmā sounds of the Numinous Treasure, the original scripture of the Mystic Cavern. For pacification, exorcism, and governance, use them at will to immediately obtain numinous response."

With the heart dwelling on the Primordial Lord and the mouth reciting this chapter, the qi summons the northwest—this is the mudra of the Jade Purity. The *Dark Texts of Delusion* are now transcended.

**Ascent to the Primordial Chapter**
The Master said: The Primordial Net unfolds, its qi entering the Mysterious of Mysteries. The Primordial Net is the guiding principle of the Primordial Cavern, the axis of the Primal Chaos. It flows through the thirty-two heavens, revolving through the five-colored realms, circling the ten directions, beginning anew after completion. From the Dipper’s leftward revolution through the degrees of the Winnowing Basket, it traces the divisions of the sun and moon, accomplishing the great transformation of the Five Emperors. In thirty-five divisions—thirty-two heavens and three heavens—its qi converges. Within the unfolding of the Upper Primordial, it revolves through the Primordial-Colored Realm, darkly uniting with the qi of the Jade Purity’s Eight Luminaries Heaven, entering the Heaven within Heaven, the Mysterious within the Mysterious.

Speaking inwardly, the Primordial Net of the body is the Mud-Pill Palace. Day and night, it circulates qi and blood, completing its cycle through the body, converging in the Upper Primordial. The Three Divisions, Eight Luminaries, and twenty-four qi—revolving through the Jade Purity Palace and the Mud-Pill Palace—unite the true feminine and true masculine with the Eight Luminaries, totaling thirty-two qi. The Three Primordials and Three Qi converge in the Upper Primordial’s Mysterious Palace, descending to connect with the pericardium’s eight vessels, darkly uniting with the Lower Primordial’s Eight Luminaries.

There exists the *Chart of the Mysterious Net*, which explores the way of ingesting the flowing qi of heaven, fully expounded in this section. To contract the Mysterious is the method.

**Contracting the Mysterious Chapter**
The Master said: Within the Mysterious dwells the Supreme August, extending to assist the ten thousand immortals. The Supreme August within the Mysterious is the Queen Mother, mother of the myriad qi of the Lower Primordial, the divine spirit of eternal life. She is the Dao Lord of the Supreme Emperor, the sacred perfected of the Supreme August, dwelling in the Great Rosy Cloud Palace of the Western Primordial. She chants the empty and cavernous numinous chapters, ceaselessly generating the myriad qi. In her left hand, she grasps the Golden Perfected Jade Radiance; in her right, she brandishes the Flowing Gold Fire Bell. Its resonance flows through the thirty-five heavens, its sound responding to the cloud encampments of the Heaven within Heaven. The jade tones gather the Upper Primordial’s qi; the numinous winds assemble the smoke of the *pifei*. The purple luminaries flourish in the Great Void, and the ten thousand immortals assist and attend in homage—this is the great esoteric method of the *Great Cavern’s Revolving Wind and Primal Union*.

The *cloud encampments* are not camps of gathered clouds but the encampments of revolving and instantaneous movement. The marvel lies in the sixteen characters: *Golden Perfected shining bright, its resonance flows through the cloud encampments; jade tones gather qi, numinous winds assemble smoke.* These are the great prohibitions of the heavens, not to be lightly revealed. They are concealed within the opening chapter of the *Perfect Scripture of the Great Cavern*, awaiting the worthy to seek and examine them, thereby contracting the true Mysterious.

**Perfection of the True Chapter**

The Master said: A thousand harmonies, ten thousand unions—this is the ultimate safeguard of life and the root of generation. With this esoteric method, blend and merge one thousand times, totaling ten thousand repetitions, and you shall naturally attain perfection. Within perfection dwells the spirit, the Lord of Longevity, foremost among the Nine Perfected.

The Noble Youth of Primordial Florescence is the spirit of the liver, governing the *hun*. The Venerable White Prime is the spirit of the lungs, governing the *po*. The Supreme Unity is the Lord of Life, master of qi; Peach Radiance and Union of Longevity govern essence. Together, they hold the five talismans and five registers of your destiny, preserving the root of your life’s origin. When the five spirits merge, the hundred spirits transform.

**Chapter of the Flowering Salutation**

The Master said: Ascend to the Supreme Clarity, where the myriad qi unite as immortals. Supreme Clarity is the flowering chamber of the heart. The Supreme Unity contains the lotus, its form naturally arising. The Primordial Sovereign of the Supreme Unity resides there, like the heart of a lotus bud—unopened cinnabar blossom. The eight hidden meridians converge in this place, all gathering within the heart. Within the subtlest of subtleties, the primordial qi flows, circulating through the wellspring’s source. Like the veins of plants and trees, these are the pathways of the body’s crimson script and blood vessels, the encampments of its defense.

The governance of the five qi within is the refinement of the five spirits’ wondrous qi at the Central Origin. The five spirits unify the eight hidden blood vessels in profound union. When the hundred spirits revolve ten times in their numinous return, the myriad qi unite as immortals.

Within the heart’s center lies water, called *spirit-water*. Drink of it, and demons and spirits shall behold you as the crimson sun. These seven spirits are the Mysterious Cinnabar of the Supreme Unity, the gods of the Central Dipper: Yang Brightness. The Noble Youth of Primordial Florescence is the Supreme Unity of the Northern Culmen. Within the human body, they are the original form of the Yellow Supreme Emperor. The Lord of Longevity is Yang Brightness. The Noble Youth of Non-Florescence is Yin Essence. The Venerable White Prime is the Supreme Unity of the Northern Culmen. The Perfected One, the Lifespan Lord, is the Ninth Cinnabar and Primordial Cinnabar; Peach Radiance is the Great Lord; Mysterious Darkness. The Great Spirit of Union and Longevity is the Radiant Light.

**Chapter of the Three Realms**

The Master said: The Dao of immortality values life, ascending to the midst of soaring emptiness. The Desire Realm lies lowest, its domain the Six Heavens. Those who cultivate three hundred virtuous deeds may be reborn in the Form Realm. Those who maintain the Three Pure Practices—purifying body, mind, and speech—may be reborn in the Formless Realm. Those who purify the three karmas and remain unstained by the six senses may be reborn in this heaven. If both dust and karma are purified, one is born among the Seed People. Beyond this lies the attainment of the natural origin, the realm of the Great Cavern.

The *Song of the Three Realms* is the melody sung by the Demon King as he soars through the void, following the Jade Clarity. *A-da* is the Demon King’s self-designation.

**Chapter of Reverent Form**

The Master said: The Demon King reveres form, extending to the seven ancestral elders. This refers to the cessation of the *Song of the Three Realms*, which is not part of the two canonical chapters. From *Demon King* to *regeneration*, these thirty-two characters are admonitions to restrain earthly attachments, urging scholars of the recitation to show reverence.

**Chapter of Heavenly Treasure**

The Master said: The Dao declares that what heaven treasures is not transmitted to the lower world. According to the Mysterious Regulations, the Heavenly Perfected are transmitted once every forty thousand kalpas. If one pledges gold and treasures with a sincere heart, following the ancient statutes and swearing oaths before the Ten Heavens, only then may transmission be granted.

The ancient statutes decree that the Perfected and the ordinary have ranks. After forty thousand kalpas, the Perfected One, in accordance with the Crimson Palace’s immortal statutes and the Great Perfected’s alliance rituals, may transmit once every forty years.

**Chapter of Universal Salvation**

The Master said: The Dao speaks of heaven and earth, extending to the universal salvation of the primordial limit. This refers to the dissolution of all inauspiciousness through boundless scriptures, universally saving the limitless.

**Chapter of Yin Refinement**

The Master said: Those who study the Dao superficially must refine the corpse’s form to attain immortality. As described in the preceding *Chapter of Learning*, the method of refining and transforming the corpse’s form derives from the *Scripture of the Five Refinements of the Numinous Treasure for Generating the Corpse*, specifically the *Chapter of the Nine Refinements for Life and Transformation*, clarifying its essentials in the *Section on Ascension and Salvation*.

**Chapter of Preservation and Pacification**

The Master said: The Dao speaks of heaven and earth, extending to the universal salvation of heaven and humanity. This method of preservation and pacification has been lost in the various sections.

**Chapter of the Utmost Words**

The Master said: The Dao declares that whoever possesses this scripture shall attain immeasurable merit and virtue, boundless mysterious transformation, and responsive retribution of sin and blessing. The common person, ignorant of its reality, must diligently practice, while the superior person deeply comprehends its profound principles. Only on the day of attaining the Dao shall one fully understand the scripture’s most wondrous words and the true efficacy of its numinous responses.

**Chapter of the Great Cavern**

The Master said: This is the middle section. The sounds of the Great Brahma’s jade script in all heavens, the hidden language of the thirty-two heavens’ primordial measure—these are the ancestral qi of the Primordial Beginning, the forbidden chapters within the *Numinous Writ*, composed by the Jade Dawn Dao Lord and transcribed by the Heavenly Perfected Sovereign. Within it lies the secret taboo of the Great Cavern’s recollection, the sounds of the five kalpas’ unfolding diagrams, drawn from the *Scripture of the Jade Characters of the Inner Sounds of All Heavens*. Its hidden mysteries point to profound depths; you may examine them in detail. Take care never to reveal them to the ears and eyes of the unworthy, lest you evade heaven’s decree. Practice it in silence.

**Chapter of the Mysterious Response**

The Master said: Those who know its sounds shall attain the Mysterious Response by reciting them alone.

**Chapter of the Sovereign**

The Master said: The *Supreme Wondrous Scripture of the Primordial Measure for Salvation of Humanity* consists entirely of titles designated by the Dao Lord. This chapter is the internal title given by the Heavenly Perfected Sovereign. The four lines of *Supreme Wondrous* to *Naturally* (sixteen characters in total) summarize the scripture’s central purpose and great meaning. The assembled perfected ones also say that the five directional true writs are concealed within this scripture.

From *Merging the Cavern* to *Salvation of Humanity* is the main text spoken by the Primordial Heavenly Worthy. From *Now* to *All Heavens* records the instructions for salvation received by the Jade Dawn Dao Lord. From *Universally Proclaiming* to *Supreme Clarity* contains the commands and divine works bestowed by the Primordial Heavenly Worthy, as recorded by the Dao Lord. From *Supreme Clarity* to *Brahma Conduct* is also the main text spoken by the Primordial Beginning.

From *Thirty-Two Heavens* to *Receiving Salvation* records the Dao Lord’s account of his own salvation on that day, his words of self-congratulation. From *Passing the Barriers* to *Gate of Heaven* contains the Primordial Heavenly Worthy’s passage through the barriers, as recorded by the Dao Lord. From *Binding the Dipper* to *Demonic Spirits* recounts the Dao Lord’s proclamation of the deeds of support, defense, and sweeping away, the awe-inspiring power of the Great Gods of Jade Clarity. From *Three Officials* to *Supreme Clarity* is the talisman of command received on that day by the Divine Duke, the Supreme Perfected, the Grand Minister of the Great Mystery, and the Five Numinous Northern Thearch, the words bestowed by the Primordial Heavenly Worthy, as recorded by the Dao Lord. From *Primal Net* to *Gate of Life* is the main text spoken by the Primordial Heavenly Worthy. From *Within It* to *Lofty Perfected* contains the Dao Lord’s transmission of the Great Cavern’s instructions. The *Hymns of the Three Realms* were composed by the Demon Kings and transcribed by the Heavenly Perfected Sovereign. The *Hidden Sayings, Middle Section* is the Dao Lord’s arrangement of the Primordial Heavenly Worthy’s main text. From *Above These Three Realms* to *Utmost Profound Mystery* was all spoken by the Dao Lord and transcribed by the Heavenly Perfected Sovereign. From *Decree to Govern Earth* to the *Thirty-Two Characters of Renewed Life* is the Primordial Heavenly Worthy’s decree, also recorded by the Dao Lord.

The second chapter begins at *Primordial Cavern’s Mysterious* and continues to *Proclaiming to Supreme Clarity*, forming the first section. From *Primordial Cavern’s Jade Register* to *Parting from the Highest Perfected* is the second section. The *Hymns of the Three Realms* do not belong to these two sections but were composed by the Demon Kings. The remainder, being the words of the Dao, were recorded by the Dao Lord and do not pertain to the purport of these two sections.

Here ends *Supreme Clarity Numinous Treasure Great Rites*, Scroll Twenty-Six
Beginning *Supreme Clarity Numinous Treasure Great Rites*, Scroll Twenty-Seven

Dongwei Gaoshi Kaiguang Jiuku Zhenren Ning Quanzhen bestowed upon the Shangqing San Dong disciple, Lingbao Preceptor and Successor Master Wang Qizhen, compiler of *Dongxuan Immortal Ranks*

**Gate of Immortal Ranks**
**Discourse on the Grades of Immortals**

The Master said: Male immortals of the highest rank are called Heavenly Worthies; female immortals of the highest rank are called Primordial Ladies. If form and spirit have not yet attained sublime refinement and still retain the fleshly corpse, they shall not be granted such titles.

For those with a physical body—once perfected—the great merit requires three years, middle merit seven years, and lesser merit nine years for one promotion. For those in the primordial body, all ascend once every seven hundred years.

First, one is examined for office in the Nether Bureau; next, one enters the Water Officials as master of mountains and rivers; then the Earth Officials as master of serene abodes and blessed lands; then as master of grotto-heavens; then as immortal officer of the Ten Continents and Three Islands; and gradually advances into the Heavenly Bureaus.

For those who perform merit in the world, establishing great virtue and great merit to transform others, with both inner and outer merits complete, the place where the spirits are welcomed and offices conferred is the Great Yin’s refinement of the corpse. When the years of cultivation are fulfilled, they merge with the immortal form and ascend in flight.

If merit and virtue are incomplete in inner and outer cultivation, one’s spirit is dispatched to govern affairs, establishing a residence in the Nether Bureaus of Heaven, Earth, and Water.

To enter these mysterious ranks and pure grades, one must receive the Dipper’s scriptures, erase the name of death, and ascend to the Southern Bureau. When merit rectifies corruption, one ascends into the immortal ranks. After comparing years of cultivation, promotion within the immortal grades is also permitted.

Those who presumptuously overstep will be strictly investigated by the Three Officials—how can one not guard against this? Offenders will be demoted in rank, have years of cultivation revoked, and be penalized with additional merit tasks. One must be reverent and cautious.

The above ten ranks are comparable to the heavenly chancellors. All require fifty rectifications of corruption for one promotion; forty rectifications grant entry into the above ten Perfected Steward ranks. From here onward, one enters the Form Realm of Heaven.

Grand Splendor Dharma-Enforcing Immortal Stewards, Upper Immortals, Perfected Stewards.
Primordial Capacity Dharma-Enforcing Immortal Stewards, Upper Immortals, Perfected Stewards.
Grand Peace Dharma-Enforcing Immortal Stewards, Upper Immortals, Perfected Stewards.
Manifest Stability Dharma-Enforcing Immortal Stewards, Upper Immortals, Perfected Stewards.

The above require sixty rectifications of corruption to enter the Immortal Steward ranks, seventy to enter Upper Immortal, and eighty to enter Perfected Steward. From here onward, one enters the Formless Realm of Heaven.

Grand Script Dharma-Enforcing Immortal Stewards, Upper Immortals, Perfected Stewards.

Supreme Dharma-Enforcing Immortal Stewards, Upper Immortals, Perfected Stewards.
