**Section on Transmission Procedures and Statutes**

The Master said: When opening the altar to transmit the Dharma, act according to one’s capacity. For those of ample means, one should submit petitions in advance, perform the evening rites of water consecration and altar prohibition, and conduct the overnight invocation rituals as in the fast. At dawn the following day, ascend the altar and perform the three daily audiences. By evening, conclude with the offering of the jiao ritual for transmission—this is most excellent. However, worldly custom often abbreviates the process, limiting it to the jiao alone, so the overnight invocations and morning audiences are seldom fully recorded.

The three-day liturgy of the Numinous Treasure Great Fast and Daoist arena may also be adapted as needed. Here, I shall briefly outline the jiao ritual for transmission, which is the rite of receiving the Dharma and giving thanks—distinct from the Yellow Register fast. Proceed according to its relative importance.

---

**Liturgy for the Transmission Jiao of the Numinous Treasure Great Dharma**

All pay reverence to the Master and visualize as prescribed, then intone the divine incantations:

Xiao Ren supports Fusang, Fang Zhu glows with crimson mist.
The Primordial August arrays the Perfected, congealing in cloud-sprouts.
Radiant with nine rays, containing the qi of triple blossoms.
Clashing the heavens, brandishing the sword—Divine Tiger dispels evil.
Great Emperor of Anyang, who subdues and governs the hordes of demons.
Ascending to Mysterious Capital, bathing one’s form in the Celestial River.
*Response:* In harmony with the Dao, united with the Real.

Fiery qi floats as smoke, ascending into the Crimson Clarity.
The Primordial Sage of Longevity, exalted in Jade Capital.
Descending the wondrous Mysterious Net, scattering crystal through the six darknesses.
The Great Proclamation of Primordial Heaven universally delivers all beings.
Dissolving trials of demons, dispelling flying fire-bells.
Safeguarding the upright qi, eternally tranquil through kalpas.
*Response:* In harmony with the Dao, united with the Real.

Resplendent scene of golden splendor, eternal brilliance of the Cavernous Light.
The Great Brahma flows forth, revolving the Primordial Net.
Luminous transformations intermingle, soaring and transforming the ten directions.
The Seven Passes are pacified, harmonizing yin and yang.
The Emperor’s qi flows boundlessly—I receive auspicious blessings.
Jade scriptures are proclaimed, the Way of life extends and flourishes.
*Response:* In harmony with the Dao, united with the Real.

The Primordial Yin’s northern extremity, ascending to connect with the Emperor’s abode.
Flowing flames surge as crystal, transforming form in Jade Emptiness.
Assisting and guarding the Three Realms, examining the Primordial Charts.
True talismans shine forth, fixing the registers in Azure Capital.
Names inscribed in the Golden Record—all past transgressions are erased.
Soaring to the Azure Empyrean, transcending to ascend to the Great Primordial.
*Response:* In harmony with the Dao, united with the Real.

The Primordial August of the Void, gathering qi to dwell at the center.
The Three Realms are profoundly distant, giving birth to the vault of heaven.
Seven revolutions, nine numina—mingling and blending with the returning winds.
Transforming the myriad spirits, opening communication between heaven and earth.
On this auspicious day, conduct the rites—all demons’ traces are severed.
Morning radiance shines brightly, silently enacting the Primordial Work.
Raising the banner, scattering flowers, holding the staff in the Great Void.
Universally delivering the ten directions, the kalpic destiny reaches its end.
*Response:* In harmony with the Dao, united with the Real.

The Dharma Master kneels in reverence and summons the officials as prescribed.

Your servant humbly summons from within his body the Five Visceral Perfected Officials, the Merit Officers and Attendants, the Yin-Yang Merit Officers of Transformation and Transmission, the Officers of Disaster-Dispelling, Calamity-Scattering, and Misfortune-Resolving—twelve each. From this oratory, summon the Banner-Holding Supervisory General of Merit, the Direct Merit Officers, the Yin-Yang Divine Central Attendants—two each. Let all who are summoned don their regalia, take their stations, and encircle your servant’s body in formation.

The Gentlemen-Officers, Tiger Warriors, Inspectors of Treachery, Hook-Riding Cavalry, Chief Administrators, Archers, Celestial Soldiers, Officers of Rectification, Spirit-Feeding Officers, Poison-Collecting and Poison-Feeding Officers, Essence-Collecting and Essence-Feeding Officers, Evil-Collecting and Evil-Feeding Officers, Talisman-Breaking and Shrine-Destroying Officers, Officers of the Rigorous Wind and Mounted Couriers, Flying Dragon Cavalry, and all other officials shall assemble and station themselves to your servant’s left and right, front and rear, to receive your servant’s words and transmit them to the local earth gods, territorial deities, governing spirits of tranquil dwellings, renowned mountains, cavern-heavens, blessed lands, sea and mountain Tai Sui officials, and all divine officers and attendants within the Dharma.

With sincere devotion, your servant jointly petitions the Supreme August of the Primordial Form, Primordial Name, Void Primordial, and Self-So True Great Dao, the Supreme August of the Primordial Origin, before the Golden Gates and Jade Steps.

On the day your servant received the Dharma, he pledged to propagate it widely for the salvation of all beings, prioritizing the reception of others.

Now, with utmost reverence, this Dao-practitioner [Name] humbly presents a petition of advancement and obeisance, supplicating the Mysterious Response.

May all that your servant prays for be fulfilled, all that he petitions be answered, all that he condemns be repelled, and all that he averts be transcended. May the Merit-Officials, Generals, and Flying Dragon Cavalry Officers distinctly transmit and timely report these entreaties. Once the petitions are presented in full, may they return to your servant’s body and resume their stations within the palace chambers. When summoned again, may they arrive as before, in accordance with established protocol.

Invoking the Dharma rank, your servant, the humble and unworthy [Name], jointly and sincerely petitions the Jade Purity Sagely Realm’s Primordial Heavenly Worthy, the Highest Purity True Realm’s Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, the Great Purity Immortal Realm’s Dao and Virtue Heavenly Worthy, the August Jade Emperor of the Vast Heaven, the Great Emperor of the Southern Culmen, the Great Emperor of the Northern Culmen of Purple Tenuity, the Earth Deities who Uphold Heaven and Emulate the Dao, the Divine Empyrean Jade Purity True King and Great Emperor of Longevity, the Great Emperor of the Eastern Culmen of Azure Radiance, the Highest Perfected of the Myriad Heavens, the Highest Perfected of the Sun, Moon, Stars, and Milky Way, the Three Officials and Great Emperors, the Four Sagely Perfected Lords, the Heavenly Worthy of the Numinous Treasure Great Dharma and Mysterious Center Great Dharma Master, the Tranquil Elder of the Three Heavens, the Perfected Lord of the Tranquil Response of the Three Heavens Great Dharma Master, the Three Perfected Lords of the Ancient Scriptures and Registers, the Perfected Lord of the Grand Ultimate Immortal Elder, the Perfected Lord of the Nine Heavens’ Divine Merit and Wondrous Salvation, the Three Perfected Lords of the Yellow Register, the Divine Immortals of the Three Caverns and Four Supplements’ Scriptural Registers, the Perfected Lord of Floating Hill of the Thunder Bureau, the Perfected Lords and Immortals of the Dharma-Transmitting Masters, the Heavenly Immortals, Divine Officers, Generals, and Soldiers of the Dharma Registers, and all the August Perfected and Highest Perfected of the Three Realms and Ten Directions.

May your vast compassion open the luminous mirror of discernment. Your servant has heard that the Primordial Form and Primordial Name are the wondrous traces of the Mysterious True. With light and image, they manifest the numinous mechanism of divine transformation. They preceded the formation of the cosmos and were the foundation of Heaven and Earth’s creation. From this single qi, the Three Powers were nurtured; all spirits were governed, and the myriad kinds were cultivated. Thus, the Primordial Net unfurled its mysteries, establishing the root and origin of ten thousand kalpas. The Great Brahma revealed its secrets, disclosing the esoteric scriptures of the Nine Purities. The Three Caverns spread forth, and the Nine Grades were proclaimed. These served to unfold the mechanism of transformation and to manifest the essentials of the Dao. Through the enlightenment of the revered masters, the teachings have been revered across past and present.

Your servant, though unworthy and base, has presumptuously joined the ranks of the ordained, recklessly presiding over the supreme teachings and gazing upon the sacred scriptures. It is fitting that he exert himself to propagate the Dharma, never daring to neglect his duties on account of others. Having purified himself to advance, he must open the path of diligent cultivation. The transmission is inexhaustible, fulfilling the intent of the Great Teaching’s completion. The standards of transmission are established, and it is proper to supplicate the Highest Perfected for their oversight and grace. Thus, he gazes toward the Purple Culmen to offer sincerity and bows toward the Azure Empyrean in reverence. Undeterred by the meagerness of his offerings, he dares to extend his plea to the august presence.

May five-colored auspicious clouds surround the flaming bells and flowing talismans. May the Three Flowers and Yellow Dao descend in the chariots of flying dragons and phoenixes. May the host of sages approach the throne, and the assembly of perfected take their places. As your servant and the hundred spirits tremble in awe, with a single-minded purity, they bow at the celestial steps to reverently welcome the sagely procession.

May the Perfected and August Ones descend to the altar. The first libation shall be offered. The Dharma office shall be solemnly proclaimed again.

Your servant, the humble and unworthy [Name], respectfully reiterates his petition to the Three Realms’ Highest Worthies, the Myriad Heavenly Thearchs, the Ten Directions’ Primordial Ultimate Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, the Numinous Treasure Great Dharma’s successive generations of master perfected, and the August Perfected and Highest Perfected of the Three Realms and Ten Directions.

Your servant has heard that the Dao’s essence is beyond words, and the teachings are established through scriptural precepts. Transformation is enacted through works, and salvation is extended through the Dharma’s thread. The Nine Grades and Three Vehicles are mutually interconnected. The Six Scripts and Eight Styles illuminate one another. Transmitted in the heavens, they become the path of myriad sages’ return. Descended to the human world, they open the gate for all beings’ cultivation and advancement. Without the good causes of past kalpas, how could one glimpse the true canon? Moreover, the teachings’ essentials are refined, and only then may one become a master. The will and thoughts must be pure and lofty to receive the Dharma. Establishing merit and accomplishing deeds glorifies the Mysterious Plan. Cultivating conduct and disciplining the self inwardly refines the mortal frame. The precepts are most weighty, and transmission is not to be taken lightly.

Your servant, by nature unworthy and lacking true understanding, knows not the truth of refining the Five Sprouts and Three Primes, nor can he escape the waves of the Six Desires and Seven Emotions. He ought to reflect upon himself—how could he instruct others? Yet, having sworn an oath and ascended the altar to receive his office, though he must not recklessly divulge the teachings, neither may he seal them away and lose the transmission. Moreover, moved by earnest entreaties and wishing to spread the transformation of the True and Perfected, how could he, on account of his own inadequacy, ultimately reject and sever the connection? Fortunate that the aspirant has resolve, he presumes to present this petition. Though he may be ignorant of the mechanisms of communion with the True and attainment of the Numinous, he dares not transmit treacherous or deceptive methods. Thus, he consults the ancient canons and unfolds the numinous precinct, awaiting the descent of the Highest Perfected and revering the presence of the August Worthy. Presumptuously, he lays bare his humble devotion and presents his petition to the august throne, solemnly proclaiming the words of transmission and advancement.

The proclamation of the petition shall be read aloud, and the offerings burned. As the words of the petition state, the sincerity is firm and earnest, and the circumstances warrant guidance. He dares not decline.

Your servant has heard that the Numinous Treasure’s divine chapters and Mysterious Upper Scriptures, from the inception of the Eternal Prosperity, are unfathomable in their origin. At the dawn of the Dragon Han, their wonders gradually manifested. They coalesced the jade qi of soaring mystery and formed the numinous sounds of hidden secrecy. They established the root and origin of the Five Peaks and spread through four translations. They pacify states and assist the governance of emperors, harmonize yin and yang, and aid the work of creation. The August Perfected and Highest Perfected all attain the Dao through them. How could the suffering souls of the departed not ascend and transcend by their power? They are the bridge for the myriad kinds and the model for all spirits. Though the transmission of these majestic canons is not to be taken lightly, their vast merit encompasses all without exception.

Again, your servant reflects that, though dull and unlearned, he has presumptuously occupied the seat of master and teacher. His successor, [Name], though base and common, has presumptuously received the office of the immortal and numinous.

The matter far exceeds my station, and in truth, I am ashamed at heart. Yet I humbly pray that Heaven’s creation may show compassion, and further hope that the grace of my master may shelter and nurture me. May I be permitted transmission and initiation, that I may ascend the ranks of the Perfected, be early recorded in the Mystic Capital, have all my transgressions erased from the Black Register, bypass demonic trials, and gradually enter the lineage of immortals. Yet the stains of my presumption are too many, and my capacity for reverence is all too meager. Once more I offer two libations to express my sincere devotion.

Your servants bow twice and perform the secondary offering with reverent ceremony. We invoke the Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the Ten Directions.

The Preceptor kneels and presents the petition, reciting:

I have heard that in the primordial kalpas of the Original Beginning, the myriad heavens were transformed into being. Hidden were the celestial hymns of the Azure Vault, and spread were the luxuriant blossoms of the Purple Void. The Three Luminaries were revealed to universally establish the divine and numinous. The Five Scriptures were disseminated to preserve and regulate the kalpic destinies. Seated upon a five-colored lion, the Heavenly Worthy expounded the Dharma to deliver beings. Abiding in the resplendent forest of the Seven Treasures, he transmitted the scriptures and entrusted the world. Myriad sages bowed their heads at the imperial dais, and hosts of Perfected attended the seat in reverence. All were the hidden and secret sounds of the heavens, not the common chants of the mundane world. The numinous wind filled the sacred flute, causing the sun and moon to halt their courses. The golden mouth broadly expounded, stilling the divine winds into silence. With a single utterance, the heavens acclaimed its goodness; with ten repetitions, withered bones became human. Thus, we know the wondrous Dao is unfathomable, and its mysterious power is measureless. Treasured by the heavens above, it is not transmitted to the world below. Only when encountered by a true person with a sincere heart is it received through covenants of gold and silk. Hosts of Perfected oversee the transmission, myriad sages attend the dais, the heavens ensure its proper transmission, and demon kings affirm its completion. Only then, in accordance with the Mystic Pattern, is one permitted to advance into the ranks of the pure.

Now, your disciple [Name] has stepped forward to the altar, holding sincerity in heart to receive the Dharma. I, your servant, early received my master’s decree and obtained the sacred texts. Their fundamental purpose is to deliver beings, and when encountering the truly worthy, they must not be concealed. When earnest supplications arise, I thus petition the Supreme Mystery. Already, auspicious responses have been received, and on this propitious day, the transmission of talismans, the bestowal of the Dharma, the conferral of precepts, and the empowerment of the Dharma-army are granted.

I humbly beseech the Numinous Treasure hosts of Perfected, the exalted sages of the Highest Void, to compassionately deliver beings and skillfully guide them. May your disciple [Name] transcend the dusty world, forever depart from illusion, purify the six senses, escape the turning of the eight difficulties, suddenly awaken to the Mystic Mechanism, and attain the wondrous practice of the Dao. May his merit and conduct flourish in the Three Thousands, summoning and gathering the hosts of immortals. May he command the demon kings of the Five Emperors and subdue the myriad spirits.

Your servant and disciple bow twice and recite the petition of commitment. After the recitation, the successor disciple bows twice, kneels, and addresses the assembly:

The successor of the Great Numinous Treasure Dharma, your humble servant [Name], with awe and trepidation, bows his head and prostrates himself, offering sincere reverence again. I respectfully invoke the August Thearchs of the Three Realms of the Golden Towers, the Heavenly Worthies of the Numinous Treasure of the Ten Directions and the Primordial Ultimate, and the successive masters of the Numinous Treasure Great Dharma. May you grant compassion and deign to witness and record my plea.

Through a thousand lives, I have been fortunate to encounter, in this single day, the transmission of the Dharma and the succession of the lineage, advancing in rank and office. I vow to steadfastly uphold my pure resolve and never betray my heart. Should I violate this covenant, I willingly accept punishment. Today, with my preceptor, I divide the ring and break the contract, swearing an oath and drinking the cinnabar elixir. I humbly pray for your witness and permission to receive the transmission.

My heart is overwhelmed with earnest supplication. I bow twice and respectfully speak.

We invoke the Heavenly Worthy of Primordial Measurelessness Who Delivers Beings.

The master and disciple return to their ranks and stand facing each other. The master begins the proclamation of the precepts, and the disciple faces upward, kneeling to receive them.

I reverently hear that the Dao of the Numinous Treasure and the lineage of the Mystic Mystery are wondrous beyond naming, measureless in delivering beings. Those who receive it surpass the merit of seven generations of ancestors; those who cultivate it ascend their forms beyond the Nine Heavens. It is the numinous pivot of the myriad Dharmas and the essence of the true teachings of the ten directions. Its virtue is supremely great, profound beyond measure. One must cultivate what ought to be cultivated and, moreover, uphold what must be upheld as precepts. If one maintains them without fail, the ranks of the true immortals may be attained.

Today, before the Three Worthies, we first clarify the Ten Precepts.

We invoke the *Gatha of the Root of Wisdom-Generating Precepts*.

The First Precept: Do not forget the Eight Poles.
Loyalty is the pole of reverence, filial piety the pole of compliance, fasting the pole of restraint, magnanimity the pole of breadth, generosity the pole of joy, forbearance the pole of harmony, and patience the pole of wisdom. Heaven takes the North Star as its pole, earth takes the mountains as its poles, and a house takes the ridgepole as its pole. Heaven, having poles, can gather the multitude of *qi*; earth, having poles, can gather the multitude of forms; a house, having a pole, can gather the multitude of timbers. Humans, too, are thus with the Eight Poles. Therefore, one can establish the multitude of virtues. When virtues are established, the Dao is complete. When the Dao is complete, what one hears and sees naturally becomes clear and expansive, and one’s responses naturally become harmonious and fitting. This is the foundation of attaining the Numinous Treasure’s deliverance of beings.

The Second Precept: Do not forget the Mirroring Waters.
The mirror is an analogy for the heart; water is an analogy for nature. When the heart is bright, the myriad Dharmas are all illuminated; when nature is still, the five turbidities do not intrude. The Dao within humans is round and penetrating, not something that can be understood through obscuration or attained through restlessness. Entrusting oneself to the mirroring waters to awaken to the heart and nature—this is the essence of attaining the Numinous Treasure’s deliverance of beings.

The Third Precept: Do not forget the Daily Record.
The Daily Record is used to examine and review good and evil. The afflictions of humans in the world are not knowing themselves, not hearing their faults, and not heeding advice—thus, there is no benefit. Now, by recording daily actions in the Daily Record, one must not leave anything unnoted, for all are one’s own transgressions. The value lies in reform. Thus, the Daily Record is an uninstructing teacher, a silent friend, an uncommanding lord and father, and an unenforced code of law. It must not be forgotten. This is the contemplation of attaining the Numinous Treasure’s deliverance of beings.

The Fourth Precept: Do not forget the Pursuit of Deliverance and Pacification.
Moreover, of those to whom humans are close, none surpass their parents; of those they revere, none surpass their sovereign. To repay the virtue and kindness of parents and sovereigns is the pursuit of deliverance and pacification.

"Pursuit" refers to reciting scriptures and practicing disciplines, dedicating the merit to the departed ancestors and the six relations of one’s lineage to aid their journey in the netherworld. "Deliverance" refers to reciting scriptures and practicing disciplines, dedicating the merit to the living ancestors and the six relations to augment their fortune and lifespan. "Pacification" refers to reciting scriptures and practicing disciplines to extend blessings for the sovereign’s longevity, pacify the four directions, summon dragons to bring rain, expel demons and toxins, protect the people and all beings, and avert calamities caused by stellar influences—all of which are encompassed within this.

Whether dwelling at home and fulfilling the aspirations of ancestors, or serving in office and sharing the duties of the sovereign, one must act in every way that brings benefit and repays kindness. Even the falling leaves of a tree return to nourish its roots—this is the principle of returning to the root and restoring the mandate. The duty of humans to repay their origins and return to their beginnings must not be neglected. This is the proper way of attaining the Numinous Treasure’s deliverance of beings.

The Fifth Precept: Do not forget the arts of healing and salvation, with compassion as the foremost priority.
For all who are ill, recite scriptures and employ talismans on their behalf, performing exorcisms with utmost sincerity, as if they were one’s most beloved children or parents. In every possible way, extend kindness and grace with wholehearted devotion. When governing as an official, ensure that all actions cultivate hidden merit, enacting policies with leniency and fairness, reflecting thrice before acting, and deliberating twice before moving. Whether repairing bridges, planting along roads, or undertaking any endeavor beneficial to the world, exert every effort to accomplish it.

Human compassion is like the root of a tree. A person devoid of benevolence falls short even of beasts. Consider how gibbons rescue elephants, how magpies battle serpents—such acts of deliverance from peril exist in the world. Reflect upon this: this is the reason for attaining the Numinous Treasure’s deliverance of beings.

The Sixth Precept: Do not forget the arts of refinement and cultivation.
Harmonize with Heaven and Earth, emulate the patterns of yin and yang, maintain purity of thought in every moment, and preserve integrity without lapse. Thus, one naturally transcends, transforming into the primordial unbounded state. Witness how silkworms, though initially earthbound, eventually take flight; how creatures of land and water ultimately roam freely. If even animals achieve this, how much more should humans? This is the method of attaining the Numinous Treasure’s deliverance of beings.

The Seventh Precept: Do not forget firmness and purity.
Firmness entails steadfastness, refraining from improper conduct. Purity entails moral discipline, eschewing unwholesome sustenance. By not indulging in improper desires, one preserves the spirit and essence of the body. By not craving unwholesome food, one spares the lives of beings. Regard others’ wives and daughters as one’s own kin. Treat the lives of all beings as one’s own offspring. Thus, the spirit remains whole, and karmic adversaries diminish. This is the true practice of the Numinous Treasure’s deliverance of beings.

The Eighth Precept: Do not forget frugality and restraint.
In all that one seeks, recognize that all things originate from the primordial transformation of the Black Mystery of the Original Beginning. After the turbid waters receded, no adornment was needed. Coarse grains suffice to sate hunger; no need for lavish feasts. This is the fortune of attaining the Numinous Treasure’s deliverance of beings.

The Ninth Precept: Do not forget vows and pledges.
"Vows" are the aspirations one makes upon first entering the Dao. "Pledges" are the oaths sworn before Heaven and Earth after entering the Dao, overseen by the divine. One must not alter them midway. The precepts and disciplines must be upheld. This is the devotion of attaining the Numinous Treasure’s deliverance of beings.

The Tenth Precept: Do not forget teachers and friends.
Teachers provide instruction; friends offer admonition. Instruction is like a father; admonition is like an elder brother. Who, then, are like father and brother? They must be revered and cherished, never abandoned. This is the foundation of attaining the Numinous Treasure’s deliverance of beings.

Uphold these precepts without the slightest lapse.

The ten precepts expounded above are transmitted and reverently bestowed by masters, elucidating the ancient scriptures. Scriptures are the mechanism and method of the Dao’s unfolding; precepts are the application of the scriptures’ essence. To follow the true teaching, diligent practice is paramount. Uphold and practice them without negligence. Countless ancestors, their souls awakened in the netherworld, will thereby receive deliverance and ascend to the Vermilion Palace. Only through unwavering cultivation and ceaseless study can one fulfill merit and perfect virtue, attaining immortality, ascending to the Golden Towers, and roaming the Jade Capital. Strive earnestly in this.

Next, the transmission of the scriptural text.

As the scripture states: Those of superior learning who study and recite this scripture, penetrating its profound mysteries, will attain flight to the Southern Palace, bypassing hell, and universally deliver boundless beings. All heavenly and mortal beings will receive blessings, immeasurable fortune, and grace in life and death. This scripture is treasured by Heaven and must not be transmitted to the lower world. Only those of utmost sincerity, offering gold and treasures, may swear an oath to Heaven and receive it. To treat it lightly or with disrespect brings calamity upon nine generations, condemning them to eternal servitude under ghostly officials.

The Five Emperors will assign twenty-four Jade Lads and twenty-four Jade Maidens to guard the sacred text and protect the body of the recipient. After receiving it, hold it in reverence and preserve it.

Next, the transmission of the esoteric methods.

At the origin, the Dao’s methods arise from spontaneity, its merits bestowed without dominion. Though named by force, it attains the most wondrous; though formless, it exhausts the transformations of primordial chaos. Behold the great Golden Writ of the Numinous Treasure’s great law—truly the mystery of the Primordial Beginning’s silence and non-being, the utmost emptiness’s profound quiescence. Its abyssal source cannot be fathomed; its wondrous principles cannot be exhausted. Secretly treasured in the Heaven of the Great Net’s Golden Gates, it imparts the decrees of the Floating Black Pearl. All heavens revere it; ten thousand sages guard and uphold it. Only those with good roots from former lives may glimpse its mysteries.

Now your disciple [Name], with reverent heart and bowed head, swears to receive the secret transmission, revealing it to the ten directions and pledging sincerity to the three realms. May I exhaust the utmost principles, embody the Dao, and deliver others. Humbly before the sacred presence, I receive and uphold the great law. I beseech the Elders of the Jade Capital and the Perfected of the Golden Gates to dispatch Jade Maidens bearing flying missives, presenting golden chapters for broad revelation. Command Golden Lads to proclaim virtue, unfolding the treasure steps for transmission. May your disciple’s soul and spirit be purified and upright, the ten thousand *qi* everlasting. May I avoid suffering and affliction, my body radiant with light. May the three realms provide escort, the Five Emperors oversee my reception, and ten thousand spirits pay homage. May my name be inscribed in Heaven, my merits complete and virtues perfected, ascending to the Highest Clarity. Receive and practice this, allowing no careless disclosure.

Next, the transmission of the Dharma seals.
At the origin, the Dharma has its steps and ranks, its offices and grades. Those who would issue commands must first bear the seal. Documents, memorials, and petitions rely on it for proclamation; summoning and directing depend on it to align with Heaven’s treasures. It must not be transmitted to the unworthy. Once entrusted as a token of faith and oath, it is conferred according to the regulations. Thus, troops follow the seal’s turn; generals obey the command’s course. In receiving and upholding it, one must await auspicious response.

Next, the transmission of the Dharma sword.
At the origin, to act on Heaven’s behalf, promulgate decrees, and display authority, one relies entirely on the divine edge of three feet to restrain the heterodox among the myriad demons. Its light soars through the seven luminaries; its might subdues the ten thousand spirits. Whatever is commanded, none fail to respond. I now entrust this to you—cherish and safeguard it well.

After each transmission is complete, master and disciple take up brushes to swear an oath.
The master intones: *Turn the brush to point at Heaven.*
The disciple says: *Above, I do not betray Heaven. If I betray Heaven, may my seven ancestors suffer punishment. If Heaven betrays me, may sun and moon lose their light.*
The master: *Turn the brush to point at Earth.*
The disciple: *Below, I do not betray Earth. If I betray Earth, may my body suffer the blade. If Earth betrays me, may grasses and trees not grow.*
The master: *Turn the brush to point at the heart.*
The disciple: *I do not betray my heart. If I betray my heart, may my household not prosper. If my heart betrays me, may the Dao’s transformations not proceed.*
Invoke: *The Perpetually Aiding Heavenly Worthy of the Dharma’s Karmic Bonds.*

Next, the division of the contract and ring.
The ring and contract serve to bind oaths to the Three Officials, pledge alliance to the ten heavens, and eternally affirm trust. The master must not conceal truth or reveal falsehood; the disciple must not rebel against the Dao or forsake the master. The divided ring ensures the oath never falters; the torn contract ensures the vow is never broken. From diligence to neglect, the Five Emperors record transgressions. With reverent devotion and refined cultivation, the nine heavens share in blessings. Receive this before the sacred, treasuring and upholding it for life.

The master holds the left side of the contract; the disciple holds the right. With a knife, they split it down the center, exchanging halves as a sworn covenant.
The disciple kneels and declares:
*Brush points to the Eastern Heaven of the Nine Qi, to the Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, the Perfected, Divine Immortals, Jade Maidens, Jade Lads, Divine Officials, and Immortal Soldiers. Today, rejoicing in this blessed transmission, I pass through the barriers of all heavens, beseeching the eradication of the three evils, the severing of earthly roots, and the flight through the five gates. May my name be listed in the Great Mystery; may the Demon Kings vouch for me; may my station be entrusted to the Jade Clarity. May the nine ancestors and seven generations be delivered from hell, all receiving transmission and ascending to the Southern Palace. May I transcend the three paths and five sufferings, the eight difficulties and nine calamities, the thousand disasters and ten thousand misfortunes. With merits complete and virtues perfected, may my mysterious master guide me, surpassing the three realms and roaming freely in the Highest Clarity. With inner cultivation and outer preparation, may I pass through the three realms and ascend to the rank of immortal. May all demonic trials be vanquished; may the Three Officials disperse their forms. May I command thunder and lightning with a whistle, summon wind and clouds with a breath, dispatch the celestial soldiers, and rebuke ghosts and spirits. May I summon a thousand Perfected, command ten thousand spirits, subdue evil poisons, deliver the living and the dead, restrain tigers and leopards, and slay demonic spirits. May I rescue epochs, stabilize kalpas, safeguard peace, assist Heaven’s transformations, aid the nation and save the people. May I harmonize the five *qi*, receive Heaven’s warp and weft, refine the inner to achieve Perfection, and effortlessly manifest the traveling kitchen. Wherever I go, may there be prosperity and uprightness. If I prove unworthy, may Heaven and Earth bear witness to my oath.*

*Today, I return my spirit, body, and life to the Three Treasures’ majesty. Should I harbor deviant intentions—beginning with diligence but ending in neglect, rebelling against the Dao or disdaining the Dharma, carelessly disclosing or disrespecting, defying the master’s instructions, lacking reverence or faith, disregarding time limits, transmitting to the unworthy, being disloyal or unfilial, indulging in licentious *qi* or discarding precepts, plotting harm, or willingly awaiting Heaven’s judgment—may my ancestors first fall, followed by my distant descendants, forever sinking into the Northern Darkness. May my person be punished according to the offense, my form tormented by wind and blade, thrice interrogated and reborn in a non-Daoist body, eternally barred from aspiring to immortality. I willingly accept this, making clear my betrayal of Heaven and Earth, rebellion against the Dao and master, and treacherous, evil heart. I dare not resent the Dao or blame the master.*

*Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the Numinous Treasure’s great Dharma and statutes!*

Next, the covenant is sworn with inscribed vows.

The Heavenly Official of the Upper Primordial, the Earthly Official of the Middle Primordial, the Aquatic Official of the Lower Primordial, the Celestial Emperors of the Four Quarters, the Five Emperors of the Five Directions, the sun, moon, and stars, the Perfected Ones of the Four Poles, the Three Masters who confer ordination, and the Witnesses of the Mysterium—after inscribing this covenant, I swear not to betray Heaven, not to betray Earth, not to betray my master. I shall be loyal to the state, filial to my parents, and compassionate toward all beings. For one kalpa, I shall relieve suffering and misfortune, using goodness to aid all things, and swear never to violate this pact.

Should I break this pact, I willingly await Heaven’s judgment, endure the trials of the Three Wretched Realms, and repay through the torments of the Five Sufferings.

Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and decrees!

The master and disciple each hold one half of the jade ring, then sever a lock of blue-green silk with a blade to symbolize the cutting of hair. Next, they prick their fingers to drink the cinnabar elixir and swear the oath.

Cutting hair to swear before Heaven, pricking blood to seal the covenant, drinking the elixir to bind the vow—looking up, I invoke the Heavenly Worthies: may the Three Officials sponsor me, the Five Emperors bear witness, the Three Masters confer ordination, and the myriad heavens record my name. May the Northern Dipper release me from death, the Southern Dipper raise me to life, and the ten thousand Perfected receive my service. May the heavenly demons revere my form, and may the seven generations of my ancestors be refined in the Southern Palace. On the day my merit is fulfilled, I shall ascend to the Jade Purity.

Should I betray my heart and violate this oath, may I fail in my tasks and lack divine efficacy.

Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and decrees!

The master holds a vermilion cup and brush, declaring:
The transmission of ordination is now complete, the covenant sealed anew with blood—here, cinnabar replaces blood, each firming their resolve. Drink this elixir of radiance to commune with the Perfected and reach the numinous, to harmonize the five qi within and unite the hundred spirits. Ten revolutions return the spirit, and the myriad qi ascend as immortals together.

Next, the master exhales the cinnabar-water upon the disciple’s body, declaring:
First exhalation: may the Three Clarities’ exalted sages confer ordination.
Second exhalation: may the ten directions’ supreme sages confer ordination.
Third exhalation: may the Three Realms’ host of Perfected confer ordination.
Then the disciple drinks a mouthful of the cinnabar-water.

The master and disciple each store their half of the ring-token. The master again holds the ring-token and intones:
Heaven and Earth unite in trust, the ring-token serves as covenant.
Conduct with fidelity and filial piety, the heart pure and serene.
Compassion, kindness, reverence, and respect—words true, the body unsullied.
From beginning to end as one, the Dao unites with the divine.
Let no flattery or obsequiousness arise, nor greed or wrath.
To harm the body and break virtue is to defy the Three Realms.
Today we divide the ring-token, its meaning stronger than metal.

The master presents the divided ring-token to the disciple.
The ordination certificate is proclaimed.
Next, the immortal decree is conferred:
By long-accumulated fortune, you have encountered the true wind. Having embraced the numinous scriptures and steadfastly upheld your oath, it is fitting to bestow the immortal decree, that you may join the ranks of the pure. Hold fast to it, never forgetting cultivation and introspection.

The immortal decree is proclaimed.
Next, the talisman of authority is bestowed:
Having received Heaven’s favor and advanced in immortal rank, today we follow the mysterious statutes to confer the ritual implements. Those among you who serve as officials in the celestial bureaus shall, in the presence of the sacred, receive their charge, that the gods may divide their powers to govern. Thus, the talisman of office is granted to establish your authority.

After the talisman is proclaimed, the master intones:
The scriptures and methods of the Numinous Treasure are revered by the myriad heavens. Today, having received ordination, the Three Realms pay homage. The names of all are recorded in the heavens, ranked among the immortal elders. The Emperor Lords and Great Saints proclaim to the primordial bounds: measureless is the salvation of humanity, and our Dao flourishes.

The disciple receives the talisman and offers thanks, declaring:
This humble servant, dull of nature and base of endowment, has been graced with imperial favor and numbered among the true companions. Having sealed the covenant strong as metal and stone and embraced the subtle guidance of the scriptures, though by fortune’s turn, I am truly unworthy. How dare I not redouble my resolve, forever abiding in the mysterious model, to exalt the primordial transformation above and strive for the merit of saving the world? With utmost sincerity, I bow twice in profound gratitude.

The disciple performs the threefold obeisance.
The master again invokes the ritual statutes:
We humbly reaffirm our address to the Three Clarities’ Supreme Thearch, the myriad heavens’ Perfected, the Great Law’s founding master, the celestial officials and generals of the scriptures and registers, and the host of exalted Perfected of the Three Realms and ten directions.

We have heard that the Dao is magnified through people, and the law is transmitted by masters. Only through unbroken succession can the true wind flourish, and only through boundless dissemination can the great teaching expand. Guiding later learners, all beings with breath are led to fulfill the work of aiding and rectifying, broadening the path of salvation. This servant, of meager talent and shallow cultivation, has not met a perfected one nor fathomed the profound mysteries. Now, undeservingly entrusted with transmission, I am truly ashamed of my inadequacy. Yet, by the master’s grace in bestowing the statutes and permitting me to propagate them, we have sworn before Heaven, exchanged the talisman of authority, and presented offerings with reverence, roughly completing the rites. Mindful of our lack of full purity, we have surely offended the Perfected. We pray for boundless mercy to pardon our errors and omissions.

May this disciple soon ride the auspicious winds, swiftly awakening to the mysterious mechanism, advancing in cultivation to overcome demonic obstacles, and attaining harmony with the divine. May breath and response align, petitions silently reach the gods, and the merit of saving the living and delivering the dead accumulate, securing the wondrous depth of deep roots and firm stems.

Above, may the true wind shine forth and the supreme teaching spread. Sun bright, moon luminous, Heaven clear, Earth tranquil—may the Emperor’s longevity equal the enduring Southern Mountains, his great enterprise as steadfast as bedrock. May the ancestral temples be at peace, officials fulfill their duties, borders free of alarms, and the people live in harmony. Next, may the master who conferred the Dao, and the parents who gave life—those living receive blessings, those departed ascend as immortals. May those dwelling in valleys or mountains on rocks soon fulfill their vows, and all beings, whether walking, flying, or pecking, attain their destined flourishing.

We bow twice with reverence to present the final offering.
The dragon chariot memorial is proclaimed.
Next, the Dharma Master rises, assumes his role, and solemnly reaffirms:
Your humble servants, [names], humbly readdress the August One of the Golden Portal, the exalted saints of the Jade Vault, the revered masters transmitting ordination at this altar, and the host of Perfected and Saints of the Three Realms and ten directions.

We have heard that the Dao is empty yet responsive, and Heaven high yet heeds the lowly. Thus, at this altar of transmission, we have been blessed with your observant grace. Deeply ashamed of our repeated transgressions, we implore your forbearance. Now, the conferral of office is complete, the ritual offerings concluded. The immortal and the mortal part ways, the ceremonial retinue cannot linger. The clear processional music falls silent, returning to the jade capital’s ranks. The purple clouds withdraw their radiance—how can we gaze upon the jade chariot’s light? The Perfected return in glory to their domains, the officials and generals divide their powers to govern. Our longing and devotion redouble.

We, with the disciple, bow twice in utmost gratitude to express our reverence and farewell.
The Dharma assembly escorts the deities, burns the memorial, and concludes with the dedication of merit.
Thanks are offered to the officials and generals with the threefold presentation of documents.

In the hidden rhythms of the hundred demons, the natural separation and union unfold. The Three Radiances shine forth, pervading the great qi of Brahma. In the primordial Great Luo’s realm, the Primordial Beginning’s honored one resides. Bestowing the law to save humanity, the subtle wonder of returning form is revealed. Transmitting the scriptures to the world, the mysterious power to raise the dead is spread. Those who serve these scriptures are guarded by the eight directions’ mighty spirits. Those who protect this law are attended by the heavens’ exalted saints. The Five Emperors govern the great demons, the ten directions’ envoys oversee their duties. Now that the disciple has sworn the covenant and received transmission, the demon kings proclaim the Dao’s perfection.

Adhering to the celestial prohibitions, the open-air ritual is performed upon the sacred altar, summoning and commanding the ten directions, guiding the earth deities to their subtle wonders. Might equals that of heavenly governance, binding demons and ghosts with the true scriptures. In practicing this doctrine, the myriad saints descend to the hall; in reciting this scripture, all heavens assemble in unison. Those who assist my law emerge from non-being into being upon hearing the incantations. Those who aid my Dao, bearing the celestial mandates, deliver life and transcend death. Harmonizing the five qi, merging the hundred spirits as one.

Now, in strict accordance with the ritual covenant, we reverently present these offerings of fern and pondweed. We humbly beseech the solemn ranks of divine attendants to turn their gaze upon this rite, that the majestic processions may partake of these pure and abundant offerings. May the great teaching be expanded, and profound merit amassed—may the spirits witness this devotion.

We first offer this libation, holding in reverence the original scriptures of the Numinous Treasure, which contain the profound mysteries of the Double Mystery. The supreme and wondrous Dao is the root and origin of the great law. Some are disseminated among the mortal realm, while others are secretly preserved in the celestial treasuries. Those who honor and revere them attain the Dao; those who treat them lightly or with disdain invite calamity.

By virtue of karmic causes from past lives, I have reverently partaken in this great law. Having received transmission from my teacher, I now prepare these offerings in gratitude. Looking up to the sagely wisdom of the Most High, I pray that my humble offerings be witnessed. May the radiant majesty of the spirits respond to this plea, aiding the true teaching upon the sacred altar, their numinous presence resplendent. May the accumulation of hidden merit in the mortal world dispel the shame of my meager learning.

Though I rely on the teachings to uphold my practice, having encountered an enlightened master, it is only through divine power that I receive assistance. Severing the roots of misfortune by cutting off forms and beheading, clarifying commands by reverently upholding the essential principles, rescuing the hidden and aiding the manifest—nothing is left unaccomplished. In establishing virtue and merit, all requests are answered.

Let none grow lax or betray their sworn words. Facing the august presence, we reverently present the second offering.

The Dao cannot stand without humanity, nor can humanity proceed without the Dao. Thus, the Dao employs humanity to manifest, and humanity relies on the Dao to endure. Having been unworthily entrusted with these profound mysteries and presumptuously advanced upon the immortal ranks, I am ashamed of my lack of virtue and can only depend on the supreme spirits for support.

We humbly pray that the divine hosts be divided into ranks, jointly maintaining order upon the ritual altar, their banners arrayed in solemn formation, each securing peace within their domains. When names are called and summons issued, response is immediate. As the spirits move and qi is deployed, their numinous power blazes forth in brilliance. May they assist my Dao in establishing merit, guarding this covenant with vigilance. Above, may they aid the transformations of the Primordial Mystery, never forgetting the cultivation from beginning to end. With meritorious deeds accomplished, the ranks may advance in dignity.

Now, with words repeated and rites thrice performed, we do not stray from the sincerity of our hearts, trusting in the wisdom of the spirits’ discernment. We reverently present the final offering in gratitude for this majestic radiance.

*Here concludes the thirtieth scroll of the Supreme Purity Numinous Treasure Great Law.*
*Here begins the thirty-first scroll of the Supreme Purity Numinous Treasure Great Law.*

The Illuminating Master of Subtle Mysteries, the Perfected of Salvation from Suffering, Ning Quanzhen, transmitted this to the Disciples of the Three Caverns of Supreme Purity, the Preceptors of the Lingbao Tradition, and the Heir of the Teaching, Wang Qizhen, who compiled it.

**Section on Diagrams of Ritual Altars for Fasting Rites**
**General Discourse on Fasting Rites**

The Master said: According to the *Precious Register of Qingwei*, it is said:
*"Virtuous deeds in the unseen realm elevate one’s ancestors,
While manifest virtue brings blessings to the self.
Why not establish merit to save those beyond inquiry?
Then the Heavenly Emperor shall naturally bestow upon you true perfection.
Rebellious ministers and traitorous offspring sink forever,
Yet even they may be transformed by extraordinary grace into insects.
After nine years, the Nine Heavens rejoice in celebration,
As one ascends by daylight upon clouds to the Jade Purity."*

Those "beyond inquiry" are the suffering souls of the hidden yin. For those who cultivate the profound principles of salvation and seek the essential path to transcendence, how can they not universally deliver these suffering souls of the unseen yin?

The esoteric purport of the trials in the hidden yin is fitting for each case. Across countless lifetimes, the four births and six destinies revolve endlessly in the cycle of birth and death. Without transcending the Three Realms and embodying the natural state, how can one escape the suffering of samsara?

Moreover, within the human realm, even the most civilized teachings of the Central Kingdom do not reach the lands untouched by the light of sun and moon. Yet all beings possessing the three karmas, six senses, and five encumbrances are born as humans, universally governed by the Northern Heaven. In the north, there are Three Offices, presided over by the Ghostly Officials—not the Pure Cold, Azure Radiance, or Purple Tenuity Offices. These Three Offices are solely responsible for the threefold karmic retribution. If bodily karma is grave, the Fire Office examines; if mental karma is grave, the Record Office examines; if verbal karma is grave, the Water Office examines. If all six senses and three karmas are grave, the Wind and Blade trial is imposed.

When a person is born, the father’s essence and mother’s blood coalesce into bone and flesh, forming the physical body. After ten months of gestation, the Great Tenuity descends qi to generate the spirit, and the wind-nature transforms into the soul and consciousness, completing the birth. If male, one holds rank among the Heavenly Worthies; if female, among the Primordial Ladies. Yet, entangled by the three karmas and six senses, when one’s allotted span ends, they return to emptiness, receiving retribution according to their deeds. The corpse decays into the earth, while the soul is bound in the nether realm. Unless one perished untimely in a past life, the local earth spirits and lords of the soil confine them in eternal night, with no hope of release. If their karmic debts are repaid, they descend directly to the Ghost Capital, remaining unredeemed for ten thousand kalpas. If sins outweigh merits, they endure the Five Sufferings before gradually finding a path to rebirth. If merits outweigh sins, they pass through one realm and swiftly attain the blessings of rebirth. If both sins and merits are scant, they are reborn according to their karma. If devoid of merit and burdened by great sin, they sink into hell for ten thousand kalpas. Those examined by the Fire Office face the retribution of copper pillars and iron statues, molten bronze and charcoal furnaces, fiery moats and celestial rivers, fire chariots and boiling cauldrons. Those examined by the Water Office endure icy pools and frigid ponds, vats of poison and filth. Those examined by the Record Office suffer the blows of metal hammers and iron rods. Those subjected to the Wind and Blade trial endure dismemberment, sawing, flying spears and drifting halberds, tongue-plowing, thunderous gales, blades converging from all directions, carving body and mind, knife mountains and sword forests, dismemberment, fire dogs and venomous serpents piercing flesh and bone, burning fat and grinding bones to powder, dying and reviving ten thousand times a day. As the karmic wind scatters them, they are instantly restored to form. If their sins are slight, their suffering ends, and they are reborn, though they may not regain human form, instead becoming lowly beings with incomplete features or born in the remote lands of the four barbarian tribes. If sins are heavy and karma light, they take the form of livestock. After ten lifetimes of the Five Sufferings, they may return to the human path. If sins are grave, after the Wind and Blade trial, their scattered souls drift in all directions, born through moisture and gestation into tiny insects, forever barred from regaining human form. Those whose sins are few but whose transgressions are notorious endure the Three Realms and Five Sufferings before entering the realm of hungry ghosts. After eons of rebirth, they are confined to the eternal night, bearing sand and stones, drawing from turbid waters, harnessing thunder and lightning. After their servitude, they are reborn as ghosts, suffering ugliness and deformity for countless kalpas in the eternal darkness.

Thus, Xin Xuanzi’s *Record of Dengdu* states: "There are womb-born ghosts," referring to this. Once born into the human world, all actions and conduct cultivate only sin. Intentions and emotional attachments become the roots of karma. Good deeds and virtuous karma seek retribution here and now; evil deeds and wicked karma seek retribution elsewhere. Losing human form leads to such realms, even unto Dengdu.

The Northern Emperor addressed the Supreme One, saying: "Having unfortunately served as an official in the netherworld for countless kalpas, I have never beheld the light—how much less so the lesser and sinful ghosts! Now, in accordance with the Most High’s compassionate teachings, I reveal these causes and conditions, that scholars may witness these sufferings and their significance. May they cherish the compassion of the Most High, awaken the wisdom of compassion, practice the Dharma gate of compassion, and realize the wondrous Dao of compassion. Then the suffering souls may receive the grace of compassion—how joyous would that be!"

Thus, the ancestral masters expounded this Dharma gate of salvation from suffering, composing myriad scrolls as vessels across the sea of suffering and pathways to perfection. For advanced scholars who awaken this compassionate mind, take heed not to neglect or slacken, lest their merit be lost and their efforts in vain.

The Master said: Above the Nine Purities lies the Supreme Great Luo, the Golden Portal of the Jade Capital. Within it are the covenants of the Perfected, sealed in the Jade Treasury—the Dharma gate of Lingbao for universally delivering the seen and unseen. Since the beginning of the Red Clarity’s unfolding, the Heavenly Worthy of Primordial Beginning expounded the sacred scriptures of salvation and absolution, forming covenants with all sages to vow across countless kalpas to deliver suffering souls. Hence, it is called the Covenant of the Perfected.

The canons of the Covenant of the Perfected comprise three grades: the upper contains the statutes of the Upper Prime Golden Register, the middle contains the statutes of the Middle Prime Jade Register, and the lower contains the methods of the Lower Prime Yellow Register.

In summation, this is called the Supreme Covenant of the Perfected within the Jade Treasury. The Yellow Register universally delivers the seen and unseen—an immeasurable great retreat. The method of its establishment begins with receiving the petition’s intent, then divining an auspicious site and time, proclaiming the retreat’s solemn decree, and assembling fellow disciples of shared aspiration to enter the oratory and face the retreat. They first announce to the Upper Heavens, then draft memorials to inform the Ten Heavens and Nine Earths, the Three Primes and Nine Provinces, ensuring none are left uninformed. They uphold the recitation of scripture titles, expound the liturgical protocols, burn incense and cultivate refinement, erect the altar and present memorials, distribute talismans and petition for mandates, summon and manifest the divine, awaiting resonance and communion. When merit extends to both the hidden and manifest, one’s name is inscribed in the Jade Clarity, and all under heaven embrace virtue—no merit surpasses this. One must follow the retreat’s sequential procedures with care, never recklessly disclosing them or confounding the Three Primes, for such transgressions are unforgivable. Should one encounter a Perfected who fails to propagate and transmit these teachings, obstructing the grace of the Dao, celestial judgment will swiftly descend. Disciples should carefully assess a candidate’s character and bone-signs before entrusting them.

**Seal of Faithful Trust**
The Master said: In ancient times, people were simple and sincere, embracing the Dao and holding fast to virtue. They neither ate nor desired excessively, each content with their lot. With utmost sincerity alone, they could achieve resonance, requiring no wealth or treasures to harmonize with the celestial perfected. In this degenerate age, people are cunning and deceitful, coveting only wealth and goods, ignorant of karmic conditions. They scorn life and prize riches, ruining families and destroying nations, harboring myriad evils within while allying with wickedness without. They perish in succession, never awakening. For this reason, the teachings mandate dispersal: first, to prevent external strife, ensuring inner and outer tranquility, and dissolving all calamities. Thus, pledging trust and demonstrating sincerity begins with wealth. When wealth is offered, the heart follows, and sacred communion arises in accordance with one’s intent. The lofty heavens and profound earth, the mysterious sages and perfected immortals—none respond without trust, nor resonate without sincerity. The attainment of resonance and communion lies in the heart.

**Thirteen Golden Dragon Talismans:**
Ten talismans govern the ten directions, and three are submitted as the Three Memorials.

The Regulations state: Each weighs one tael and measures three cun and six fen. □For state use, employ the finest gold; for dukes, marquises, and high ministers, use secondary gold; commoners may use silver gilded with gold—all are universally applicable.

The dragon serves as the celestial courier of the lofty heavens. In transmitting messages and achieving resonance, the dragon’s steed takes precedence. Bearing the memorial, it soars to convey trust to the Three Offices; pledging oaths, it proclaims alliances to the ten poles. The method of securing trust begins with the dragon. Deficiencies are examined and attributed to the Yin Officials’ Bureau.

**Eleven Mirrors of Radiance:**
Ten segments govern the ten directions, and one segment, the trust-token, is placed at the center.

The Regulations state: The east features nine azure patterns; the south, three crimson patterns; the west, seven white patterns; the north, five black patterns; the upper realm, thirty-two jade-green patterns; the lower realm, thirty-two yellow patterns; the four corners, twelve yellow patterns each—totaling one hundred thirty-six across the ten directions. The state uses bolts of fabric; dukes and marquises, zhang; scholars and commoners, chi. The trust-token segment: the Son of Heaven and nobles use purple, while scholars and commoners use the color corresponding to their natal year’s sound. The length of fabric in bolts, zhang, or chi aligns with the years of the ritual’s sponsor, with one additional unit to signify the pledge of extended life.

The patterned silks manifest the colors of the Five Phases, symbolizing the qi of the ten directions, descending from the ten heavens, summoning the Five Emperors, and establishing resonance to petition for blessings and divine efficacy. These must not be omitted. Deficiencies are examined and attributed to the Celestial Officials’ Bureau of the Mysterious Capital.

**Ten Sets of Paper, Ink, Brush, and Inkstone:**
For the ten directions, twelve sheets of paper are allocated to each.

The Regulations state: When establishing a fast and performing the Dao, whether to deliver billions of ancestors and departed kin or to pray for blessings and dispel misfortunes, the Four Controllers, Five Emperors, and the Three Realms and Ten Directions record merits and adjudicate transgressions. Thus, paper and brush serve as the register for recording virtues, substantiating trust across the ten directions—these must not be omitted. If deficient, the Ten Heavens will not record merits, nor will the Nine Yins and Three Offices absolve transgressions. Deficiencies are examined and attributed to the Three Officials’ Bureau.

**Ten Trays of Incense and Flowers to Govern the Ten Directions:**
The Regulations state: Incense serves as the medium for resonance, dispelling impurities and banishing defilements. Flowers, with their fresh purity, symbolize auspiciousness and demonstrate sincerity, forming the foundation for invoking blessings and beseeching the perfected. Incense should be of the finest agarwood or sandalwood to descend the perfected; flowers should be fragrant and borne of living trees. If flowers are unavailable, five-colored silk may be cut and arranged to govern the ten directions—these must not be omitted. Deficiencies are examined and attributed to the Yin Officials’ Bureau.

**Two Hú and Four Dǒu of Rice (or One Hú and Two Dǒu):**
The Regulations state: Rice substantiates trust before the Celestial Officials, augmenting one’s rank and emoluments. Deficiencies are examined and attributed to the Celestial Officials’ Bureau.

**Two Dǒu and Four Shēng of Oil (or One Dǒu and Two Shēng):**
The Regulations state: Oil belongs to the yin category. Within yin, yang is born; thus, oil governs the Yin Officials to sustain the radiance of yang. Deficiencies are examined and attributed to the Yin Officials’ Bureau.

**One Hundred Twenty Jīn of Charcoal (or Twenty-Four Jīn, or Twelve Bundles):**
The Regulations state: Charcoal belongs to the yang category. Within yang, yin is born; thus, charcoal governs the Yang Officials to nourish yin qi. Deficiencies are examined and attributed to the Yang Officials’ Bureau.

**Twenty-Four Thousand Cash (Dukes and Marquises: Twenty-Four Strings; Scholars and Commoners: Twelve Strings, or Two Strings and Four Hundred, or One String and Two Hundred):**
The Regulations state: The twenty-four thousand cash substitute for the pledge of finest gold, substantiating sincerity across the Three Realms and proclaiming alliances to the Ten Heavens. Deficiencies are examined and attributed to the Celestial Officials’ Bureau of the Mysterious Capital.

**Thirteen Jade Discs:**
Ten for the ten directions, three for the dragon memorials.

The Regulations state: Jade possesses the virtue of purity and integrity, enabling resonance with the perfected immortals—thus, it serves as the token of trust. The ten directional discs are round with hollow centers, each two cun and four fen in diameter and two fen thick. The discs for the dragon memorials: the Celestial Official uses an azure disc, round with a hollow center; the Earth Official uses a yellow disc, square with a hollow center; the Water Official uses a black disc, hexagonal with a hollow center—each two cun and a half in diameter. For the three memorials, they are bound with golden dragons and azure silk cords, secured with golden clasps.

Azure silk replaces the cutting of hair, golden clasps replace the blood of sacrifice—thus are the Three Officials petitioned.

For omissions, refer to the Earth Official’s Nine Capitals Bureau.

**Three Catalpa Wood Tablets:**
The Regulations state: Tablets serve as records, chronicling the merits of the age and petitioning the covenants of the perfected immortals. They are square on all sides, each one chi and two cun in length, two cun and four fen in width, and two fen in thickness. For the state, they are made of jade. Jade possesses the nine virtues, embodying the trust of Heaven and Earth. For all others below, they are made of reed wood or birch.

The cinnabar boundary invokes the Five Phases; the cinnabar script records the state’s name, the year and cyclical signs, the location of the retreat, and the officiating master’s name. These are cast into renowned mountains and deep caverns, sacred springs and dragon lairs, or buried within the retreat altar. They petition the envoys of the Three Officials of Heaven, Earth, and Water, making clear the retreat’s purpose to be memorialized in the upper realms.

For omissions, refer to the Earth Official’s Nine Capitals Bureau.

**Twenty-Seven Golden Clasps:**
Nine are used for each tablet.
The Regulations state: Each is nine fen in diameter, round in shape like a ring. The state uses pure gold; ministers, officials, and commoners all use silver gilded with gold. Azure silk binds the dragon tablets, which are then cast. The use of nine clasps per tablet is prescribed in the *Lingbao Scriptures and Rituals*; the rest follow the *Guangcheng* regulations, which later generations dare not alter. Only the *Guangcheng* regulations specify the tablets: no talismans are inscribed, only true script on one side. In ritual methods, seal script may be used on one side, but whether to employ it or not is determined by reasoned deliberation.

**Chapter on Ritual Dignity**
The Master said: The Three Supreme Ones of the Great Highest dwell on the Jade Capital Mountain of the Mysterious Capital, within the Seven-Treasured Mysterious Terrace of the Purple Tenuity’s Upper Palace. The exalted sages of the ten directions, the loftiest and most revered, at the three hours of yin, wu, and xu each day, circumambulate in audience, bearing talismans and registers, raising standards and holding banners. They chant the cavernous scriptures, burn incense and scatter flowers, present the celestial music of *Jun Tian*, with phoenixes singing and dancing, the ten thousand perfected offering felicitations, and the Three Realms trembling in awe.

Today’s retreat rituals—ascending the altar to present memorials, pacing the void in circumambulation—are modeled after the Jade Capital of the Mysterious Capital. The forms of ritual dignity are all fully provided herein.

**A Pair of Flying Rainbow Banners:**
Resembling standards but without dragon or phoenix motifs, adorned with ribbons. Made of five-colored silk in three tiers, suspended from poles.

**A Pair of Vermilion Banners for Audience with the Origin:**
Pearl canopies with pearl nets, eight-angled and single-tiered, suspended from poles. The wooden core is flanked by a dragon on the left and a tiger on the right, with golden dragons holding the ribbons in their mouths.

**A Pair of Void-Dispersing Silk Nodes:**
Made of five-colored silk in five tiers, suspended from the tops of poles, with golden phoenixes holding the ribbons in their beaks.

**A Pair of Exquisite Treasure Screens:**
Adorned with pearls, brocade, and jade pendants, held by golden phoenixes, suspended from poles.

**A Pair of Five-Light Feather Fans:**
Carved from wood and decorated with gold and pigments. The upper part depicts the sun, moon, and stars; the center displays the Five Peaks; the lower part depicts the seas and mountains, mounted on vermilion poles.

**A Pair of Crane-Feather Fans:**
Carved from wood to resemble crane wings, mounted on vermilion poles.

**Lamps and Candles:**
During the pacing of the void and ritual recitations, lamps and candles are essential—not only for presenting memorials but also for dispelling misfortune. The scriptures and regulations specify varying quantities, but the key is to act according to one’s means. Alternatively, one may follow only what is recorded in the *Golden Register Tablets*: illuminating the myriad heavens, continuing brightness to dispel darkness, reaching down to the Nine Yous and hells, and shining up to the boundless halls of fortune. Among all meritorious deeds, this is the highest.

Some combine various fragrant oils with orchid unguents, ensuring all conform to ritual standards, thereby naturally invoking blessings. The purpose of lighting lamps is to continue brightness and illuminate the night. Once the sun has risen, the attendant should extinguish the lamps according to protocol. This practice remains unchanged today, and the use of lamps and candles should not be abolished.
