**Vermilion Script: Mandate of Numinous Power to Deliver the Underworld**
The Three Heavenly Thearchs universally deliver suffering souls,
Liberating them from the cycle of birth and death, rescuing them from the delusive ford.
Severing the root of the dead, refining their forms in the Eastern Well,
The Three Terraces shine brilliantly, the six *qi* converge as one.
The gloom of the Nine Netherworlds is dispelled, all behold the light.
Universally proclaimed to the Three Realms—let the winds and fires cease not,
That they may ascend to heaven and attain the immortal Dao.

**Outer Seal Formula: Jade Tablet of the Water Office’s True Talisman**

Proclaimed to the Nine Bureaus and Forty-Two Offices of the Lower Prime’s Examiners—

**Upper Prime’s Jade Tablet of the Three Heavens’ Pardon-Sin True Talisman**

The Master says: The White Tablet of the Jade-Pure Three Heavens is the Jade Register of the Three Heavens, the divine script of the Most High. When proclaiming its enactment, one must fashion a tablet from wood, seven *cun* and three and a half *fen* in height, four and a half *cun* in width, and three *fen* in thickness. Coat it with powdered wood shavings, inscribe the talisman on its face, and write the proclamation on its reverse, along with the year and cyclical signs, in six lines. Seal it externally with blue paper.

This talisman is exclusively for the deliverance of emperors, kings, empresses, consorts, dukes, and marquises. Only after the deceased has undergone three prior deliverances may it be employed.

The Dharma states: When inscribing the talisman, kneel facing the Heavenly Gate and silently petition the Three Heavens. Visualize the descent of the Three Pure *qi*, then silently invoke the hidden names of the Three Heavens, reciting: *Hong-ling-yun-gan-zhong-yi-qi* seven times. Draw *qi* into the brush and inscribe. Upon completion, recite the invocation nine more times, then draw three breaths of Pure *qi* and blow them onto the tablet. Execute the Jade-Pure Mudra.

*Three qi surge as mist,
Luminous qi soars in fourfold ascent.
The suffering souls of myriad ancestors,
Their forms having traversed the Great Yin,
Are refined and delivered by the reckoned day—
Thus attaining immortality.
Sins and blessings, prohibitions and karmic bonds,
All receive liberation;
The body is reborn upon reception of life.
The soul’s transient extinction yields immediate return to life.*

**Proclamation**

By the Jade-Pure Jade Script, proclaimed to the Most High Heavens, the wardens of the left and right prisons, the revered clerks, the overseers of celestial dungeons, and the spirits presiding over sins: Deliver the deceased, [Name] and others, forever departing the eternal night. Dissolve their grave sins, block the wellsprings of evil, and ascend their forms and spirits. Let them ascend to the Heavenly Gate, where fortune and wisdom arise spontaneously, to ride the dragon-carriage and abide eternally in the True Dao—all in accordance with this proclamation.

**Outer Seal Formula: Jade-Pure Three Heavens’ Pardon-Sin Jade Tablet True Talisman**

Proclaimed to the Ten Directions’ and Three Realms’ overseers of sin, judges of retribution, and myriad prison spirits—
Your subordinate, [Name], in full ceremonial position, respectfully seals.

This talisman employs one script, reserved exclusively for the deliverance of emperors. The outer seal reads: *Ascending and delivering the divine souls of ancient emperors across the Nine Provinces’ domains.* For the Nine Provinces, use nine scripts, with the outer seal reading: *Proclaimed to the overseers of the Nine Provinces’ domains.* All are inscribed in vermilion on yellow paper.

For the Ten Directions, use ten scripts, with the outer seals reading: *Proclaimed to the overseers of the Eastern Heaven, Earth, and Water Prisons.* The East is inscribed in blue on vermilion; the South in red on yellow; the West in white on black; the North in black on blue; the Center in yellow on white; the Northeast in blue on purple; the Southeast in azure on green; the Southwest in green on gray; the Northwest in purple on azure. The remainder are inscribed in vermilion on yellow. For the deliverance of emperors, white jade powder or white powder may also be used for inscription.

This talisman delivers those whose merit is not yet complete above and the imperial consorts and lineage below.

**Middle Prime’s Golden Script of the Nine Heavens’ Purple Palace Inner-Sound Precious Edict**

The Master says: This talisman is the true script of the Nine Heavens’ orthodox *qi* and generative transformation, the numinous mandate of the Supreme Emperor, for the deliverance of suffering souls. For universal deliverance, inscribe it according to this formula. For dedicated rites of mourning, the deceased’s birth and death years and fate must be inscribed beneath their name and added to the tablet.

When proclaiming its enactment, fashion a tablet from *xiang* wood, nine *cun* and nine *fen* in height, three *cun* and nine *fen* in width, and three *fen* in thickness. Coat it with white powder as the ground and inscribe in vermilion seal script. Each line contains eight characters; if arranged in four lines, it totals thirty-two characters. The proclamation is also inscribed on the reverse. Seal it externally with blue paper, titled in vermilion.

This talisman may be proclaimed by high ministers and officials. Alternatively, inscribe the golden seal script on yellow silk, with the proclamation written in black, and mount it with brocade, like an imperial edict. During the refinement and deliverance, present it to the deceased to hold, proclaiming it as prescribed.

When inscribing the talisman, burn incense, face the northwest, and silently petition the Nine Empyrean Emperors. Visualize the Nine Emperors in imperial regalia, their feathered robes resplendent, and present your intent. Then invoke the *qi* of the Nine Heavens once:

*Emperor’s True Womb-Mandate: Primordial Unity’s Yellow-Extending Qi,
Emperor’s True Embryo-Mandate: Cavernous Darkness’ Purple-Gate Qi,
Emperor’s True Soul-Mandate: Eternal Numinous Bright Immortal Qi,
Emperor’s True Corpse-Mandate: Code of the Dark-Extending Underworld Qi,
Emperor’s True Viscera-Mandate: Five Immortals’ Central Numinous Qi,
Emperor’s True Spirit-Mansion Mandate: Lofty Immortal’s Penetrating Fusion Qi,
Emperor’s True Primordial-Mansion Mandate: Lofty Immortal’s Cavernous Tome Qi,
Emperor’s True Radiant-Mansion Mandate: True Numinous’ Transformative Coagulation Qi,
Emperor’s True Mountain-Mansion Mandate: Spontaneous Mysterious Illumination Qi.*

Upon completion, draw the Nine Empyrean’s nine-colored *qi* into the brush and inscribe. After finishing, recite the invocation once more, execute the Jade Mudra, and draw the nine *qi* into the tablet as before.

**Proclamation**

By the Emperor’s Talismanic Mandate, proclaimed to the Three Offices’ overseers of celestial dungeons, earthly prisons, and underworld courts: Deliver the deceased, [Name] and others, all receiving this talismanic mandate. Escort their forms and souls, let them reverently receive the Precious Edict, ascend to the Imperial Court, reconcile their sins and enmities, and merge with the Dao. Let their spirits ascend to the Jade Palace, undergo refinement, and abide eternally—all in accordance with this proclamation.

Proclaimed on the [Year], [Month], [Day], [Hour] of the Great Year.
By the Dharma Position.

**Outer Seal Formula: Middle Prime’s Golden Script of the Nine Heavens’ Precious Edict**

Proclaimed to the overseers of celestial dungeons, earthly prisons, and underworld courts—
Your subordinate, [Name], in full ceremonial position, respectfully seals.

This talisman employs one script, reserved exclusively for the deliverance of ancient generals, ministers, and the virtuous renowned for the Nine Merits and Seven Virtues. It is also called: *Delivering the official-rank souls across the Nine Provinces’ domains.* For the Nine Provinces and Ten Directions, follow the same formula as the Jade Tablet.

**Lower Prime’s Salvation-from-Suffering Dipper-Center Register-True Deliverance-from-Death-and-Rebirth Talisman**

The Master says: This talisman is the Red Script of the Jade-Pure and the Golden Text of the Purple Court, for deliverance from death and rebirth, and ascension to the True. It is used for the deliverance of commoners’ souls.

When issuing decrees, use a catalpa-wood tablet, nine cun and nine fen in height, three cun and nine fen in width, and three fen in thickness. Prepare a white-powdered ground, inscribe in cinnabar on both front and back, and enclose it in a blue-paper sealing pouch, following the previous formula.

This talisman employs one script, reserved exclusively for the deliverance of common scholars and officials. Nine scripts are used to address the Nine Provinces, and ten scripts to address the Ten Directions. All are inscribed in cinnabar on yellow ground.

The method states: When inscribing talismans, burn incense, face the northwest, and kneel to memorialize. Visualize the White Jade Capital Mountain above the Dipper’s center, its myriad treasures radiating auspicious light, illuminating the body within and without.

Recite the incantation:
*"Primal Cavern’s Jade Record—*
*the body attains rebirth."*

Recite this incantation once, draw qi from the northwest, channel it into the brush, and inscribe with the Jade-Pure mudra. Upon completion, recite the incantation again and draw qi to blow upon the tablet.

**Cinnabar Script commands demons to deliver life,**
**Dark Netherworlds’ souls to cross over.**
**Three Heavens’ decree absolves and saves suffering souls,**
**releasing them from life and death, severing death’s roots.**
**Eastern Well refines form in the crucible of fire.**
**Great Compassion’s Jade Decree pardons wandering spirits.**
**Three Terraces radiant, six qi conjoined—**
**Nine Netherworlds’ shadows all behold the light.**
**Attaining the Five Paths, wind and fire cease not,**
**ascending to Heaven’s halls, attaining immortality as Perfected.**

**Memorial Text**
The Jade-Pure’s Cinnabar Script and Jade Text ascend to the Purple Court. By Heaven’s compassion, absolve the Three Realms’ nether prisons and the Nine Netherworlds’ sinful souls. **Highest Clarity Numinous Treasure Great Rites, Scroll Forty-Six**
**Highest Clarity Numinous Treasure Great Rites, Scroll Forty-Seven**

**Master of the Cavernous Subtleties, Illuminator and Savior from Suffering, Perfected Sovereign of Nocturnal Perfection, Xiao Quanzhen, transmitted to the Disciples of the Three Caverns of Highest Clarity and the Numinous Treasure Lineage, Preceptor Wang Qizhen, Compiler of the Rites**

**Section on Fasting Rites, Talismanic Scripts, Memorial Tablets, and Dragon-Offering Petitions**

The Master said: The Primordial Beginning, in stabilizing and spreading the Five Scriptures, caused the Five Venerable Lords of the Dao to receive the Vermilion Writ of True Texts, securing the root of Heaven and the source of Earth, and descending to guard the Five Marchmounts, thereby establishing the Five Directions. This is truly the root and origin of the Numinous Treasure, the pivot of salvation for humanity. Those who study the Dao and seek immortality, transmitting the scriptures of the Central Alliance and wearing the registers of the Numinous Treasure, all inscribe the Vermilion Writ of True Texts upon wooden tablets, facing them to compose memorial petitions. These are cast into mountains and rivers or placed at residences, sealing covenants with the Three Realms and excising the roots of transgression. Offering dragon tablets and presenting petitions at the Five Marchmounts erases faults and dissolves errors—this is its fundamental purpose, as recorded in the Jade Scripts of True Texts and various scriptures.

The ritual statutes state: Whenever a grand Yellow Register fast is established and the altar rites conclude, tablets of mountain soil and water are used, accompanied by golden dragons, golden fasteners, and jade discs, to record and seal the merits of the fast and petition the Three Origins. This method truly originates from the Vermilion Writ of the Five Venerable Lords. Since Master Zhang Chengxian of the Tang dynasty compiled the *Ritual Statutes of the Shu Fast*, it has been explained in detail. When Du Guangcheng compiled the *Ritual Statutes of the Yellow Register Fast*, he exhaustively described the origins of the Vermilion Writ and the ceremonial forms of petition-offering, making it clear and unambiguous. In recent times, some inscribe a single talisman on each of the three tablets, with varying talismanic forms transmitted by different individuals. How could one abandon the original intent of petition-offering and proceed without the Vermilion Writ? Here, we briefly elucidate the incantations for the three tablets, clarifying their essentials.

The incantation for the mountain tablet states:
*"Mystic Above opens illumination,
Primordial Beginning oversees truth,
The Five Venerable Lords of the Dao,
command the Vermilion Script of Cinnabar Texts.
The origin of Heaven and Earth,
governs the Three Origins."*

The incantation for the water tablet states:
*"Primordial Beginning and the Five Venerable Lords,
Supreme Lords of the Dao,
Perfected Ones of the Ten Directions,
Transcendent Immortals of Great Splendor,
the Vermilion Script proclaims the mandate,
unheard in no hidden realm."*

The incantation for the earth tablet states:
*"Heaven and Earth unfold,
the Nine Qi divide their numen,
the Three Origins’ cavernous palaces,
the Ten Directions radiantly pure.
The Five Venerable Lords of the Dao,
open truth and govern life,
the Cinnabar Script of Vermilion Texts,
Highest Clarity of the Primordial Beginning."*

Examining the purport of the three incantations, they all clearly refer to the Vermilion Writ of the Five Venerable Lords. If replaced with other talismans, this would greatly contradict the original intent, and the incantations would no longer align. How could one fail to verify this? Now, following the scriptural intent, the Five Venerable Lords’ Vermilion Writ in Jade Script is inscribed on the reverse of the tablets. This is chosen for its meaning as a token of petition-offering, derived from the orthodox scriptures and not comparable to later private transmissions. Though various lineages may have their own traditions, this form must not be altered. Moreover, petition-offering directly concerns the offices of the Three Officials, where sin and fortune are determined—one must reflect carefully.

The Jade Scripts of the Vermilion Writ are already detailed in the *Section on Suppression and Control*. For convenience, the relevant portions are excerpted here and presented below, though some repetition is unavoidable. The three talismans, though not to be used, are also preserved to serve as evidence for advanced scholars.

**Instructions:**
A tablet is a record. It records the merits of the age and petitions the Supreme Perfected Ones. The upper and lower edges are each one foot two inches long, two inches four fen wide, and two fen thick. For the state, they are made of jade, for jade possesses the Nine Virtues and is the token of ritual propriety for Heaven and Earth. For all others, they are made of *huai* wood or cypress, with cinnabar borders representing the Five Phases. The country’s name, the year, the location of the fast, and the name of the High Merit Officer are inscribed in cinnabar. They are cast into famous mountains, cavern-heavens, numinous springs, and dragon lairs, or buried at the fast’s altar, petitioning the Three Officials of Heaven, Earth, and Water to manifest the fast’s merits and report the affair to the upper realms.

Each tablet is accompanied by a golden dragon. The dragon serves as the messenger bearing the tablet and petition to the offices of the Three Officials. Each tablet is also accompanied by a jade disc: the mountain tablet uses a green disc, circular with a hollow center; the earth tablet uses a yellow disc, square with a hollow center; the water tablet uses a dark disc, hexagonal with a hollow center. Each is two and a half inches in diameter. Additionally, twenty-seven golden fasteners are used, each nine fen in diameter, their outer edges rounded like rings. Nine fasteners are used per tablet, bound together with the dragon and disc using green silk. The green silk substitutes for cut hair, and the golden fasteners substitute for sacrificial blood, petitioning the Three Officials. Salvation in life and deliverance in death, cultivation of truth and study of the Dao—all follow the same principle. Only the texts and incantations differ; one must carefully examine and perform them to avoid error in the unseen and manifest realms.

Your servant, on [year], [month], [day], respectfully approached the Three Caverns Master [Name] to receive the Vermilion Writ of the Five Venerable Ones of the Numinous Treasure, the inner sounds of the Three Divisions and Eight Luminaries of all heavens, the registers of the Twofold Immortals and the Eightfold Might, the talismanic staffs of the Five Emperors, and the scriptures of the Central Covenant. Upon completion of transmission, the mountain tablet is cast into the numinous mountain, the water tablet into the dragon’s pure spring, and the earth tablet into the Central Palace. With golden dragons as messengers, may the ledgers of sin be expunged.

If the petition is for merit on behalf of the state or commoners:
Now, [Name] humbly acts for the sake of the state above and the living and deceased below, beseeching blessings and grace, repenting transgressions, and establishing a grand Yellow Register fast.

**Gate of Ascent and Verification**

The Master says: Once the departed soul has completed its refinement, a certificate of ordination and talismanic writ shall be issued for its custody. This document is to be presented to the relevant authorities for verification and matching, so that the soul may be registered for rebirth. It serves as the imperial mandate and evidentiary proof for this world. Without it, the soul will face obstruction and detention at every passage, making transcendence difficult to achieve.

**Vermilion Mound True Talisman of the Great Unity for Saving the Living, Rescuing the Dead, Relieving Suffering, and Enabling Transcendence**

The Method states: When inscribing this talisman, first face east and burn incense. Kneel, bow three times, and memorialize, visualizing the Great Unity riding a nine-headed lion of five colors, its golden light flashing, mouth exhaling the *qi* of the Azure Mystery. After nine prostrations and the memorial, form the Jade Mudra, empower the brush, and recite the incantation:

*"Primal Thearch of the Jade Capital, spread forth the most efficacious Dharma.
The Dao’s methods bestow grace, conferring talismans for transcendence.
If transgressions exist, swiftly remove them.
Your jade words manifest—ten thousand spirits heed."*

Once the prayer is complete, draw the *qi* of the Heavenly Gate into the brush. Next, form the Mao Mudra, invoke the name of the Great Unity eighty-one times, and draw the *qi* from the Great Unity’s mouth into the paper and brush. Recite again:

*"By the decree of the Heavenly Worthy of Great Unity, Savior from Suffering."*

Repeat eighty-one times, drawing *qi* into the brush. Then, recite eighty-one times more, drawing the *qi* of the Azure Mystery, and inscribe the talisman as the *qi* flows.

**Jade Contract for Ascending to Heaven in Unison**

The Master says: The *Inner Writ of the Three Sovereigns* contains a *Board and Contract for Ascending to Heaven*. When attaining the Dao and ascending in flight, the Heavenly Worthy dispatches attendant perfected ones to bestow the contract, enabling flesh and bones to ascend together and pass through the Heavenly Gates. This practice is not permitted for unauthorized use in the mundane world.

This is the *Jade Contract in Unison of the Three Heavens*, the *Numinous Mandate of the Thearch* and *True Writ of the Jade Emperor*, bestowed upon scholar-practitioners of the living who pay homage to the origin and visit the perfected, as well as to liberate the souls of the dead. It refines the po in the Southern Palace, ensuring no obstruction at the Heavenly Gates.

The method employs a sheet of blue paper, folded into four gates. The contract text is inscribed in cinnabar on the front, while the memorial, year, cyclical signs, and Dharma rank are written on the back, arranged in five columns. It is placed in a crimson pouch, tied with a blue cord. If the practitioner’s heart is aligned, it should be worn over the heart. When liberating the dead or enabling transformation, it must be attached to the straw effigy for the Heavenly Gate officers to facilitate passage.

*"Three Heavens’ Void and Primal,
Three Treasures’ Mysterious Capital,
Yang days merge, *qi* coalesces to form Heaven.
Southern Palace forges and casts,
Northern Bureau dissolves transgressions.
Solemnly decree the messengers of the Three Bureaus
To summon and restrain the numinous souls,
Bearing the Dharma body,
Attaining liberation of the true origin,
Ascending into the void, entering the wondrous,
Realizing the Dao in non-action."*

The Three Officials’ Joint Contract and the Three Origins’ Unison Pact shall both record the purpose of the ritual and the name of the departed soul as the principal. The intent is that the departed, upon reaching the unison contract, shall undergo transformation according to their rank.

For edicts, follow the format of the guarantor petitions and the four talismans. Additionally, use blue and white silk to fashion a sealed envelope, inscribing it in vermilion, and employ it according to the prescribed method.

**Section on Ritual Methods and Talismanic Scripts**
**Left and Right Contracts for Ascension to Heaven in the Numinous Treasure Tradition**

The Master says: These contracts are the talismanic agreements of the Most High, the material proof for ascending to Heaven.

**Method of Preparation:**
Use double-sided azure paper, nine *cun* or one *chi* in height, and one *chi* six *cun* or one *chi* eight *cun* in length as the standard.

**Left Contract (Front Side):**
In the center, inscribe the Great Brahmā Hidden Script in a circular arrangement, with four phrases per line. The left contract, being an odd number, employs single characters. The petition text is written from the inside outward to both edges on the reverse side, following the prescribed script of the Three Sovereigns’ Inner Sounds and True Writ.

**Right Contract (Front Side):**
In the center, inscribe the names of the Thirty-Two Heavenly Emperors in a circular arrangement, with four phrases per line, totaling sixteen lines. The right contract, being an even number, employs paired characters. The petition text follows the same format as above, with the reverse side also inscribed with the True Writ.

After refinement and empowerment, sever the contracts at the center. Place the two right halves in a paulownia wood box or seal them with inner and outer layers of azure paper, then entrust them to the Heavenly Gate Officers for confidential submission alongside the petition and memorial.

The two left halves are distributed as follows: one half to the male soul’s principal recipient, and the other half to the female soul’s principal recipient, who shall keep them. Encase them in an azure paper envelope, attach them to the base of the banner, or place them within the *Shengtianju* (Ascension to Heaven Apparatus). If dedicating the ritual to a single individual, store the contract in an azure pouch and affix it to the left or right side of the straw effigy, then present it to the Heavenly Gate for verification.

In the great Ming year [Year], under the Tai Sui of [Month], on the [Day] of the lunar month, [Native Place and Name] humbly petitions at the Yellow Altar to receive the transmission of the Supreme Yellow Register of the Numinous Treasure of the Cavernous Mystery for Long Life and Deliverance of Destiny, First Rank. As the scripture states:
In ancient times, the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning, dwelling in the Three Yuan Palace of the Ninefold Clarity’s wondrous realm, expounded the most subtle and vast teachings with the assembly of great sages, enlightening humans and devas. He inscribed meritorious deeds in the Yellow Register, arranging golden tablets and jade slips before the Three Clarities, so that every hell might witness the ten directions. The Heavenly Worthy of Salvation from Suffering entered the Nine Dark Realms to deliver all from torment.

The Heavenly Worthy universally proclaimed to the four assemblies: “If you can receive and uphold the Golden Register and White Slips, the Ninefold Wondrous Precepts, the Talisman of Long Life, and the True Talisman of Salvation, you shall eradicate the great sins of the Nine Dark Realms and inscribe your names in the Nine Palaces. The Youth Who Surveys Destiny, the Guardian Spirits of the Precepts, the Direct Talismans of the Five Emperors, and the functionaries of the Six Palaces shall follow the writ’s text to shelter and protect the departed souls who receive the precepts.”

Now I shall clearly expound the Ninefold Wondrous Precepts, the merits of upholding the Golden Register and White Slips, the deliverance from calamity and salvation from suffering—divine powers beyond comprehension.

The assembled spirits bow their heads, reverently receiving the sacred command.

The Heavenly Worthy declared:

First, the Nine Wondrous Precepts:
1. Reverence and deference—filial piety and care for parents.
2. Diligence and devotion—loyalty to the sovereign.
3. Non-killing—compassion and deliverance of all beings.
4. Non-lewdness—rectifying the body and dwelling in integrity.
5. Non-theft—extending righteousness and diminishing the self.
6. Non-anger—no cruelty or aggression toward others.
7. Non-deceit—no flattery, treachery, or harm to the good.
8. Non-arrogance—no contempt or disregard for the Perfect Truth.
9. Non-duality—devotion to the precepts with single-minded focus.

The Nine-Dragon Golden Register of the Azure Palace of the Eastern Ultimate, the True Talisman of Salvation of the Primordial Writ and the Golden Register with White Slips, is proclaimed to the boundless worlds of the ten directions, to the Three Offices and Nine Bureaus, the One Hundred Twenty Courts, the Examiners of the Five Emperors, the Nine Dark Hells, the Mighty Heavenly Enforcers, the Divine Soldiers of Punishment, the Recorders of Deeds and Lifespans, the Ministers of Merit and Execution, the Ox-Headed Wardens, and the Great Demons of the Three Realms.

Deliver the departed soul of so-and-so from transgression, liberate them from the hells, forever parting from eternal night to behold the light. All sins shall be swept away, all grievances dissolved. By the merit of this Nine-Dragon Talismanic Writ, ascend to the heavens above, all as proclaimed.

The Illustrious Perfected Ning Quanzhen of Radiant Salvation, Master of Mystic Subtlety, transmitted to Wang Qizhen, Disciple of the Three Caverns of Highest Clarity and Successor in the Teaching of Numinous Treasure:

**Gate of Grand Refinement Talismans**

The Master said: In the nether realms, suffering souls and stagnant spirits, their forms defiled and impure, are bound fast within the gates of the Yellow Springs. Without the transformative power of Heaven and Earth’s true qi refining and delivering them, how could they ascend and transcend?

Thus, the Most High, in great compassion, transmitted the scriptures of Fire-Refinement and the methods of Yellow Flower Ablution. Those who practice these arts embody the primordial transformation-body of the Origin, gathering the mysterious and primordial qi of yin and yang, harmonizing the qi of the Three Fields. Borrowing the fire of the three qi of the Southern Quarter, they ascend and descend to purify the turbid, sever the ghostly portals, and wash away filth and grime. Thus, inner and outer become radiant and translucent, the hundred bones suffused with light, and only then may one attain the Dao of Non-Action.

Therefore, to summon the soul, one first employs the writings of the Northern Dipper to gather the hun and po, removing the portal of death. Thereafter, one uses the talismans of the Southern Culmen to oversee the register of rebirth. Thus, the Southern Asterism and Northern Dipper refine the hun and forge the po, enabling the return of form and the roaming of the Great Void. This is the supreme Dao of Numinous Treasure.

**Altars of Threefold Radiance Refinement**
**Altar of Southern Prosperity for Refinement and Deliverance**
**Altar of Ninefold Refinement for the Generation of Corporeal Forms**
**Altar of Numinous Treasure for the Refinement and Deliverance of Ascending Immortals**

**Formats for the Gate of Ascension and Refinement**

Inscribe five characters upon it, then use a talisman to pass through the Water Gate. Likewise, for the fire pool, construct a gate beside it, inscribe five characters upon it, and use a talisman to pass through the Fire Gate.

Swiftly, swiftly, as the Celestial Emperor decrees.

**Form for Water Pool and Fire Pond**
The Master says: When establishing a water pool, choose a *ren-gui* day, construct it of stone, square within and round without, with the center below forming the *Kan* trigram. Let it be five feet in diameter, carve the talisman within, and set up a placard inscribed *Flowing Torrent Pond* at the northeast corner.

When establishing a fire pool, choose a *bing-ding* day, have artisans carve it from stone, square within and round without, with the center below forming the *Li* trigram. Let it be three feet in diameter, set up a placard inscribed *Smelting Refinement Pool*, carve the talisman within, and place it at the southeast corner.

Above both pools, hang banners to guide the approaching souls. The Dharma Master shall establish them according to this form.

**Great Refinement Talismanic Gate**
**Taiyin Primordial Form Yin Refinement Method**

The Master said: The Primordial unites with qi, gathering to form the numinous.
Three Origins and nine numbers circulate through the twelve divisions.
In heaven, they correspond to the twelve celestial palaces and their domains;
in humans, to the twelve meridians and visceral systems,
aligning with the six yin and six yang to generate and complete the outer and inner forms.

Now, the refinement of the yin corpse transforms through qi-convergence and spirit-gathering,
forging the true radiance of life, penetrating the yang light,
so as not to fall into dark destinies but to ascend to the realm of the Dao.

Yet those whose souls remain unrefined—
even in the nether courts, the same applies.
One must perform the Nine Yang Refinement and Salvation,
reciting the twelve meridian true talismans,
burning them in the fire pool,
then invoking the twelve great generals’ true forms
to regenerate the five viscera and six bowels.

The method states:
Bind mugwort into a human shape, using the clothing the departed wore at life’s end.
First, inscribe and burn the twelve meridian talismans, distributing them among the five viscera and six bowels.
Then, in cinnabar, write the Jade Script true writ and affix it to the abdomen.
Also in cinnabar, write the *Great Great Contract for Ascension to Heaven*,
place it in a crimson silk pouch, and hang it from the collar.
Further, inscribe the *Numinous Treasure Five Talismans* and arrange them among the five viscera,
uniting my three sections and eight luminaries with the twenty-four true qi.

First, establish the altar and perform the Dao,
petitioning the Celestial Emperor,
notifying the Nine Dark Prisons and the Bureaus of the Dead,
dispatching the traveling officials to pursue and retrieve the departed soul.
When night falls, prepare the ritual regalia
and place the mugwort effigy at the Ghost Gate in the northeast wilderness.

The Dharma Master, at the Earth Gate,
transforms into the Nine Radiance Perfected Person,
paces the Dipper from head to tail,
gazes toward the Heavenly Gate, and summons the true qi.
A youth holds the soul-summoning banner at the Heavenly Gate,
while the Dharma Master gathers and commands the qi,
transmuting it to form the five viscera.
Then, the assembly recites the *Golden Watchtower Transformation Body Heavenly Worthy*,
and the youth circles, drawing the true qi downward to infuse the mugwort effigy,
completing the twelve qi.

Next, at the Human Gate,
visualize the mugwort effigy transforming into a human form.
The Dharma Master and assembly recite the central scripture in unison,
circling the effigy, sprinkling willow-branch purified water three times.
The assembly chants the *Step-in-Emptiness Invocation*,
raising the mugwort effigy to the altar’s base.
The Dharma Master then performs the refinement and salvation in sequence,
using the twelve Primordial Great General talismans
and the twelve meridian talismans in the Great Refinement.
This method, from the Yellow Register, may be used for up to three names.

**Primordial Twelve Great Generals Yin-Yang Twelve Meridian Talismans**

The Master said:
Thirty-six qi form the material basis of yin and yang;
thirty-six qi generate the meridians.
Thus, the thirty-six celestial circuits flow through the body,
uniting yin and yang, hun and po,
to form the infant and return to the womb, becoming human—
this is the Dao of one generating two, two generating three.

Within the talismans, each Great General commands one hundred twenty officers,
with one supreme commander overseeing each.
During refinement, burn the talismans to summon them,
using them to regenerate the five viscera and six bowels.
The yin and yang meridian talismans must be employed together.
Write them with realgar mixed with cinnabar on yellow silk,
focusing the mind, stabilizing the spirit, and embodying the true self.
Visualize the Three Luminaries’ scripts without distraction.

The method states:
First, enter a quiet chamber, burn incense,
and petition the Three Luminaries’ High Perfected, the Vermilion Numinous Great Emperor,
Lord Donghua and Queen Mother of the West,
presenting your sincere intentions.
Then summon the various Great Generals and spirit officials to descend.
Face southeast and inscribe according to the prescribed form.

**Primordial Twelve Meridian Yin Talismans**
Right talisman generates the kidneys—press the *zi* script, visualize the north qi’s dark hue.
Right talisman generates the heart—press the *wu* script, visualize the south qi’s red hue.
Right talisman generates the liver—press the *mao* script, visualize the east qi’s blue-green hue.

Right talisman generates the lungs—press the *you* script, visualize the west qi’s white hue.
Right talisman generates the spleen—press the *shen* script, visualize the central qi’s yellow hue.
Right talisman generates the bladder—press the *yin* script, visualize the northeast qi’s qi hue.
Right talisman generates the small intestine—press the *xu* script, visualize the northwest qi.
Right talisman generates the gallbladder—press the *si* script, visualize the *xun* green qi.
Right talisman generates the large intestine—press the *you* script, visualize the west’s white qi.
Right talisman generates the stomach—press the central script, visualize the central heaven’s yellow qi.
Right talisman generates the triple burner—press the *ji* script, visualize the southeast’s blue-red qi.
Right talisman generates the pericardium—insert the Eight Trigrams mudra, visualize the eight directions’ qi.

The above twelve talismans are to be inscribed in cinnabar on yellow paper. Facing east, press the corresponding directional mudra and draw in the directional qi; the rest are to be visualized according to the directional numbers.

**The Memorial Format for Presenting the Nine Talismans**
Your subordinate, [Name], of such-and-such rank,
respectfully states: In the [Name] Daoist oratory, an unsurpassed Great Yellow Register Fast has been established to beseech the deliverance of the deceased [Name] and others, freeing them from suffering and enabling their ascent.

Today, I invoke the thrones of the Three Worthies and the oversight of the myriad sages.
In reverent accordance with the mysterious statutes, I perform the refinement and deliverance, following the ritual procedures to present the talismanic commands. I humbly pray that the luminance of flowing water be refined into the True Bladder Talisman.
Herewith, the talisman is changed.

*Inscribe this talisman.*

Respectfully presented to the Fire-Refined Elixir Realm Heavenly Worthy before the altar. As the talisman is changed, I reverently await your Daoist compassion, that you may specially bestow the qi of life to irrigate the souls of the deceased [Name] and others.
May the dead souls receive refinement, transform into immortals, and assume human form, turning with the kalpic wheel to share the heavens’ lifespan, transcending the Three Realms and roaming freely in the Highest Clarity.

Your subordinate’s heart trembles with utmost awe.
Respectfully submitted.

On the day of the year governed by the Great Year-Star [Tai Sui], in the [ ] month.

Humbly submitted by the officiant, your subordinate [Name].

**Upper Corpse Talisman**
*Incantation for the Upper Corpse:*
The Upper Corpse loves desire, self-styled Pengju.
Transformed into nine kinds, bird-headed with serpent’s body.
Chaotic and heartless, now sinking, now floating.
Greedy for flavors and splendor, self-indulgent in beauty.
It flees with human *hun* and *po*, oversees human faults.
It severs the root of life, scatters *qi*, and spirits wander.
Reckless in the Three Palaces, tiny worms without toil.
True Person of Jia-Yi, inscribe the numinous talisman.
Desire for sensuality is cut off, the path of death removed.
The Primordial Beginning has decreed: beseech the destruction of the corpse’s head.
The Three Terraces monitor the form—swiftly depart, Yuanliu!
Eradicate the root, sever the lineage, leave no remnant behind.
The deceased is refined in truth, the Three Palaces made clear and void.
The Five Emperors oversee, the Great One records the decree.
On an auspicious day, bathe and don cap and sash to perform the rites.
Soar through the celestial realms, streaming radiance in the jade chariot.
Pursue the light to the Upper Clarity, roam the void in flight.
All in accordance with the proclaimed command, ascend to Jade Capital.

**Middle Corpse Talisman**
*Incantation for the Middle Corpse:*
The Middle Corpse, Pengqi, is called the Central Yellow.
It dwells in desire, hiding within the belly.
Sinking and floating, transforming—its form has no constant shape.
It seizes human *hun* and *po*, fleeing to the Three Palaces.
The Red Child gallops, driving one to madness.
Desire and nature deplete the spirit—sin arises from tiny worms.
True Person of Jia-Yi, the Celestial Emperor has already summoned.
Adorn the body with jade talismans, jade script and golden seals.
Inscribe names on the Primordial Register—three desires are now extinguished.
The Primordial Beginning’s talismanic command: behead and destroy the corpse’s form.
Sever the root, cut off the lineage, let it not take flight.
The departed soul undergoes refinement, the Five Palaces cleansed and frozen.
True immortals settle in peace, light born within the viscera.
The Five Emperors oversee, the Great One arrays the ranks.
Bathe in the Middle Prime, don cap and robes.
Release the form, transform into radiance—streaming jade light.
Fly and ascend to the Upper Clarity, breathe the void of the Great Emptiness.
Ever preserve the natural, heaven and earth without end.
All in accordance with the proclaimed command, ascend to Jade Capital.

**Lower Corpse Talisman**
*Incantation for the Lower Corpse:*
The Lower Corpse, Pengjiao, glories in greed and desire.
White and chaotic, its body has no constant form.
It clings to human feet, delighting in stirring emotions.
Speaking of my gains and losses, it flees as *hun* and *ling*.
It disturbs the Three Palaces, the Red Child unsettled.
Greedy, desirous tiny worms feign readiness in the hidden depths.
True Person of Jia-Yi, the three refinements are now purified.
The gate of desire is sealed, no longer receiving demonic essence.
The Primordial Beginning’s urgent decree: the Three Terraces descend to the court.
Swiftly depart, Yuan Yin, along with your brothers!
Nine kinds of descendants—all beheaded at once.
The Five Emperors deliver truth, the Great One records names.
Bathe in the Lower Prime, don cap and feathered azure.
Pass beyond the Three Realms, drink the primordial essence above.
Release the form, vanish in transformation—streaming light to the Upper Clarity.
Step the void in flight, the Three Realms equally luminous.
All in accordance with the proclaimed command, ascend to Jade Capital.

**Ninefold Refinement of the Living Corpse Talisman Chapter**
The Master said: The method of Ninefold Refinement of the Living Corpse is the supreme Dao.
When a person first receives life, all emerge from the Void.
None fail to rely on past karma, meeting present conditions.
Taking the image of Heaven and Earth, embracing Sun and Moon,
Transforming yin and yang, spirit and consciousness coming and going—
Amidst the myriad transformations, the Three Burners congeal in secret,
The Nine Heavens darkly revolve. All are born through the harmonious union of the *qi* of the Nine Heavens’ generative spirits.
The first month: the *qi* of the Baoyu Shantian descends to form the embryo.
The second month: the *qi* of the Taishan Shantian descends to form the fetus.
The third month: the *qi* of the Fan Jian Tian descends to complete the *hun*.
The fourth month: the *qi* of the Jiran Tian descends to complete the *po*.
The fifth month: the *qi* of the Poluonimi Bujiaole Tian descends to transform the gallbladder.
The sixth month: the *qi* of the Dongxuan Tian Wujiang descends to transform the viscera.
The seventh month: the *qi* of the Mingqiao Linghua Tian descends to illuminate the orifices.
The eighth month: the *qi* of the Gaoxu Tian descends to attach the radiance.
The ninth month: the *qi* of the Yuanxiang Yuanjie Yuan’ai Tian descends to infuse the spirit.
Within the body, eighteen thousand spirits—inner and outer in harmony—
Thirty-six thousand spirits simultaneously generate the body.
Golden towers and jade chambers, purple portals arrayed in spirit,
Enveloping the body within and without, resonating in sound and spirit.
The Three Primes nurture, the Nine *Qi* shape the form,
Day and night unceasing, spreading transformation and change.
The Yellow Spirit receives the essence—thus one enters the womb.
In receiving life, none fail to be born through the *qi* of the Nine Heavens.
Now, gathering and transforming the *qi* of the Nine Heavens,
Spreading it across the Eight Directions—
The dead return to life, withered bones emit smoke,
Sins and burdens dissolve, the Nine Heavens merge as one.
The myriad spirits are complete, spirit and consciousness clear.
Then the *hun* alone transcends the Three Heavens,
Modeling Heaven and Earth, containing yin and exhaling yang,
Generating spirits and spreading transformation—each has its method and secret.
Through repeated refinement and transformation, one may ascend to the Primordial Beginning.
The method of Ninefold Refinement of the Living Corpse follows the count of one hundred and eight:
Thirty-six Heavens, thirty-six Primes of Chaos.
Taking the thirty-six within the deceased’s body—
One Primordial, Two Modes, Three Lights, Four Images,
Five Phases, Six Pitches, Seven Governors, Nine Palaces—
Together, one hundred and eight.

Thus follows the reckoning of Yang’s ninety-six cycles, gathering the qi of Heaven and Earth to regenerate and form the human. The qi of Heaven engenders the spirits; the qi of the Nine Spirits engenders the nine orifices. Above, they connect to the Gate of Heaven, their voices attaining spirit-completion, resonating with the Nine Heavens above. The Nine Qi emerge before the Great Void, concealed within the hollow emptiness—without light, without image, without form, without name. The Nine Non-Beings array the proper order: sun, moon, and starry constellations; yin and yang, the Five Phases; the peoples and all categories of beings—all receive life and formation.

The myriad transformations of Heaven and Earth, if not nurtured by the Three Origins, would not coalesce into form through the Nine Qi. Therefore, after nine months, when the spirits have spread and qi is full, the Five Spirits are complete, and the human body is formed. Thirty-six transformations are generated, corresponding above to the Thirty-Six Heavens and below to the Thirty-Six Earths—none is lacking. Excluding the two qi of sun and moon that overspread and illumine the ten thousand lands, this makes one hundred and six in total, which aligns with the calamity of Yang’s ninety-six cycles—the great term of *jiashen*.

Originally transmitted by Xiāo Quánzhēn, compiled by Wáng Qìzhēn of the Sù lineage. Emerged from the simplicity of the Southern Song. One of the comprehensive collections of Daoist methods of the Song *Yuánfú* talismanic tradition. Comprising twenty-seven sections in sixty-six scrolls.

**Source:** *Zhengtong Daoist Canon*, *Zhengyi* Section, Part One.

*Scroll Fifty-Three of the* Supreme Purity Numinous Treasure Great Law
**The Cavernous Subtlety Lofty Adept Opening Light Deliverance from Suffering Perfected Níng Quánzhēn Transmits to the Supreme Three Caverns Disciple, Numinous Treasure Lineage Master, Successor Wáng Qìzhēn Compiles**
**Great Refinement Talismanic Registers Section**
*Nine Heavens Refinement Yin Talismans*

**Yùdān Heavenly Talisman**
The Three Qi honor the deities. The nine qi of all living beings emerge from the Great Void. Concealed, they call upon the Hollow Cavity. *Chánshàn* Heavenly Talisman—without light, without form, without clarity, without shape, without color, without trace, without sound, without voice. *Fànjiān* Heavenly Talisman—opening the mysterious passage. The Three Qi blend in primordial chaos, now present, now absent. *Jìrán* Heavenly Talisman—the qi purifies and ascends, the qi condenses and coagulates. The nine qi take their positions, all receiving life and completion.

**Bōluó Heavenly Talisman**
Nurtured by the Three Qi, guided by the nine qi. *Dòngxuán* Heavenly Talisman—the Three Origins cultivate and nourish, the nine qi shape the form. The nine-month spirit spreads forth; when the qi is full, it can produce sound. *Fànfǔ* Heavenly Talisman—the Nine Heavens rejoice. The Great One holds the talisman; the Thearch issues ranks. The Controller of Destiny determines fate; the Five Thearchs oversee life.

**Gāoxū Heavenly Talisman**
For men, the ten thousand spirits chant reverence; for women, the ten thousand spirits chant devotion. *Wúxiǎng* Heavenly Talisman—for men, the Controller of Destiny honors their vessels; for women, the Controller of Destiny honors their compliance.

**Nine Talismanic Declarations**
The Golden Characters of the Great Ancestor and the Jade Script of the Nine Qi Yin Talismans deliver the souls of the deceased, establishing them in the Heavenly Paradise. All is as decreed.

**Nine Heavens Life-Spirit Original Qi Talisman**
For this talisman, perform the Nine Refinements. Use yellow silk to craft nine banners, each nine inches wide and eight feet one inch tall. Inscribe the original qi talisman at the top, and engrave the Nine Heavens Yin Talismans along the banner’s body. Write the declaration in both hands and place them within the Nine Heavens Altar.

**Yùdān Heavenly Talisman**
Heaven is clear, Earth is tranquil, humanity is numinous. The Nine Luminaries move in harmony; yang is full, yin is abundant. The heart arises in emptiness and stillness, delivering the suffering from the hidden yin. Naturally uniting with the Dao, sun and moon share the same form.

**Chánshàn Heavenly Talisman**
The Dao’s foundation is vast and serene, transforming and harmonizing yin and yang. Uniting with the Real, awakening to the Dao, the heart is realized as no-heart.

**Fànjiān Heavenly Talisman**
Equal observation and wisdom transform. The numinous radiance of the Numinous Treasure illumines all heavens and the thirty-two Thearchs. They descend to teach the Dharma, delivering both the living and the deceased. Those in the cinnabar realm attain rebirth.

**Jìrán Heavenly Talisman**
The numinous talisman is refined by fire; the hundred bones take flight. Qi transforms into gēng and xīn; the spirit crosses the mysterious ford. Body and mind are purified, riding the light to ascend.

**Bōluó Heavenly Talisman**
The Three Qi surge like smoke; within the sun, the essence crystallizes. The po is refined, the hun is born; yin excites, yang blazes.

**Dòngxuán Heavenly Talisman**
Three transformations, nine refinements—changing the countenance, returning to the form. The body unites with the mysterious radiance, eternally enjoying long life.

**Línghuà Heavenly Talisman**
The sublime and distant of the Brahmā realm. The subtle governs the golden; the bright and clear attain preservation. Treading the clouds, soaring through the heavens, receiving the qi of the mysterious and profound. Together, they guard the Yellow Court.

**Gāoxū Heavenly Talisman**
The Three Yangs shine forth; the seven qi form the embryo. The Five Phases gather, uniting to stabilize the cinnabar terrace. Sun and moon contain radiance; the embryo’s light hangs like a fringe.

**Wúxiǎng Heavenly Talisman**
The Mysterious Thearch responds to the movement. Qi pierces the center of Heaven; the most wondrous and true numen matches the primordial lineage. The Nine Heavens’ total qi delivers the soul.

**Nine Heavens Total Qi Deliverance Soul Jade Talisman**
Yùdān concentrates the spirit; *Chánshàn* preserves the spirit.
*Fànjiān* condenses the qi; joyous assembly with the Real.
*Jìrán* rests in tranquility; the numinous Brahmā generates essence.
Transformation responds to the flowing light; *Gāoxū* illuminates the spirit.
Without attachment, without desire—names are listed in the Thearch’s register.
Yin and yang unite with the spirit; thirty-six thousand.
The two qi intermingle, internally guarding the Three Fields.
Attaining the sagely rank, coeval with the kalpas.
Flowing clouds and jade chariots come to serve the Thearch’s carriage.
Driving dragons, riding the light, ascending to the Nine Heavens.
*Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the decree of the Great Thearch of Long Life.*

**General Talisman**
The *Huòluò* Dipper, the ancestral qi blown forth and burned. The deceased’s body shines with yang radiance, rivaling the sun; their immortal robes are lovely, their spirit bright and clear.

**Eightfold Life Natural Numinous Void Flying Talisman**

Two qi initiate form,
Yin congeals, yang completes.

Primal qi entwines and descends to birth the human form.

Exhaustively fathom principle and life,

Nine steps, eight kun.
Perform the Sevenfold Firmness,

**Sweet Dew Pool Talisman**
**Sweet Dew Divine Incantation**
Limpid, sweet dew,
Dripping, nectarous liquor.
For the virtuous, ghee and milk;
For the wicked, icy broth.
Nine Dark Realms’ soul-awareness,
Seven ancestors’ misfortunes dispelled.
The River of Love clears,
The Sea of Suffering shines.
Lonely souls do not drown,
Stagnant *po* remain unharmed.
By the Primordial True One’s decree,
Proclaimed to the ten directions.

Inscribe in cinnabar upon yellow silk with jade talismanic gestures. Before the Southern Palace, set a basin filled with water boiled from licorice, persimmon, and honey. Burn the talisman, invoke the incantation, and cast the ashes into the basin. First visualize the basin as a Frigid Pool; after burning the talisman and reciting the incantation, transform it in mind into Sweet Dew—this is called "shattering the Frigid Pool of Suffering to create the Sweet Dew Pool." Such is the ancestral method of the Numinous Treasure, bestowed by the Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy upon Lady Wei of Southern Marchmount and Perfected Lord Xu for their practice. It delivers the souls within the pool, dissolving the sins of ten thousand kalpas.

**Prayer at the Pool’s Edge**
We bow in reverence: the round pool and square pond mirror the forms of Heaven and Earth. The Sweet Dew and Frigid Pool correspond to the omens of bliss and suffering. Thus, from Fengdu to the Yang Valley, waves ripple boundlessly; from the winding springs to the river’s source, depths stretch vast and wide. For the virtuous, it becomes ghee and honey; for the wicked, it turns to fire and scalding broth. Entering this River of Love, it is named the Sea of Desire. Yet if one clarifies the Five Turbidities, severs the Six Roots, retreats from the Ten Entanglements, and eliminates the Three Karmas, then one shall transform foul juices into Sweet Dew, convert the Frigid Pool into fragrant waters. The Nether Courts shall open in clarity, and sunken souls shall ascend in deliverance.

Today, we prepare the wondrous offerings of the Nine Dark Realms to rescue the numinous souls of the seven ancestors, universally aiding all sentient beings and universally bestowing upon the undeserving. Thus, we transform the waters of the Frigid Pool into the nectar of Sweet Dew, moistening the Nine Dark Realms and harmonizing the Ten Poles. Thereby, the *hun* and *shen* become pure, the *po* and consciousness revive, crossing the great Dharma Bridge to ascend the Crimson Mansion. We now invoke the empowering Sweet Dew Divine Incantation. Recite the incantation, burn the talisman, and visualize as before.

*Shangqing Lingbao Da Fa*, Scroll Fifty-Three, concludes.

**Text Title:** *Shangqing Lingbao Da Fa*
Originally transmitted by Xiao Quanzhen and compiled by Wang Qizhen; emerged from the simplicity of the Southern Song. One of the comprehensive collections of Daoist methods from the Song Yuanfu talismanic lineage, comprising twenty-seven sections in sixty-six scrolls.
**Source:** *Zhengtong Daozang*, Orthodox Section, Part One.

*Shangqing Lingbao Da Fa*, Scroll Fifty-Four
Transmitted by Ning Quanzhen, Illuminating Perfected One of Subtle Radiance and Salvation from Suffering, to Wang Qizhen, Disciple of the Three Caverns and Successor in the Numinous Treasure Teaching.
**Section on the Aims of Ritual Purification** – An Exegesis of the Numinous Treasure

The numinous pertains to yang: it has form yet lacks substance, unites with the Dao to attain truth, and takes shape above. In humans, it silently accords with the human spirit, transforming through thought in the heart—hence it is called *numinous*. The precious pertains to yin: it has both form and substance, transforms emptiness into solidity, and gathers form below. In humans, it nourishes the blood to form the body and congeals essence in the kidneys—hence it is called *precious*.

Thus, all things that come into being cannot but be born. For they are moved by the numinous to generate form; once form is complete, substance takes shape; once substance is formed, spirit arises—emerging from non-being into being. All things that come to an end cannot but perish. For as the precious scatters, substance withers; as substance withers, spirit departs; as spirit departs, form dissolves—passing from being into non-being.

The *Scripture of Virtue and Truth* states: From birth to death, the great transformation in humans encompasses four stages—infancy, youth and prime, old age, and death. In infancy, qi is concentrated, the will unified, and harmony perfected; no external thing can harm it, and no virtue surpasses it. In youth and prime, blood and qi overflow, desires and thoughts arise in abundance; external things assail it, and virtue thus declines. In old age, desires and thoughts grow gentle, the body prepares for rest; no external thing takes precedence, and though one cannot fully preserve the wholeness of infancy, one may still compare favorably to the state of youth. In death, breath ceases, returning to the ultimate origin.

Thus, life arises from the numinous giving rise to the precious, while death results from the precious losing the numinous—this is the constant principle of Heaven and Earth. Moreover, the numinous and precious reside within the human body. As this scripture’s commentary states: "When the hundred spirits do not scatter, it is called *numinous*; when the singular qi is ever-present, it is called *precious*." If one can guard the spirit, nurture the qi, secure the precious, and refine the numinous, then at the time of dissolution, form and spirit transcend external things. Hence it is said: The Way of the divine immortals enables one to ascend the Nine Heavens and become a minister to the Jade Emperor.

**Secret Essentials for Harmonizing Heaven, Pacifying Earth, Protecting the State, and Securing the Family**
The *Aims* state: The Great Rites of the Numinous Treasure can, above, preserve the enduring existence of Heaven, avert the dimming of the sun and moon and the misalignment of the stars; below, they dispel calamities of the kalpa—war, fire, and flood—as well as the disasters of the yang-nine and bai-six, and remedy the monstrosities of mountains, rivers, pythons, and giant beasts. In their highest form, they encompass the inner refinement of truth and the Way of ascending with flesh and bone; at the intermediate level, they offer methods for achieving long life and transcending the world, as well as corpse-liberation; in their lesser applications, they possess the power to deliver the living and the dead, reviving corpses and restoring life. In the manifest realm, they command the winds and thunder, transforming through the numinous power of spontaneity; in the hidden realm, they summon and employ the myriad spirits, perceiving clearly the patterns of the Ten Heavens. Thus, the sages embody and constantly employ them, while the common people use them daily without awareness.

**Lineage Transmission**
The *Aims* state: The transmission of the Great Rites of the Numinous Treasure’s lineage was orally passed down from one perfected immortal to another after the five kalpas of primordial transformation, never committed to writing. For to reveal the workings of Heaven would invite celestial censure. As the saying goes: "Written texts are easily seen, but the lineage’s aims are rarely encountered." Those who meet with them in this age do so by virtue of past good deeds, and thus should cherish, revere, and honor them.

Jade Repository of Alliance in Perfection

**Principle States:**
On the day of receiving the precepts, within the oratory, one bows to the memorials of the Thirty-Two Heavens, bowing to one heaven each day, completing the thirty-two days. Thus is one made a Jade Repository of Alliance in Perfection. Having paid homage to the Thirty-Two Heavens in all four directions, one is then comparable to those bound by the Golden and Jade Repositories. The prohibitions of the Yellow Register are weighty; transgressions are examined without pardon. Hence, the Jade Repository. Like a repository of jade, it is to be treasured, cherished, and guarded.

**Thirty-Six Heavens Above**
**Principle States:**
When primal chaos first divided, the mysterious qi gave birth to the primordial, from one came two, and from two came the qi of origin, forming three qi. The Heaven of Pure Subtlety is the mysterious, the Heaven of Yu Remainder is the primordial, and the Heaven of Great Redness is the origin—one heaven giving rise to three heavens. Each heaven generates three qi, forming the Nine Heavens. The Heaven of Pure Subtlety gives rise to the Heavens of Yu Shan, Chan Shan, and Xu Yan; the Heaven of Yu Remainder gives rise to the Heavens of Dou Wei, Bu Jiao Le, and Ying Sheng; the Heaven of Great Redness gives rise to the Heavens of Fan Fu, Qing Ming, and Wu Xiang—these are the Nine Heavens. Each of the Nine Heavens generates three heavens, totaling twenty-seven heavens. Externally, excluding the Supreme August Yellow and Once-Heaven and the four formless heavens—Great Void, Great Release, Dragon Transformation, and Great Ultimate—these together form twenty-seven heavens. The Three Clarities and Three Heavens reside above the Nine Firmaments, constituting the Thirty-Six Heavens Above.

**Thirty-Six Earths Below**
**Principle States:**
Just as the heavens have the Nine Heavenly Lords, the earth has the Nine Mounds of Earthly Sovereigns. Each mound also possesses three qi—earth, water, and wind—each in one stratum, layered above and below. The first earth is called Moistened Hue, the second Glossy Hue, the third Stone-Fat Glossy Hue, the fourth Moist Gloss, the fifth Golden Millet Gloss, the sixth Adamantine Iron Gloss, the seventh Water-Restrained Gloss, the eighth Great Wind Gloss, and the ninth the Boundless Abyssal Formless Net Earth. Each of the nine mounds generates three qi, forming the Thirty-Six Earths Below. The thirty-six yang qi of the heavens above constitute the Thirty-Six Heavenly Lords, while the thirty-six yin qi of the earths below constitute the Thirty-Six Earthly Sovereigns. Beneath the nine mounds lie three qi—the qi of wind, marsh, and abyss—vast and unyielding emptiness enveloped by wind and marsh. This is the qi of the Primordial Beginning’s Brahman Wind, harder than true metal, also called the adamantine wind. It upholds the nine mounds, bearing all heavens, floating high yet not dispersing, suspended yet not falling, connecting above to the Great Network—such is the nature of the Dao.

**Illuminating the Three Treasures**
**Principle States:**
In the Great Rites of Numinous Treasure, what is revered is the Most High Boundless Great Dao, the Thirty-Six Venerable Scriptures, and the Great Dharma Masters of the Mysterious. These are called the Three Treasures. As set forth in the *Guangcheng Fast Regulations*, all directions adhere to this, comprising seventeen characters in total, without variation. Recently, some have presumptuously altered and added to these, incorporating them into the *Simplified Serenity Rituals*—this is incorrect.

**The Most High Boundless Great Dao**
**Principle States:**
The Boundless Great Dao, when the singular qi first divided, was transmitted by the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of Original Beginning to the Supreme Dao Lord, who then passed it to the Later Sage Lord Lao. The Primordial Beginning was the teacher of the Dao Lord, and the Dao Lord was the teacher of Lord Lao, who descended to propagate the teachings in the world—this is the Boundless Great Dao.

**The Thirty-Six Venerable Scriptures**
**Principle States:**
The Great Rites of Numinous Treasure constitute the ancestral teachings of the Three Caverns. After the opening of the five kalpas, the Jade Purity Cavern of Perfection, the Highest Purity Cavern of Mystery, and the Supreme Purity Cavern of Divinity, along with the Four Auxiliary Talismans and Registers, were all formed from the vermilion-script jade characters of incantations and scriptures. The *Great Cavern* in thirty-nine chapters elucidates the body of primal chaos from the opening of the five kalpas and expounds the method of harmonizing the three qi into one, bestowed upon the Jade Dawn Dao Lord. Subsequently, across the heavens, the *Thirty-Six Venerable Scriptures of Numinous Treasure* were expounded, completing the scriptures of the world. In every land of the ten directions and the celestial offices therein, there exist the true writings and precious talismans of the *Thirty-Six Venerable Scriptures*. The common saying refers to the twelve divisions of the *Cavern of Perfection*, the twelve divisions of the *Cavern of Mystery*, and the twelve divisions of the *Cavern of Divinity*, totaling thirty-six divisions. Yet few know that each has its own distinct titles.

**Twelve Divisions of the Cavern of Perfection**
*Scriptures of Highest Purity*: one division, eight thousand scrolls
*Scriptures of Wondrous Perfection*: one division, five hundred fascicles
*Scriptures of the Supreme Unity Immortals*: one division, eight hundred scrolls
*Scriptures of the Wondrous Grove Immortals*: one division, eighty fascicles
*Scriptures of Opening Transformation*: one division, eight thousand scrolls
*Scriptures of the Immortal Kan*: one division, seven thousand fascicles
*Scriptures of Master Huanglin*: one division, eighteen thousand scrolls
*Scriptures of the Supreme Perfection*: one division, fifteen thousand scrolls
*Scriptures of Daoist Teachings*: one division, fifteen thousand scrolls
*Scriptures of Refining Essence*: one division, eighty-eight thousand scrolls
*Scriptures of Merit and Virtue*: one division, eighty-four thousand scrolls
*Scriptures of the Dao and Its Virtue*: one division, five thousand scrolls

**Twelve Divisions of the Cavern of Mystery**
*Scriptures of Numinous Treasure*: one division, eight thousand scrolls
*Scriptures of Primordial Yang*: one division, one hundred twelve scrolls
*Scriptures of Primordial Epochs*: one division, one hundred thousand scrolls
*Scriptures of the Great Kalpa*: one division, ten thousand scrolls
*Scriptures of Opening Mountains*: one division, one hundred thousand scrolls
*Scriptures of the Inner Sounds of All Heavens*: one division, one hundred thousand fascicles
*Scriptures of the Eight Refining and Reviving Corpses*: one division, one hundred thousand scrolls
*Scriptures of the Harmonious Heart-Sound*: one division, eighty thousand fascicles
*Scriptures of Dispelling Demons*: one division, eighty thousand scrolls
*Scriptures of Immeasurable Life*: one division, eighty thousand scrolls
*Scriptures of Massage*: one division, one hundred thousand scrolls
*Scriptures of the Daoist Body*: one division, one hundred thousand scrolls

**Twelve Divisions of the Cavernous Divine Canon**

*Scriptures of the Great Clarity*: one division, eight thousand scrolls
*Scriptures of Penetrating Vision*: one division, ninety thousand scrolls
*Scriptures of the Assembly of Immortals*: one division, eighty thousand scrolls
*Scriptures of the Cavernous Abyss and Divine Ruan*: one division, eighty thousand scrolls
*Scriptures of the Inner Secrets*, *Scriptures of the True One*, *Scriptures of the Assembly of Spirits*, *Scriptures of the Central Essence*, and *Scriptures of the Immeasurable Grades*: one division each, eighty thousand scrolls
*The Yellow and Laozi’s Collected Palace Scriptures*: one division, eighty thousand scrolls
*Scriptures of the Yellow Court*: one division, one hundred thousand scrolls
*Scriptures of the Lesser Kalpa Grades*: one division, eighty thousand scrolls

**The Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center**
The宗旨 states: After the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning established the teachings, in the first year of the Supreme Sovereign’s reign, the Five Kalpas unfolded simultaneously. The Five Phases took full form, the Five *qi* were complete, and the manifold Perfected Ones were transformed into being. The various immortals, arising within the Five Kalpas, were transformed from the essence of the Mysterious Center, and the essence within the Mysterious—all were of the Supreme Sovereign’s former kalpa, styled the Five Kalpas. From within them was transformed the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center, who received the quintessence of the Five *qi*. Together with the Celestial Perfected Sovereign, they assembled the clouds into chapters, the dragon embryos and stone effulgences, the millions of talismanic writings, the Three Divisions and Ten Precepts—all became the orthodox texts. Thus did the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center first establish the teachings.

**Clarifying the Numbers of the Five Directions’ *Qi***
The East: nine *qi* of *renzi* Wood, the time-number of arising, reaching the ninth position of *gengshen*, where the yang spirits gather.
The South: three *qi* of *wuzi* Fire, the time-number of soaring flames, reaching the third position of *gengyin*, where the yang spirits gather.
The West: seven *qi* of *jiazi* Metal, the time-number of stern execution, reaching the seventh position of *gengwu*, where the yang spirits gather.
The North: five *qi* of *bingzi* Water, the time-number of the mysterious essence, reaching the fifth position of *gengchen*, where the yang spirits gather.
The Center: one *qi* of *gengzi* Earth, the time-number of profound humility, occupying the first position, where one *qi* of yang spirits gathers.

**Clarifying the Great Expansion Numbers of the Ten Directions**
East: nine *qi*; South: three *qi*; West: seven *qi*; North: five *qi*; Center: twelve *qi*. Excluding the void number of Earth, this refers to the lower direction.
Southeast: six *qi*; Southwest: two *qi*; Northeast: four *qi*; Northwest: eight *qi*; Upper Direction: one *qi*; Lower Direction: one *qi*. In total, eighty-five *qi*. Excluding the one *qi* of Heaven’s Origin, the two *qi* of the Sun and Moon, and the one *qi* of Earth’s Origin, this accords with the ninety-nine of the Central States, the yang number.

**Clarifying the Distribution of the Nine *Qi***
The *宗旨* states: The various methods record only the Five *qi*, according to the Five Directions and Five Thearchs’ kalpas. There are nine-colored circular images, yet without distinguishing the patterns of ingress, egress, and transformation, one cannot communicate with the Perfected or summon the spirits. Here, we provide diagrams and categories.

**Diagram of the Five *Qi* Transforming into Nine *Qi***
We humbly observe that the teachings of the August Void originated in primordial antiquity. The wondrous Dao opened its radiance, and divine texts descended into the world, sometimes manifesting in accordance with the times, their affairs transmitted through succession. From the middle antiquity onward, the canonical writings became vast and abundant. By the Jin and Song dynasties, Master Lu of Tranquil Simplicity first clarified the origins of transmission and descent, distinguishing the Three Caverns and Four Supplements, examining and collating the various canons, and compiling the liturgical rites. Thereafter, these were promulgated far and wide, the liturgical methods widely disseminated, the scriptural injunctions arranged in order, and the sequence established.

By the Tang, Zhang of Pure Capital and Myriad Blessings further edited and compiled, gradually refining the canonical models. After the mid-Tang, Master Du Guangting of Broad Accomplishment thoroughly investigated the thirty-six divisions of scriptures, collating and annotating the ancient and modern canons, exerting great effort in editing and proofreading. Thus, the liturgical methods reached their full fruition. Yet every single word and method, from beginning to end, derived from the scriptures’ authority—the twenty-four grades of ancient liturgy.

Master Guangting’s discourse states that the *Huanglu* [Yellow Register] encompasses both life and death, uniting the short-lived and the long-lived in shared fortune. From the state down to the common people, all may cultivate and uphold it. It is subordinate to the Middle Officials of the Lower Era, governing the myriad spirits, and is connected to the Nine Treasuries. Its merits and virtues are profound and weighty, benefiting both the living and the dead. Thus, he compiled forty fascicles of liturgical methods, titled *The Yellow Register Liturgical Canon*. In this way, the altar’s legacy and ritual forms, the morning and evening observances, all followed a single path from ancient times to the present. Its liturgical texts were solemn and well-ordered, its canonical models clear and flowing, elucidating ancient principles and illuminating future generations. The liturgical methods reached their ultimate refinement, beyond which nothing could be added.

In the first fascicle of this canon, the regulations for the Altar Officers state: The Dharma Master should bear the registers and insignia of the Three Caverns. Next, those bearing the registers of the Cavernous Mystery may perform the rites. For the liturgical methods derive from the *Lingbao* [Numinous Treasure] scriptures, belonging to the Cavernous Mystery division. From the announcement of the liturgy’s commencement to the concluding offerings, dispersal of the altar, and thanksgiving, all are fully provided in Guangting’s canon. In later generations, though the liturgical canons proliferated, drawing from the various scriptures of the Three Caverns, most derived from the Twelve Divisions of the Cavernous Mystery. If one performs liturgical affairs, talismans, incantations, memorials, and official documents not recorded in the canon, these have, since the Tang, been subsumed under the *Lingbao* Great Dharma. The foundational text of this Dharma centers on the first fascicle of the *Upper Grade of Salvation*, known as the *Great Dharma of the Upper Clarity and Numinous Treasure*. Though concise, its profundities are inexhaustible.

The scriptures say: When the stellar lodges are in disarray and the sun and moon lose their dusk, one should perform the liturgy, burn incense, and recite the scriptures. When the ruler of the state faces calamity and warfare arises on all sides, one should perform the liturgy, burn incense, and recite the scriptures. When pestilence spreads and the people perish in great numbers, one should perform the liturgy, burn incense, and recite the scriptures. When teachers and friends pass away, one should perform the liturgy, burn incense, and recite the scriptures.

In Guangting’s canon, the *Huanglu* rites are employed to eliminate disasters for the state, pray for blessings for the people, deliver teachers and friends, universally save the souls of the departed, petition for blessings from the Three Origins, and connect with the ascent of the Nine Ancestors. All these are called *Huanglu*. Each has its liturgical methods and rites, derived from the *Lingbao* scriptures. Thus, the origins and transmissions compiled herein relate to a vast number of scriptures, while the liturgical talismans and methods are all contained in this book.

The ancient methods of *Lingbao* begin with upholding the precepts and deeply comprehending the fundamental scriptures, refining *qi* through ingestion, preserving the spirit through inner cultivation, and gathering one’s radiance for internal alchemy. Only then may one save the world and deliver beings, assist the upright and expel the perverse, establish virtue and merit, and rescue the hidden and ferry the departed. At this stage, the liturgical rites must be performed—this is to fully manifest what one has cultivated and extend it to the world, following the proper sequence of application.

In the established canons of *Guangting*, the *Huanglu* rites hold the highest importance. The old methods of *Lingbao* are also all classified under *Huanglu* liturgical ranks.

The Mysterious Master said: "To deliver the seven ancestors and rescue those in the three wretched realms, the *Huanglu* Grand Rite is foremost. When intending to perform deliverance, one must first receive the petition from the sponsor of the rite, then carefully assess whether the person is filial, benevolent, loyal, upright, sincere, and earnest, whether they have taken refuge and hold faith in the liturgical methods, and whether they are fit to carry out the rites. Only then may their petition be accepted and their observance of the rite permitted. They should be instructed on the ritual implements and offerings required for the rite, so that these may be prepared in advance and nothing be lacking when the time comes.

Next, an auspicious site is chosen to establish the altar, preferably in grotto-heavens and blessed lands, famous mountains and pure abodes, sacred altars and Daoist temples, or serene residences. Sites that have witnessed warfare or battles, slaughterhouses, prisons, places of childbirth with blood pollution, tombs, or other defiled and inauspicious locations are to be avoided—only such are deemed auspicious.

Next, an auspicious day is divined for announcing the rite, preferably coinciding with the Three Origins, Eight Festivals, Five La Days, Ten Straight Days, or Three Assemblies. If the rite is dedicated specifically to delivering the mysterious ancestors, the days should align with the departed’s seventh seven-day period, hundredth day, major and minor anniversaries, distant death anniversaries, or birthdays. For universal deliverance, the days should coincide with *gengshen*, *jiazi*, the Four Beginnings, Ten Straight Days, Heavenly Grace, Heavenly Amnesty, or other highly auspicious days, ideally overlapping with festival days, La Days, or Assemblies. A single auspicious day alone is insufficient for initiating the rite.

The announcement of the rite marks the inception of intent, with petitions conveyed to the Three Origins, beginning from the chosen auspicious day. The sponsor brings the ritual offerings and submits a written petition to the masters’ gate, bowing to invite the liturgist. Once the master receives the petition, they lead the sponsor to the Dao altar, where reverent incense is burned to make the announcement. If there is a written petition, it is presented; the master then commands fellow disciples and like-minded practitioners to assemble. Fellow disciples refer to those who share the same path, altar, and teacher; like-minded practitioners are those who share the same aspirations to universally aid the living and the dead. If unsuitable persons are involved, harmonious *qi* will not arise, and the merit of the rite will be compromised.

From the day the rite is announced, the master, the sponsor, disciples, fellow disciples, and like-minded practitioners enter the pure chamber to face the rite, abstaining from external affairs. The duration may be a hundred days, ninety days, seventy days, forty-nine days, or thirty-two days, during which they focus single-mindedly on deliverance. The scale of the rite—whether grand or modest—is determined by the number of departed souls to be delivered, with all preparations made in full to avoid deficiencies when the time arrives.

An auspicious day is chosen to establish the sacred altar. At the center of the altar, the Three Treasures’ positions are set, adorned with canopies and precious coverings. The divine scriptures are placed in the middle, while within the inner altar, incense tables for the Ten Directions are arranged, with flowers, lamps, and ritual implements arranged according to the proper method. Diagrams show six tents positioned to the left and right before the altar. A model is placed in the center with the Nine Dark Realms’ spirit lamps, or above the Heavenly Gate. Around the altar’s perimeter, lamps are lit according to the method. Diagrams depict the southeast of the altar adorned with the Revolving Radiance Wheel Lamp, the northeast with the Nine Prisons Lamp, and the rear center with the ritual arena, where the Emperor’s throne is placed in the middle, flanked by ranks of left and right attendant sages, with incense, flowers, and ritual tables arranged properly. To the left front of the arena, a separate position is set for the Three Masters of Orthodox Unity. In the southeast of the altar, the Hall of Reception is established, facing the altar from afar, serving as the position for the sponsor’s nine *xuan* and seven ancestors. Additionally, twelve stepped platforms are erected to the left and right before the altar, each assigned to manage specific affairs.

Before the altar rites commence, memorials and petitions are presented within the ritual arena. Outside the altar, positions are set for the local earth god, the territorial deity, the attending officials, and the supervising altar spirits.
