Thirty-two, twenty-four, or fourteen days prior—depending on the number of departed souls to be delivered—petitions are submitted to the celestial realms. A vermilion memorial invoking the Heavenly Savior is presented, establishing the Hall of Azure Radiance for Salvation. The Nine Dragon Talismanic Commands are proclaimed, and the Azure Mystery Precious Banner is erected. Models show the rites of covenant and alliance with the Three Clarities and Four Emperors, the Five Masters of the Eastern Ultimate, the Three Officials, the Three Bureaus of the Heavenly Pivot, the Ten Heavens of the Three Realms, the Five Marchmounts and Nine Provinces, the Nine Earths and Ten Paths, the Northern Capital’s Underworld Courts, the City Gods and Year Gods, the local earth deities, and other relevant offices. Petitions are issued to summon the attending merit officials, direct talismans, and local earth gods according to the proper method.

Next, a memorial invoking the White Horse and Plain Carriage is presented, and the Banner of Covenant is erected to inform the profound heavens. A model shows a separate space designated as the Scripture-Recitation Hall, where fellow disciples and like-minded practitioners gather to purify body and mind. Daily, they diligently recite the *Lingbao* scriptures, such as the *Upper Chapters on Delivering the People and Nurturing the Spirit*, the *Golden Register for Delivering Lives and Attaining the Dao to Save from Suffering*, and other scriptures. They perform the rites of repentance for the Nine Dark Realms and the Heavenly Court, recite the Sweet Dew Divine Mantra, and invoke the sacred titles of the Jade Emperor, the Azure Mystery, and the Lords of the Ten Directions, accumulating merit through repetition. The merit of printing and burning paper offerings is limited.

Ten, seven, or three days prior—depending on the circumstances—the Nine Clarities’ Supreme Emperor, the Eastern and Southern Ultimates, the True Kings of the Nine Dark Realms and Vermilion Mound Grotto-Abyss, the Lords of the Ten Directions and Five Elders, the Heavenly Worthies and Emperors of the Thirty-Two Heavens of the Nine Empyreans, the Wooden Duke and Metal Mother of the Shen Day Palace, the Nine Luminaries, the Five Dippers of the North, South, East, West, and Center, the Three Officials and Four Sages, the Five Masters, the Supervising Masters of Orthodox Unity, the Three Bureaus and Five Offices, the Northern and Southern Courts, the Upper Office of Nanchang, the Heavenly Bureaus of the Nine Heavens, the Heavenly Perfected and August Persons, the Flying Heavenly Spirit-Kings, the Perfected of the Ten Ultimates, the Perfected Immortals of Talismans, Methods, and Scriptural Registers, the Water Palaces of the Five Marchmounts and Four Waterways, the Fengdu Earthly Courts, the Nine Rivers and Nine Ramparts, the Grotto-Heaven Immortal Officials, the Year Gods, the City Gods of the respective prefectures, commanderies, and counties, the local territorial deities, the various Daoist and prison officials, the Nine Provinces’ earth gods, the Lord of the Yellow Springs, the water and land passes, the boundary deities of the Five Directions, the dark passes and hidden paths, the Great Gods of the Five Roads, the Fengdu Marchmounts and Waterways, the underworld clerks and officials, the supervising altar spirits, the attached officials and generals of the respective bureaus, the local earth gods and life-mandate officials—all relevant places are thoroughly and meticulously prepared.

Furthermore, memorials shall be submitted to the Supervisors of Waterways and Thunderous True Lords, and writs dispatched to the Year God Kings, the Wind and Rain Dragon Deities, the City Gods and Village Earth Gods, the Mountain Forest Chiefs and Han Immortals, as well as all local administrators of the Marchmounts, the Grotto-Heavens and Blessed Lands, and the various Celestial Immortal Bureaus. From each, divine soldiers shall be dispatched to guard the ritual altar, dispel inauspicious influences, prolong clear skies, prevent wind and rain or overcast conditions, and secure timely fair weather.

Local territorial deities shall be selected and commissioned to stand vigil at the altar, preventing misfortune and restraining evil, overseeing the covenant of the fast, and rebuking those who violate the Dao. Next, proceed to the Divine Tiger Hall’s Pass, summoning the Divine Tiger Officials, Generals, and the ranks of clerks and soldiers. Establish the Yin-Yang Dual Altars and the Eight-Gated Altar, issue jade writs, and include the souls of the deceased to be delivered. Present the writs to the Two Sagely Jade Maidens, the Messengers of the Three Departments, the Envoys of the Two Prisons, and the summoning officials. Charge them to bear the jade writs and, in advance, report to the Water and Earth Bureaus to trace the roots of the delivered souls, ensuring their presence at the altar to manifest karmic response and await the rites of the fast. Prepare and erect the standards for the Ascension of Spirits and the Return of Radiance, and once the writs have been duly submitted, proceed in order to inscribe and confer the talismans of liberation.

Seven days prior—or five, four, or three days before—the ritual arena shall witness the prostration and presentation of the *Precious Chapter for Dispelling Defilement to the Mysterious Heavens*. Following the prescribed rites, proceed day by day to present the *Chapter for Amnesty in Fengdu*, proclaim the *Edict of Amnesty from Fengdu*, the *Edict of Talismanic Mandate from the Primordial Beginning*, or the *Talisman of Salvation from Suffering* and the *Talisman for Delivering Souls from Darkness*, invoking the Dragon. In due course, present the *Precious Chapter for Opening the Roads*, proclaim the *Precious Edict of the Jade Emperor* and the *Edict for the Governance of Earthly Deities*, perform the *Rite for Opening the Five Paths*, and release the souls of the departed.

As the fast approaches its appointed time, present the *Precious Chapter for Purification and Alchemical Transformation*. One or two days prior, assemble the officials to ascend the altar and rehearse the dignified rites. On the day of the fast, at the hour of noon, the bell shall sound. The altar officials, fast officials, and ritual attendants shall invite the Dharma Master to the Hall of Serene Silence to assign roles, distribute written duties, and stand in order according to rank. The Dharma Master shall take his seat, while the sponsor performs the Nine Bows thrice repeated, kneels thrice, and offers words of entreaty thrice, beseeching the Master to ascend the altar. With formal assent, the Master is acclaimed and led to the high seat, where incense is offered, the seat consecrated, and the covenant initiated. Descending, the Master inscribes the covenant document, and the officiants, bearing the placard of dignified rites, lead the procession from the hall to the outer altar’s Earth Gate, where the altar is purified with consecrated water.

The Dharma Master, leading the assembled officials, each holding sprigs of purifying water, shall recite the incantations of Heaven and Earth, circumambulate the altar in order, and sprinkle it with purifying libations. Once the altar is ritually secured, proceed according to the prescribed rites. First, present the *Talisman of Inviting Light* to summon the Solar Fire, lighting the Primordial Beginning’s foremost candle. From beginning to end, the flame must be continuously maintained, never extinguished. Next, before the altar, erect six tents: the Tent of the Mysterious Master, the Tent of the Five Emperors, the Tent of the Heavenly Master, the Tent of the Three Masters, the Tent of the Three Officials, and the Tent of the Fast Overseers. In each, invite the sagely presences, offer libations, present memorials and petitions, read the covenant document, and advance the spirit money and horses, all to be consumed in the flames.

Proceed to establish the halls and steps for the various bureaus, following the prescribed texts, then return to the Hall of Serene Silence for a brief rest. Next, proceed to the Hall of the Underworld Officials, where offerings are set for the Ten Kings, and the rites for the Ten Kings are acclaimed. As dusk falls, the Dharma Master ascends the altar to distribute the lamps. Following the text, the lamp attendants light the lamps in proper order, ensuring they illuminate the interior and exterior completely, before retiring to the hall.

The following preparations shall mirror the previous: with dignified rites, the Dharma Master is respectfully invited to ascend the altar for the overnight invocation. Acclaimed and led from the hall, the procession pays homage to the six tents—first the Five Emperors, then the Three Masters, the Fast Overseers, the Three Officials, the Heavenly Master, and finally the Tent of the Mysterious Master. The officials stand in ordered ranks, while the sponsor offers incense and presents the petition box, conveying the intent of the fast. The Master receives the petition and, chanting praises and leading the procession, arrives at the outer gate of the ritual arena. The two ranks stand in order at the foot of the altar, where the Master offers incense and makes invocation. The chief attendant recites the petition to open the altar, which is then burned outside the altar. With the sounding of bells, jade chimes, and gongs, the Master kneels to present the *Scroll for Rolling Up the Curtain*, following the text to prostrate and present the *Memorial for Communicating with the True*. Ascending the altar according to the rites, the Master arrives at the Earth Gate, recites the secret incantation, and enters. The officials follow into the central altar, standing in order, while the Master alone ascends the inner altar. Offering incense and conducting the rites, the Master performs the overnight invocation, unfurling the true scriptures, proclaiming the petition to the Divine Officials, or presenting the *Words for Establishing the Altar*. The precepts are expounded, ranks conferred, prohibitions declared, and longings for return expressed. Errors are confessed and corrected, and the rites for honoring the lamps are performed.

The *Rite for the Salvation of Suffering Youths* is proclaimed, the *Nine Yang Talisman* invoked, and the lamps for the Nine Calamities and Nine Ramparts are repented before. The *Rite for Summoning Spirits to Bathe and Pay Homage* is performed, with incantations for the offering of food as prescribed. The *Rite of Tenfold Repentance* is proclaimed. On the first day of the main fast, the circuit of the Way is performed, paying homage to the six tents. Following the rites, the three daily circuits are conducted, incense offered for the Six Perfections, the scriptures recited ten times, and each morning the spirits are led to the altar’s base to pay homage to the Three Treasures, repenting and confessing transgressions. The incense burner is raised, the palace exited, and the souls led to the altar, where the great thanksgiving is completed and the spirits returned to their positions.

In the quiet of night, before the Emperor on High, the *Talisman and Edict for the Staff of Authority* is requested. Proceeding to the lamps of the Nine Prisons, the *True Talisman for Breaking Open Hell* is proclaimed, and the repentance before the lamps is performed according to the rites. The talisman is issued, and the staff wielded to break open the prisons—performing this at the first watch of the night is especially efficacious. The lamps of the Nine Dark Realms are honored, and at the Lamp of Returning Radiance, the *True Talisman for Delivering Souls from Darkness* is proclaimed, repenting before the lamps to break open the prisons.

If the summoning of souls and related rites were not performed on the first night, they shall be conducted on the night of the main fast. On the second day of the main fast, the three daily circuits of the Way are performed as on the first day. That night, at the lamps of Fengdu, the *Green Mystery Talisman for Breaking Fengdu* is proclaimed, and the repentance before the lamps is performed according to the rites. The *Universal Summons of the Nine Springs and Six Paths* is issued, calling forth the lonely souls, who are then bathed, clothed, and led to pay homage. Following the text, they are guided to the outer precincts, where the *Unobstructed Night Fast* is conducted.

The rites proceed with the untying of knots and the release of bonds, followed by the transmission of talismans and the conferral of precepts. The rites may then proceed directly to the refinement and deliverance of souls, or the souls may be led to the Hall of Gathered Spirits to await the refinement and transformation of the deceased. The outer precincts may also be burned in offering.

On the third day of the main fast, the circuits of the Way are performed thrice daily, as on the second day. Alternatively, during the evening audience, the circuits of the Way may be performed while presenting the *Green Petition* to beseech blessings. After the audience, the altar is ascended, and the *Precious Chapters for the Ascension and Deliverance of Departed Spirits* are presented. The announcement is made to the various passes of the heavens, and the lamps of the Thirty-Two Heavens are lit. In the stillness of night, the rites of refinement and transformation are solemnly performed to transmute the departed souls. Each is instructed in the wondrous precepts of the Nine Perfected, and the *Talisman of Longevity* is proclaimed. The *Ordinance of True Deliverance* is bestowed, and the yellow-robed investiture of the Dao is conferred, along with the *Register of Southern Florescence*, the *Ordinance of Longevity and the Yellow Register*, and other such documents. The *Dragon-Invoking Incantation* is recited to break the register, and the merit memorial is read aloud. The Three Corpses are severed, and the Five Passes are transcended. The rites proceed with the invocation at the Pavilion of Flowing Fire, the ascension upon the Dharma Bridge, and the presentation of documents to the guardian deities of the Heavenly Gates, who escort and protect the departed spirits as they ascend to the Crimson Palace.

The souls are then sent forth, the wooden tablets burned, and the outer precincts consumed in flames along with the scriptures, paper money, and other offerings. The *Grass-Dragon Lads* and other attendants perform the rite of releasing living beings. On the fourth day, at dawn, the memorials are prepared and the feast is set to invite the deities, though according to ancient rites, this may be omitted. The Three Treasures and the Supreme Emperor are petitioned, and the Three Officials are addressed. On the appointed day, the dragon tablets are distributed, and the rites proceed in due order: the altar is ascended, the *True Writs of the Five Directions* are invoked, and the memorials of merit and repentance are presented. The altar is then dismantled, the seats cleared, and the earth tablets and dragon tablets are cast. That night, within the ritual arena, the feast is held according to the rites. The *Green Petition* of gratitude is presented, and the memorials of merit—including the *Cart, Brush, Paper Money, and Horses*—are offered. The deities are sent forth from the altar, the six curtains are drawn back, and the memorial of gratitude is proclaimed. Next, the ritual master is approached to offer thanks, and the *Memorial of Gratitude to the Mysterious Master* is presented to conclude the altar rites. The precepts are returned, and the master’s duties are fulfilled. The banners are withdrawn, and the troops of the Eastern Peak and other realms are dismissed. The City God is memorialized to oversee the altar’s closure, and the ritual implements are returned. The merits are reported to the local earth deities and other officials, who are then dismissed according to their ranks. Finally, the brushes, horses, and other ritual items are burned, the ritual master and officials return to the oratory, the master is sent off with gratitude, and the disciples bow in thanks. The rites conclude with mutual congratulations on their completion.

On the appointed day, the dragon tablets and memorials are cast into the sacred springs of the grotto-heavens. When the merit is complete and the fruits are fulfilled, the Three Officials submit their recommendations, the Five Emperors record the names, and all the heavens rejoice. The merit extends to both the hidden and the manifest, and the departed ascend to the ranks of immortality.

According to ancient rites, after the presentation of the memorials and the casting of the tablets, the feast is held to welcome the deities. The deities are then sent forth from the altar, the banners are withdrawn, the master is sent off, the precepts are returned, and the duties concluded. The officials are dismissed, and the altar is dismantled. Such is the proper order of the rites, which must not be transgressed. Whether the rites span five, seven, nine, fourteen, or even forty-nine days—or as few as three days—every step must be followed meticulously, in strict accordance with the sequence. However, as the regulations of past and present often differ, there is no fixed standard to rely upon. Here, the essential principles of the fast are distilled, their rhythms and structures laid bare. Where they do not conflict with ancient precedents, they are to be followed in accordance with their meaning. To deviate from the proper sequence is not only to risk violating the statutes but also to invite the mockery of the underworld officials. The Three Officials will wield their brushes, the Four Departments will investigate, and all efforts will be in vain, labor without reward.

Moreover, the *Five Elders’ Original Practices* state that even those who have merely glimpsed the *Yellow Register* thrice will not fall into hell—how much more so for those who personally undertake the great teachings to universally deliver both the hidden and the manifest, even if their numbers do not exceed ten? In heaven above and earth below, among the immortals, spirits, and gods of the Three Realms, and all creatures that fly, crawl, or bear shells, none are beyond the reach of your virtue and power. The Demon Kings bow in reverence and submit their recommendations, the Supreme Emperor rejoices and celebrates, the Three Officials record your merit, and the Five Emperors list your deeds. The Patriarchs bestow imperial favors, and golden talismans fly to the celestial palaces. Clouds of cinnabar and radiance descend, the Seven Ancestors are rescued from the Northern Palace, and the Nine Lineages are delivered from the Register of the Dead. Your body and flesh are transformed into immortality, and both spirit and form ascend to the wondrous Dao. You swallow the golden elixir, wear the immortal registers, and ascend to the Three Heavens in broad daylight, accompanied by a thousand chariots and ten thousand riders. According to your merit, you are granted the ranks of the Perfected: some attain the position of *Shangqing Perfected*, others the title of *Jade Clarity Immortal Elder*, or the office of *Left Minister of the Great Ultimate*, where they gain profound enlightenment and universally deliver all beings from the uninterrupted hells. Such is the fruition of merit and virtue. You must strive diligently and devote yourself wholeheartedly to the practice.

The *Two Rites of the Ten Kings and the Lads* are hereby made clear.

As the *Sutra of Karmic Retribution* states: In the first month after a person begins to receive the embryo, it is called the "womb," and the first yang spirit descends to generate the first hun-soul. In the second month, it is called the "embryo," and the second yang spirit descends to form the second hun-soul. In the third month, the third yang spirit descends to complete the three hun-souls. Once the three hun-souls are whole, the seven po-souls emerge in the seventh month. By the ninth month, the spirit spreads and qi fills the body, voice and spirit are fully formed, and birth separates the form into a human being. At birth, the yang number is nine nines; at death, the yin number is seven sevens. When the seven sevens are complete, the seven po-souls all depart the body, ascending to the Heavenly Courts to report the person’s sins and blessings. After a hundred days, the cycle of yin and yang reaches its limit. When the first hun-soul departs, it is called "the end of weeping"; after three hundred and sixty days, the spirit and qi renew their movement. When the second hun-soul departs, after two years and seven hundred and twenty days, the spirit and qi complete their cycle and the wheel turns anew. When the third hun-soul departs, it is called "the great auspice," and after seven hundred and twenty days, the yin and yang spirits leave the corpse. This follows the seventy-two numbers, with yin and yang each comprising thirty-six. Yet people today merely sing beautiful songs, unaware of their origin or the merit and virtue they convey. The *Rites of the Lads* comprise ten sections, and the *Rites of the Ten Kings* include ten courts—how profound!

The method states: During the seven sevens and the hundred days, the lesser and greater auspices, one should seek repentance and remorse. By atoning for the transgressions and faults of the deceased, dissolving the sins of their former life, and performing various meritorious deeds, one broadly delivers the six paths and four births. Through the power of these meritorious deeds, the Black Register is burned, and the deceased is reborn into the human world.

**Refining the Form and Maintaining Practice**
If one wishes to enter the oratory to align the primordial, approach the altar to perform rites, fly the spirit to pay homage to the Emperor, or present petitions in mourning to refine and deliver the deceased souls, yet remains in a state of common impurity with a body mired in defilement and spirits in obscurity, how can one communicate with the Supreme Mystery, ascend to save the dark underworld, or perform deeds that benefit others? One must first refine and transform one’s own form according to the method before applying it. Only then can one perform audience rites and summon spirits, achieving success in all undertakings. Thus may the dark paths be opened and the departed souls be delivered. This method may be practiced during the Three Primes, the Eight Festivals, the four seasons, the days of *gengshen* and *jiazi*, one’s own life-destiny days, the last and first days of the lunar month, when ascending the altar to perform rites, or when entering defiled places.

The principle states: The method of refining the form begins by entering the oratory, burning incense, sitting upright, concentrating the spirit, and knocking the teeth thirty-six times. Calm the qi and visualize one’s body as withered wood, containing the five viscera, six bowels, large and small intestines, and the jade script of the hands. At noon, extract them, ignite the four mountain fires along with the wind, and imagine the firelight like red threads emerging from the heart to burn the withered wood and all objects in one’s dwelling. Next, exhale through the nose as if the wind scatters dust. Then visualize a great flood washing everything away until nothing remains. Next, contemplate the true qi of the five directions and five colors gradually descending into the Mysterious Valley, growing from small to large, coalescing into an infant. Within it, the five viscera and six bowels are fully formed, and as it grows, it becomes a Perfected One, clad in dignified attire. The sun is to the left and the moon to the right, removed from the corners of the eyes to illuminate both pupils with radiant light. Guide the Azure Dragon within the liver to emerge from the left ear, the White Tiger within the lungs to emerge from the right ear, the Vermilion Bird within the heart to emerge from the mouth, and the Dark Warrior within the kidneys to emerge from both feet, all arrayed clearly to the left and right. The Dipper’s mouth covers the head, and its handle points to the earth. Next, roll the tongue to the left nine times, swallow a mouthful of saliva, and visualize it as red cinnabar entering the abdomen. From the great vertebra at the nape, it rises above the neck, emitting nine-colored light that covers the head. Then press the central script, circulate the twelve palaces, open the eyes, rise, and approach the altar to perform the rites.

**Burning Incense**
Incense is not mere wood but the eight celestial incenses of the Supreme Perfection: the incense of the Dao, the incense of virtue, the incense of non-action, the incense of spontaneity, the incense of purity, the incense of wondrous penetration, the incense of numinous treasure and wisdom, and the incense that transcends the Three Realms.

The incense of the Dao is the pure incense of the heart. The incense of virtue is the spirit. The incense of non-action is the intent. The incense of purity is the body. When one’s heart, spirit, intent, and body are unified and undistracted, bowing and rising while contemplating above, one will surely reach the Supreme Clarity. To wash the body free of dust and make the *talu* (cinnabar field) clear is called spontaneity. When the spirit is not scattered and the intent commands the spirit, the heart focuses single-mindedly on serving the Azure Vault as if standing near the sovereign. If the body avoids defilement and the four incenses harmonize to return to the round image, how can one worry that prayers for blessings will go unanswered?

The incense of wondrous penetration is the circulation of the spirit to present memorials at the Golden Gates of the Three Heavens. The incense of numinous treasure and wisdom arises when the heart is settled and the spirit is whole, contemplating and moving the Three Realms so that the myriad spirits descend to the court—this is it. To transcend the Three Realms, one contemplates the Jade Capital externally, circulates the spirit to meet the Dao, and omits nothing. This summons the perfected beings of the eight directions, the radiant numinous treasure and wisdom—such is this Dao. It responds to the four blessings and applies to the self. Burning incense with fire embodies the pure sincerity of the Dao and non-action. Using fire to ignite fire expresses sincerity from the heart. May the ascending smoke communicate one’s wishes and invoke the response of the true and numinous.

At the outset of burning incense, the practitioner has fifteen incense talismans to be used according to the occasion, each with its own incantation and method.

**Inviting and Descending the Talismans and Declarations of the Perfected**
The principle states: Whenever one intends to issue talismans or declarations, since they are written by mortal hands, one must first invite their descent before they can be proclaimed. The method of invitation is as follows: Place the talisman or declaration before the altar of the Supreme Emperor. The practitioner burns incense, bows three times, kneels, and presents the memorial. With both hands, form the Ten Heavenly Mudras at the Heavenly Court above, then form the Mudra of Jade Clarity, gently knock the teeth seven times, and circulate the light of the sun and moon in the eyes. Direct it upward to the Heavenly Court, wheeling it to illuminate the practitioner’s body. Within the light of the sun and moon, visualize the Primordial Celestial August One, appearing as a round luminosity. Then emit the radiance from both ears, merging it with the light of the sun and moon.

Next, according to rank, the practitioner makes a formal memorial to the Primordial Celestial August One, earnestly stating the purpose of the retreat and entreating the opening of the Purple Yang Jade Writ to proclaim and descend the specific talisman, which is then bestowed for the practitioner’s proclamation and enactment. Whether for breaking open the dark prisons, refining the departed souls, summoning retrieval, or burning and transforming, the prayer is made as desired. Upon completing the invocation, the secret incantation is recited three times, silently without sound.

**Incantation for Inviting the Descent of the Void and Secret:**
*Supreme and Vast, the Great Possession,*
*Myriad spirits of Jade Clarity.*
*Cloud-light treasure talismans,*
*Universally descend upon the imperial court.*
*Hasten, hasten, as the Primordial Celestial August One commands!*

Visualize the Supreme Emperor emitting a ray of multicolored radiance, infusing the treasure talisman, piercing through it like cloud talismans and rosy clouds flowing with golden hues, resplendently illuminating all above. Again, form the Ten Heavenly Mudras, gathering and directing the qi above. Then form the Mudra of Jade Clarity, gazing with the eyes to draw in the qi, absorbing the august presence within the light of the sun and moon before oneself, merging it directly into one’s own form to become one. Only then knock the teeth three times, swallow the saliva once, and bestow the proclamation to the left and right for enactment.

**Incantation for Dispatch:**
Universally proclaim to the boundless divine realms of the Three Realms, the subterranean courts of the Yellow Springs, the Northern Capital of Fengdu, the Three Officials and Nine Bureaus, the Twelve River Sources. Liberate the ancestors and karmic kin of countless kalpas, swiftly expunge their sin registers, eradicate their evil roots. They must not be detained or forced into ghostly throngs. By the Primordial Celestial August One’s talismanic command, may they ascend at once. In the Northern Capital’s icy pools, may their forms and souls be guarded and escorted. Subdue demons, ensure their protection and promotion, and may they be graded in the Southern Palace. Let the dead souls undergo refinement, transforming into immortals and becoming human. May the living receive deliverance, enduring through kalpas without end. Turning through kalpas, may they share the heavens’ longevity. Forever delivered from the Three Paths, Five Sufferings, and Eight Difficulties, transcending the Three Realms, may they roam freely in the Supreme Clarity.

**Preparatory Announcement:**
The ritual code states: For all grand retreats, upon receiving the retreat sponsor’s petition—termed the vow of devotion—collecting alms to redeem the sins of the deceased and seeking compassionate deliverance, the practitioner enters the oratory chamber. There, they compose and write the *Memorial to the Celestial Realm for Salvation from Suffering*, following the prescribed form to ascend in spirit and make audience, praying in advance for grace and the cessation of bitterness.

Next, establish the *Hall of Salvation by Azure Radiance*, raise the *Azure Mystery Proclamation Banner of Alliance*, and announce the ninefold *Nine Dragon Talismanic Commands* to absolve the nine provinces and their corresponding celestial regions. Burn the *Memorial for Opening the Altar*, hang the *Great Placard* at the gate, and issue the *Preparatory Announcement Proclamation*. Dispatch the *Flying Dragon Rider-Officers* to inspect the empty void and respond to the numinous administrators. This constitutes the *Celestial Salvation from Suffering*, announcing in advance to the ten directions, halting the trials of the imprisoned as if suspending executions in the yang world.

Bow to present the *Memorial to the Celestial Realm for Salvation from Suffering* and proclaim the *Nine Dragon Talismanic Commands*.

**Incantation for Dispatch:**
Universally proclaim to the boundless divine realms of the Three Realms, the subterranean courts of the Yellow Springs, the Northern Capital of Fengdu, the Three Officials and Nine Bureaus, the Twelve River Sources. Liberate the ancestors and karmic kin of countless kalpas, swiftly expunge their sin registers, eradicate their evil roots. They must not be detained or forced into ghostly throngs. By the Primordial Celestial August One’s talismanic command, may they ascend at once. In the Northern Capital’s icy pools, may their forms and souls be guarded and escorted. Subdue demons, ensure their protection and promotion, and may they be graded in the Southern Palace. Let the dead souls undergo refinement, transforming into immortals and becoming human. May the living receive deliverance, enduring through kalpas without end. Turning through kalpas, may they share the heavens’ longevity. Forever delivered from the Three Paths, Five Sufferings, and Eight Difficulties, transcending the Three Realms, may they roam freely in the Supreme Clarity.

Form the Jade Mudra, summon the eastern qi, and burn it with fire. Pray to the Nine Dragon Envoys to carry the talisman and proceed.

**Submission of the Preparatory Memorial:**
The retreat’s details are transcribed and presented to the Three Heavens, petitioning the vast and profound, allying with the Three Realms, universally proclaiming to the ten directions. Pray in advance for the imperial command, proclaiming it for nine nights, opening the gates of the netherworld, halting the trials of the imprisoned. The incantations and mudras for summoning and dispatching are employed as in the formal memorial.

**Bow to Present the Chapter of the Plain Chariot and White Horse**
Proclaim the *Universal Announcement to the Three Realms*.

**Incantation for Dispatching**

Proclaim universally to the boundless divine realms of the Three Realms, the subterranean courts of the Yellow Springs, the Northern Capital of Fengdu, the Three Offices and Nine Bureaus, and the Twelve River Sources. May the ancestors of countless kalpas and all karmic kin swiftly have their names expunged from the ledgers of sin and their evil roots eradicated. Let them not be detained or forced into the company of ghosts. By the primordial talismanic command, may they ascend at the appointed hour.

In the Cold Pool of the Northern Capital, may their forms and souls be guarded and escorted. Subdue demons, ensure their protection, and promote them to the Southern Palace. Let the dead souls undergo refinement, transforming into immortals. Let the living receive deliverance, enduring through kalpas, roaming with the heavens in eternal years. May they forever transcend the Three Paths, the Five Sufferings, and the Eight Adversities, rising above the Three Realms to roam freely in the Supreme Clarity.

**Erecting the Alliance Banner**

The Dharma states: The Azure Mystery Treasure Banner is crafted from azure silk, inscribed with the Great Nine Dragon Talisman to form the banner. It has nine streamers at its base, eight encircling it, and one at its center, each inscribed with a Nine Dragon Talismanic Command. Once presented, it becomes a sacred standard.

According to the correspondences of the Nine Provinces, it is erected with due reverence. Coins and fruits are rolled within the banner and scattered in the ten directions. As mortal eyes may glimpse celestial perfected beings, the prohibition against carelessness is severe.

**Essential Instructions:**

Upon completing the preliminary announcement, the adept faces the Heavenly Gate, offers incense, and visualizes the Heavenly Gate with a thousand plain chariots and ten thousand white horses, accompanied by celestial perfected deities and great generals from the ten directions, floating in the void to witness the rites. The adept then petitions before the Heavenly Gate and scatters the banner as prescribed.

The site where the altar is established and the banner erected becomes the Palace of the Great Qi Water Office, pure and unobstructed, crowned with a canopy like a mushroom-shaped standard. The radiance of the sun and moon flows through, illuminating the water office. Within, a great banner transforms, its four sides stirred by divine winds, directly connecting to the canopy above.

Visualize a lotus within the waters, its fragrance inexhaustible, surrounded by golden light and auspicious clouds of Brahman qi. The streamers of the banner scatter in the ten directions like fine rain or dense mist. Beneath the canopy sits the Azure Mystery Supreme Emperor, holding a branch to sprinkle the Dharma rain. Auspicious clouds ascend to receive the yin souls, who gather beneath the banner, awaiting the altar’s opening to pay homage to the Supreme Emperor and receive transformation for rebirth.

**Morning Memorial**

**Essential Instructions:**

Following the preliminary announcement, the adept proceeds to present the morning memorial at the Golden Gates of the Three Heavens, beseeching grace and petitioning for the command, prostrating before the gates to await the decree.

First, the adept’s true spirit transforms the four directions, gazing upon the jade-like forms. In an instant, two Jade Lads appear, bearing banners and scepters, holding luminous sun-like pearls whose radiance flashes and shines upon the adept. The Jade Morning Supreme One emits the light of his brow, mouth, and nose, merging with the pearl’s brilliance. The adept subtly draws this light with his eyes and nose until it reaches his face. The Jade Lads hold the pearl like a sun wheel, illuminating all without obstruction.

The pearl’s qi divides and arrays, swiftly entering the adept’s form like flowing gold. The adept gazes in reverence at the Jade Morning, bows twice, and retreats from the gates. The Jade Maidens, driving the sun, ascend with the adept’s body. The pearl’s golden light forms a circular wheel, its radiance illuminating the four directions above and below, penetrating even the darkest depths of the netherworld’s gates, turning all as bright as day.

The ghostly officials in the prisons bow their heads, touching their foreheads in homage, submitting to the Supreme One with joy and delight. This light opens the dark prisons, releasing all imprisoned souls, halting their trials, and freeing the yin souls from their torments.

Next, the Jade Maidens, bearing banners and scepters, drive the pearl’s circular light, illuminating all within and without. The banner revolves atop the wheel of light, and the Dharma rain of compassionate clouds sprinkles the dark prisons, transforming them into radiant clarity. Inside and out, all becomes a lotus realm, universally uplifted, with even the faintest light reaching all.

The adept, in accordance with the Dharma, absorbs the true qi and exits the chamber. That night, upon falling asleep, the outer bed transforms into a jade carriage, carrying the adept’s body amidst clouds, mist, the sun, moon, and stars, their brilliance resplendent and reflecting upon the adept.

Visualize one’s form as the Azure Mystery Supreme Emperor, seated upon a nine-headed lion, holding a pure lapis lazuli vessel in the left hand and an empty azure jade branch in the right, sprinkling rare fragrances in the ten directions. From the ears, eyes, nose, and mouth, these flow boundlessly into the netherworld, bringing joy to all in the dark realms, who receive the sprinkled blessings and ascend.

This is the way of focused contemplation in the preliminary announcement to open prosperity and halt suffering.

**Bowing to Present the Chapter on Opening the Karma-Transforming Path of Fengdu**

Proclaim the **Amnesty: Talismanic Command of the Primordial Beginning**

By the talismanic command of the Primordial Beginning, ascend at the appointed hour.
In the Cold Pool of the Northern Capital, guard and escort the forms and souls.
Subdue demons, ensure protection, and promote them to the Southern Palace.
Let the dead souls undergo refinement, transforming into immortals.
Let the living receive deliverance, enduring through kalpas, roaming with the heavens in eternal years.
Forever transcend the Three Paths, the Five Sufferings, and the Eight Adversities, rising above the Three Realms to roam freely in the Supreme Clarity.

**Proclamation for Deliverance from Fengdu**

The Supreme One opens the light; the Primordial Beginning oversees the true.
The Five Elder Thearchs and the vermilion script of the Jade Texts
deliver all from karmic debts and sinful roots, granting universal liberation.
Cease all trials and punishments; let souls ascend to the Nine Heavens and spirits cross to the Vermilion Mound.
Today is most auspicious; all spirits heed this decree.
Dragons bear the white tablets to open the covenant with the netherworld’s spirits.
May all wishes be fulfilled, transmitted swiftly as wind and fire.

**Incantation to the Dragon**

**Bowing to Present the Chapter on Opening the Path**

**Proclamation of the Jade Thearch’s Precious Edict**

The Supreme Peerless, the Boundless Heaven’s Mysterious Existence and Profound Truth—
its distant Purple Goldwatch, the Grand Tenuity’s Jade Clarity Palace,
the Limitless and Supreme, the Sacred and Vast Dharma-Light,
the Serene and Vast, the Unfathomable Origin—
encompasses the Ten Directions with its tranquil and constant Dao,
its vast and empty great spiritual potency:
the Jade Thearch, Great Heavenly Honored One, the Lofty Emperor of Mysterious Vault.

**Edict to Command Earth Spirits**

By edict, command the earth spirits:
attend and escort, deliver from the earth’s gates the Five Sufferings and Eight Adversities.
Let the seven generations of ancestors ascend and depart,
forever freed from the offices of ghosts.
May souls cross to the Vermilion Mound,
undergo refinement, and be reborn anew.
This is called boundless deliverance, universal salvation without end.

**Opening the Five Paths**

The ritual employs five mud seats, upon which five white banners are planted.
Bamboo stalks are affixed to the mud seats, and the banners inscribed with
*"Heavenly Honored One Who Opens the Paths."*
These are arranged within the five-direction lamp altars.
Further details are recorded in the ascent to the altar.

**Principle States:**
The adept faces the Heavenly Gate and performs three bows,
then kindles the lamps for opening the paths.
Holding the banners, they chant and intone while tracing the five directions with a ritual staff or sword.

Beginning in the east, they stand facing east in the *ding* position,
visualizing the Envoy of Grand Unity and the Five Thearchs’ Direct Attendants,
directing the qi of life to enter the eastern gate.
With the ritual staff, they trace and open the eastern path.
Proceeding thus to the south, west, north, and center—
this is the rite for opening the paths and releasing the departed souls.

*Here ends Scroll Fifty-Four of the Supreme Clarity Numinous Treasure Great Rites*
**Text Title:** *Supreme Clarity Numinous Treasure Great Rites*

**Supreme Clarity Numinous Treasure Great Rites, Scroll Fifty-Five**

*Originally transmitted by Xiao Quanzhen and compiled by Wang Qizhen in admiration, emerging from the simplicity of the Southern Song. One of the comprehensive collections of Daoist methods and rites from the Song Yuanyou-era registers, comprising twenty-seven sections in sixty-six scrolls. Source edition: Zhengtong Daoist Canon, Orthodox First Section.*

**Scroll Fifty-Five of the Supreme Clarity Numinous Treasure Great Rites**
*Transmitted by Ning Quanzhen, Perfected of Subtle Radiance and Illuminator of Suffering, to Wang Qizhen, Disciple of the Three Caverns of Supreme Clarity and Successor in the Teaching of the Numinous Treasure*

**Section on the Principles of Ritual Purification**

**Main Petition for Opening the Purification Rite**
**Principle States:**
At the outset of sitting or standing in the oratory or Hall of Refined Contemplation, the adept steadies the will and concentrates the spirit, transforming the body into the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning. With both hands, they form the Jade Clarity mudrā, close their eyes, and with the tongue, spray qi to either side, thereby manifesting two Perfected Ones—clad in azure robes, crowned, girded with plain skirts, and adorned with pendants—who stand at the adept’s left and right to jointly conduct the purification rites. In all actions and meditations, the two Perfected Ones divide the tasks.

First, the adept visualizes the myriad divine officials and generals of their own department, arrayed above and below the altar platform to receive commands, and proclaims the written memorials, talismanic decrees, and mandates. Next, with both hands, they form the Four Mountains and Circumambulating the Dipper mudrās, manifesting the Four Courier Courts below the altar, arranged as in the public administration of the mundane world. Crimson gates and courtyard dwellings appear, each with banner-bearing warriors attending to their duties. Urgent messengers, bearing yellow command banners and flags, stand ready to relay talismans, memorials, and proclamations, and to issue decrees. Upon receiving their orders, they mount the mists and speed away like shooting stars. All other matters proceed in accordance with this model.

The Golden Dragon Courier Court, the Reeds-and-Dragons Courier Court, the Wind-and-Fire Courier Court, and the Golden Horse Courier Court.

When the Ninefold Purity Supreme Lords ascend their thrones, they dwell above the myriad layers of the Dao’s qi in the realm of emptiness and non-being. One must not gaze directly upon them, for it is as when a worldly emperor ascends his hall—eight screens are held to veil him. Only after he has taken his seat are the screens drawn back to summon the ranks. Thus, one first performs the rites with the curtain lowered, envisioning the Supreme Lords ascending their thrones. Then, the documents are proclaimed, and only thereafter is the curtain rolled up.

The essential principle states: The officiant, arrayed in full dignity, approaches the earthly portal, envisioning the altar hall suffused with auspicious radiance, enveloping the ten directions. Next, facing the Heavenly Gate, they kneel to present their petition and engage in audience, imagining the divine perfected ones of the ten directions, the exalted sagely transcendents, and their thousand chariots and ten thousand riders escorting the Ninefold Purity’s imperial throne as it descends to the altar platform and ascends the hall. Then, the altar officials step forward in rank to proclaim the true memorial, while the officiant inwardly visualizes and presents the memorial in homage. Next, the ranks are divided, and the curtain is rolled up. The officiant offers incense and burns the Jade Steps talisman, then follows the ranks into the altar to conduct the rites.

**The Rite of the Golden Bell and Jade Chime**

The method of the golden bell and jade chime summons the yin and yang spirits within the high officiant’s body, harmonizing Heaven and Earth, dispelling defilement and impurity, gathering the true numina, opening the ten directions, bridging the hidden and the manifest, pursuing and capturing souls, regulating and assembling the breath of salvation—preventing reckless dissipation—all governed by these two spirits. Thus, at the outset of opening the altar, the bell and chime must be sounded to summon them.

Their alternating resonance—emerging in turn to merge as one—refines yin into yang. With unwavering sincerity and pure intent, free from stray thoughts or disordered will, one may summon the numinous. Some today speak of "offering to the golden bell and jade chime," yet they do not hasten to do so.

The yang spirit is named Lu Hui, styled Yanling, standing eight feet and three inches tall, wearing a Liang-dynasty cap and robes of raging flame, wielding a sword in his right hand. He presides over yang-world spirit shrines, purifying Heaven and Earth of impurity, and driving away the spirits of the hundred trees.

The yin spirit is named Lu Tong, styled Yongfu, standing eight feet and three inches tall, wearing a Liang-dynasty cap, plain robes, and wide sleeves, wielding a sword amidst the clouds of qi. He governs the netherworld’s underworld prisons and can also purify the world’s impurities, ending the torments of the yin realm.

It is said: The bell’s form is round above and inclined downward; its sound is clear and far-reaching. Its crown is coiled with dragons, and it is aligned with yang as the "golden bell." The chime’s form is round below and inclined upward; its sound is deep and heavy. Its base is a crouching tiger, and it is aligned with yin as the "jade chime." This reflects the primordial division of the undifferentiated: when humans emerged, the sounds of humanity became the harmony of the Three Powers, hence their exclusive use in the Daoist ritual arena.

When dragons rise, clouds gather; when tigers roar, winds rage. From the auspicious convergence of wind and cloud, the myriad sages all arrive. When dragon and tiger resonate together, the thousand spirits all descend.

The bell measures nine inches in diameter and one foot in height, the yang number embracing the yin calculation. The chime measures one foot in diameter and nine inches in height, the yin number embracing the yang calculation. When the jade mallet strikes the bell, its sound becomes clear and far-reaching through yin. When the metal striker hits the chime, its tone harmonizes through yang.

At the beginning of opening the altar, the golden bell is first sounded twenty-five times to summon the yang qi. The jade chime follows with thirty strikes to gather the yin qi. Then, the bell and chime alternate for thirty-six strikes, harmonizing yin and yang. The officiant visualizes the spirits and recites the incantations for summoning yin and yang, communicating with the true and reaching the numinous. Afterward, the golden bell sounds six more times, the yang position on the right, so that the tiger’s true qi of golden clouds fills the yin origin. The jade chime sounds nine more times, the yin position returning to the left, so that the dragon’s true qi of jade wind and scorching fire arises in the altar’s wood.

The golden bell sounds six more times, the yang position on the right. When proclaiming the liturgy, the bell is struck once between phrases; for major thanksgivings, it is struck once per phrase. The counting of yin and yang phrases follows this rule. When bowing, one must hear the bell’s sound; when rising, one listens for the chime’s resonance—this is the Way of ascent and descent. If the proclamation is not concluded, the sounds may disrupt the text. If officials are dismissed without the proper sounds, the spirits may become confused.

When the Daoist assembly approaches the altar, the bell’s sound comes first, called the "left compass." When the officiant approaches the hall, the chime responds, called the "right square." In all ritual matters, the bell precedes the chime to guide the assembly’s decorum. Thus, the sounds of the bell and chime arise from the left compass and right square.

The essential principle states: The officiant circulates the divine wind, silently invoking the auspicious qi. With eyes closed, they circulate the ears, nose, and tongue to emit the auspicious wind, receiving the divine wind of the Brahma void, like rippling water or shimmering light. First, strike the golden bell on the left thirty-six times to summon the mighty soldiers. Then, strike the jade chime on the right twenty-four times to gather the true numina. In the center, beat the ritual drum twelve times to announce to the Supreme Lords.

The silent incantation says:
*The host spirits arrayed within,
The mighty soldiers spread without.
Twin radiance enters the eyes,
The mouth emits numinous light.
The head bears the Seven Stars,
The feet tread the Dark Net.
The myriad spirits perish in the qi,
The thousand demons vanish of themselves.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by law!*

Next, summon the two spirits by burning the talismans for the yin and yang spirits and reciting the incantations to summon them. One must first sound the golden bell and jade chime within oneself, inwardly visualizing the two spirits within the body before they can be gathered.

The essential principle states: The yang spirit resides in the officiant’s hands, the spirit of the Three Yangs, an official of the Three Heavenly Gates. When summoned forth, first circulate it to the cinnabar palace in the upper chamber, then to the jade palace, intertwining the three colors of blue, red, and black jade. It emerges from the brain palace above, coalescing into a mushroom-cloud of auspicious vapor, receiving the qi of the cinnabar heavens, like mist and fog. Within, it transforms into soaring simurghs and dancing phoenixes, singing and arrayed in formation, ascending together to the side of the Heavenly Altar.

Next, circulate the qi to generate the True within the True. It emerges from the upper Mud Pill, ascending to the edge of the cinnabar heavens’ clouds and mist to pay homage to the Supreme Void Emperor, all appearing in unified vision. Only then is the golden bell sounded to complete the nine yang qi. Once stabilized, listen with the left ear: a hollow sound takes form, and one senses the bell’s resonant echoes within the cinnabar heavens, harmonizing with the mysterious altar, its hidden tones ringing clearly.

The Doctrine states: The Yin Spirit resides at the adept’s right hand, governing the Three Yin Palaces—she is the Jade Maiden of the Heavenly Gate where yin arises and Brahma-chants resound. Within the body, she is the single outflow of essence, qi, and spirit in transformation, ascending and spreading before one.

Next, visualize the Three Perfected Ones and Jade Maidens, each emitting the qi of Azure Mystery, coalescing into a dense vapor shaped like a lotus pond in full bloom. White qi, like swirling clouds and mist, intertwines with the qi of the Cinnabar Heavens, shrouding the Mysterious Altar, where the radiance of sun, moon, and stars faintly appears.

Then, visualize the Celestial Court and the two ears, left and right, along with the nostrils, each exhaling qi of manifold hues. Gradually ascending to the edge of the clouds and mist, they transform into the forms of dragon and tiger. Their eyes meet, and simurghs and phoenixes gather with harmonious cries as the Dragon and Tiger Spirit Lords array themselves above and below.

Only then is the jade chime struck to complete the count of nine yang qi. As the Yin Spirit is invoked in prostration, the adept’s eyes flicker open and shut, gazing faintly toward the celestial expanse. The ears perceive resonant echoes, and the chime’s reverberations descend to the Jade Altar, vibrating through the ten directions.

Next, the sounds of yin and yang intermingle and resonate. The clouds and vapor disperse, leaving not a trace of dust or shadow. A single strike shatters the primordial chaos, forging heaven and earth, their forms now distinct and luminous. From the four directions, divine winds arise, playing celestial music, while auspicious winds and propitious clouds coalesce. Beholding the heavenly melodies resounding within the Nine Void Realms, the Three Realms ascend in unison as the ten directions pay homage.

Here, the qi of heaven ascends, the qi of earth surges, and yin and yang divide to accomplish their great work, establishing the image of heaven and earth.

---

**Striking the Bell and Chime**
The *Ordinances of the Supreme Perfected* state: In practicing the supreme Dao, expounding scriptures, or conducting fasts and rites, one must first strike the bell and chime. This not only alerts the assembly but also stirs the host of spirits. Divine immortals and perfected beings attend in timely convergence, magnifying the Dao and harmonizing all things, their abundant virtue flowing in mutual accord. With focused mind and spirit, one perceives their presence.

When striking the mallet, begin softly and gradually increase in force, counting twelve, twenty-four, and thirty-six strokes. Holding the mallet for the bell and chime, first recite the invocation:
*"The round mallet awakens the ritual instrument,
Its flowing sound pervades the ten directions.
Below, it penetrates the long night;
Above, it resounds in the Jade Chamber.
The Nine Dark Realms hear and escape suffering,
The Seven Ancestors ascend to the Immortal Hall."*

First strike three times, emitting the sound of sprouting yang, for yang’s number arises from one and culminates in nine. Next, draw out nine strikes, evoking the resonance of jade and chalcedony.

The first three strikes ascend to the Three Heavens: Pure Tenuity, Yu-Yu, and Great Red. Another three strikes resonate with the Three Realms: Desire, Form, and Formlessness. A final three strikes awaken the Three Paths: Hell, Hungry Ghosts, and Animal Realms.

Conclude with twenty-seven strikes. Nine strikes summon the Dao Lords of the Nine Heavens; nine stir the Perfected Emperors of the Nine Palaces; and nine call forth the suffering souls of the Nine Dark Realms. Together, the thirty-six strikes ascend to the Thirty-Six Heavenly Emperors, resonate with the Thirty-Six Revered Scriptures, and penetrate the Thirty-Six Hells below.

Failure to adhere to this method not only risks offending the unseen judges but also brings shame upon the assembly and disrupts the ritual’s rhythm. The *Mysterious Ordinances* decree: The responsibility lies with the director of chanting. If the director fails to announce the proceedings, both they and the offender shall be penalized with one catty of incense and twenty prostrations as restitution.

---

**Invoking the Light**
The Doctrine states: At noon on the day the altar is established, the adept inscribes two *Qingguang* talismans, wraps them in incense, faces the southern *li* direction, holds a mirror in the left hand and the talismans in the right, positioning them to face each other. Silently recite the incantation:
*"Essence of the sun, vermilion radiance,
Illuminating the green canopy.
Crimson youths of returning mist,
Mysterious flames and whirling images."*

Using a yang-sundial fire, ignite one talisman as a torch, dipping it in oil and lighting it over the incense. Then, light the candle before the Primordial Beginning. For three, five, or seven days and nights—up to forty-nine—it must never be extinguished. When the flame nears its end, relight it with another candle. If the sky is overcast, use fire kindled from wood.

Thus, the true fire of the sun’s center can descend to the Nine Dark Realms below and ascend to illuminate the Three Luminaries above, its radiance blessing the Felicitous Court.

---

**Dividing the Lamps**
To deliver and uplift yin spirits, the lamps that pierce the darkness of the unseen must be kindled with the method of *Wisdom Light*, for only then can the wisdom of the Three Luminaries descend to merge with the light of ordinary flame, enabling the summoning and salvation of souls. Without this method, the light remains mundane and incapable of transcendence.

The Doctrine states: At noon on the day of the main fast, the adept faces south, burns incense toward the sun, inhales qi, and exhales onto the brush. On a nine-inch yellow paper, inscribe twelve *Wisdom Light* talismans in cinnabar, using the Jade Clarity mudra and the qi of the eastern direction. Fashion a torch from [material] to ignite the lamp’s flame.

To light the three altars’ sacred lamps, first use the yang-sundial to await the sun’s presence in the southern palace, then recite the *Incantation of the Sun’s Radiant Spirit*:
*"O radiant sun,
Divine light penetrating the Three Clarities.
Qi disperses within the Mysterious Vastness,
Spiritual smoke arises in the Purple Court.
Guiding the winds and clouds,
Soaring beyond all form.
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the law!"*

After reciting, use the yang-sundial to capture the sun’s true qi and light a lamp before the Primordial Beginning.

The Doctrine states: As the adept circulates transformation within the Heavenly Altar, heaven and earth have divided, celestial music and dragon-tiger imagery have taken form, and yin and yang have manifested. Yet the dense yin remains imprisoned in darkness, unseen by the light.

The High Priest steps forward, approaches the Primordial Beginning, offers incense with three bows, and silently recites the *Hymn of the Bright Lamp*. Upon completion, one attendant stands to the left holding the lamp, another to the right holding incense. The High Priest, torch in hand, invokes the descent of the sacred light before the Primordial Beginning.

Visualize the Primordial Beginning granting assent. Envision golden light like the blazing sun melting metal, penetrating the talismanic script, suffusing it with a hundred hues of radiance. This light merges with the adept’s body, coalescing into a great solar orb. Golden light bursts forth, filling the altar inside and out. The High Priest circulates the qi of the Primordial Beginning’s Upper Palace, transforming it into a single vapor like a golden-green rainbow, ascending to the Cinnabar Heavens to merge with the qi atop the Primordial Beginning’s crown.

Exhaling golden light from the mouth, like the rising sun, it revolves downward to the altar, extending to the front of the Mysterious Realm, beneath the Supreme Void Emperor, where the light converges at the side.

Visualize the radiant treasure-light in motion, envisioning golden towers and vermilion gates, with dragons and tigers intertwining. As assent is granted to the petition, the shifting shadows of sun, moon, and stars stream into the treasure-light, blazing forth in resplendent revelation. The golden gates and vermilion palaces of the treasure-light pour forth, flooding the Celestial Altar with luminous brilliance.

Next, ignite the talismanic torch within the central lamp’s light, first circulating "One giving rise to Two, Two giving rise to Three." Then, the attendant of the lamp performs three bows and receives the flame from the master to light the lamp. The attendant of incense likewise performs three bows and, taking the talismanic torch, lights the lamps in all ten directions. Once the ranks have finished lighting, the Three Masters return, each performing three bows, and gather the remaining torches into one. The High Priest performs three bows and burns it in the censer before the Primordial Beginning.

Envision the Perfected Saints of all heavens jointly spreading auspicious light, bursting through the ten directions—inner and outer, above and below—illuminating mountains, forests, rivers, seas, official residences, household gates, the prisons of water and fire, the yin dungeons, the yang courts, and the earthly prisons. Above, it pierces the Nine Heavens; below, it shines upon the Nine Provinces and the Nine Earths. Wherever the deepest yin and utmost evil reside, all receive the treasure-light, penetrating and breaking through, transforming all into wondrous realms. Thus, at the site of the established retreat, both within and without, all beings and things abide within the treasure-light. The ten directions of the world are all thoroughly illuminated; even the darkest dungeons and hidden prisons are radiant with brilliance.

In an instant, the luminous qi gathers brightly within the treasure-light, suspended and floating above the Celestial Altar. Once the lamps and candles are dispersed and the ritual actions completed, slowly draw in the light with the nose and eyes, gently inhaling it into the form of the Perfected within. Return it to the Mud-Pill Palace atop the cinnabar chamber to receive the Perfected.

As the *Simplified Writs of the Three Primes* states: "The merit of the Celestial Capital’s ritual of kindling lamps can ascend to illuminate all heavens, descend to shine upon the deepest yin, and radiate across the eight directions. It aids the brilliance of the Three Mornings, dispels the calamities of the Nine Lands, reflects the wisdom-light of the Heavenly Worthies, and delivers the suffering souls of the deepest yin. With a single illumination of yang-light, myriad sorrows cease; iron cities crumble, and those touched by the light attain liberation."

Next, recite the extinguishing-lamp incantation to attain the Dao of "One giving rise to Three" and the method of returning to the root and restoring the mandate. "One giving rise to Three" refers to the attendants of the lamp and incense each holding a talisman, approaching the High Priest’s hand to divide the light before lighting.

**Incantation for the Jade Clarity’s Generative Dispersal of Wisdom-Light**
Compassionate treasure-script, jade peaks wreathed in mist.
Flowering lamps scatter, universally illuminating the Nine Springs.
The Three Realms grow bright; radiance disperses through the Ten Heavens.
The deepest darkness bathes in flame, beneficence extending boundlessly.
Today, in this great celebration, suffering is cast off and immortality ascends.
The Dao gives rise to the One qi, and the myriad things are brought to completion.
The mighty script of the Primordial Beginning generates transformation naturally.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Jade Clarity’s Highest Emperor decrees!

**Three Lights Mantra.**
Upon completing the lamp-lighting, recite the Lamp Incantation:
The Most High scatters through the ten directions,
Flowering lamps convey sincerity.
All heavens shine resplendently,
Hell realms all grow bright.
My body, too, is luminous,
The five viscera blossom with splendor.
The fiery radiance illumines the Great Void,
Distant thoughts reach the Jade Capital.
Open and begin.

**Purpose Statement:**
To open the proceedings and memorialize the Supreme Emperor and the lofty perfected, one reports the sincerity of the fast. The officiant steps forth to request the water for purifying the altar, then enters the earthly portal to recite the secret incantation. Approaching the main censer, they offer incense thrice, burn the true summons talisman, and invoke the transformation of the thousand perfected and ten thousand sages. These ascend into the void to witness and examine the sincerity of the fast. The incantations and hand seals employed are the same as those used during the Three Audiences.

**Memorial Petition:**
**Purpose Statement:**
Once the opening is complete, the officiant follows the ranks to the master’s canopy, offers incense, and requests the master’s presence. Kneeling and bowing twice, they memorialize in secret, invoking the descent of the master’s true radiance and luminous grace to observe the fast. They then request the descent of the memorial petition, talismanic writ, and proclamation, which ally the Three Realms and universally announce to the ten directions.

**Submitting the Formal Memorial:**
**Purpose Statement:**
Whenever submitting a formal memorial or proclamation, one must summon and command the myriad spirits. First, transform one’s own form: burn incense, stand at the center, execute the Ten Heavens Hand Seal with both hands, raise it to the Heavenly Court, and flick it forth. Face forward, inhale a mouthful of qi, and distribute it to left and right. Transform the body into that of the Primordial Beginning Supreme Emperor, silently reciting the Transformation Incantation:

The Primordial Beginning’s supreme numen,
Ninefold rises in verdant splendor.
Paying homage, the form is concealed,
Bathed and refined to generate radiance.
The palace chariot spans the Six Harmonies,
Enabling my ascent in flight.
The seven spirits disperse and array,
Forever preserving distant years.

Swiftly, swiftly, as the Primordial Beginning Supreme Emperor decrees!

First, execute the Three Officials Hand Seal and flick it forth. Next, take the water vessel, inhale a mouthful of primordial qi, and exhale it into the right-side water, envisioning the pure mist-like qi flowing like fine rain or dense fog into the vessel, surging within. Then softly recite the *Purify Heaven and Earth Incantation*, sprinkling and purifying all around. Next, recite the *Emit the Aura Incantation* and step the *Aura of Summoning and Commanding Myriad Spirits*, pressing the Jade Purity Hand Seal before the heart. On yang days, begin with the left foot; on yin days, begin with the right.

**Aura of Summoning and Commanding Myriad Spirits**
*Emit the Aura Incantation*
The numinous treasures of the Supreme Sages,
Govern and move all immortal spirits.
The aura flies, stars gleam,
Paying homage at the imperial court.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Jade Purity Supreme Emperor decrees!

Upon completion, flick forth the Jade Purity Hand Seal. Then recite the *Five Emperors Pacify Spirits Incantation*:
The Azure Emperor guards the hun,
The White Emperor attends the po,
The Vermilion Emperor nurtures qi,
The Black Emperor circulates blood.
The Yellow Emperor presides at the center,
Ten thousand spirits do not transgress.
The numinous aura ascends in petition,
Myriad spirits array in solemn ranks.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Primordial Beginning Supreme Emperor decrees!

Press the hand seal of the current day to summon the Day’s Directing Merit Clerk to arrive first. At the Numinous Petition Great Dharma Bureau, burn incense and invoke the Day’s Directing Merit Clerk Messenger, commanding: "Hear this summons and swiftly attend the ritual altar."

Burn the Merit Clerk Talisman and recite the incantation:
Officers of the Mysterious Bureau, bearers of jade script, charged with merit,
Govern the Jade Purity, petitioning the Three Heavens.
By the Emperor’s decree, swiftly descend in divine radiance.
I solemnly summon the Merit Clerk of this day,
To act in accordance with the law:
Yang essence flies and gleams,
Radiance illumines the divine court.
With a single summoning breath,
Ascend to the cinnabar clouds.

**Summon the Day’s Decade Directing Merit Clerk Incantation**
Clerks and lords of the Jade Treasury,
Messengers of the yang essence and solar decade,
Hear the summons and swiftly proceed.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Primordial Beginning Supreme Emperor decrees!

Flick forth the Bureau Clerk Hand Seal at the current decade and hour. Draw qi from the northwest, envisioning it descending from the Heavenly Gate upon cloud qi, arraying before the altar. Then command and proclaim the summoning of the Jade Maidens and Numinous Officers of the Celestial Receivers, along with all spirits of this bureau, to attend the altar.

**Great Incantation of Summoning the Immortal Bureau**
By the command of the Jade Purity,
All immortal bureaus are summoned,
The thirty-two heavens,
The thirty-two emperors.
Azure Heaven’s Demon King, Bayuan Choubo,
Vermilion Heaven’s Demon King, Fu Tian Dan Shi,
White Heaven’s Demon King, Fan Shan Liu Mu,
Black Heaven’s Demon King, Jian Chou Lang Fu,
Yellow Heaven’s Demon King, Heng Tian Dan Li.
The Five Great Demon Emperors,
Ancestors of ten thousand spirits,
Fly with drumming retinues,
Commanding ghostly legions.
Brandishing banners, beating drums, and wielding staffs,
They roam and observe the great void,
Proclaiming their majestic might,
Uniting all heavens in merit.
Ascending to deliver humanity,
Sternly seizing the northern Deng.
Divine lords receive the command,
Universally sweeping away misfortune.
Pledging oaths and transforming,
Petitioning the Void Sovereign.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Primordial Beginning Supreme Emperor decrees!
