The highest heaven,
Ruled by the Jade Purity.
The great aura of the Dark Culmen,
Born of the Supreme Mystery’s mansion.
Within resides the Imperial Lord,
The Numinous Void Jade Mother.
Governing the chanting of hymns,
Wielding jade script and golden talismans.
Administering immortal prohibitions,
Golden Lads and Jade Maidens.
Discerning essence and distinguishing demons,
Governing and commanding the lords and clerks.
Ascending to the Three Heavens,
Forming the bureau of promotion.
Doctors and grandees,
Transmitting and proclaiming decrees.
Relieving suffering and distress,
Providing defense and protecting the Dao.
Imprisoning and binding demonic insults,
Wandering through the myriad heavens.
Aiding the living and delivering the dead,
Dissolving calamities and crushing monsters.
Communicating with the Purple Mansion,
By the edicts of the Ten Heavens,
Summon those under their charge.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the edict of the Supreme Purity and the Primordial Beginning Supreme Emperor commands.

Burn the *Descend True and Summon Numinous Talisman*, the *Summon Myriad Spirits of the Three Realms Talisman*, the *Summon Majestic Myriad Spirits Talisman*, and the *Summon Myriad Spirits to Initiate Movement Talisman*.

**Incantation to Summon the Jade Maidens of Celestial Receivers and Petitioning Numinous Officers**
The great Dharma of the Numinous Treasure,
Qi transforms and generates spirits.
Jade Maidens and Numinous Officers,
Ascend and descend at the imperial court.
Bearing talismans and presenting petitions,
They ascend directly to the Jade Purity.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the edict of the Primordial Beginning Supreme Emperor commands.

Press the Yin-Mao (Tiger-Rabbit) Hand Seals, gazing right at the qi of moonlight.

**Numinous Treasure Spirit Transformation Incantation**
Resplendent and radiant,
Bearing heaven and treading earth.
Yin and yang unite,
The four seasons harmonize.
The Three Luminaries transform in totality,
By the command of the Great One,
Transforming and growing in response.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Primordial Beginning Supreme Emperor decrees.

Recite this incantation three times, then flick forth the Central Script Hand Seal.

**Incantation to Summon Myriad Spirits of This Bureau**
The thirty-two heavens,
The thirty-two emperors.
The great demon within heaven,
The light within heaven.
Nine harmonies and ten unions,
Transforming into the Supreme Purity.
Hearing this proclamation,
Swiftly depart the imperial court.
By the Celestial Emperor’s edict,
Swiftly, swiftly, as the law commands.

Execute the Three Officials Hand Seal, drawing qi from the east.

**General Incantation to Summon Majestic Myriad Spirits**
Luminous and numinous,
Qi transforms into true spirits.
The Void Sovereign’s total qi,
Universally descends upon the imperial court.
Spirits ascend, qi descends,
Qi unites with true essence.
Swiftly respond to my summons,
Swiftly respond to my call,
Swiftly, as the Jade Purity Supreme Emperor decrees.

The Golden Watchtower and Jade Chamber,
The Great Brahma and Vast Sovereign,
Hearing this proclamation,
Swiftly arrive in resonance.
Beating drums and brandishing banners,
Descend upon the Milky Way.
Riding the wind and driving qi,
Coming from the floating void.
The Mud Pill Palace and Crimson Palace,
Jade Chamber and Golden Hall,
The Three Divisions and Eight Effulgences,
The four limbs and hundred spirits.
Rising majestically,
Arriving in solemn ranks,
Arrayed in grand assembly,
Lining the ritual altar.
Receiving the Jade Purity’s command,
Responding with auspicious radiance.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Primordial Beginning Supreme Emperor decrees.

Execute the Ten Heavens Hand Seal, emitting from the Three Palaces, transforming the Bureau Lords, ascending and descending above and below. Envision from the Cinnabar Palace a crimson mist and radiant splendor, like sunlight falling and illuminating, bursting through the pores like lapis lazuli. Rushing upward to the Twelve-Storied Tower, with the tongue, exhale a breath to form a solar orb before you, within which the myriad spirits brandish banners, beat drums, and wield staffs.

Recite again:
Myriad spirit lords,
A hundred million chariots arrive in unison,
Ascending and descending with qi,
Without delay or pause.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Primordial Beginning Supreme Emperor decrees.

Execute the Four Mountains Hand Seal for this method.

**Incantation to Summon the Central Pacifying Immortal Officers**
The Beginning Azure penetrates the wondrous,
Qi harmonizes with the Three Origins.
Morning’s radiance divides the boundary,
Swiftly descending from the distant heavens.

Swiftly, swiftly, as the Three Treasures Sovereign decrees.

**Jade Clarity Hand Seal**
With the eastern qi, visualize the transformation of officers descending from the Heavenly Gate, riding upon colored clouds, slowly alighting at the altar site. They take their seats within the golden terrace and jade chamber, paying homage to the Dharma Master, who likewise pays homage.

**Incantation to Summon the Divine Tiger Officers**
Golden gates gleam with radiant splendor,
The Great White’s sevenfold mystery,
Geng and Xin’s ancestral qi,
Transform and respond in spontaneity.
Summon qi and call forth yin,
Bearing the drifting essence of the Subtle.
The primordial transforms into white,
Stars fly—□—returning steps to the hidden depths.
Myriad spirits obey the command,
Rushing swiftly in haste.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Inner True Lady decrees with urgent authority.

**Yin Script**, northern qi.

**Incantation to Summon the Yellow Register Court Officers**
Primal luminosity takes flight,
Soaring toward the Supreme Clarity.
Three Origins’ register envoys,
Descend without pause.
Ascend and deliver with earnest care,
Illuminating the hidden depths.
The Sovereign issues the decree,
To ascend and ferry across to the true.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Void Sovereign decrees.

**Middle Script**, eastern qi.
Visualize officers numbering in the thousands, clad in golden armor and yellow robes, with functionaries and senior scribes descending upon clouds of qi, ready to carry out the summons and tasks.

Burn the **Direct Talismans of the Three Realms** and the **Four Seasonal Functionary Talismans**.

**Incantation to Summon the Envoys of the Three Realms**
Couriers and mounted officials,
Stars rushing like fire.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Void Sovereign decrees to summon the true numina.

**Hai Script**.

With the **northwestern qi**, the mountains tremble and the earth quakes, the Direct Talisman and mighty soldiers.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the decree commands.

**Si Script**, northern qi.
By the **Imperial True Decree**, the spirits plunge into the waters.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Void Sovereign decrees.

**Middle Script**, Dipper qi.

Once the summons is complete, visualize in turn the transforming officers and generals arrayed to left and right, awaiting commands.

Next, offer incense and proclaim the intent, directing the presentation of tea and wine. After the three offerings and the proclamation of the petition are concluded, offer incense again, knock the forehead seven times, and with both hands execute the **Midnight-Noon Dipper Seal**. Envision the stars and constellations above and below, clouds and mist, golden light suffusing all, as if the starry heavens themselves manifest before you.

Then direct the dispatch of the officers, proclaiming and transmitting the memorial, ascending to the Imperial Court, announcing it universally to the ten directions and throughout the Three Realms. Visualize the officers bowing to receive the command and accepting the official document.

Next, recite the **Incantation to Dispatch the Officers**:
Vast and numinous, the myriad qi,
Govern the celestial bureaus.
Bearing this mission and dispatch,
From below they ascend on high.
At the Jade Steps of the Imperial Palace,
They transform and soar freely.
In reverence and response to the mysterious,
They harmonize with the Dao and ascend in audience.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Primordial Beginning Supreme Emperor decrees.

After the incantation, spray water, and with both hands execute the **Ten Heavenly Seals**. Visualize the officers taking up the memorial, rushing upward and away, borne upon stars, constellations, clouds, mist, and golden light, ascending directly into the Heavenly Treasury. Spray water once more, entering straight through the Heavenly Gate to present the memorial and withdraw.

**Principal Directive**:
Once the memorial is presented, enter the oratory, settle the mind, and sit upright. With both hands, execute the **Ten Heavenly Seals** above the forehead. Swallow saliva three times, press the tongue to the upper palate, and circulate the qi from the **Twelve-Storied Tower**, exhaling a true breath to connect with the Heavenly Gate. Then **knead the Nine Palaces**, swallow saliva three more times, and circulate the light of the sun and moon to connect with the true persons, left and right officers, ascending into the realm of stars, constellations, light, and mist. Palaces and towers stand in solemn array before you. Bearing the memorial, ascend gradually.

Next, execute the **Thunder-Fire Seals** with the left and right hands, emitting the qi from the five viscera, striking forth as thunder, fire, lightning, and thunderbolts. Ascend directly to the Heavenly Treasury, breaking through and dispersing the demonic realms, the fierce winds, and the vast qi of the **Dipper’s Firmament**.

After a time, the officers and generals complete their presentation and descend. The practitioner guides them with the **Boundary-Directing Seal** at the waist, gathering them all into the **Upper Mud-Pill Palace**, returning them to the body. Seal the true, close the gates, swallow saliva once, and execute the **Midnight Seal** with the right hand. Then slowly rise from the seat.

This is the **Method for Transmitting and Activating the Upper Dao**.

**Erect the Banner**.

When establishing a grand fast, one must follow the prescribed forms: fashion the **Banner for Conveying the Spirits** from yellow silk, the **Banner of Returning Radiance** from red silk, and the **Banner of the Supreme One’s Precious Edict** from blue silk. Additionally, there are banners for deliverance and others, all to be made and erected according to the esoteric regulations, hung before the fast altar to flutter in the wind. Thus, the hidden souls of the ten directions may behold these numinous banners, and with a single thought of refuge, the great sins of kalpas past dissolve with the wind. Hell’s gates open in peace, and the spirits ascend to the Southern Palace.

**Incantation for Raising the Banner:**
The Yellow Register unfolds deliverance across the Three Realms and the Ten Directions.
The four births and six destinies together arrive at the Dao altar.
The spirits are conveyed, and the souls ascend—never forgotten through ten thousand kalpas.
The banner’s essence follows the wind in flight.
Wherever the wind reaches, each turns toward its direction.
From the Palace of Heavy Yin and the Land of Nine Nights,
Hell’s hungry ghosts and the boundless creatures of the lower realms
All attain liberation, ascending to Heaven’s halls.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Supreme Lord’s decree for the deliverance of the living commands.

**Principle:** When raising the various banners, one must visualize them as mushroom-shaped canopies and precious parasols, with auspicious winds from the four directions stirring and guiding the yin souls to the altar for deliverance.

**Invoking the Dragons:**
According to the regulations, two dragons and two youths are fashioned from *jiao* grass and placed before the altar. The *jiao* dragon stands on the left, the golden dragon on the right, while the two youths each hold a banner. Talismans are inscribed according to the prescribed forms and affixed to the bodies of the dragons and youths. These serve as couriers to proclaim the edicts, absolve sins, and convey the spirits. The front is called the *Jiao* Dragon Post and the Golden Dragon Post—this is the method.

**Principle:** The practitioner, with talismans and invocations, animates the *jiao* dragon. With the left hand, form the *chen* and *mao* seals, gather the eastern qi, and with a breath, infuse the dragon’s body. Then, with the left hand, trace from *zi* to *hai*, return to *si*, proceed to *shen*, and again return to *si*, inscribing the seal upon the dragon’s body. Visualize its scales, limbs, claws, and teeth fully formed. Sprinkle it with water and imagine the dragon in motion. Next, form the *wu* seal, gather the *namo* from the south, and blow it into the dragon’s body. Visualize crimson flames blazing, and see a jade maiden holding the Supreme Jade Talisman of Edicts and the Precious Writs of Pardon, descending through the air on clouds. Mounted upon the dragon, radiant with light, she comes to attend the Heavenly Altar of the Jade Emperor, awaiting the proclamation of the talismanic edicts. Upon receiving the decree, she swiftly mounts the dragon, riding the wind into the depths of Heavy Yin, penetrating the Nine Nights, and summoning the sinful souls. Visualize the four courier spirit-lords of the front, all assisting the *Jiao* Dragon Post scribes, bearing the Precious Talismans of Jade Clarity to proclaim the edicts of absolution.

**Principle:** Once the *jiao* dragon is animated, it bears the mandate to open the paths of the Nine Nights. Yet after the souls endure refinement, to which realm shall they return? Thus, the Golden Dragon Post scribe is invoked to convey the spirits.

The practitioner, with talismans and invocations, animates the golden dragon. With the left hand, gather *wu*, *wei*, and *si*, returning to *shen* to inscribe the seal. Gather the southeastern qi and blow it into the dragon’s body. Then inscribe the Four Gates Seal, circulating through the four gates to transform its scales, claws, horns, and limbs into full form. Invoke the harmony of yin and yang, and visualize golden light converging upon its body. Sprinkle it with water and imagine its form in motion. Next, visualize within the light a jade maiden, clad in cinnabar robes, holding a red lotus above the dragon’s head. Then imagine a pavilion transforming, like the Vermilion Mound Palace, suspended upon the dragon’s back. The dragon bears it in motion, returning to attend the Heavenly Altar. From the four posts, the spirit-lords and officials guide the dragon pavilion to stand below the altar. In the air, four maidens and four youths, each holding lotuses of their respective colors, support the dragon pavilion within their midst, yet they do not join the ranks of the celestial court. When the refinement and deliverance are complete, the practitioner performs the method of transformation and ascension to the Heavenly Bridge, linking it to the dragon pavilion. The jade maiden guides the souls to ascend into the Cinnabar Heaven’s realm, unrestrained by Heaven’s gates.

**Incantation for the *Jiao* Dragon:**
The Supreme Lord opens illumination, the Primordial Beginning oversees the true.
The Five Elder Thearchs and the Red Writs of Jade
Redeem all karmic roots of past sins.
All receive liberation; trials and torments cease.
Souls ascend to the Nine Heavens, spirits cross to the Vermilion Mound.
Today is most auspicious; the ten thousand spirits all heed.
The dragon bears the white writ, connecting the numinous of the hidden realms.
May the wish be fulfilled, swiftly transmitted by the wind and fire posts.

**Incantation for the Golden Dragon:**
The Primordial Beginning Thearch, the Red Writs of Jade,
Dissolve the knots of yin, attaining transcendence and truth.
The blade of the Southern Culmen, the spirit of the floating realm,
Refined by flowing fire, the dharma protects life.
The Vajra Youth and the cleansing of yin’s miasma,
Within and without, radiant and pure, the jade infant’s form.
Striding the Dhyāna Realm, the Cavern Yang’s court.
As the Golden Mouth Decree of the Primordial Beginning Thearch commands.

**Erecting the Six Pavilions:**
**Principle:** The practitioner, along with the altar officers and fast officers, exits the hall to erect the pavilions. Beginning with the **Mystery Master’s Pavilion**, the ranks arrange themselves to offer incense. Kneeling, they invite the master to present the memorial, review the documents, and read the covenant. They then offer paper money and horses, completing the burning. Next are the **Five Thearchs’ Pavilion**, the **Celestial Master’s Pavilion**, the **Three Masters’ Pavilion**, the **Three Officials’ Pavilion**, and the **Fast Supervisor’s Pavilion**. For each pavilion, they pay homage, concentrate their spirits in silent presentation, perform the transformation of the memorial, review the documents, and proceed as in the Mystery Master’s Pavilion. The order of the altar pavilions is detailed in the altar diagram.

**Mystery Master’s Pavilion (East 1):**
The **Mystery Master of Numinous Treasure** is the transformer of the Three Heavens, the teacher who expounds the teachings. When conducting fasts, one must first notify and invoke them to witness the fast’s merits. A tent is erected, and the sacred image and altar table are arranged according to the proper forms.

**Five Thearchs’ Pavilion (West 1):**
The **Five Elder Thearchs** preside over the records of merit and transgression in Heaven, bearing witness to the fast’s merits. In ancient fasts, they were placed upon altars in the five directions. According to the *Guangcheng Yiling*, a separate tent is erected north of the Three Masters’ position, with the sacred image and altar table arranged as prescribed.

**Celestial Master’s Pavilion (East 2 or West 2):**
The **Orthodox Celestial Master of the Correct Unity** is the master of the Three Heavens’ dharma, the teacher who transmits the methods. For all fasts and practices, one must notify and invoke them. A tent and altar table are arranged according to the proper forms.

**Three Masters’ Pavilion (West 2, or East 3):**
The **Three Masters of the Scriptures and Ordinances** serve as the founding masters of deliverance and the foremost of those who sustain mindfulness. Their tent and altar are arranged according to the proper forms.

**Three Officials’ Pavilion (East 3, or East 2):**
The **Three Great Officials** preside over the registers of the Three Primes’ examinations, bearing witness to the fast’s merits. Their tent and altar are arranged according to the proper forms.

**Fast-Overseeing Pavilion (West 3):**
The **Overseeing Dharma Master** is the principal supervisor of the Numinous Treasure fasts. Their tent and altar are arranged according to the proper forms when presiding over fasts.

The six pavilions are set up according to the available space, arrayed to the left and right of the Mystic Altar. According to ancient rites, the Five Thearchs were placed in the five directions upon altars. The *Guangcheng Ordinances* prescribe that a separate tent be erected north of the Three Masters’ position, facing the Mystic Master. Thus, the Mystic Master occupies East 1, the Five Thearchs West 1, the Celestial Master East 2, the Three Officials East 3, the Three Masters West 2, and the Fast-Overseeing Master West 3—all following the *Guangcheng* system. In ancient ordinances, the Three Masters of the Scriptures and Ordinances did not occupy the Heavenly Gate. There is also a **Pavilion for the Three Masters of the Orthodox Unity**, which honors the ancestral masters of the Dragon-Tiger Orthodox Unity lineage. Master Tian later adopted this practice, adding the pavilion for the Three Masters of the Orthodox Unity, thereby placing the Masters of the Scriptures and Ordinances at the Heavenly Gate—a departure from ancient ordinances. Moreover, the Numinous Treasure rites should adhere to the ancient system. In narrow spaces, it is not necessary to set up each pavilion individually. Instead, arrange one pavilion each to the east and west, then divide each into three sections, setting up three incense and flower altars as prescribed. When paying respects, all should proceed through the central path. In this arrangement, the eastern pavilion places the Mystic Master in the center, the Celestial Master to the left, and the Three Officials to the right. The western pavilion places the Five Thearchs in the center, the Three Masters to the left, and the Fast-Overseeing Master to the right. Since three pavilions are combined into one, the central position is the most honorable, with the left and right following in order.

**Oratory:**
This is where the High Merit performs rituals, writes talismans, and prepares registers. At its center are placed the Heavenly Perfected Sovereign, the Yellow Register True Lord, and the Register-Officials of the Talismanic Registers. The furnishings are arranged according to the proper forms, set up in advance on the day of the preliminary announcement.

**Sutra-Recitation Hall:**
At its center are established the positions of the Three Clarities and Three Treasures, with incense and flowers arranged as prescribed. During the fast, the altar officials lead daily recitations of scriptures, mantras, and sacred invocations here, concluding with the submission of memorials and repentance rites.

**Twelve Hall Terraces:**
When establishing a grand fast, one must first construct the Twelve Hall Terraces to summon the lofty immortals and perfected spirits, thereby conducting the fast’s affairs. The Twelve Halls are as follows:
1. **Hall of Azure Radiance**
2. **Hall of the Divine Tiger** (also called the **Hall of Gathering Souls**)
3. **Hall of Investigation**
4. **Hall of Concentrated Contemplation**
5. **Hall of the Underworld Officials**
6. **Bureau of Life-Monitoring**
7. **Hall of the Celestial Physicians and Purification Office**
8. **Bureau of Karmic Refinement**
9. **Court of the Yellow Register**
10. **Office of Rebirth**
11. **General Bureau of the Five Paths**
12. **Office of Memorial Transmission**

Additionally, there are the **Supervisory Office**, the **Altar-Monitoring Office**, the **Office of the Generals**, the **Hall of Ordination**, and the **Hall of Universal Deliverance**, each with its own generals, titles, and ritual procedures, all conducted in accordance with the prescribed forms. These serve as the administrative divisions.

**Hall of Azure Radiance and Salvation from Suffering:**
At the beginning of receiving petitions, one establishes the vow of sincerity, offering gold to redeem the sins of the deceased and beseeching deliverance. The High Merit prepares the petition, enters the oratory, and writes the *Memorial to the Heavenly Savior from Suffering*, following the method of submitting memorials by flying the spirit upward. This is done in advance to implore divine mercy. First, the **Hall of Azure Radiance** is established, with the **Azure Sovereign of the Primordial** at its center, and all offerings arranged as prescribed. Next, the **Azure Primordial Treasure Banner** is displayed—a banner of azure silk, forty-nine feet long, with nine streamers, each inscribed with the Nine Dragon Talismanic Commands. The central streamer is surrounded by eight others, forming a treasure banner. According to the nine provinces’ astrological divisions, the Flying Dragon Courier is dispatched to the void, where the spirit-officials observe and respond. Nine Dragon Talismanic Commands are burned to absolve the nine provinces. The *Memorial for Opening the Altar* is burned, the grand proclamation is hung at the gate, and the preliminary announcement is issued as prescribed. At the hall’s center is placed the *Chart of the Azure Vault and Empty Song*. Daily, incense is burned, and the *Hymn of Salvation from Suffering* is recited. On the appointed day, the altar is opened, and the nine periods of the day are observed with circumambulation and reverence. Thus, the Heavenly Worthy, moved by compassion, responds to the cries and descends upon the Mystic Altar, bestowing the mind of salvation.

**Nine Morning Recitations of the Hymn of Salvation from Suffering**
**Burning the Talisman of the Azure Vault and Empty Song**
**Wearing the Seal of the Demon King**

**Three Hymns of the Azure Primordial’s Salvation from Suffering:**
1.
The Heavenly Worthy vows with great compassion,
Salvation spreads everywhere, transforming good causes.
The Five Marchmounts and Four Offices all receive commands,
The Fengdu Underworld and earthly prisons halt their punishments.
True talismans descend, and all receive absolution,
Divine youths proclaim the pardon of sinners.
The Primordial’s transformed body, true and wondrous,
Delivers countless beings, and the Dao is fulfilled.

2.
The Heavenly Worthy vows to deliver all beings,
Expounding the Dharma with solemnity, seated in the treasure grove.
Nine-headed lions manifest auspicious forms,
Wisdom’s light shines, dispelling dark shadows.
Swords and trees of blades are shattered,
Fire, mist, wind, and thunder all cease.
Great kindness and great compassion, boundless power—
The Fengdu Underworld and earthly prisons all behold and hear.

3.
The Heavenly Worthy’s wisdom saves the yin spirits,
Salvation responds to cries, breaking the iron city.
Vast aid knows no bounds, delivering as wished,
Radiant light universally illuminates the dark.
Where the benevolent wind blows, flames vanish,
When the Dharma rain falls, decay revives.
Boundless compassion fulfills salvation—
The departed souls all meet the Merciful Worthy.

**Hall of the Divine Tiger (Hall of Gathering Souls):**
When establishing a grand fast, after the preliminary announcement, during the review of memorials, or on the day of the fast’s commencement, a room is chosen at the *gen* (northeast) door in advance. The **Hall of the Divine Tiger and Gathering Souls** is established, with the sacred position of the Divine Tiger at its center, summoning the generals and officials, and arranging incense and flowers as prescribed. To the left and right of the hall, fresh soil is used to construct the **Altar of Yang Radiance and Passage** on the left and the **Altar of Yin Spirits and Soul-Gathering** on the right, each three feet and six inches square, leveled and smoothed evenly.

At the center of the altars, place the spirit tablet of the Prison Overseer. Then position the male and female seals respectively at the hearts of the Yang and Yin altars. Prepare jade tablets, memorials, official documents, and summonses. Also, depict the forms of the Three Envoys in color along with talismans. List the names of all the deceased souls to be delivered, ensuring each document is complete and prepared in advance. At the appointed time, proceed with the rites, visualizing the deities, pacing the stars to summon the generals, and inviting the sages to partake in the libations. Present the three offerings while reciting the jade tablets, talismans, and memorials. According to the prescribed form, trace the Yang and Yin altars with a sword.

At the center of the hall, establish the **Eight Gates Gathering Souls Altar**, spaced eight *chi* and one *ren* apart. At the heart of the altar, place a water basin in which the **Iron Trace Platform** and **Radiant Treasure Seal** are immersed. At its center, set the **Summoning the Departed Star Diagram**. To the left, erect the **Iron Trace Banner**, and to the right, the **Radiant Treasure Banner**. When summoning the yang deceased, use the Iron Trace Banner; for the yin deceased, use the Radiant Treasure Banner.

On the incense table, arrange pure water, incense, and flowers, along with the **Guiding Youth Talisman** and various **Divine Tiger Talismans**. Once the altar is established, dispatch the jade tablets and documents, burn the talismans, and visualize the commanding generals and officials gathering the souls to the altar, manifesting their traces in accordance with the original methods, incantations, and rituals. After dispatching the generals and officials, sprinkle water and burn the jade tablet envoys’ documents, along with paper money and horses.

Next, seal the hall’s doors, allowing no persons or objects to enter or exit. Outside the door, post notices to restrain the generals and officials until the appointed time for summoning the departed. Afterward, use the **Summoning Souls**, **Manifesting Forms**, **Communicating with the Hidden**, and **Conversing with the Departed** talismans. First, immerse them in west-flowing water within the altar, then retrieve the water to sprinkle the four sides of the altar. All souls will immediately manifest their true forms, communicating with the living as clearly as if in life. Do not weep in sorrow; if joyful, their forms will fully appear. They will bathe, attend the morning audience, receive offerings, listen to the precepts, and be transmitted talismans.

As the days of refinement and deliverance grow distant, the departed may fear the yang *qi* of the living, causing their yin souls to scatter. Again, use the banners to guide them back to the **Gathering Souls Altar**, entering through the **Gate of Death** and encountering deliverance, then exiting through the **Gate of Life**. The altar’s design, talismans, incantations, and rituals are all detailed in the *Divine Tiger Collection*.

**Bureau of Investigation and Correction**
This bureau is established to publicly display regulations, correct errors, and admonish the assembly of fast officials, ensuring they strictly adhere to the rules and do not obstruct the fast’s efficacy. At its center, set the positions of the **Five Masters** and **Three Officials**, with incense and flowers as offerings. On the day the fast begins, first establish this bureau. The officiant will pay respects, present libations, invite the sages, recite the memorial, and offer paper money and horses as prescribed.

**Nine Morning Sessions of Correction and Admonition**
Burn the **Descending Perfected Summoning Spirits Talisman**

**Hall of Concentration**
For all annual altar rites, this chamber takes precedence. Also called the **Hall of Serene Silence** or **Hall of Preserving the True**, it ensures the altar officials maintain solemn dignity, settle their spirits, and focus their minds. With a single thought, they cultivate the twofold purity, free from all delusions. They must not leave this hall even briefly when ascending or exiting the altar. At its center, set a high seat for the **Perfected Master**, with the positions of the **Fast’s Dharma Ancestors** arranged alongside. The high seat and desk are occupied by the **High Merit Official**, while the **Six Offices** and other officials line up on both sides. This hall should be established first.

**Nine Morning Sessions of Reciting the Heavenly Youth Sutra**
Burn the **Summoning Flying Heavenly Divine Kings Talisman**

**Flying Heavenly Divine Kings Incantation**
Of the **Cavern Mystery Lineage**, the origin of the numinous branch.
Left Scribe of the Great One, riding *qi* like mist.
Dignified and harmonious, clad in flying immortal robes.
In a blink, they traverse the ten poles, governing the myriad heavens.
*Ālǎnnàyì*, *Pónítányán*,
*Yuǎnluònàgù*, *Juélúnbólián*.
Riding the five dawns of fate, attending the altar’s commands.
To proclaim transformation and deliverance, as the law is bound.

**Hall of the Underworld Officials**
Before breaking the prisons in a grand fast, an offering for the underworld officials must be held, akin to the prison wardens of the yang world. First, establish this hall, with the **Azure Mystery Supreme Emperor** at its center. To the left and right, arrange the altars of **Mount Tai**, **Fengdu**, the **Ten Kings**, and the **Underworld Courts**, with incense and flowers as prescribed. At the appointed time, set up the altar and proceed according to the rituals.

**Nine Morning Sessions of Reciting the Sutra of Salvation**
Burn the **Talisman of the Ten Directions’ Savior Heavenly Worthies**

**Bureau of Life Supervision**
For grand deliverance fasts, broadly aiding the submerged souls...

Among these, there may be those still living yet carrying unborn children, their fetal bonds unresolved, or where child and mother remain undivided—whether the child survives while the mother perishes, or both mother and child die together. For such as these, by what means may they attain liberation? First, a memorial must be presented to the **Great Emperor of Life and Spirit of the Nine Heavens**, and a petition submitted to the **Celestial Bureau of Life Supervision**, its immortal overseers. On the day the fast is properly established, the **Bureau of Life Supervision** shall be set up. The officiant shall first approach the bureau to request the summoning, invocation, and invocation rites. Only after the deceased have been summoned to the altar tent may the **Most Sacred Supervisors of Life** be invited to descend and oversee the altar for their deliverance. The **True Writ of the Supervisors of Life** shall be placed upon the bureau’s table, allowing the departed to behold it, whereupon their hundred bones shall naturally radiate light, dispelling the foul luminescence of corpse and impurity.

**Nine Morning Sessions:** Burn the **Talisman for the Already-Born and Not-Yet-Born**
**Ten Heavenly Talismans of Mysterious Transformation**
**Hall of Purification**

For all souls receiving deliverance, those who perished in childbirth sink into the **Blood Lake**, their forms steeped in filth and defilement. Though they may, by the grace of Heaven’s mercy, receive a special pardon and proceed to the **Mystic Altar**, if the taint of blood remains unremoved, how can they receive deliverance? Moreover, among the multitudes of male and female souls, some may have suffered in life from illness—festering sores, suppurating wounds, or bloodshed from execution, suicide, blade or weapon, violent slaughter, mauling by tigers, or venomous snakebite. All such cases bear the mark of blood upon their bodies at death. Before they may approach the **Celestial Physicians** or the **Supervisors of Life**, purification must first be performed. It is fitting to first invite the descending officials and, at the appointed time, establish this bureau, inviting the sacred ones to station themselves, conduct invocations, and recite the scriptures. Once the summoned souls arrive at the bureau, talismans shall be burned and transformations enacted to cleanse the blood, after which the **Supervisors of Life** and **Celestial Physicians** may proceed with treatment.

**Nine Morning Sessions:** Burn the **Talisman for Purifying Heaven and Earth**
**Talisman for Cleansing the Spirit**

**Hall of Celestial Physicians**

Among the souls to be verified, some may have suffered in life from various afflictions—blindness, deafness, muteness, lameness, paralysis, or contorted limbs—while others may have perished by execution, blade or weapon, drowning, fire, hanging, mauling by tigers or wolves, poisoning, lightning, judicial punishment, pitfalls, or dismemberment, their bodies left incomplete. Those who died in childbirth, their blood mingling with that of their unsevered child, must first have the **Celestial Physicians** invoked to descend and heal the departed souls. The officiant shall first establish the bureau’s tent and, in advance, invite the **Celestial Physicians** and their overseers to descend and take their place in the sacred bureau, installed according to the rites. Once the summoned souls arrive at the bureau, the officiant shall employ talismans and incantations, invoking the **Celestial Physicians** to restore them to wholeness, enabling them to return to their original state and proceed to the altar to attend the perfected ones and hear the Dharma.

**Nine Morning Sessions:** Burn the **Talisman for Summoning the Celestial Physicians**
**Incantation for Summoning the Celestial Physicians**

Above the **Northern Emperor**, beside the **Hidden Prime**.
Messengers of the **Celestial Physicians**, descend to the Yellow Chamber.
Heal and restore the departed, cleansing their bodies and restoring their health.
Summoned by talisman, hasten swiftly to the hall.
By the law of the **Supreme Emperor**, this is the command.
**Dipper Mudra**, **Heavenly Gate Qi**.

**Bureau of Refining and Deliverance**

The ancient rites of **Guangcheng** lacked the ritual of refining and deliverance. In recent times, this practice has flourished. Some establish a separate refining and deliverance site, entirely unrelated to the ritual arena, while others conduct it before the **Supreme Emperor** within the arena itself. Alternatively, it may be performed facing the **Supreme Emperor**, with the banquet tables arranged opposite one another, merely adding the officials and generals of refining and deliverance. Since the **Nine Heavens** and other deities are already present in the ritual arena, they need not be separately installed. As there is no fixed form, the present practice shall follow the master’s teachings, arranging the positions of the refining and deliverance generals to the left and right within the ritual arena. Next, the offerings and rites for refining and deliverance shall be conducted, whether in a separate location or within the arena itself. The **Supreme Emperor’s** sacred seat shall be established in the center, and the officiant shall set it up according to the prescribed form. At the appointed time, the souls shall be guided to the bureau to undergo the great refinement of water and fire.

In ancient times, the rules for morning memorials emphasized the importance of the altar. Now that the altar is established for the rites, it is unfitting to set up a separate site. Even minor inconsistencies may hinder the process, and refining the yin souls of the departed is indeed a difficult matter. What is relied upon is the supplication to the true numina and the invocation of the **Two Qi**. Talismans serve as the token for summoning qi, while incantations are the celestial sounds. Only then may one’s own spirit and qi be mobilized, merging with the generative essence of the two images. Through refinement, the withered bones are transformed, and both form and spirit attain perfection. How could this be achieved by any other means? Such is the intent of this original rite.

**Nine Morning Sessions:** Burn the **True Jade Casket of the Covenant for Delivering Souls** and the **True Register of Han Jun**
**Incantation for Summoning the Bureau Officials of Refining and Deliverance**
**Mudras for Wu, Hai, and Wu**

Golden radiance transforms, green mist disperses in array.
Officials of the Jade Bureau, refine the substance and temper the form.
Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the law of the **Primordial Supreme Emperor**.

Radiant light of the Primordial flies aloft, hastening to ascend the Supreme Clarity.

The completion of altar rites, the awe-inspiring solemnity of prohibitions, the presentation of memorials and submissions, the soaring of petitions to the heavens, the issuance of talismans and registers, the invocation of mandates and prayers for grace—all are executed by the officials and generals, along with all matters within and beyond the altar precincts.
Any transgressions, omens, or inauspicious events, as well as any hindrances to the harmonization of merit, are subject to their scrutiny.

**Bureau for Supervising the Altar and Overseeing the Rites**
The site of the altar’s construction is invariably a mundane realm, where malevolent vapors and perverse qi may linger, along with those who disbelieve in the Great Dao—brutish and obstinate individuals who, with their meat and wine, clamor and violate the altar’s prohibitions. Who can guard against them?
At the outer gates to the left and right, arrange the altar precincts accordingly. Specifically, invite the majestic deities of the City God’s temple, along with the officials and generals appropriate to the high priest’s method, to jointly station and guard the altar, supervising the fast and its covenants, punishing negligence, expelling inauspicious influences, revering the imperial perfected ones, and bearing witness to the deliverance.
Thus, all who come and go will hold the rites in awe and admiration, ensuring no disruption to the fast’s merit.
Upon completion, report the merits according to protocol.

Arrange the altar’s position opposite the front of the altar, or to its west, enshrining the City God, the local earth god, and the deities of the local domain with incense and flowers, as prescribed.
Alternatively, combine them with the supervising officials and generals into a single bureau, adjusting the arrangement according to the space available.

**Hall of Deliverance**
When the fast’s sponsor establishes the fast to deliver the Nine Dark Prisons, they must first purify their mysterious ancestors.
Opposite the altar, arrange the Nine Ancestors, the Seven Mysteries, and the deceased spirits to be delivered, preparing offerings for each in full.
The *Statutes and Ordinances of Du Guangcheng* are placed in the southeast, or in a separate chamber if preferred. Rigid adherence is not required.
After summoning the deceased to attend the perfected, guiding the spirits to receive food and precepts, and completing the refinement and deliverance, the rites may then be concluded.

**Hall of Universal Deliverance**
For the universal deliverance of dark souls, on the day of the *cui-shen* ritual, construct a reed enclosure with four gates, topped with white thatch and draped with blue curtains on all sides. Locations near the outskirts, wilderness, or water’s edge are particularly auspicious.
Form earthen walls on all four sides, evenly painted with cinnabar. Inside, build a two-tiered platform, placing ritual implements on the lower tier. At the center, set a water basin with an iron mirror or luminous treasure talisman submerged within. Place a measuring vessel in the middle, and arrange the positions of the six paths of lonely souls. At the four gates, lay out rice, food, wine, fruits, and viands in full.
The ritual’s purpose states: The master first purifies the reed enclosure, visualizing themselves as the Primordial Beginning, facing east, riding a purple cloud, inhaling the green qi, holding the Jade Clarity mudra, and wielding a banner. Thrice summon the *ding* stem’s *gang* alignment, recite the visualization, circumambulate the platform while chanting the *Dipper Chapter*, and guide the souls to circle the four gates three times for bathing and transformation of garments.
Then, proceed through the western gate, face the Heavenly Worthy, complete the prostration, and plant the banner at the center. Burn talismans to dispel defilement, summon generals to maintain order, and proceed with the ritual’s measurements, admonitions, and precepts.
The master silently circulates the Primordial Beginning’s three qi, weaving them into a misty union, as if with the radiance of gold and jade. Transform the offerings through visualization, and conclude according to the ritual’s protocol.
Do not yet transmit the talismans to send the spirits; instead, continue the inner offerings until the refinement and deliverance of the spirits commence, then return to the reed enclosure’s four gates to summon them forth.

**Volume Fifty-Six of the Supreme Clarity Numinous Treasure Great Rites**

**Section on the Principles of Ritual Purification: Preliminary Invocation and Altar Establishment**

Transmitted by the Perfected Adept of Profound Mystery, the Illuminating and Salvific Realized Person Ning Quanzhen; compiled by Wang Qizhen, Disciple of the Supreme Clarity Three Caverns and Master of the Numinous Treasure Lineage.

**Preliminary Invocation and Altar Establishment**

The *Preliminary Invocation* (宿启) is fundamentally the *Natural Audience* (自然朝), the ancestral rite of all purification ceremonies. At the inception of any purification rite, the *Natural Audience* must first be conducted. The *Audience* consists solely of kindling the incense burner to invoke the sages, offering obeisance to the directions, and performing repentance—three invocations and three prostrations. This is followed by the *Spreading of Declarations* (敷露), the recitation of vows and precepts, the *Supplementing of Offices* (补职), and the *Proclamation of Prohibitions* (宣禁). The present *Audience* is what the ritual codes term the *Submission to the Regulations* (馑依科法), and the *Preliminary Invocation* is precisely this.

The concluding line of the ritual code states: *"At dawn tomorrow, the Dao-circuits shall commence, and further invocations shall follow."* This signifies that the formal purification rite and Dao-circuits begin only the next morning. Since the rite is established on behalf of others, the intent of the purification must be announced to the true spirits in advance.

According to ancient codes, the *Preliminary Invocation* was always held at the *zi* hour (11 PM–1 AM) on the day the purification rite was to be established. However, in Lu Jianji’s *Numinous Treasure Rites for the Daoist’s Self-Cultivation and Alliance with the Perfected* (《灵宝道士自修盟真斋仪》), there is no *Preliminary Invocation*; instead, on the morning of the purification day, the precepts are recited, offices are supplemented, and the rite proceeds directly to the ascent of the altar and the Dao-circuits, followed by the verbal presentation of merits and petitions.

Furthermore, the *Zhengyi* scriptural codes state only: *"When establishing a purification rite, the Natural Audience must first be conducted,"* with no mention of the *Preliminary Invocation* or the dispersal of the altar. Zhang Ruohai of the *Cloud Radiance* lineage, unaware of the scriptural texts, presumptuously imposed his own views, penning nearly twenty spurious arguments that grossly contravene the teachings. As a result, later students, misled and errant, now recite precepts and supplement offices *before* the *Preliminary Invocation*, and only after receiving the tablets do they ascend the altar.

Du Guangcheng has rightly criticized this practice, noting that for grand purification rites, the sponsor must submit a petition in advance, which the High Merit Officer receives and memorializes, typically a month prior. Petitions and memorials are then presented in sequence, and talismanic decrees are issued. This is to conduct the affairs *before* supplementing offices—a reversal of proper order. How, then, can the High Merit Officer be permitted to supplement offices *before* the preliminary announcement?

A careful examination of the scriptural codes reveals that the *Supplementing of Offices* is intended for the Dao-circuits to be held the following morning. Thus, the *Preliminary Invocation* and altar establishment do not pertain to the formal purification rite. Moreover, in Lu Jianji’s *Numinous Treasure Rites: Illuminating Candles, Precepts, Penalties, and Vows* (《灵宝斋说光烛戒罚祝愿仪》), it is stated: *"First, the Preliminary Invocation is completed; next, the Ten Precepts are conferred, and offices are supplemented. The assembled officers kneel to receive their tablets, and the following day, the Dao-circuits proceed according to their designated roles. Then, the Thirty-Six Prohibitions are proclaimed, and the majestic ordinances are announced."* This clearly indicates that the recitation of precepts, supplementing of offices, and proclamation of prohibitions must occur *after* the *Preliminary Invocation*—a sequence explicitly prescribed in the codes and thus most appropriate.

From the Jin through the Tang dynasties, this tradition remained unaltered.

Now, Zhang Ruohai of the Cloud Radiance tradition has propagated reckless and unfounded doctrines, which some shallow scholars have taken as their source—this only reveals their failure to broadly examine the ancient codes as they truly are.

A single day of observance is called a *zhai-hui* (fasting assembly). Only when it extends to three days or more is it properly termed a *zhai* (fast). Some last seven or nine days, and the longest may span a full month. These durations are all recorded in the scriptural codes, as set forth in the *Scriptural Writings of the Perfected of the Great Ultimate*, which also prescribes the essentials of fasting, precepts, and majestic rites. The Celestial Master Lu culled the scriptural essentials to compile the *Rites of Fasting, Thanksgiving, Precepts, and Penalties*. Whether for the Three Registers or the Nine Dark Realms, whether for delivering the suffering from the mire of bitterness—whether three days, seven days, one watch, or nine watches—the categories may be numerous, but the ritual norms remain one. To trace the stream to its source, apart from the Perfected of the Great Ultimate and the Celestial Master Lu, to whom else could one turn?

In recent times, the rite of supplementing offices has seen the addition of superfluous procedures, such as the "upper and lower relinquishment discussions" and the phrase *"assigning so-and-so to the role of..."*—this has often obstructed the High Functionary’s duties. Moreover, how could such roles be filled by those who merely consume the offerings of the assembly? Furthermore, in the *Fasting Codes* compiled by Li Jingqi, on the day of altar construction, a *Natural Audience* is conducted in the afternoon, followed by the recitation of precepts, the return to the Mystic Master’s tent, the supplementing of offices, and the proclamation of prohibitions. Only then, at night, is the *Preliminary Invocation* performed according to the codes. This would mean conducting two *Natural Audiences* on the day of altar construction—is this not redundant?

Today, all such practices have been corrected to conform to the ancient codes: after the *Preliminary Invocation* and the *Three Rituals*, the *Exposition* is delivered, followed by the *Proclamation of Words*. Before the *Return to the Censer*, the recitation of precepts, supplementing of offices, and proclamation of prohibitions are carried out, aligning with the original codes of the Celestial Master Lu and avoiding adherence to vulgar customs.

**Preliminary Invocation and Altar Construction**
The guiding principle states: Before entering the altar tent, one must visualize oneself as the Azure Mystery Lord of the Nine Heavens, attended by jade lads and jade maidens, emerging from the Gates of Wondrous Mystery upon beams of light, bearing banners and staves and standing before the Dao. In the course of the ritual, one invokes the Nine Phoenix Officers of Destruction and Purification, who descend with sprays and exhalations, transforming the mundane into the sacred. At the Earth Portal, the altar is consecrated with water according to the method.

**Consecration of the Altar**
*Bowing and Submission of the Purification Memorial*
**Supplementing Offices**
The heavens possess six revolutions, corresponding to the establishment of the Six Offices. When constructing the fast and conducting the Dao-circuits, these six roles must be assigned to align with the lofty heavens.

**Ascending the Altar**
Whenever ascending the altar, one first offers incense at the Six Curtains. Next, two attendants—one bearing the hand censer and the other the chime—lead the way, guiding the Dharma Master to ascend the altar. The ritual assembly, in majestic array, divides into left and right ranks and stands in order before the altar.

The High Functionary ascends to the Outer Altar and stands outside the Earth Portal, reciting the secret incantation. Upon entering the portal to ascend the Middle Altar, the assembly follows. In common practice, the participants proceed in a circular procession, with the High Functionary trailing behind the assembly. Upon reaching the Xun Portal at the Outer Altar, the High Functionary moves ahead, entering the Earth Portal first, while the assembly halts. The High Functionary then steps aside to allow the others to pass—a most undignified arrangement.

Thus, the *Established Rites of the Jiang Clan* also states: *"Whenever ascending the altar, the High Functionary leads; when descending, the High Functionary follows."* This aligns with the ancient codes and is most fitting.

Once the High Functionary has entered the portal, the entire assembly enters the altar. The Chief Lector circles to the east of the Middle Altar and stands facing west, while the Six Offices remain at the west of the Middle Altar, facing east. The High Functionary, together with the fast officers, ascends through the Heavenly Gate to the Inner Altar and offers incense to the Ten Directions. By day, one begins with the east; by night, with the north. Next, incense is offered at the Imperial Table, and after the censer is lit, the secret incantation is recited while visualizing as prescribed.

After the fast officers have offered incense, they exit the Heavenly Gate, circumambulate leftward to the northwest of the Middle Altar, and stand. The High Functionary returns to his position, offers incense in the hand censer, recites the secret incantation, and proceeds according to the codes. Upon completing the *Return to the Censer*, the attendants with the hand censer and chime perform their duties first, followed by the assembly, while the High Functionary exits and enters the Inner Altar through the Heavenly Gate.

In recent times, some have entered both the Middle and Inner Altars through the Earth Portal and exited through the Heavenly Gate—this is incorrect. The ritual methods of Du Guangcheng and Lu Jianji both prescribe entering through the Earth Portal, ascending through the Heavenly Gate, and offering incense to the Ten Directions, a practice established since antiquity and not to be altered by vulgar custom. The Inner Altar models the heavens, and thus one must exit and enter through the Heavenly Gate.

**Sung Exhortation**
The guiding principle states: The Mystic Master stands at the front, dividing the ranks. The High Functionary offers incense, bows three times, kneels, and makes the announcement upon completing the fast. The incantation reads:

*"May the Master attain the Dao, and may I ascend in flight.
Deliver the seven ancestors and parents,
free them from the five sufferings and eight difficulties,
and swiftly ascend to the celestial halls,
where their names are inscribed in the registers of immortals."*

Another version reads:
*"May the Master attain the Dao, and may I become a flying immortal.
Deliver the mysterious ancestors,
dissolving their sins and sufferings.
Inscribe their names in the registers of immortals,
and ascend to the imperial court."*

The fast officer presents the document of words, and the petitioner kneels to receive it before announcing the fast. The Inspector of the Fast proclaims the office assignments, after which the Sung Exhortation begins. After offering incense at the corridor curtains, the petitioner goes outside the main gate to invoke the *Preliminary Invocation* and proclaim the *Memorial for the Preliminary Invocation*, then enters the portal.

The petitioner enters the Outer Altar first and stands outside the Earth Portal. The secret incantation reads:

*"Four Upper Merit Officers, Dragon-Tiger Envoys,
Primordial qi of the Orthodox Unity,
and the Serene Maidens of the Void—
when there are nighttime invocations,
may they be made clear.
May the youthful lads of the Upper Mystery
and the maidens serve as ministers,
all entering the Yellow Chamber within,
to convey the invocations and ensure they are heard above."*

*Jade Clarity Seal.*

The *Principles* state: When entering a portal, step first with the left foot, then the right; when exiting, step first with the right, then the left. One must visualize the Fragrant Officer Envoys, the Dragon and Tiger Lords of the Left and Right, and the various spirit-officials attendant upon incense. In the morning, one should also visualize the Four Luminous Merit Officers, one Communicating-with-Dao Envoys, two Jade Lads of Serene Attendants, and two Jade Maidens for Transmission, all arrayed to left and right. At night, one visualizes the Four Upper Merit Officers, the Serene Maidens, the Enlightening Lads, and the Upper Mystery Maidens, each one arrayed to left and right. "Entering the portal" refers to entering the Earth Portal. When ascending the altar, one stands to the left of the Earth Portal and recites the secret incantation in visualization. When exiting the portal, one visualizes the officials, generals, and jade maidens transmitting the sincerity of the fast, each dispersing in turn.

According to the *Scriptural Regulations of the Three Caverns*, the jade maidens entering and exiting portals all employ this incantation. Recently, some shallow-minded scholars, seeing that the *Essential Principles of the Orthodox Unity* use this incantation for morning and evening observances, have claimed that the methods of the *Cavernous Mystery* and the registers of the Dao should be altered accordingly—how mistaken they are!

**Offering Incense to the Ten Directions**
The *Principles* state: When the petitioner ascends the Heavenly Gate to enter the Inner Altar, one must first offer incense to the Ten Directions, beginning with the East by day and the North by night. When offering incense, bow while holding the ritual tablet, then light the incense and hold the memorial slip to announce one’s name. Bow again and silently recite one’s title and position, then place the memorial slip to the right of the spirit tablet. Next, proclaim the memorial document and burn it. Proceed thus for each direction. Only when establishing the altar is the memorial document used; otherwise, when ascending the altar, one holds the memorial slip, and when dispersing the altar, one holds the memorial of gratitude.

**Offering Incense at the Imperial Table**
The incense at the Imperial Table is offered before the central table in the presence of the Supreme Emperor. It is also called the *Cavern Table*—*cavern* meaning "to communicate," the place where incense is burned to reach the true and the numinous. In the ritual arena, it stands before the Jade Clarity; in the altar, it stands before the Three Treasures. The verse "Incense smoke rises from the Cavern Table" refers to this table.

The *Principles* state: When offering incense at the Cavern Table, one must first visualize the Three Treasures, then offer incense to the Ten Directions. First, visualize the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning seated directly upon the Yang Throne. Next, visualize the Most High Lord of the Dao to the left and the Most High Lord Lao to the right, each seated beside the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning, their radiance brilliant and resplendent, all duly arrayed in proper attendance. Then visualize the thirty-six divisions of the sacred scriptures to the left of the Three Worthies, with jade lads and maidens, immortal youths and kings, immortal lords and ministers in proper attendance. Next, visualize the Great Master of the Mystery-within-the-Mystery to the right of the Three Worthies, directly opposite the scriptures, with true attendants to left and right as prescribed.

For pure fasts, silently invoke the Celestial Worthies of Numinous Treasure of the Ten Directions. For yin fasts, invoke the Celestial Worthy of Great Unity Who Saves from Suffering.

The *Principles* state: The center of the altar is beneath the Golden Gate. Step forward with the left foot, and with the two-step Star Pearl Illuminating Pace, proceed to stand before the main incense burner and release the mudra.

**Star Pearl Illuminating Pace**
**Incantation for Treading the Pace:**

The *Principles* state: Close your eyes and transform the altar maidens. Above, connect to the Yellow qi of the Heavenly Gate, intertwining like azure clouds and crystal, with the sun, moon, and stars exchanging radiance. Below, link to the center of the numinous altar, where mushroom canopies and flowered banners stand to left and right, silent and majestic. Transform the mind-palace to bloom open like a lotus, with one luminous scene at its center, a golden light suspended within.

Burn one *True Writ of Jade Script* in the main incense burner and recite the incantation:
*"Primordial qi of the Celestial Worthy,
Uniting with the numinous script.
No script is not delivered,
No script is not radiant.
Crimson writ on jade stalks,
Dragon scripts trailing brilliance.
Your servant now burns and transforms it,
Ascending to the Jade Chamber.
Swiftly, swiftly,
As the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning commands!"*

With both hands, form the Jade Clarity mudra, and visualize the three-tiered Towering Golden Gate of Resplendent Light. Within it sits the Most High, ascending nine steps, the altar suffused with radiant qi. The petitioner’s heart pours forth sincerity, seeking grace and petitioning for the Mandate. The Emperor grants the request, and the altar ground becomes like the realm of Primordial Yang, utterly free of the slightest dust.

Jade maidens and golden lads transmit incense and present memorial slips, golden light arrayed in crossing patterns like woven threads. To the left, the Five Elders ride cinnabar chariots, flying through empty space to descend. To the right, the thirty-two Heavenly Emperors arrive together in phoenix carriages, all bowing in homage to the Three True Ones. The Five Masters step forward to pay their respects, and the Three Officials and Four Saints all ride this light to descend upon the numinous altar. Then the Five Marchmounts, the Four Seas, and the hosts of perfected beings bow in homage to left and right. The city gods of the curtains and enclosures, the officials and generals of the Thunder Bureau, all guard and protect front and rear. Here, the sun, moon, and stars exchange radiance, moving to connect with the realm.

Burn the *True Talisman for Summoning the Numinous* in the main incense burner and recite the incantation:
*"Mandate of the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning,
Summoning the ten thousand numinous beings.
Numinous light universally illuminates,
The Three Realms are thoroughly bright.
Jade talismans fly down,
Uniting with the imperial court.
Grant your servant to present petitions,
Ascending to the Jade Clarity.
Clouds and mist fly in offering,
Unceasing, moment by moment.
Swiftly ascend the Jade Gate,
Uniting with the Dao in truth.
Swiftly, swiftly,
As the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning commands!"*

*"Highest Clarity and Numinous Treasure,
Jade Clarity summons the numinous.
Divine light wondrously transforms,
Myriad millions arrive together.
Swiftly, swiftly,
As the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning commands!"*

From the center, trace outward in a circle, then from the Central Palace upward to the Upper Palace, and trace the *wu* trigram out of the incense burner.

**General Summons of the Heavens Spell**

The Cavernous Mystery shines with primordial radiance,
The Three Qi form a straight path.
The Five Phases move in their course,
The Three Heavens revolve in motion.
Hasten, hasten to come,
All spirits heed the call.
Swiftly, swiftly,
As the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning commands.

With the Jade Clarity mudra, trace and break open the barrier;
Within the Dipper, the Three Lights,
The Five Directions descend their qi,
The Heavenly Perfected Maidens,
Incense-bearing and message-transmitting Maidens,
Dragon-Tiger Perfected Ones—
All stand before the imperial altar.

**Incense at the Primary Position**
This ritual protocol marks the beginning of the fast,
Where memorials to the court take precedence.
Following the protocol ensures no lapse in speech or conduct,
Thus the ritual text is established.
Stand upright with the jade tablet,
Do not hold the scroll—
Hence the ritual table is placed before the High Master’s standing position.
Most now use a single hibiscus-wood stand,
Just large enough to hold the ritual book,
While incense is offered from the hand censer with secret incantations.
Secret incantations mean reciting the words while the heart contemplates the audience with the Celestial Emperor.

Jiang’s *Established Rites* prescribes a separate incense burner on the ritual table,
With the censer placed to one side,
Intending to expand the ritual table.
Yet in practice, none follow this.
If the altar space is too narrow to accommodate the primary incense position,
One may revert to the ancient method of offering incense from the hand censer.

The *Principle* states:
The officiant retreats from the main censer to their position,
Bows thrice and kneels,
Holding the hand censer to offer incense three times,
Reciting the secret incantation:
The Dao is studied in the heart,
The heart conveys it through incense.
Holding the jade censer,
The heart dwells before the Emperor.
True numina gaze down,
Immortal lattices approach the hall.
Grant your servant to petition,
Ascending to the Nine Heavens.

Another incantation:
Emptiness manifests through form,
The heart transmits through incense.
What the heart conveys
Is neither fire nor smoke.
Grant your servant to petition,
Ascending to the Nine Heavens.
True numina are moved to respond,
Not requiring words to proclaim sincerity.
Secret incantations mean silently contemplating the audience with the Celestial Emperor,
Thus it is said: "Not requiring words to proclaim."
It is also said: This incantation comes from Yang Jie’s *Xuanhe Jinlu Rituals*.

**Each Pays Homage to the Masters with Contemplation as Prescribed**

To pay homage to the masters is to honor the Three Masters of the Scriptures, Registers, and Transmission.
Guangcheng said:
The *scriptures* (jing) are distant,
For the scriptures are the distant masters,
The teachers of the register masters.
Through the master’s transmission,
One does not forget the source.
The *registers* (lu) are the means,
For transmitting the true learning of the Dao,
Where master and disciple are interdependent—
The disciple of the scripture master,
The master of the transmission master.
*Transmission* (du) means advancement,
Advancing my mortal form,
Ascending to the ranks of the Dao,
From the mundane to the true—
All depends on the master,
One’s own master.
The Dao cannot be without a master,
For even the smallest method or mudra
Is none but the master’s transmission.
How much more so for wearing the scriptures and registers,
Conducting great rites,
Presiding over fasts and cultivations,
Delivering humans and heavens—
How could this be without a master?
In ancient times, when transmitting registers,
Those who already held registers served as masters.
In the middle ages, with the establishment of ancestral altars,
Private transmissions were forbidden,
Thus the transmission of scriptures and registers
Had to be conducted with the ancestral altar as the master.
If one inherits the Numinous Treasure tradition,
And petitions to receive the fast rituals,
One must contemplate and bow to the Three Masters
According to the method one has received.
Or, if one has received scriptures from a master outside the registers,
One should also contemplate and honor them.
But if, for the sake of receiving scriptures,
One neglects the master who transmitted the method,
This is impermissible.
The scriptures are the remnants of the Dao,
The methods are the application of the scriptures.
To regard only the transmission of scriptures as essential,
And not honor the master who transmits the method,
Would be partial indeed.
The registers arise from the scriptures;
Without the scriptures, there is no method.
Those who practice heterodox teachings or miscellaneous methods outside the true teaching
Are not included in the contemplations at the altar.

The *Principle* states:
The role of the *doujiang* (liturgist) is governed by the White Emperor of the West,
For metal governs sound,
And metal is the palace of solemn execution,
Thus they alone lead the chanting.
Whenever the chant is raised,
Each pays homage to the masters with contemplation as prescribed,
All officials hold their tablets upright in their hearts.
With focused gaze and concentrated mind,
Follow the text below to pay homage.

First, contemplate the direction where the scripture master resides—
The direction of their dwelling.
Contemplate their appearance, taboo name, and title,
Bow thrice in the heart, and pray:
May my master attain the immortal Dao,
Ascend to the lofty numina,
Deliver me and all beings,
All attaining the true Dao,
My own form ascending and being delivered.

Next, contemplate the direction where the register master resides,
Bow thrice in the heart, and pray:
May my master attain flying immortality,
Ascend to the lofty perfected.
Deliver my seven generations of ancestors,
That they may be born early in the heavens,
I attain the true Dao,
And ascend into the formless.

Next, contemplate the direction where the transmission master resides,
Bow thrice in the heart, and pray:
May my master attain ascension and deliverance,
Ascend to the lofty immortals.
Deliver me from the Five Sufferings and Eight Difficulties,
My name entered in the immortal registers,
Forever becoming a perfected one.

Next, contemplate the descent of the Three Masters from the heavens,
And bow to them in the heart.
Contemplate golden light filling the chamber,
All transformed into the land of the Three Treasures,
Each adorned with haloed radiance,
Immortals and perfected ones of the ten directions arrayed in ranks.
The Scripture Master, the Perfected Yu Luoqiao,
From the Northwest Heavenly Gate,
Descends within the white qi to the altar.
The Register Master, the Perfected Zhen Dingguang,
From the Northwest Heavenly Gate,
Descends within the yellow qi to the altar.
The Transmission Master, the Perfected Guang Miaoyin,
From the Northwest Heavenly Gate,
Descends within the blue-green qi to the altar.

**Five Directions’ Guardian Spirits**

Contemplate the upright qi of the Five Directions—
Not the Three Pure Clouds.
The Three Names together generate the Nine Qi,
Which disperse into the ten thousand distinctions.
Divided into the great Five Qi,
In heaven they are the Five Stars,
On earth the Five Peaks,
In humans the Five Viscera,
In things the Five Phases,
In affairs the Five Constants.
Now, in the incantation, contemplate the descent of the upright qi of the Five Directions,
To repel demonic vapors,
And purify the altar space.

The blue-green qi of the East pertains to the liver,
Corresponding above to Jupiter,
Its season is spring,
Its emperor the Bluegreen Emperor.
All that pertains to wood
Is governed by the blue-green qi of the East.

The red qi of the South pertains to the heart,
Corresponding above to Mars,
Its season is summer,
Its emperor the Red Emperor.
All that pertains to fire
Is governed by the red qi of the South.

The white qi of the West pertains to the lungs,
Corresponding above to Venus,
Its season is autumn,
Its emperor the White Emperor.
All that pertains to metal
Is governed by the white qi of the West.

The black qi of the North pertains to the kidneys,
Corresponding above to Mercury,
Its season is winter,
Its emperor the Black Emperor.
All that pertains to water
Is governed by the black qi of the North.

The yellow qi of the Center pertains to the spleen,
Corresponding above to Saturn,
Its season is the four quarters,
Its emperor the Yellow Emperor.
All that pertains to earth
Is governed by the yellow qi of the Center.

Thus, the armies of the Five Directions and Five Emperors are presided over by these spirits.
The method of contemplating their descent is to visualize in an instant the qi of each direction following its color, with each containing historiographer-soldiers descending, responding to the incantation’s summons to guard and protect the ritual altar.

The essential instruction states: Close the eyes for a long while, inwardly envision the Five Viscera and Five Peaks, the Five Stars and Five Emperors arrayed in defense within the body.
Next, contemplate the blue-green, yellow, and white qi filling the numinous altar, the Four Numinous Beasts standing guard, the ten thousand spirits arrayed in solemn ranks. Inwardly visualize the golden light shining as a canopy, the entire body transformed into golden radiance.
First, let it emerge from the lungs to the nape of the neck, generating a circular halo that illuminates the body in all ten directions, revealing all within and without.

For the Eastern incantation, trace the *mao* talisman. Envision Jupiter’s Cavern Gate and Vermilion Terrace, located one inch behind the eyes, emitting the Ninefold Numinous Azure Jade Light to envelop the body.
Suddenly, it enters through the mouth and nose, pouring into the liver palace, gleaming like translucent azure beryl.

Next, envision the blue-green light filling the body, swirling within and without, shooting straight toward the East like a blue-green cloud covering the altar space.

For the Southern incantation, trace the *li* talisman. Envision Mars’ Jade Gate and Resplendent Chamber, located five *fen* within the eyes, emitting the Threefold Numinous Crimson Radiance to envelop the body.
Then it enters through the nose, pouring into the heart palace, glowing like the brilliance of the sun.

Next, envision the red qi filling the body, swirling within and without, shooting straight toward the South like a crimson cloud covering the altar space.

For the Western incantation, trace the *you* talisman. Envision Venus’ Jade Pendants and Purple Gate, located one inch between the brows, emitting the Sevenfold Numinous White Floral Qi to envelop the body.
Then it enters through the mouth and nose, pouring into the lung palace, shining like the luminous essence of the moon.

Next, envision the white light filling the body, swirling within and without, shooting straight toward the West like a white cloud covering the altar space.

For the Northern incantation, trace the *zi* talisman. Envision Mercury’s Imperial Homeland and Primordial Palace, located one inch within the hairline, emitting the Fivefold Numinous Amethyst Light to envelop the body.
Then it enters through the mouth and nose, pouring into the kidney palace, glowing like the radiance of amethyst.

Next, envision the purple light filling the body, swirling within and without, shooting straight toward the North like a purple cloud covering the altar space.

For the Central incantation, trace the *zhong* talisman. Envision Saturn’s Golden Chamber and Everlasting Valley, located two inches within the philtrum, emitting the Twelvefold Numinous Yellow Floral Light to envelop the body.
Then it enters through the mouth and nose, pouring into the spleen palace, gleaming like translucent yellow blossoms, luxuriant within.

Next, envision the yellow light filling the body, swirling within and without, shooting straight toward the Center like a yellow cloud covering the altar space.

Strike the ritual drum twenty-four times.
Guangcheng said: The ritual drum rectifies the inner spirit-qi and extinguishes demonic numina; it is the first priority in all ritual affairs.
Whenever the cantor begins the chant, strike the ritual drum twenty-four times. If the drum is sounded during the visualization, not only does it disrupt the proper rhythm, but it also reveals ignorance of the visualization—how could one comprehend the celestial statutes?
Later students, unfamiliar with the dignified deportment, merely seek to imitate the conduct of senior masters. Yet by deviating from the ritual regulations, they falsely claim to meet the standards.
Thus, those who remain unenlightened and persist in delusion have long since made this a common practice, merely pursuing the recitation of ornate texts—this is decidedly incorrect.
The great ritual relies on precision and reverence. Focus the mind and concentrate the thoughts, prioritizing dignified conduct to ensure compliance with the standards.
If the ritual regulations are deficient and the mind is not applied, how can one align with the Dao?
Then the exalted perfected will not descend, and blessings will not arrive; instead, one will incur transgressions and reproach.
Those who seek to align with the Dao must adhere to the established procedures and verify the ritual measures.
Do not treat minor matters carelessly, for as the saying goes: a deviation of one *fen* leads to a loss of a thousand *li*.

The essential instruction states: Strike the left teeth as the Celestial Bell, the right teeth as the Celestial Chime, and the central teeth together as the Ritual Drum.
The striking serves as the rhythm.
The twenty-four strikes correspond to the three eights, summoning the twenty-four spirits of the Three Divisions and Eight Sceneries within the body, dispersing the perfected and true.

The proper method is to visualize the spirit-qi during the twenty-four drum strikes, so that the spirit-qi becomes clear and penetrates the Jade Clarity.
Envision the blue-green, yellow, and white qi within the body ascending from the cinnabar palace, passing through the Five Viscera, rising to the Muddy Pellet, and directly piercing the Heavenly Gate to merge with the Primordial Three Qi of the Mysterious Origin. They coalesce into a lapis lazuli treasure hall where the exalted sages reside at the center, with the perfected arrayed in ranks.

**Emit the furnace and summon the spirits**
Burn the talisman for dispersing the perfected and true spirits, and the talismans for summoning the incense officials.

The essential instruction states: The practitioner holds the hand censer, silently visualizing their body within the blue-green, yellow, and white qi clouds, surrounded by darkness within and without, the Four Numinous Beasts standing guard, and the ten thousand sages arrayed in solemn ranks.
Next, trace the *zhong* talisman and invoke the Supreme Three Heavens, so that they descend into the practitioner’s body in accordance with the ritual, summoning the spirits.
Summoning the spirits refers to summoning the incense officials, memorial officers, and the hundred spirits who guard the precincts—not the officials who present memorials or petitions.
For the spirit-qi and heaven and earth are one; wherever the thought reaches, the spirit follows the thought and goes. It permeates heaven as heaven, permeates earth as earth.
As the *Scripture of Salvation* states: "Above, it roams the Upper Clarity; below, it guards the human body."
Emit the furnace: externally, heat the incense to convey sincerity; internally, summon the officials to dispatch the spirits.
When inner and outer sincerity are complete, the spirits ascend to heaven and descend to earth without obstruction—this is called "communicating with the perfected and reaching the numinous."

Proclaim the Primordial Three Qi of the Supreme Three Heavens—Upper, Middle, and Lower—unto our bodies.

At the hours of *chou* and *yin*, the Three and Five Merit Officers; from *mao* to *chen*, another version states the Five Directions Formula, returning to the life-destined palace. The Left and Right Official Envoys; from *si* to *wu*, another version states *mao* and *you*. The Left and Right Incense-Bearing Courier Dragon Riders; from *wei* to *shen*. The Incense-Attending Golden Youth at *you*, another version states entering the center. The Word-Transmitting, Flower-Scattering Jade Maidens at *xu*; the Five Thearchs’ Direct Talismans at *hai*, another version states the Five Directions returning to the center. The Day-Official Incense Officers, rotating from *chou* and *chen* to *wu*, each thirty-six in number, emerge.

Visualize the Courier Dragon Riders clad in red robes with black hems, along with the Merit Officers, Youths, and Incense Officials descending from the Heavenly Gate. Then visualize those within your own body emerging from the brain, each merging into one, proceeding to the altar to stand in attendance on the left and right, thirty-six on each side.
