Release the talisman to open the earth-altar; at *xu*, return to the central text. Proceed before the throne, from the upper text to *wu*, emerging from the censer. Visualize the couriers all receiving the words, bearing the incense as they depart.

Next, silently recite the incantation:
*Within, there is luminosity; without, there is direction.
Inner and outer radiant, utterly without residue.
Abide in stillness to await it—thus its manifest form appears.*

The formula states:
*Atop the Mud-Pill Palace, lofty and exalted,
Encircling the mountain, the Nine Palaces arrayed.
The first peak, crimson light and purple mist,
Where the Jade Thearch and Heavenly Emperor reside.
At the sounding of jade chimes and golden bells,
Summon the myriad spirits to audience in the upper vault.
The Red Child of the Middle Realm transmits the imperial will,
Traversing all offices to attend in person.
The host of perfected, arrayed in ranks, must not hasten—
Swiftly pass the twelve-storied tower of layers.
Gaze upward at the celestial countenance, eyes conjoined,
Together extolling the imperial virtue and sacred merit.
Upright and reverent, in non-action’s pure and tranquil breeze,
The myriad people rely upon it, ever harmonious.
Sovereign and ministers rejoice in boundless longevity,
Forever preserving heaven and earth in undivided unity.*

**Emerging the Officials**
Emerging the officials refers to manifesting the true officials within the High Merit’s body. First, visualize a vermilion gate one foot and eight inches wide upon the forehead—the vermilion gate being the gate within the brain. The scribes and soldiers emerge from this gate, descending to array themselves before the altar.

Know that only when qi merges with qi, spirit with spirit, utterly without separation, may one enter its domain. Thus is attained the wondrous efficacy of the Numinous Treasure’s descent of the perfected. Lest this be lightly divulged, it must be secretly transmitted by one’s master.

First emerge the Three Generals and Four Numinous Spirits, escorting before and behind, left and right, then proceed to emerge the officials. These are employed when bowing and establishing the altar’s petitions; otherwise, they are not used.

The essential method states: The adept knocks the teeth twenty-four times, kneels lengthily, and first visualizes the Four Numinous Spirits emerging from the head to stand before, behind, left, and right. Next, visualize the sun, moon, and five stars covering the head, the Northern Dipper enveloping the form, and green qi from the liver filling the dark altar, radiant as sun and moon.

Next, visualize General Tang emerging from the left kidney, bearing the Jade Talisman of the Marshal; General Ge emerging from the right kidney, wielding the Great Halberd; General Zhou emerging from the heart, brandishing the Jade Axe of Command. Then visualize the Three Generals descending from the Heavenly Gate to merge with the spirits emerging from the body, all clad in cloud-patterned robes with wide sleeves, jade crowns upon their heads, standing before the altar. The soldiers, three hundred thousand in number, all clad in vermilion, resplendent, each emerge from their respective palaces to encircle the body. The nine Wood Officials emerge from the liver, bearing bows on the left; the three Fire Officials emerge from the heart, bearing spears on the front left.

The seven Metal Officials emerge from the lungs, bearing swords on the right. The five Water Officials emerge from the kidneys, wielding halberds at the rear. The twelve Earth Officials emerge from the spleen, holding spears on the front right. The Generals of the Five Virtues/Powers of the Four Directions emerge from the five viscera, clad in five-colored robes, their forms like jade spirits, arrayed in the four directions, issuing forth from their palaces according to the method.

**Summoning All Officials**
As previously visualized, once the invocation is complete, next form the Dipper mudrā and rise, then the mudrā of Returning to the Supreme Emperor. Proclaim the incantation to dispatch the ministers from within the body, reaching the Heavenly Ding Mighties. Visualize each in turn, summoning the spirits from within the body, imagining the officials and soldiers emerging from the brain to the left, right, front, and rear.

Next, trace from the center line to the root, circling the roots of the two fingers, then to the *si* line and flick. Then recite the incantation:

*"One body, empty and still—
what emerges, what enters?
This is the ritual form;
breath and exhalation reach it."*

**Summoning Each Official from the Body**
The Five True Officials of the Five Bodies emerge from the five viscera at the *mao* line. The Direct Envoys of the Upper Immortals and Upper Spirits emerge from the shoulders—or, some say, from the kidneys; others, from the cheeks—at the *you* line. The Direct Envoy of Merit, the Orthodox Unity Merit Envoy, emerge from both shoulders—or, some say, from the heart—at the *zi* line.

The Merit Envoy for Healing Illness emerges from the spleen. The Left and Right Official Envoys emerge from the spleen and lungs, bearing banners and staffs. *Wu* line. The Yin-Yang Divine Judgment Officials emerge from the heart and kidneys. *Chou* and *yin* lines. The Scarlet Talisman Chariot Officials emerge from below the navel, appearing as ancient Daoists, attending to the chariot’s reins—or, some say, from the crook of the thighs. *Chen* and *si* lines. The Gale-Wind Officials emerge from the left thigh and spleen, taking the form of ancient scholars, riding beasts. *Wei* line. The Rider and Attendant Officials emerge from the right thigh and spleen, appearing as ancient scholars with piled crowns, horse-hoofed feet, and azure forms, attending to the chariot’s reins—or, some say, the Gale-Wind Rider and Attendant Officials emerge from below the left and right knees, as mighty warriors riding *suanni* beasts, twelve in number. *Shen* line. The Courier Officials for Memorials emerge from below the two lungs, the neck, and the feet, taking the form of ancient scholars, riding red horses. *Xu* line. The Flying Dragon Rider Officials and the Multiscript Wolf Officials emerge from the neck, wielding swords and clad in vermilion robes. The Tiger-Rushing Officials emerge from the nose, in tiger form—or, some say, from the two eyebrows, or from the two kidneys. *Kan* line. The Inspectors of Deceit emerge from the heart, taking the form of ancient scholars, riding lions. The Hook Riders emerge from the large and small intestines, appearing as ancient scholars, riding lions with azure bodies—or, some say, from the heart, riding the red mist of *qi*, covering and protecting their domains. *Gen* line. The Three Officials’ Attendants, three in number, emerge from the navel, in Daoist form—or, some say, from the stomach. The Heavenly Armored Soldiers emerge from the left and right arms, clad in golden armor and wielding swords, twelve in number—or, some say, three armored soldiers. *Zhen* line. The Heavenly Might Warriors emerge from the left and right shoulders, in divine king form, twelve in number—or, some say, from the kidneys or the eyebrows. *Xun*, *li*, *kun*, and *dui* lines. The Rectifying Officials, the *Qi*-Gathering and *Qi*-Consuming Officials emerge from the nose, in warrior form. The Spirit-Gathering and Spirit-Consuming Officials, the Ghost-Gathering and Ghost-Consuming Officials emerge from the two elbows. The Poison-Gathering and Poison-Consuming Officials, the Evil-Gathering and Evil-Consuming Officials, the Essence-Gathering and Essence-Consuming Officials, the Pestilence-Gathering and Pestilence-Consuming Officials, two each, totaling thirty-six, all emerge from the twenty-one joints of the four limbs—or, some say, the seven Gathering Officials emerge from the *qi* of the nose, all clad in black robes with vermilion garments, in Daoist form. The Talisman-Severing and Temple-Destroying Official, one in number, emerges from the heart, in Daoist form. The Community and Village Lords emerge from the liver, clad in azure-black robes, in Daoist form with imposing presence, standing at the earthly gate. The Left and Right Grand Marshals restrain all the lords, generals, and officials, emerging from the back. *Zi*, *chou*, *hai* lines, with a flick.

What is called "emerging the officials" should be performed according to the ritual when establishing an altar and reciting petitions; otherwise, it is unnecessary. The same procedure applies to the first audience and the rite of gratitude.

**Proceeding According to the Ritual**
The officiant stands upright, holding the ritual jade tablet, visualizing themselves as a Perfected One, and declares the invocation to awaken the sacred. Next, they pay homage to the ten directions, beginning from this point.

Heaven engenders water, the primordial *qi* of Heaven, around which all stars gather toward the North—thus the rite commences here.

**Principle States:**
The officiant, together with the altar officials, offers incense to the ten directions. For each direction, incense is offered once, followed by a bow upon returning to position. After completing the bows, they kneel in prolonged repentance.

**Repentance**
*Principle States:* The officiant kneels before the incense burner in repentance. The altar officials, in conducting the fast and performing the Dao, may have transgressed prohibitions or violated ritual codes, accumulating various transgressions. Yet, with sincere devotion before the altar, may no demonic trials obstruct us, and may our prayers be answered. Next, they repent for the three karmic actions and six senses, as well as the sins accumulated by the deceased over lifetimes, praying for grace to deliver them and accomplish the ritual’s merit.

**Threefold Invocation of the Scriptures**
*Principle States:* Having completed repentance, it is proper to venerate the scriptures. Thus, they chant the *Three Invocations*, pacing the void while performing three bows.

**Veneration of the Three Treasures**
*Principle States:* Whenever venerating the Three Treasures, one concentrates the mind and performs three bows.

**Spreading the Revelation**
To establish a jade altar is to model Heaven and emulate Earth, arranging the sun, moon, and five planets, harmonizing yin and yang, aligning the celestial lodges, and erecting the altar’s boundary. The mortal realm is transformed into a golden palace with jade steps, where the myriad Perfected and Saints gather in assembly.

At the appointed time, when the directions are not yet fixed and the forms and *qi* remain unsettled, in the space between bowing and rising, it is as if the cosmos turns in the palm of one’s hand. One must then employ the twenty-eight constellations and the jade scripts of the five directions to summon and settle the divine Perfected, pacifying the five quarters, dispelling malevolent influences, and purifying the altar space. Only by harmonizing the square and the round, entering stillness and motion, can the Most Exalted reside in the mystery of the Dao’s transformation, and the sun and moon circulate in perfect order.

Just as the sovereign of the realm sits enthroned in the ninefold palace, with ministers attending to governance, so too, from the moment the altar is established, the left assembly begins its administration—this being the court where the masters and Perfected of the Three Heavens of Great Mystery convene.

**Spreading the True Writ** requires meticulous observance. There are four methods:
1. **Spreading and Settling:** Invoking the Five Celestial Thearchs and their divine soldiers to descend and pacify the altar. The *Five Chapters* are the primordial *qi* of the five directions, harmonizing yin and yang to guard the ritual space. One burns the *Five Thearchs’ Nurturing Life Talismans*, summoning the thirty-two Celestial Thearchs to deliver beings according to the directions and present memorials.
2. **Revelation:** Displaying silk banners, golden dragons, and jade tablets to manifest sincerity.
3. **Spreading the True Writ:** These are the treasured scripts of the Nine Heavens and the numinous essences of auspicious clouds. Written in talismanic script, they rectify the sun and moon when they lose their proper course, and in the center, they avert calamities and blessings for the people.
4. **The Five Chapters:** Composed of the *qi* of the Nine Heavens, the secret names of the myriad heavens, and the constellations of the celestial circuit. They harmonize the earth’s generative forces, transforming yin into yang. They can also deliver the souls languishing in the long night of the Nine Dark Realms, elevating them all to the Crimson Mound—this is the perfection of the Four Symbols.

Yet today’s unlearned practitioners merely invoke the name *Spreading the Revelation*, considering the beauty of the chant and the recitation of the text sufficient, without deeper inquiry. They fail to grasp the true fruit of deliverance—is this not lamentable?

**Guang Cheng** states: In ancient times, when the Celestial Venerable of Primordial Beginning first divided the undifferentiated, the Three *Qi* unfolded the cosmic pattern. From the primordial essence of the Great Dao and the true unity of *qi*, the *Numinous Treasure Red Writ* coalesced into script, descending upon the five directions to pacify and stabilize Heaven and Earth, summoning the Perfected Spirits. Thus, Heaven and Earth were settled, the sun and moon shone brightly, ghosts and spirits were delivered, and the people attained longevity. The transmission of the True Writ to the world averts celestial disasters, protects and stabilizes the sovereign, dispels poison and harm to deliver the people, subdues ghosts and spirits, and rescues the suffering souls of the dark realms—there is nothing it cannot accomplish.

The scriptures say: Without the Writ, there is no illumination; without the Writ, there is no clarity; without the Writ, there is no establishment; without the Writ, there is no completion; without the Writ, there is no deliverance; without the Writ, there is no life. It is also said: The *Red Writ of Jade Scripts* and the *Eight Might Dragon Scripts* safeguard the kalpas, ensuring Heaven’s eternal endurance. Such is the wondrous efficacy of the *Numinous Treasure Five Chapters True Writ*.

Thus, it can rectify the celestial divisions, harmonize yin and yang, deliver the wandering souls, protect the sovereign, rescue the drowning, bridge the dark and the bright, reconcile transgressions, avert death, prolong life, and alleviate the sufferings of life and death—there is no affliction it cannot remedy. Therefore, when establishing a fast, the True Writ and Jade Scripts are installed to pacify the five directions. Upon concluding the altar rites, the talismans are gathered and burned, their ashes scattered in the blue smoke—this follows the method of the Jade Seal.

If a scholar seeks immortality and self-deliverance, aspiring to ascend the ranks of immortals and forever escape the offices of the dead, they should inscribe the Writ on a jade tablet and cast it into a renowned mountain on the days of the Three Primes, the Eight Festivals, or their own birth year and day. This erases the sins recorded in the ledgers of past lives, and their name is inscribed in Heaven. Upon completion, they pass through the myriad heavens thrice, and the Three Officials and Nine Bureaus record their meritorious deeds. They bid farewell to the heavens above, and the myriad spirits pay reverence, the Five Thearchs attend as guards, the Three Realms’ administrators welcome them, and the thousand demons and ten thousand spirits dare not intrude.

The scriptures say: With unwavering resolve, all aspirations are fulfilled. Seven generations of ancestors ascend to the celestial offices, and the blessings of life and death respond in kind.

**Establishing the Altar with the Five Elders’ Red Writ**
1. The *Primordial Undifferentiated Red Writ*
2. The *Jade Writ for Subduing Evil* or the *Primordial Undifferentiated Jade Calendar*
3. The *Numinous Treasure Five Talismans*
For grand offerings, employ the *Hidden Language of the Great Brahma*.

**Invoking the True Writ**
*Principle States:* When spreading the Jade Scripts of the five directions, one must first invoke their descent. Place the True Writ and ritual offerings upon the altar table. The officiant offers incense, performs three bows, and kneels to present the petition. They raise both hands, forming the *Ten Heavenly Seals* above the Celestial Court, then execute the *Jade Clarity Seal*, striking the teeth seven times. Their eyes radiate the light of the sun and moon, which soars to the Celestial Court above, wheeling to illuminate their body. Within this light, the Primordial Vacuous August One appears, as if within a halo of radiance.

Then emit the radiant light from both eyes, merging it with the light of the sun and moon.

Next, present the memorial, detailing the purificatory offerings, and beseech the opening of the Purple Yang Jade Envoy to proclaim and descend the True Script of the Jade Writs, entrusting them to the officiant for pacifying the ritual altar. Dispel the old *qi*, summon the true numina, and conclude the invocation as desired. Silently recite the secret incantation for invoking descent:

*"Supreme Great Possession,
Myriad Spirits of Jade Clarity.
Cloud-Light Treasure Script,
Universally descend to the Imperial Court.
Swiftly, swiftly, as the Primordial August Lord commands."*

Within the *qi* of the Ancestral Origin, visualize the August Lord emitting a beam of multicolored radiance, casting it upon the True Writ. Execute the *Jade Clarity Seal*, gaze upon the single *qi*, and draw in the Most Revered from within the light of the sun and moon, merging it with one’s own form. Then strike the teeth three times, swallow the saliva once, and pacify the directions accordingly.

**East:** Offer incense upon the eastern altar table, burn the *Azure Emperor’s Nurturing Life Talisman*, proclaim the eastern memorial, place the True Writ upon the table, and secure it with the *Golden Dragon Ritual Token*. Proclaim the Jade Script of the East. The officiant visualizes the *qi* of the liver issuing from the eyes, merging with the external *qi* to form an azure forest *qi*, coalescing into a cloud-forest jade palace where the Azure Emperor resides. The Eight Stellar Mansions of the East pay homage to his palace, stars and constellations gleaming brilliantly. A single beam of azure *qi* and golden light emerges, pointing toward the Southern Palace. The officiant draws the azure *qi* into the liver repository through the mouth.

**South:** Offer incense upon the southern altar table, burn the *Vermilion Emperor’s Nurturing Life Talisman*, proclaim the southern memorial, place the True Writ upon the table, and secure it with the *Golden Dragon Ritual Token*. Proclaim the Jade Script of the South. The officiant visualizes the *qi* of the heart issuing from the throat and tongue, merging with the external *qi* to form the *qi* of empty Brahman, coalescing into a palace where the Vermilion Emperor resides. The Eight Stellar Mansions of the South pay homage, stars and constellations gleaming brilliantly. Within, a single beam of crimson *qi* arcs and passes toward the West. The officiant draws the vermilion *qi* into the cinnabar repository through the nose.

**West:** Offer incense upon the western altar table, burn the *White Emperor’s Nurturing Life Talisman*, proclaim the western memorial, place the Writ upon the table, and secure it with the *Golden Dragon Ritual Token*. Proclaim the Jade Script of the West. The officiant visualizes the *qi* of the lungs issuing from the eyes, merging with the external *qi* to form a palace of crystal and lapis lazuli where the White Emperor resides. The Seven Stellar Mansions of the West pay homage, constellations interweaving their radiance. A beam of golden-white *qi* transforms and passes directly toward the North. The officiant draws the pristine *qi* into the lung repository through the nose.

**North:** Offer incense upon the northern altar table, burn the *Black Emperor’s Nurturing Life Talisman*, proclaim the northern memorial, place the True Writ upon the table, and secure it with the *Golden Dragon Ritual Token*. Proclaim the Jade Script of the North. The officiant visualizes the *qi* of the kidneys issuing from both ears, coiling and merging externally to form a palace where the Black Emperor resides. The Eight Stellar Mansions of the North stand in homage, constellations intermingling their radiance, spraying upward and downward to connect with the Central Palace. The officiant draws the preceding *qi* into the Mysterious Palace through the nose.

**Center:** Offer incense upon the central altar table, burn the *Yellow Emperor’s Nurturing Life Talisman*, proclaim the central memorial, place the True Writ upon the table, and secure it with the *Golden Dragon Ritual Token*. Proclaim the Jade Script of the Center. The officiant circulates the essence of the cinnabar palace, merging it with the *qi* of the spleen’s origin, spraying it from the mouth to coalesce externally into a triple palace and triple tower—upper, middle, and lower layers—where the Yellow Emperor resides. Within, yellow *qi* spreads to connect with the *qi* of the four directions. Five stars, resembling a chariot wheel, hang above, their starlight radiating to illuminate the officiant’s form. Drawing in the two *qi*, swallowing the saliva, and withdrawing, this is called *"The Five Emperors Mounting the Scenery and Riding the Clouds to Audience in the Great Lofty Realm."*

It is further said: Visualize the thirty-two Celestial Emperors and their armies of the four directions, along with the twenty-eight stellar lords of the lunar mansions, descending to the central palace of the ritual altar. Visualize the Yellow Celestial Emperor, the armies of the Three Heavens, the great spirits of the Three Heavens, the stellar lords of earthly virtue, the nine immortals and nine sages, golden lads and jade maidens descending to the ritual altar. Proclaim the memorial to the numinous officials of the ten directions, leaving it upon the table. Disperse the altar by burning the memorial according to the liturgy.

Alternatively, the *Memorial for Establishing the Altar* may be recited here. Step the *Ding* and *Jiang* pacing, visualize, and prostrate as prescribed.

**Delivering the Precepts**
*Principle States:* The Dharma Master turns once and stands facing east, chanting: *"All officials bow their heads to the ground, silently paying homage to the ten directions with three bows, beginning from the north."* The officials sit facing west toward the east. Disciples at the altar receive the precepts together. The Dharma Master pinches incense three times, delivers the precepts according to the liturgy, and upon completion, circulates and returns to the ranks.

**Appointing Offices**
The heavens have six revolutions, establishing the six offices in turn. When establishing purificatory rites and performing the Dao, the six offices must be assigned to summon the lofty heavens.

*Principle States:* The officiant, together with the six officers, approaches the curtain of the Mystic Master to offer incense, perform three bows, and kneel to draw lots and receive their offices. They silently visualize the Three Officials and Mystic Master, maintaining pure sincerity, proclaiming the precept clauses, and presenting the oath of alliance. From this point onward, all conduct must be reported to the *Jianzhai* (Inspector of Purificatory Rites). Perform three bows according to the liturgy and withdraw; the same applies upon return. No negligence is permitted.

**Proclaiming the Thirty-Six Prohibitions**
The officiant and all officials sit in order to proclaim the prohibitions. The *Jianzhai* receives the penalty slips and performs three bows.

**Presenting the Mystic Memorial**
The officiant visualizes as prescribed, arriving at the Three Heavenly Gates beneath the Terrace of Supreme Mystery, at the office of the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Center, and pays homage according to the liturgy. Upon being seated, visualize rising, contemplating the intent of the memorial, and submitting it for transcription and presentation. It is issued throughout the Three Realms. Offer thanks, exit the Three Heavenly Gates, and proceed according to the liturgy to return the office and restore the furnace. If the Mystic Memorial is not issued, conduct oneself with mindfulness and recite praises.

**Restoring the Furnace and Returning the Spirits**
Burn the *Inverted Light Returning Chariot Talisman*. The officiant holds the hand censer and proclaims to all numinous officials, rotating from *Zi* to *Hai* to enter the center. Execute the *Three Realms Seal* and strike it outward. Visualize the spirits entering, draw in the *qi*, and swallow it into the cinnabar field.

Silently recite the incantation:
*"From the five bodily palaces of my form, the true officials, functionaries, and generals have been summoned forth. Entering through the Gate of Myriad Mysteries, those on the left return to the left, those on the right return to the right."*

After the recalled spirits arrive, proceed as before. Visualize the Celestial Worthies, the perfected of the Three Realms, and their attendant officials ascending together into the empyrean. Only the scribes and soldiers of the Five Emperors remain to guard the altar precincts. Gather the spirits and return them through the Gate of the Brain, consolidating them into the Three Palaces to merge as one.

Descend through the Gate of Heaven, exit through the Portal of Earth.

**Incantation for Exiting the Portal at Night:**
*"Mystery generates the Great Yin; the eight windows open in clarity.
All petitions hitherto presented, the Maiden transmits the numinous.
Following the heart’s transformation, peace is established in the Yellow Court."*

Once the rites are complete and all return to their stations, the myriad spirits settle in tranquility. Visualize the officials, generals, and jade maidens conveying the sincerity of the offering, each dispersing to their respective places. Exit the altar and approach the curtain; the officiant offers incense at the curtain of the Mystic Master, kneels, and bows thrice to present gratitude and acknowledge transgressions. Rising, he corrects his errors, returns to the oratory to resume his position, and offers incense thrice while bowing. The Perfected Master and all officials return to their stations.

**The Fifty-Sixth Scroll of the Supreme Purity Numinous Treasure Great Rites concludes here.**

**The Fifty-Seventh Scroll of the Supreme Purity Numinous Treasure Great Rites**
*Transmitted by Ning Quanzhen, Perfected of Radiant Salvation and Deliverance from Suffering, Illustrious Adept of the Cavernous Mystery, to Wang Qizhen, Disciple of the Three Caverns of Supreme Purity and Successor in the Numinous Treasure Lineage and Teaching*

**Gate of the Purificatory Rites’ Fundamental Principles: The Three-Day Observance**

The Three-Day Observance draws its model from the Seven-Treasured Mystic Terrace of the Purple Tenuity Upper Palace within the Jade Capital of the Mystic Metropolis of the Jade Purity Heaven. Each day at the hours of *yin*, *wu*, and *xu*, the ritual drum is sounded, and the Celestial Thearchs and Perfected Divinities of the Heavens ascend to attend the Primordial Beginning. From the Heaven of Pure Tenuity downward, all proceed to the audience. The rites of the Three-Day Observance are founded upon this.

**Sequence of the Audience Rites**
First, the High Master offers incense to convey reverence and sincerity. Next, the furnace is kindled, and the intent of the retreat is announced, summoning the deities within the body and invoking the local earth spirits to proclaim the register. Each declares their ritual rank, and the names and titles of all officials are communicated. Together, they present their sincerity and petition the host of sages, declaring the purpose of the retreat and the reasons for conducting the rites.

Then, the *qingci* is recited to express the heartfelt devotion of the retreat officers. In performing meritorious deeds during the audience, one must first offer prayers for the universal felicity of the sovereign and the realm, extending blessings to the nine generations of ancestors. Next, prayers are made for the living—this is the meaning of the triple offering of incense. For the deceased, one considers the accumulated transgressions of their lifetime; for the living, one reflects on their past faults. If these are not confessed and resolved before the Ten Directions and the Three Realms, and if no plea is made to the celestial and terrestrial bureaus, then even with earnest supplication, how can transgressions be dissolved? How can the mysterious grace descend?

Thus, one pays homage to the Heavenly Worthies of the Ten Directions, performing repentance in each quarter, beseeching the sun, moon, and stars, the mountains, rivers, and sacred peaks, to pardon offenses and expunge the records of sin. The officials of the Three Realms who oversee and examine these matters are none other than the assembled sagely hosts of the retreat.

**Order of Progression**
When the Hall of Refined Contemplation is established, the officiant and retreat officers offer incense and bow thrice to the Perfected Master. They proceed to the six canopies and the canopy of the Mystic Master, offering incense thrice with bows, kneeling to announce the retreat. Chanting and circumambulation follow, with incense offered at the corridor canopies. They assemble outside the main gate, ascend the outer altar, enter the Earth Gate, and proceed to the central altar.

**Morning Entry Incantation (identical for the noon rite):**
*"Four Luminants, Merit Officers,
Divine Messengers, Jade Lads who transmit words,
Jade Maidens who attend the oratory—
as ministers, they convey our entreaties.
The qi of Primordial Life enters my body,
ensuring that all I declare reaches the heavens above."*

Standing to the left of the Earth Gate, one recites the incantation in secret, executes the Jade Purity mudra, and visualizes the incense officials, the Dragon and Tiger Lords, the attending spirit-officials, the Four Luminants, the Divine Messengers—each one in attendance—along with the Jade Lads who transmit words and the Jade Maidens who attend the oratory, two of each, arrayed to left and right.

**Evening Entry Incantation:**
*"Four Superior Merit Officers,
Dragon and Tiger Messengers,
the Unadorned Maidens who attend the oratory—
when petitions are made at night, may all be illuminated.
The Lads of the Upper Mystery, the Maidens as ministers,
all enter the Yellow Chamber within,
conveying entreaties to open the gates above."*

As before, one visualizes the Four Superior Merit Officers and the Unadorned Maidens, along with one Lad and one Maiden.

Ascending the Heavenly Gate, one enters the inner altar and offers incense to the Ten Directions, beginning with the East. In each direction, one holds the petition tablet, states one’s title and name, and bows in person. At night, one begins with the North; at noon, with the South.

**Morning Contemplation**
At dawn, when the nocturnal *qi* has just withdrawn and the light of yang has yet to shine, the virtue of Wood flourishes, and the Azure *qi* arises spontaneously, corresponding to the Mystic *qi* above. The principle states: *"At dawn, when performing the Dao, contemplate the Azure Cloud-*qi* descending from above, then guide the liver-*qi* upward from the crown, merging and filling the altar space. Four-headed Azure Dragons stand before, four-headed Lions behind, dwelling within the Azure *qi*, guarding front and rear."* This aligns with the contemplative meaning in the scriptures.

The Azure Dragons and Lions, with eight heads in total, flank the high seat, stationed in the directions of *si*, *wei*, *chou*, and *hai*.

**Comprehensive Contemplation for the Three-Day Observance**

Next, visualize the Immortal Youth holding incense standing to the left in the east, and the Jade Maiden holding incense standing to the right in the west. The celestial immortals’ attendant officers and cavalry, clad in flying garments, are stationed at the eastern side of the Heavenly Gate. The terrestrial immortals’ attendant officers and cavalry, clad in military attire, are stationed at the Earthly Portal. The flying immortals’ attendant officers and cavalry, clad in feathered robes, are stationed at the western side of the Heavenly Gate. The solar officials and their troops, clad in red, are stationed at the Solar Gate. The lunar officials and their troops, clad in pale yellow, are stationed at the Lunar Gate. The stellar officials and their troops, clad in robes of varying colors corresponding to their directions, are stationed in the four quarters. The Five Emperors of the four cardinal and four seasonal directions, with their troops clad in robes of the five colors corresponding to the five directions, are each stationed in their respective positions, while the central position is occupied by the direction of the August Establishment. The aforementioned troops and cavalry each number nine hundred million myriad riders. The overseers of the fast, the officials of the Three Realms, and their subordinates are arrayed to the left and right, front and rear, encircling and covering the altar space and the site of the August Establishment, along with all figures within and without.

Next, close your eyes and inwardly visualize the five viscera. The lungs have seven lobes, white in color, located below the throat. The heart resembles an unopened lotus, broader above and narrower below, of a purple-red hue, situated below the lungs. The liver has five lobes, of a purple-green color, located below the heart. The spleen is a murky yellow, like the color of gold dust, covering the upper part of the granary. The kidneys are two, of a purple-black color, positioned beside the spine at the waist. The Five Peaks and Five Mountains each reside in their respective domains—visualize them from afar.

Next, visualize the Southern Fire Star in the center of the forehead, the Earth Star to the north before the heart, the Water Star to the east between the knees, the Wood Star to the west of the left elbow, and the Metal Star at the right elbow. The Five Stars shine brilliantly in the five directions. Visualize the Five Emperors of the five directions each residing in their respective positions, with the central position occupied by the direction of the August Establishment. Each wears a crown and robes of their directional color, guarding the body within, illuminating and covering the entire form, which itself becomes golden in hue.

Guide the five *qi* from behind the lungs, flanking the kidneys, and gather them to emerge from the nose like clouds ascending to the crown, then draw in the *qi* of the four viscera. Next, raise them upward to envelop the entire body, filling the inner and outer altar space. A circular radiance emanates from the nape, like the light of the sun and moon, illuminating the ten directions and the body within, clearly revealing all within and without. As the body becomes light and buoyant, it is no longer a vessel of blood and flesh but transforms entirely into golden hue.

The aforementioned celestial, terrestrial, and flying immortals are the divine soldiers and cavalry of the summoned perfected beings. The Five Emperors are the Five Emperors of the five directions, governing the upright *qi* of the five directions and overseeing the seasonal sequences of the four times. They command the troops and cavalry, assisting and protecting the fast altar—this is their office. Thus, the scriptural officials, the Two Mysteries, the Three Origins, and the Four Beginnings are all deities of the seasonal nodes, corresponding internally and externally to this.

The visualized five viscera, Five Peaks, and Five Emperors are not external but internal, corresponding to the five viscera within the body—illustrated in the diagrams of the alchemical scriptures. The aforementioned troops of the Five Peaks refer to the deities of the mountains and waterways, dispatching soldiers to guard the altar grounds—these are external and not internal. All practices are thus a resonance of internal and external.

Here, the Five Emperors refer to the *qi* of the five viscera within the body. When the *qi* is numinous, it generates spirits, as in the *Dong Jing* (Cavern Scripture), where the Five Emperors appear in visualization—this is the case. Now, as the *Dong Jing* pertains to the Heavenly Treasure, while this method pertains to the Numinous Treasure, they are not conflated. The five viscera are detailed in the *Huangting Neijing* (Yellow Court Inner景)—this should be studied carefully.

When ascending the altar to perform the fast, one may begin with simpler methods. The principle states: After ascending the altar, first visualize the Three Supreme Ones in the Heavenly Treasure Terrace of the Jade Capital Mountain in the Mystic Capital. To the left are the thirty-six divisions of the sacred scriptures; to the right is the Great Master of the Mystic Law. They appear solemn, as if present in person, with the Ten Perfected and Five Emperors, along with a host of immortals, assisting and protecting in the manner of a court assembly. Next, visualize the Three Supreme Ones descending upon clouds, as when expounding the scriptures in the manner of a millet-grain pearl. Visualize the boundless and innumerable hosts of the perfected great spirits of the ten directions arriving suspended in the void, with dragons and tigers to the left and right, overseeing the fast and its affairs. The true numina of the Three Realms, with a thousand chariots and ten thousand riders, encircle and attend the Three Supreme Ones. Myriad spirits stand guard, forming the assembly of the Mystic and Numinous Immortals. Proceeding in order, the three-day observance follows this pattern, though the *qi* visualized differs.

**Visualization for the Noon Observance**
At noon, when the sun is at its zenith and the yang *qi* is at its peak, the virtue of Earth flourishes across the four seasons, and the Radiance of *Li* arises in the south, corresponding above to the receptive *qi* of the Primordial. One must not exceed the central *qi* of the noon hour—descend from the altar after the fourth quarter of the hour between *si* (9–11 AM) and *wu* (11 AM–1 PM).

The principle states: At noon, when performing the Dao, contemplate the golden *qi* of the crimson clouds descending from above. Guide the red *qi* from the heart to emerge from the tongue like clouds, merging and covering the Mystic Altar. Above, it reaches the Muddy Pellet, where light and darkness intertwine. Four-headed Vermilion Birds stand within, and four-headed Phoenixes stand without. The myriad pipes of the celestial orchestra resound, dwelling within the crimson *qi*. The Vermilion Birds and Phoenixes, with eight heads in total, flank the high seat, stationed in the directions of *yin*, *chen*, *xu*, and *shen*.

Next, visualize the celestial, terrestrial, and flying immortals; the solar, lunar, and stellar officials; the troops of the Five Emperors; the Immortal Youth and Jade Maiden—all as in the morning visualization.

**Visualization for the Evening Observance**
For the evening observance, ascend the altar before sunset, while the *qi* is not yet fully yin. The white *qi* flourishes, corresponding above to the Initial *qi*, aligning with the visualization. Now, the Initial *qi* within the body pertains to the lower cinnabar field, and the lungs are the mother of water. The lung *qi* is abundant at dusk, as water is about to arise, thus the white *qi* of the lungs corresponds and merges above.

The principle states: At twilight, when performing the Dao, contemplate the white clouds and ethereal mists descending from above. Guide the white *qi* from the lungs to emerge from the nose like clouds, merging and filling the Mystic Altar. Four-headed White Tigers stand within, and four-headed Qilin stand without, dwelling within the white *qi* and guarding the four directions. The two beasts, with eight heads in total, are stationed in the directions of *zi*, *wu*, *mao*, and *you*.

Next, visualize the immortal youths and jade maidens, along with the various officers and troops of the celestial host, following the same method as the morning audience visualization.

Ascend to the altar and preside over the incense burner.
The principle states: Entering the center of the altar is descending beneath the Golden Gate.

First advance the left foot, taking two steps upon the radiant Star Pearl *Gang*, arriving before the main incense burner. Release the Jade Clarity mudra.

*Gang* Steps
Recite the *Gang* Step Incantation:
*"Jade Clarity, Red Simplicity, the Great Brahma divides its flow.
The Primal Net unfurls, the Star Pearls encircle all.
Hasten! As the Primordial August Thearch commands."*

With the left hand form the *zi* character, draw straight through the center, then extend to *wu*. Slightly open both eyes, as the sun and moon part just enough.

Recite the Incense Offering Incantation:
*"Jade splendor scatters its light, the Nine *Qi* congeals as mist.
Fragrant clouds densely woven, ascending directly to the Nine Heavens.
The Incense-Bearing Golden Youth and the Message-Transmitting Jade Maiden,
Convey above to the Emperor’s presence, granting this servant longevity.
To become a divine immortal for all generations—
Whatever is petitioned, whatever is desired, may all be fulfilled as spoken."*

Visualize the Jade Maiden and Golden Youth, along with the Dragon and Tiger, beside the incense burner.

Recite the Three Pinches of Incense Incantation:
*"The first pinch of incense ascends to the Jade Clarity realm,
The second pinch of incense ascends to the Highest Clarity realm,
The third pinch of incense ascends to the Great Clarity realm.
Numinous light and Brahma *qi* descend and infuse this servant’s body.
Flying fragrance reaches the imperial court, uniting with the Dao in the Emperor’s presence.
Hasten! As the Primordial August Thearch commands."*

With the left hand form the Three Palaces mudra, and burn one scroll of Jade Script True Writ within the main incense burner.

Recite the Prayer Incantation:
*"Primal Ancestral *Qi*, uniting with the numinous script,
No writ remains untransmitted, no writ remains unillumined.
The Crimson Writ on Jade Tablets, Dragon Seal trailing its radiance—
This servant now burns and transforms it, ascending to pay homage in the Jade Chamber.
Hasten! As the Primordial August Thearch commands."*

With both hands form the Jade Clarity mudra, and circulate the Seven Treasures Golden Tower, above and below, within and without, gleaming like crystal. Within it, the August Sovereign of the Void sits enthroned in the Jade Chamber.

Draw forth with your own *qi* to connect with the Ancestral *Qi*, exhaling and dispersing it throughout the Mystic Altar. The sacred and the mundane merge into one realm, like crystal or lapis lazuli, golden light bursting forth to fill the altar.

Burn the Summoning Talisman of Descending Perfection in the main incense burner and recite the incantation:
*"The Talisman-Mandate of the Primordial Beginning summons the ten thousand spirits.
Numinous light universally illumines, the Three Realms become luminous.
The Jade Talisman flies down, uniting with the imperial court.
Grant this servant leave to present his petition, ascending to pay homage in the Jade Clarity.
Clouds and mist ascend in ceaseless offering, moment by moment without pause.
Directly ascending to the Jade Gate, merging with the Dao and becoming true.
Hasten! As the Primordial August Thearch commands."*

*"Highest Clarity, Numinous Treasure, Jade Void summons the spirits.
Divine light wondrously transforms, a hundred million arrive as one.
Hasten! As the Primordial August Thearch commands."*

Form the Ten Heavens mudra and trace outward, then circle back from the center to inscribe the *wu* character above the *qing* character, emerging from the incense burner. Visualize the talisman’s smoke transforming into a pattern of rosy clouds, interwoven and translucent, penetrating the Three Heavens above and below, manifesting as a Seven Treasures Golden Tower Jade Palace, suspended and reflected before your eyes.

Again form the Three Palaces mudra, and visualize the generation and transformation of the ten thousand spirits and the hundred million chariots, all arriving to pay homage to the August Sovereign. The August Sovereign emanates a single *qi* of golden light, like the sun’s brilliance descending directly before the main incense burner, forming a golden path of the Yellow Way.

If you wish to pay homage, from here guide your spirit to ascend and present your petition. Kneel before the incense burner, offer incense, and silently pay homage to the August Thearch.

Return to your original position, kneel three times, and with the incense burner in hand, offer incense three times.

Recite the Secret Incantation:
*"The Dao is studied through the heart, the heart transmits through incense.
Holding the jade incense burner, the heart dwells before the Emperor.
The true numen gazes downward, the immortal sieve approaches the hall.
Grant this servant leave to report, ascending directly to the Nine Heavens."*

All secret incantations are recited silently.

Guide your body to embody the Primordial Beginning, knock the teeth three times, swallow saliva three times, and with the tongue stir the Flower Pool, swallowing the saliva again.

Emit a single *qi* from the Cinnabar Palace, surging upward through the root of the tongue, penetrating the Twelve-Storied Tower, ascending to the Mud Pill, and piercing through to the crown of the head.

Guide the Perfected of the Cinnabar Palace to ride this *qi* upward through the Tower, reaching the Mud Pill, and pay homage to the August Sovereign of the Ten Thousand Treasures.

Regard your body as a realm of golden light, with a hundred strands of radiance bursting forth from every pore, like the nine-colored light of the *Milo* net.

Next, upon the golden path of the Yellow Way, pay homage to the August Sovereign and silently present your petition. Do not stir the Flower Pool, nor make any sound.

Upon completing the petition, gaze afar at the compassionate countenance of the Primordial Beginning, joyful and reverent. Golden light and Brahma *qi* descend and infuse your body.

Only then stir the Flower Pool, swallow the saliva to receive the true *qi* in the Cinnabar Palace, hold the breath to conceal the spirit, and then open your eyes to behold the Mystic Altar. Rise and perform three bows to conclude the ritual.

Each pays homage to their master according to the prescribed visualization.

First, visualize the direction where the Scripture Master resides, and in the heart perform three bows. Pray:
*"May my master attain the immortal Dao, ascending to the Highest Numen.
For my sake, deliver all beings, that all may become true in the Dao, and my body ascend and be liberated."*

Next, visualize the direction where the Register Master resides, and in the heart perform three bows. Pray:
*"May my master attain flight as an immortal, ascending to the Highest Perfected.
For my sake, open the deliverance of the seven generations of ancestors and parents, that they may be reborn early in the Heavenly Palace. May I attain the true Dao and ascend into the formless."*

Next, visualize the direction where the Initiation Master resides, and in the heart perform three bows. Pray:
*"May my master attain deliverance, ascending to the Highest Immortal.
For my sake, open the deliverance from the Five Sufferings and Eight Difficulties, that my name may enter the immortal register and I forever become a Perfected."*

Next, visualize the Three Masters of the Upper Heavens—namely, the Three Perfected—descending from the Heavenly Gate with the blue, yellow, and white *qi*, arriving at the altar.

Recite the Five Directions Incantation:
Close the eyes and inwardly visualize the five viscera, the five stars, and the five emperors, all guarding within the body.

Next, visualize the blue, yellow, and white *qi* pervading the Mystic Altar, with the Four Numinous Beings as escorts and the ten thousand spirits arrayed in formation. Inwardly regard the golden light as a canopy, the entire body becoming golden in hue.

First, emanate from the lungs to the crown of the head, generating a circular halo that illuminates the body in all ten directions, clearly revealing all within and without.

(For detailed procedures, refer to the section on altar construction.)

Sound the ritual drum.
Strike the ritual drum twenty-four times in three sets of eight, summoning the twenty-four spirits of the three divisions and eight luminaries within the body.

Disseminate the divine perfected, externally dispelling demonic influences.

Visualize the spirit and *qi* as pure and solemn, penetrating the Jade Clarity. Guide the blue, yellow, and white *qi* within the body through the five viscera, ascending to the Mud Pill, where they merge with the Primordial Three *Qi* of the Heavenly Gate. Together, they coalesce into a lapis lazuli palace, wherein the August Saints reside at the center, with the attendant perfected arrayed in formation.

Refer to the preceding details.

**Initiating the Brazier and Manifesting the Spirits**
Burn the talisman for disseminating the divine perfected and the talismans for manifesting the spirits. Visualize the body enveloped within the Three *Qi* amidst clouds, both within and without shrouded in mist.

Press the central mark on the middle finger.
Invoke the Primordial Three *Qi* of the Upper Three Heavens—Mystic, Primordial, and Origin—to descend into the adept’s body.
From *chou* and *yin* to *shen* below.
At *sanwu*, *mao*, and *chen* on the left and right; at *si* and *wu* on the left and right, holding incense; at *wei* and *shen*, attendants transmit the words.
On the days governed by *you*, *xu*, the Five Emperors, and *hai*, when the cyclical signs reach *wu*, thirty-six spirits emerge in turn.

Visualize the mounted officials in red robes and black headbands, along with the lads of merit, incense officers, and others descending from the Heavenly Gate.
The courier and mounted scribes within the body emerge from the brain, joining the attendant spirits in formation.
Extend the mudras to the Earth Deity and the True Spirit, pressing *xu* to return to the central mark before the throne.
Raise the mudras to visualize the mounted officials receiving the decree, bearing incense as they depart.

**Secret Incantation**
Within, there is luminosity; without, there is direction.
Both within and without are radiant, leaving no residual image.
Abide in stillness and await its manifestation.

**First Audience: Manifesting the Officials**
The adept and the assembled officials each perform three bows and kneel, striking the teeth twenty-four times. The scribes and soldiers proceed with their duties.

First, visualize a vermilion gate, one foot and eight inches wide, at the forehead—this is the Gate of the Brain.
The scribes and soldiers enter and exit through this gate.
First, the Four Spirit Generals and the Three Marshals emerge, escorting front and back, left and right.
The sun, moon, and five planets hover above the head; the Northern Dipper covers the body. They emerge from the liver’s blue *qi*, filling the Mystic Altar with light bright as the sun and moon.

Form the Dipper-summoning mudra and the Return-to-the-Supreme mudra. Solemnly declare the departure of the spirits from the adept’s body to the Heavenly Ding and the Valiant Warriors. Visualize each spirit within the body emerging and arraying to the left and right.
Next, trace from the central mark to the root, circling the roots of the two fingers, then flick upward at *si* to signal.

Then, prostrate and recite the incantation:
*"The body is empty and quiescent—what departs, what enters?
It is made the standard; breath and exhalation reach it."*

Sound the ritual drum three times and swallow saliva three times.

**Manifesting the Officials on the First Morning of the Retreat**
This is done only on the first morning; it is unnecessary thereafter.
If submitting memorials, follow the same procedure for manifesting the officials.
For nine memorials, manifest the officials again on the ninth audience.
For thanksgiving offerings, manifest them after initiating the brazier in the offering rites.
For memorials during altar construction, manifest them during the altar rites.
Submitting memorials has its own ritual methods, unrelated to this.

**Proclaiming the Rites and Conducting the Ceremony**
The adept stands upright, holding the ritual tablet, visualizing the body as a perfected one, and proceeds according to the ritual position and prescribed rites.

**Proclaiming the Words**
As a general rule, the rites span seven days and nights.
The words proclaimed thrice daily are the words of address, not the blue memorials.
For yang offerings, they are for the living: repenting sins and averting calamities.
For yin offerings, they are for the deceased: cleansing transgressions and faults.
For the state, they beseech relief from drought, excessive rain, eclipses, locusts, or unforeseen dangers, or to confess the faults of high officials.

The adept offers incense thrice, kneels in silence, and presents the memorial. The officiants kneel before the brazier, while three, five, or nine repenters step forward, kneel before the throne, and proclaim the words of address.
When proclaiming the imperial titles of the Supreme Emperor, all perform obeisance.

**Offering Incense Thrice**
In all morning rites, the offering begins with prayers for the sovereign’s universal blessings, the ascent of the nine generations of ancestors, and then the living—this is the intent.

The incense attendants and officiants follow the rites, offering incense thrice, each performing three bows.

**Repenting to the Ten Directions**
The form for repenting to the directions follows the rites: for the deceased, one fears their accumulated sins in life; for yang offerings, one considers the living’s past transgressions.
If these offenses are recorded in the registers of the Ten Directions and Three Realms, or inscribed in the ledgers of Heavenly Offices and Earthly Prisons, no matter how earnestly one beseeches grace, how can the records of evil be erased or the Mystic Blessings descend?
Thus, one repents to the Heavenly Worthies of the Ten Directions, confessing and seeking absolution for each direction, even to the sun, moon, stars, mountains, rivers, seas, and peaks, entreating the removal of transgressions and the erasure of sinful records.

The principle states: the assembly, led by the High Priest, offers incense to each direction, performs three bows, kneels in silence, and repents for the deceased, cleansing their faults.
The words of repentance follow the rites. The officiants hold the brazier and kneel for each direction as prescribed.

**Commanding the Demons**
Guang Cheng said: The *Ten Steps of Void* derive from the *Scripture of the Jade Capital of Mystic Metropolis on the Sacred Mountain of Lingbao*.
They are the hymns sung by the ten assemblies of sages as they circumambulate the Sacred Mountain of the Kingly Capital, praising the cultivation of the Dao.
The scripture states: When establishing a retreat and practicing the Dao, the Four Heavenly Emperor-Kings arrive in jade chariots drawn by eight luminous clouds, with perfected ones and jade maidens holding flowered banners leading the way. Phoenixes sing behind, and the celestial music of the Azure Heavens resounds; white cranes and lions roar and chant. They burn incense, scatter flowers, and float through the air to witness the rites, observe the practices, and listen to the Dharma sounds.
Thus, regardless of whether the documents inviting their descent have arrived, one must perform the *Steps of Void*.
As they circumambulate, the great divine perfected of the heavens descend from near and far, floating through the air.
Therefore, one must first command the demons to purify the realm.

The method lies in the High Priest’s secret circulation of divine light. Reverently proclaiming the Dao’s decree, by the command of the Supreme, the High Priest summons the Northern Emperor to dispatch the Demon Kings, inspect and restrain fierce spirits, and sever the roots of evil.
Once the Jade Text descends, the Three Heavens radiate clarity, the true transformation flows, and the immortal Dao flourishes.
The demonic path vanishes, the *yin* *qi* scatters and falls, the Six Heavens’ movement ceases, and within the Six Directions, the Dao’s *qi* fills all, reaching the Nine Empyreans and pervading the myriad realms. Countless sages float through the air to witness the rites and listen to the Dharma sounds.
The ability to evoke such responses lies solely in the High Priest’s internal refinement: embryonic breathing, true stillness, and the luminous clarity of the Mud Pill. Thus, a single visualization radiates divine light.
Further empowered by the Supreme’s incantations and commands, the Demon Kings receive their orders, obey the Emperor’s decree, sweep the realm clean, and the assembled sages float through the air to listen to the *Steps of Void*.

Thus, this practice is not confined to a single altar, nor limited to the assembled sages who have entered the ritual space. This is why it is employed after the *Rites of the Four Directions* and *Repentance*, yet precedes the *Scattering Flowers* and *Steps of Void*.

It is said that commanding the demon kings was already recorded in ancient liturgical methods. Lu Jianji, Du Guangcheng, and others did not compile these, but all followed the ancient canons of the *Three Morning Command of Demons and Complete Steps of Void Sutra*, circling ten times in procession—there is no doubt of this. Jiang’s *Ready-Made Ritual* states that Zhao Daosheng’s *Yellow Register Ritual* commands demons only at the noon audience, following the *Zhenghe Golden Register*. Moreover, the *Jinlu Daoist Ritual* composed by imperial decree during the Xuanhe era commands demons and performs the *Steps of Void* across all three audiences, with the *Dispersing the Altar Rite* conducted only after the offering. This was compiled by Yang Jie. At that time, the Daoist teachings flourished, and the verification of ritual canons was meticulous, so the liturgical texts largely adhered to ancient methods.

Jiang further cites Zhang Qingdu, who said: Before the Heavenly Worthy expounded the scriptures, the demon kings of the myriad heavens roamed the great void, wielding power and spreading poison. After the Heavenly Worthy preached, the demon kings submitted to transformation. Once the multitude of demons relied upon the sagely transformation, they became the perfected and wondrously accomplished true persons of the Heavenly Worthies, driving their chariots ahead to sweep away dust and clear the path. Thus, when the assembled sages are about to proceed, they first command the demon kings to drive their chariots forward.

The scriptures say: "The demon kings respectfully receive their duties, and thus are able to attend the heavens." Therefore, in the *Steps of Void* within the ritual arena, one first visualizes and commands the demons. Now, examining this passage: Zhang Qingdu’s claim that after the scriptures were expounded, the demon kings submitted to transformation, and the divine lords received their commands to universally sweep away inauspiciousness—whenever the Heavenly Emperor is about to journey, the demon kings are commanded to lead the way—this is one interpretation. Yet to directly apply this meaning and cite it as evidence that commanding demons precedes the *Steps of Void* is not entirely reasonable.

If the Heavenly Emperor is about to journey, the demons should indeed be commanded first. However, when offering incense to the Ten Directions, one already visualizes the Three Worthies residing in the jeweled terrace. Moreover, during the *Invocation of the Sages* and *Declaration of Ritual Intent*, the *Rites of the Four Directions* and *Repentance* are all directed toward the Emperor, with the deities visualized within the altar for some time. The demon kings should have already cleared the dust and performed their duties at the moment the Emperor descends to the altar—why would they be commanded only when the *Steps of Void* is about to begin? Such reasoning is not sound.

Furthermore, Zhao Daosheng and others treat the command of demons as purely an internal visualization, as if the Most High does not emerge from the *Mud Pill*. Moreover, their notion that the multitude of perfected beings reside within the body, and that commanding demons operates within the corporeal frame, is akin to silently attending the Heavenly Emperor and presenting the ritual’s intent within the *Upper Field*—all of which misapprehend the scriptural intent, misidentify the fundamental source, and err gravely.

The nine palaces of the *Mud Pill* and the hundred spirits within the body—how could these be absent? From the Three Treasures of the *Heavenly*, *Numinous*, and *Divine* teachings, all include cultivation within the body, some focusing solely on the internal, others harmonizing internal and external. Seated in meditation within the chamber, refining form and spirit—this is the internal. Ascending the altar to pay homage, conducting seasonal rituals and offerings—this is the external, where reverence reaches the Heavenly Emperor. Submitting memorials and petitions, flying the spirit to meet the Emperor—this is the spirit leaving the body to ascend the high heavens. Paying homage to the perfected, repenting, performing the *Steps of the Way*, burning incense, ordering the five *qi* to purify the altar, uniting the three primal essences to visualize the Great Dao, commanding the demon kings to purify the Six Directions, invoking the Jade Capital to chant the *Steps of Void*—all are methods of resonance between internal and external, of mutual stimulation.

Yet how can commanding demons be entirely an internal practice? Some say: Yang is born at *zi*, yin at *wu*, and the cycle ends at *zi*. The *si* hour marks the extreme of the six yang, while the *wu* hour marks the birth of the first yin. As yin encroaches upon yang, the demon kings test the ritual arena, disturbing the Dharma body. When the sun resides in the *Li* palace—*Li* being empty at its center, a pure yang *qi*—yin intrudes at the juncture of yin and yang, hence commanding demons at the noon audience. This, too, lacks any basis and stems from rigid adherence to the internal, fabricating such explanations.

If the Three Pure Ones and Jade Emperor do not emerge from one’s body, and the thousand perfected and myriad spirits all reside within, why bother ascending the altar to establish the ritual, inscribing petitions, and arranging offerings? One could simply have the ritual officer address the words to one’s own awareness, and the *Mud Pill* would understand. If the liturgical texts and ritual petitions could all be dispensed with, this would utterly contradict the sagely masters’ intent in transmitting canons to save the world.

The twenty-seven ranks of rituals and forty-two grades of offerings each have their distinctions and hierarchies—how could one focus solely on internal cultivation and neglect the scriptures, registers, and concurrent practices? As for matching metal and wood, pairing *kan* and *li*, mercury congealing and lead solidifying, dragons descending and tigers subduing—these are internal practices, not external. Yet they are not the same as the grand liturgical canons for responding to the world, conducting rituals, and establishing offerings.

Scholars, in their internal cultivation and external refinement, must understand the origins and currents. In upholding the teachings and performing rituals, they should clarify the fundamental principles to avoid mistaking east for west and falling into confusion. To claim that commanding demons is entirely an internal practice, with demon kings and deities all residing within one’s body, is a principle difficult to reconcile.

If the demon kings do not depart from the body, and the heavens reside only atop the head, then the demon kings receive their duties in the *Cinnabar Field*, pay homage to the Heavenly Emperor in the *Mud Pill*, and through such practices achieve success—yet the verses enumerating their deeds would merely describe a corpse-guarding ghost, not an immortal. Such practices of attending the *Mud Pill* are not the ultimate goal, even for beginners in visualization.

Ascending the mysterious palace to serve the Three Realms—this is the true immortal. Achieving success within the body and ascending lightly into the heavens—this is the meaning of the *Steps of Void Sutra*. As the fourth chapter of the *Steps of Void* says:

*"Looking up and down, I visualize the Most High,
The radiant splendor flourishes in the Cinnabar Field.
Glancing left, I raise Yu Yi,
Gazing right, I grasp Jie Lin."*

The Six Perfections crown the pure practices,
Virtue and power renew daily with the sun.
This speaks of constantly abiding in the Most High while practicing the supreme method above the sun and moon—thus virtue and power renew daily. This inner achievement manifests outwardly.

It further states:
*"Heaven-endowed with transcendent talent,
Delighting in reciting the* Xiaoyi *scriptures."*
This means that without transcendent talent, one cannot grasp the essence of *xiaoyi* (the subtle and formless). Only by mastering its verses can one thoroughly penetrate its profound principles.

It also says:
*"In the midst of emptiness, the Great Harmony’s qi,
Exhaling and inhaling the flowing rosy mist.
Embryonic breathing stills the hundred passages,
In boundless vastness, the Three Conveniences are explored.
The Mud Pill radiates with luminous splendor,
Thus becoming a Golden Flower Immortal."*
This speaks of awakening to the deep mechanism of the scriptures and canons, refining the practice of exhalation and inhalation, and applying the secret method of embryonic breathing—thereby causing the *Mud Pill* to shine brilliantly and unite with the Dao. Such inner refinement leads to immortality, dependent on oneself, not external forces.

Once success is achieved in this way, even the demon kings in heaven will respectfully receive their duties—how could it be merely about protection and promotion? Thus, one ascends to pay homage to the various heavens. The reason the demon kings respectfully receive their duties is precisely what enables one to ascend and pay homage to the heavens. All this is attained through repeated purification and accumulated merit. Therefore, it concludes:
*"All begins with purification and fasting,
Accumulated merit binds past affinities.
Soaring through the great void,
Ascending with the highest immortals."*
Soaring flight is indeed a matter of light ascent, not merely an internal bodily affair.

Now, in the ritual of commanding demons at the purification altar, one first visualizes the sun and moon entering the nostrils, then the *Cavern Chamber* radiating with brilliance. This is because the luminous splendor of one’s own *Mud Pill* has not yet become self-luminous, so one borrows visualization to proceed. Since one’s body has not yet become a true immortal, how could one suddenly command demon kings to receive their duties? Thus, one borrows the authority of the Most High to command them. This matter aligns in principle with the *Steps of Void* chapter. As the tenth chapter says:
*"Scattering flowers to present my vows,
Grasping the tally to summon the demon kings."*
This expresses the same meaning. The scriptures speak of achieving immortality naturally, while altar rituals borrow this authority.

If the path of embryonic breathing is accomplished and the luminous splendor of the *Mud Pill* is already bright, then one need not visualize the sun and moon to radiate light in all directions, nor recite secret incantations to command the demon kings. Those who attain this level will not personally tread the purification altar or seek fame among the common world. These regulations are the methods of purification rituals, hence they are explained in detail.

In general, when paying homage to the true and visiting the sages, the key lies in focused contemplation. If the mind is not rectified, one falls into delusion, and external demons arise. Only by maintaining a rectified mind can one break through delusion—like hot water melting snow, or a torch illuminating the dark—thus enabling the spirit to pay homage.

**Method of Commanding Demons and the Primordial Sovereign**

Green, black, yellow, red, white,
Verdant, crimson, azure, and mysterious light.
From one to nine, ingest according to the Primordial Sovereign.
Unite with the true qi of the day, and the seven orifices will bloom with radiant splendor.
After nine years of completed merit, one enters to serve in the Nine Mornings’ Chamber.

**Another Method**

One, three, three, one—dividing the light into a hundred parts,
The Nine Palaces and the Palace of Departure blaze with the sun’s brilliance.
Without seeking the Imperial One from the root lineage,
The Six Demons will laugh at your scattered thoughts.

First, the green light arises, born above in the Heavenly Origin.
Then the white light, born in the midst of the Human Mystery.
Then the yellow light, born below in Earth.
These are the three qi of Heaven, Earth, and Human, distributed across the Three Fields.
This is the One generating the Three—thus, the "one-three."

The mysterious qi of the lower *Cinnabar Field* ascends to the middle *Cinnabar Field*, merging with the white qi as one.
The white qi of the middle *Cinnabar Field* ascends to the upper *Cinnabar Field*, merging with the green qi as one.
The Primordial Three Qi—mysterious, original, and initial—gather in the *Mud Pill*, as large as a millet grain, neither form nor appearance. They transform to generate the nine qi—this is the "three-one" mysterious division of light. The generation of the nine qi is the blazing of the Palace of Departure in the Nine Palaces.

Advanced practitioners must know the root of the nine qi’s generation. If one does not seek the Imperial Mandate from the ancestral lineage, one does not understand the birth of the nine qi—how then can one manifest the radiant nine-colored mysterious image? No wonder the Six Demons laugh—let one reflect on this.

**The Nine Heavens**
Azure, red, green, verdant, yellow, white, purple, azure, and mysterious light.
The Nine-Colored Circular Images:
1. Crimson Cavern
2. White Chapter
3. Azure Luminance
4. Verdant Brilliance
5. Yellow Simplicity
6. Azure Chaos
7. Purple Fusion
8. Azure Bloom
9. Black Evolution

From inner to outer, from one to nine.

**Diagram of the Five Qi Transforming into Nine Qi**
Various methods only record the five qi corresponding to the five directions and five emperors, yet the nine-colored circular images reside in the head. Without clearly distinguishing the methods of their entry, transformation, and exit, one cannot communicate with the true and summon the numinous. Here, the diagram provides guidance by category.

- Yi and Geng combine to form verdant metal
- Ding and Ren combine to form azure wood
- Jia and Ji combine to form yellow earth
- Wu and Gui combine to form purple fire
- Bing and Xin combine to form red water

**Principle:**
When commanding demons, the High Priest circumambulates leftward to the Ghost Gate, standing facing west. The Chief Cantor stands at the Heavenly Gate, facing east, and recites. Each visualizes the nine-colored circular images, their light illuminating the ten directions. Swallowing saliva, they command the demons and recite the secret incantation. The adept knocks their teeth three times, swallows saliva three times, and visualizes the sun on the left and the moon on the right, slightly raised and nine feet from the face. The sun emits a purple-red light with nine rays, the moon a white-yellow light with ten rays, directly shining upon the face. From the nostrils, they enter the *Cavern Chamber* and *Golden Flower Palace*. Between the eyebrows, they enter three *fen* to form the Twin *Cinnabar Fields*, then penetrate another three *fen* into the bone to form the *Terrace and Watchtower*. Precisely seven *fen* deep, on the left is the Azure Door, on the right the Purple Door. Three *cun* inward from between the eyebrows is the *Cinnabar Field Palace*, also called the *Mud Pill Palace*. Four *cun* inward is the *Flowing Pearl Palace*, five *cun* inward is the *Jade Emperor Palace*—also called the *Golden Flower Palace*, located south of the *Cavern Chamber*. Directly upward one *cun* is the *Heavenly Court Palace* and *Cavern Yang Chamber*. Upward another *cun* is the *Ultimate Truth Palace* and *Cinnabar Field Palace*. Upward another *cun* is the *Mysterious Cinnabar Palace* and *Flowing Pearl Palace*. Upward another *cun* is the *Supreme Sovereign Palace*.

This is recorded in the *Scripture of the Great Cavern of Perfection*. Master Wucheng cites the *Nine Palaces Formula*, stating: "Five *cun* inward forms the *Jade Emperor Palace*." It further states: "The *Golden Flower Palace* and the Nine Palaces each span one *cun* square."

The method of visualization involves circulating the nine *qi* upward, pressing into the *Jade Pillow*, then emerging from the great vertebra at the nape. Radiant brilliance manifests as a nine-colored circular image. The *qi* is visualized as residing in the two cavities before and behind the brain, its light suffusing the nine *qi*, resembling the circular halo behind the Primordial Lord of the Dao. It revolves in cycles, illuminating the ten directions and enveloping the entire body. It follows my rotation, moving through my form—this is the true Primordial Lord of the Dao.

Next, the heart visualizes the Perfected ascending with the *qi*, treading the stars of the *Mysterious Pearl* and the Dipper, paying homage to the Lord of the Dao. Then, one knocks the teeth thrice, swallows saliva thrice, recites the esoteric incantation, burns the talisman to command demons, chants the *Jade Capital*, treads the void in the *Ding* and *Gang* steps, and circumambulates. One envisions the Five Thearchs leading celestial soldiers to drive away demons, while the Demon Kings submit to their charge.

**Incantation to Command Demons:**
*"Within the Yellow Center, I summon the* qi*, severing and extinguishing the lineage of evil. Subduing fierce demons, cutting off the traces of deviance. The Most High issues a decree, entrusting it to my body. Hasten to summon the Northern Thearch to pay homage at the Mysterious Palace. Spirits of mountains, forests, and earth—all forms submit alike. Obey the mighty command and proclaim it to the Demon Kings. The five* qi *billow and surge, clashing with the talismanic decree. The secret jade script ascends to the clouds in triumph. The Three Heavens revolve in brightness, the Six Heavens reach their end—ah, the kidneys!"*

After burning the talisman to command the Demon Kings, first visualize the Primordial Lord descending into the void of the *Mystery*. Next, recite the esoteric incantation, envisioning the Primordial Lord descending in golden light, entering the adept’s body from the crown, and settling in the *Descending Palace* to form the elixir of *Golden Liquid*. Its light fills the eight directions, illuminating within and without. The myriad spirits pay reverence, and the Three Realms become boundless. Then, one traces the central script.

**Threefold Reverence to the Scripture:**
At the outset of the ritual forms, the teachings are established through the scripture. After completing the circumambulation of the void, one should pay reverence to the scripture. The reason demons universally respect and protect, and one receives great blessings life after life, is due to upholding the precepts, contemplating the Dao, and dispelling desires—thus, one extols its merit and pays reverence. It further states: "As the scriptural Dao flourishes, families and nations prosper. With unceasing cultivation, one enters the Great Vehicle. Even the seven ancestors ascend, and the body itself transcends." Therefore, one bows again. Those who cherish the scripture and savor the Dao ultimately become companions of the Dao. Through refining form and substance, one surpasses the Three Realms’ difficulties and delivers oneself from the sufferings of hell. All success stems from the scripture—hence, the threefold reverence concludes this act.

The principle states: "The adept visualizes the Heart Thearch, bows upward, and performs the threefold reverence."

**Great Thanksgiving:**
Now, the officiant repents sins before the ten directions and beseeches blessings from the upper realms. Having extolled merit and revered the scripture, one then pays homage to the Three Treasures. Facing the celestial gate, one performs a universal repentance and thanksgiving—hence, the *Great Thanksgiving*. The rationale for reciting the *Return to the Crucible* is thereby clarified.

The principle states: "The adept assumes the proper position, kneels, and recites the declaration in full, then rises after three bows."

**Returning to the Crucible and Entering the Spirit:**
Burn the *Talisman of Radiant Light and Returning the Chariot*.

The principle states: "The adept holds the incense burner, invokes the *Incense Officials* and *Envoys* to attend the various spirit officials. From the *Zi* cycle to the *Hai*, the jade mudras are set in order. After proclaiming the commands before the throne, visualize the spirit entering, inhaling the *qi*, and swallowing it into the *Cinnabar Field*."

**Esoteric Incantation:**
*"Previously summoned from my body’s fivefold Perfected Officials, Attendants, Generals, and Clerks—enter through the Gates of Myriad Mysteries. Those on the left return to the left, those on the right to the right. Now recalled, they return as before. Visualize the Celestial Perfected and the Three Realms’ officials ascending to the empyrean. Only the Five Thearchs’ scribes and soldiers remain to guard the altar. Gather the spirit, enter through the Gate of the Brain, and return it to the Three Palaces, merging into oneness."*

**Descending the Heavenly Gate and Exiting the Earthly Portal:**
**Morning Exit Incantation (same as noon audience):**
*"Exiting yin, entering yang—ten thousand spirits open and unfold. Affairs concluded, the Yellow Chamber is sealed. The Jade Maidens attend in tranquility, illuminating the divine palace."*

**Evening Exit Incantation:**
*"Above the Mysterious, the Great Yin—eight windows open in clarity. As before, the Maiden communicates the numinous. Following the heart’s transformation, the Yellow Court is pacified. Affairs concluded, all return to their stations—ten thousand spirits rest in peace."*

Visualize the officials, scribes, and Jade Maidens transmitting the sincerity of the fast, each dispersing in turn, then exit the altar.

**Paying Homage to the Mysterious Master’s Curtain:**
The adept offers incense, kneels, and prostrates thrice to give thanks, then rises after three bows. The fast inspector notes transgressions according to the ritual form.

**Returning to the Chamber of Tranquility:**
